title.rendered: 5 Foods To Add To Your Diet For A Glowing Skin

content.rendered:
Skin that glows and radiates glimmer is considered a sign of a healthy body and mind. To throw some light on it, it isn’t a matter that is unknown that our skin is the barrier that protects us from harsh conditions, it is also something that reflects what you eat and what you think.

So, skin is not just an object of beauty but is much more healthy, glowing skin is everybody’s desire. Let’s find out what must be fed for achieving glowing skin.

1. Walnuts

Walnuts are rich in omega fatty acids including PUFA and MUFA. It is also rich in Vitamin E which is beneficial for healthy and supple skin.

2. Avocado

Avocado is a keto-friendly fruit because it contains good amounts of fats in it. Avocado when included in the diet improves skin texture and health. Have it as a dip or a side seasoned item for your breakfast.

3. Fatty fish

Fatty fish is rich in omega fatty acids which are known for healthy skin and brain health. Include fatty fish in your weekly diet and watch your skin glow radiantly.

4. Citrus fruits

Vitamin C present in citrus fruits is something that every cosmetic product would run after. Avail it naturally by including fruits like lemons, melons, oranges, watermelon, broccoli, and tomatoes in your diet. Make sure to have them every day.

5. Tomatoes

Tomatoes are rich in vitamin C and phytochemicals that are known to improve skin health. Have it as a salad or a chutney and rub some slices on your skin too!

Pro Tip: Water

Nothing works better than a diet that’s hydrating. Include loads of juicy foods and drinks.

Over to you, Skin is something that one must take care of internally as well as externally. Have these foods for youthful, radiant, and glowing skin.

title.rendered: Facing Trouble Sleeping? Follow These Tips For A Restful Sleep!

content.rendered:
A night of proper and deep sleep is everybody’s desire, ain’t it? But life is such that it makes getting a restful and a deep sleep really difficult. The burden of studies, household work, work pressure, family responsibilities, traveling frequently, improper environment, and reasons can be plenty that may affect your sleep cycle. Here are some simple tips for a good night’s sleep.

1. Stay away from the screen

The screen is very harmful to the eyes and sleep cycle as the brain interprets that it’s still daytime. Prolonged exposure to harmful radiation will impact the body in a negative way bringing loads of health issues in the long run.

2. Use aromatherapy

Blissful fragrances of aromatherapy in the form of diffuser oils, essential oils, mists, and bath oils are best for a blissful sleep. It helps to calm the nerves and induces sleep. Find out the essential oils that suit your taste amongst multiple options like rose, lavender, eucalyptus, etc.

3. Have turmeric milk

Drinking a warm glass of turmeric milk is sure to induce some good sleep as milk and turmeric are great drinks to be taken at bedtime. For the elderly population who suffer from sleeplessness, this is especially recommended.

4. Evening exercise

Exercising during the evening helps in tiring and stressing the body which results in a better quality of sleep at night and more of deep sleep as studies have indicated. Go for an evening run or hit the gym for healthy sleep.

5. Dim lights early

Dimming the lights early can prepare the body to go to sleep as compared to the one where you shut the light off suddenly and go to bed. Sleeplessness occurs when your body is not yet ready to sleep. Making a favorable environment will help in restful sleep.

Over to You Next time you struggle with poor sleep, keep in mind these points and follow them for a good night’s sleep.

title.rendered: Facing Burnouts? Here’s How You Can Tackle It!

content.rendered:
Burnout is far more common than it actually seems. It is a form of exhaustion caused by excessive and prolonged emotional, physical and mental stress. It can happen to anyone but is more common in the adult population and students in critical phases of life. It can happen when you are emotionally drained, overwhelmed, or unable to keep pace with life and its struggles.

Physical symptoms of burnout

1. Headache

2. Chronic Stress

3. Stomachaches

4. Intestinal and digestive issues

5. Tiredness

6. Sleeplessness

7. Lack of concentration

How to tackle burnout?

Despite the impact that burnout has on us, it can be recovered. Here is how you can tackle burnout.

1. Breathe deeply

The first thing when you realize you have burnout is to breathe deeply. Taking a deep breath helps in cooling and calming the mind and also supplies the body with oxygen that is much needed for proper brain functioning.

2. Journal your feelings

Writing down and keeping a track of your feeling is important to stay updated about yourself and also of your surrounding. Keep a journal of your day-to-day life and this will help in building a clearer picture.

3. Eat more fiber

Fiber and a nutritious diet take care of burnout by supplying the body with the required nutrients for a healthy mind and body. Eat loads of green vegetables, cereals, nuts, and fruits for optimum benefits.

4. Identify your stressors

One of the most vital ways to tackle burnout is to identify the causative agents that are releasing all the stress. Stress is a real threat to healthy wellbeing. The sooner you recognize your stressors, the better it is for your body.

5. Exercise

Exercise. Exercise and Exercise. Exercise releases all the good hormones necessary for a healthy mind and body. It fills the lungs and body with oxygen and tackles burnout in an effective way. Make sure not to overdo exercise, however.

6. Seek Support

Seek the support of your friends and family and do not keep your sufferings and emotional disturbances to yourself. Seek professional help when required. These simple tips are sure to go a long way in tackling burnout.

title.rendered: Recipe: Mango Kulfi

content.rendered:
What is summer if not for the mangoes! Although many face the digestive issues that mango brings with it but no denial that Mango is indeed the king of fruits. A slurp of mango kulfi on a hot summer day and that’s it, your day gets sorted, is it not?

Nutritional benefits:

Kulfi is a sweet treat for summers rich in good quality ingredients when prepared at home. Milk is a great source of calcium and Mango is rich in vitamin C and minerals. It is rich in vitamins and minerals and is also beneficial for skin health. Nuts are a good source of protein, vitamin E, and fatty acids essential for skin and brain health.

Ingredients:

  • 500ml Milk
  • 1 ripe mango
  • Unsweetened condensed milk as required
  • ½ cup low fat cream
  • 1 tsp Corn flour
  • Pistachios and almonds finely cut

Procedure

1. Boil milk till it thickens a bit. Let it cool.

2. Add corn flour and mix well. Bring it to boil. Once it thickens let it cool.

3. Add cream and mango to it and mix well. Add extra sugar if not already sweet.

4. Add condensed milk and nuts to it and mix well.

5. Adjust the consistency with liquid milk. Pour it into kulfi molds and let it semi-set.

6. Add kulfi sticks and let them freeze completely.

7. Unmold under running water and enjoy!

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Summer is all about ice-creams and kulfis! Indulge in this delicious treat of mango kulfi to stay cool and refreshed this summer.

title.rendered: 5 Ways To Add Pulses To Your Daily Diet!

content.rendered:
Pulses are like a sad sibling of cereals who often gets overlooked for not being a staple. But can we ignore it? Absolutely not! Like cereals, pulses must find their way into your diet and we list some easy ways to do so!

1. Curries

Pulses in Indian meals find their place as curries as complementary to staples such as rice and chapatti. The list of pulses as curries is endless. Chole, tadka, matar, channa, rajma, black-eyed peas, and moong are some common ones used as curries. When prepared with the best Indian masala, they taste heavenly!

2. Cutlets

Pulses can be made into cutlets to fill up the evening snack cravings. Try out beetroot peas cutlet, rajma cutlet, or urad dal cutlets along with some chopped veggies coated into bread crumbs. Season it with chat masala and ketchup for a wholesome snack.

3. Shake

A protein shake is a healthy drink that can be made at home using pulses mixed along with millets like ragi, jowar, and bajra. Roast the pulses and make them into powder form and have it as a post-workout shake with milk.

4. Cooling beverage

Pulses like Bengal gram or chana can be made into a healthy beverage like sattu. Add salt and sugar along with a teaspoon of lemon juice and your wholesome drink is ready to nourish you.

5. Sprouts

Sprouts are a gem as they are rich in vitamin C and other nutrients are increased when pulses are soaked and sprouts are formed. Pulses retain their best nutrients as they are barely processed. Have it with fresh tomatoes, onions, and cucumber along with some lemon juice and salt and pepper.

Over to you Pulses are rich in proteins and helpful nutrients that are the sole reason why many functions in the body could thrive. So take charge of your health and set your daily diet with these goodies.

title.rendered: Low in immunity? Try these Antioxidant-Rich Foods.

content.rendered:
Immunity is one of the most buzz-worthy words recently, no doubt and it has taken over everyone with utter carefulness. The fear of low immunity and ways to develop a strong immunity is everyone’s concern, to be honest, and nothing can beat a diet filled with antioxidants.

Here is our take to supply a daily dose of immunity through food!

1. Berries

Berries are rich in pigments that are violet to reddish in color and they are very strong antioxidants. It keeps skin and heart health while also being extremely nutritious. Raspberries, strawberries, and blueberries must be part of your diet. Try to have it every day as desserts or as after meals.

2. Dates

Dates are rich in vitamins and minerals, especially iron and magnesium. Dates when consumed every day improve blood circulation as well as keep hair silky and skin glowing. It is rich in iron which is essential for various body functions.

3. Trail mix

Trail mix has it all, sunflower seeds, watermelon seeds, flax seeds, nuts, and dried fruits. It is rich in zinc, selenium, magnesium, vitamin E, and other minerals and they all act as powerful antioxidants.

4. Guava

Guava is rich in Vitamin C and is one of its richest sources. Try to include guava every day and supply your body with an extra dose of nutrition. Make sure to not process it as it will only degrade your nutritional uptake.

5. Green veggies

Stop your nagging and consume that bowl of veggies, this is something every parent will tell their kids. Green veggies are a potent source of antioxidants and it’s great to have them part of your balanced diet every day.

Over to you Antioxidants are crucial for healthy and lifelong immunity and one must supply it every day by consuming diverse foods that helps in building strong immunity. So what’s stopping you? Grab these superfoods today!

title.rendered: Recipe: Tofu Stir-Fry

content.rendered:
Tofu is more than just a substitute for milk-based cottage cheese. Tofu made out of soybean is a nutritional powerhouse and this recipe for stir-fried tofu is sure to grab some attention! Have it as a side dish or a mid-meal in itself.

Nutritional benefits:

Tofu is rich in protein, potassium, iron, and calcium. Vegetables in the recipe are rich in various nutrients like vitamin A, Vitamin C, and Vitamin K, and minerals like iron, calcium, and manganese. This soft and crunchy mix of textures is bound to refresh your palate.

Ingredients:

  • 100g tofu
  • 50g mushroom
  • 100g capsicum
  • Spring onion
  • Sesame seeds
  • Honey
  • Soy sauce
  • Oil
  • Salt to taste

Procedure

1. Stir fry the tofu in little oil until it turns a little golden brown.

2. Set aside the tofu and in the same pan put in the condiments and veggies and sauté for 5 minutes.

3. Add the sauce to it and mix well. Put honey on it.

4. Cook together for 2-3 minutes until done

5 Garnish with sesame seeds, chopped onions, and coriander and serve.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: If you are looking for a change in your daily monotonous food then Tofu stir fry is your must-go-to option as it is nutritious as well as tasty enough to seek another helping!

title.rendered: Common Nutritional Deficiencies And Ways To Beat Them!

content.rendered:
A way to a healthy life is through a healthy body and having a balanced diet rich in nutrition is an ideal one. However, practically it gets difficult to meet the exact requirement every single day of every micro and macronutrient. Nutritional deficiency in one form or the other is common and it’s wise to know about them to beat them effectively.

1. Vitamin A deficiency

Vitamin A deficiency results in various issues like night blindness, poor vision, poor skin health, and low immunity. It is important to take care of it early on as its deficiency is common amongst kids.

Consume:

  • Green veggies
  • Carrots
  • Fish oil

2. Vitamin D deficiency

The sunshine vitamin is very important for various life processes. Lack of sunshine and outdoor activity increases its chances and almost all population is affected by it. It may result in rickets and poor bone formation.

Consume:

  • Mushrooms
  • Egg
  • Cod liver oil
  • Fortified foods

3. Iron Deficiency

Iron is essential for a healthy body and the production of red blood cells. From diet, you can get both heme and non-heme iron. Iron deficiency is far more common among all age groups and especially in pregnant and menstruating women. Symptoms include anemia, fatigue, and low brain function.

Consume:

  • Organ meat
  • Dates
  • Green veggies
  • Seeds

4. B12 deficiency

Vitamin B12 is a water-soluble vitamin and is very common among vegetarians as its source is mostly from non-veg sources. It helps in blood formation and various bodily processes.

Consume:

  • Meat
  • Egg
  • Shellfish
  • Milk

Over to you Keep a check on symptoms and it is advisable to visit your doctor or nutritionist for additional guidance before taking self-prescribed supplements.  Consume these food products and take a step to beat nutritional deficiency.

title.rendered: Beating Childhood Obesity Effectively.

content.rendered:
What you eat as a kid would eventually shape your adult life. Childhood obesity would put you at risk of various other health conditions that are mostly underlined until it is too late. It is advisable to take care of your child’s weight so that healthy adulthood awaits.

1. No junk

One of the major causes of childhood obesity is the availability of ready-to-eat, ready-to-cook items on the list along with not to mention, junk food items. These items just increase fat deposits and chemicals can cause liver damage too.

2. Screen out

Screens must be limited and idle sitting on the couch should be restricted to keep your kids from gathering unnecessary fats. Try to minimize exposure and avoid addictive shows when necessary.

3. Distractions away

Keep every gadget away from the dining hall and enjoy food together as a family instead. Have a tentative time frame within which meals must be complete and do not force them to complete meals beyond their capacity.

Leading an active life every day reduces the chance of getting several health risking diseases. As parents, it is expected that you take the lead and make kids follow good practices every day. Take upstairs when possible and walk or jog every day. Eventually, over time you would be able to understand that exercise and workouts should begin early to prevent the development of health hazards.

4. Every step counts

Over to you Kids require extra care, guidance, and awareness to make wise decisions and make them able enough to understand what is best for them and their health. Take professional guidance and careful planning with the help of nutritionists.

title.rendered: How To Beat Calcium Deficiency Effectively!

content.rendered:
Are you one of those who gulp down calcium supplements just to play safe? Well, it’s safer to gorge on calcium-rich foods that are so abundant in nature. Calcium deficiency often goes unnoticed until it’s very much evident!

Calcium is a useful component in various processes and body functions so one must take it in adequate amounts every day.

Symptoms of calcium deficiency

1. Weak bones

2. Brittle nails

3. Weak teeth

4. Moon shaped nails

5. Fragile and thin skin

6. Slower hair growth

Foods rich in calcium

Calcium is abundant in many naturally occurring foods as listed below

1. Milk

Milk is rich in calcium which maintains strong bones, teeth, and overall health. Include milk in the everyday diet by preparing dishes consisting of milk in it.

2. Spinach

Spinach is a green leafy vegetable that is rich in many minerals and calcium is one of them. It helps in keeping skin healthy and glowing.

3. Sesame

Sesame seeds are very effective in beating calcium deficiency. Have sesame every day in different forms like ladoo, chikki, and desserts.

4. Seeds

Seeds like watermelon seeds, garden cress seeds, flax seeds, and sunflower seeds are rich in many minerals like zinc, selenium, phosphorus along with calcium. Have a handful of it every day.

5. Beans

Beans are good for gut health as well as for healthy skin because of the good amount of calcium and protein present in it.

What’s next? Try out all these foods to beat calcium deficiency effectively. Calcium deficiency will lead to poor muscle reflex and poor skin health too. Try to visit a doctor or nutritionist for additional guidance and support.

title.rendered: Weight Loss Tips For You To Swear By!

content.rendered:
The journey to weight loss is challenging and often boring for many but it is rewarding nevertheless. Weight loss not only improves your overall health and reduces the risk of various diseases but also boosts your confidence. Let’s get into the tips for weight loss that you would swear by!

1. Eat enough

Are you one of those who restrict their diet to be slim and in shape? Well, that would not help you in the long run! Eating enough is important and you would realize it in the long run as your body starts to dysfunctional due to lack of nutrition. Try to eat a balanced diet and see the changes for sure.

2. Train harder

Just diet won’t help in weight loss. Proper training is important too. Be determined and take up exercise in any form as a habit like yoga, running, swimming, or Zumba. Hit the gym and let it motivate you to remain fit.

3. Connect with the community

The importance of a like-minded community knows no bounds. Connect with the people who are going through the same phase and share tips and tricks within your circle. Also, it will help in boosting your morale and push you even harder.

4. Don’t skip

Do not skip your meals no matter what and so do training. Keep a track of your progress and be consistent in your efforts. This way you would be able to reach your target sooner. Skipping meals would only result in the accumulation of fats and weight in the future which would be harder to lose.

5. Have Patience

The weight loss journey can be easy for some while tough for others. Do not let the time take away your motivation. Stay motivated and have patience and respect the process as your true zeal and enthusiasm will help you reach your target sooner.

6. Never give up!

Giving up is for losers and you sure aren’t one! So stick to your journey and see the change in your body soon. Do not take the process as a forced one, rather enjoy it!

Over to you You can do it! Write to yourself some self-motivating quotes, take inspiration from success stories, and consult and seek guidance from experts and nutritionists for the best results, after all it’s your body!

title.rendered: Guidelines To Develop Hygiene Practices Amongst Kids

content.rendered:
Coronavirus has brought the focus to sanitization and hygiene more than ever and as parents and guardians, it is vital to teaching your kids to take proper precautions and steps to a safer life, not just for coronavirus but as a means to good habits in general. For all the confused parents here we have a few guidelines to keep your kids safe and teach them hygiene practices.

1. Washing hands

Washing hands has always been in the textbooks for as long as we can remember but now it is even more in the limelight. Kids should be aware of when to wash their hands, even when they are not around to monitor. Here are certain instances:

a) Before and after eating

b) After visiting the loo

c) After handling pets

d) After playing

e) Touching anything dirty with an increased risk of illness

f) After visiting outside

g) After handling shoes

2. Brushing teeth

Brushing teeth twice a day is good oral hygiene that every kid must follow to avoid cavity formation. Brushing after eating anything sticky or very sweet is also recommended. Cleanse your mouth and rinse after eating every time.

3. Using a handkerchief

Using a handkerchief is good etiquette and hygiene practice. It must be taught to kids early on so that they stay neat and tidy.

4. Avoid putting everything in your mouth

Kids have the tendency to put everything in their mouths, especially toys and household items. Make them aware that it is a bad practice.

5. When to restrict sharing

Sharing is a good sign of building good relationships and friends but in some cases, sharing can harm health especially if it bears the risk of infection. Try to teach your kids not to share the water bottles they sip in, or hanky, towels, and other personal items.

6. Mask and sanitizer

Using masks and sanitizers while stepping out is a common practice nowadays and it should continue as a means to prevent infections and illnesses.

Over to you, Care for your kid’s safety and health should bring into the focus teaching them to practice such practices while you are not around to monitor. Hence it is important to teach them to develop these hygiene practices as habits.

title.rendered: 5 Nutrients And Their Sources For A Healthy Skin!

content.rendered:
Skin health is often restricted to a superficial one. But it requires equal attention from within just like any other organ. There is a lack of awareness amongst people regarding the nutrients that are beneficial for skin health. Taking care of skin health is important to look young and healthy. So the top 5 nutrients for healthy skin are as follows:

1. Vitamin E

Vitamin E keeps skin healthy and supple. It reduces the chance of getting wrinkles and keeps skin youthful. Vitamin E develops a skin barrier and helps in preventing skin diseases. Eat loads of nuts and oil and fortified foods.

2. Vitamin C

Vitamin C is an antioxidant that protects the skin. It brightens the skin and helps in skin healing. Wounded skin heals faster with Vitamin C. Eat citrus fruits like lemon, watermelon, orange, and peaches.

3. Vitamin A

Vitamin A or retinol is a powerful nutrient important for the proper development of skin and keeping them supple and healthy. Vitamin A keeps skin nourished and healthy and delays wrinkle formation. Eat loads of green vegetables, especially green leafy ones.

4. Omega fatty acids

Omega fatty acids including PUFA and MUFA are well known for their benefits on skin health. They are very important to keep skin nourished, glowing and youthful! Consume nuts and seeds every day to give your body the required dose of omega fatty acids. Almonds, walnuts, and pistachios are rich in omega fatty acids.

5. Protein

Protein is important for skin and muscle formation. It builds tissues and cells and amino acids are crucial for good skin. Have a good amount of beans, nuts, pulses, and animal protein like meat and egg.

Over to your Skin requires care from within and a healthy diet with all the above-mentioned nutrient are sure to keep your skin healthy, glowing, and supple all year round!

title.rendered: Recipe: Peachy Ice Tea

content.rendered:
We know how the song “Peaches” by Bieber is a trend these days, especially in reels, then why not make it a trend to make this health goodie a part of your diet in the form of the delicious Peachy ice tea and say goodbye to all the summer heat!

Nutritional benefits:

Peaches are good for heart health as they lower the risk of heart diseases. It is good for people with high blood pressure and cholesterol. It reduces inflammation and improves eye health and skin health. Green tea is rich in antioxidants and is great for weight loss and lowering the risk of lifestyle disorders.

Ingredients:

  • 2 whole peaches
  • 1 tbsp green tea leaves (you may opt for black tea leaves too)
  • Sweetener as desired preferably sugar
  • 1 tbsp honey
  • Ice cubes

Procedure

1. Deseed the peaches and bring them to a boil along with sugar and water. Crush the peaches and mash them well to blend into a good syrup.

2. Cover and cook for some time. Remove from heat and let it cool for 30 min.

3. Meanwhile brew your tea as per the strength you desire from light to moderate to strong.

4. Transfer the tea into a pitcher and cool in the refrigerator.

5. Strain the peach syrup and add it to the tea and stir well. Add honey if desired.

6. Add ice and serve chilled!

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Ice cold peach tea is your perfect choice as a perfect getaway to a summer evening. Try this recipe for a refreshing day or a great evening with your pals.

title.rendered: Five Ways to a Positive Life!

content.rendered:
They say, when life gives you lemons, Make Lemonade. But in reality, it is quite difficult to set a positive mindset and get the best out of the worst. It takes effort, support, and everyday motivation to set a track towards a life filled with positivity. Let’s take a look at five simple ways to fill your life with positive energy!

1. Practice Yoga

Yoga which has been around for ages has proven health benefits and fills the mind and body with positive energy. It not only cures several illness but also improves longevity. Take time out to practice yoga and start your day on a positive note.

2. Words of wisdom

On waking up, try to recite some positive words every day or find yourself spiritually engaged with God and praying. Reciting positive words and words of wisdom helps in giving life a direction and fills you with motivation.

3. Eat Healthily

Eating healthy including fiber-rich foods helps to keep the mind alert and sharp. It helps in overall growth and prevents illness and convalescence. So include loads of veggies, nuts, and cereals in your diet and keep fast food to a minimum.

4. Pick up skills

Gather a new skill that will help you in staying engaged and prevent negative thoughts and vibes. Try taking a new class, a hobby, or some team sport. Interacting with like-minded people also helps in bringing positivity.

5. Me time

Take some time out of your busy schedule and pamper yourself into a spa or a beauty routine, a session of non-stop music, a cooking session, and loads of experimenting, or a calm evening with a cup of coffee, your favorite book, and nothing else!

What’s next? Filling life with positive energy is very important for a healthy and prosperous life. So, pull up your sleeves and set on to attract all the positivity in the world because you deserve it!

title.rendered: 4 Simple Ways To Take Care Of Your Oral Health!

content.rendered:
Oral health often gets neglected and it is important to have proper awareness about oral health across all age groups because it is an important part of your body. After all, who likes yellow stained teeth!

Oral care should begin early, as early as a kid, and should continue religiously every day. Kids learn from elders so everyone in the family should be part of the ritual to take care of the teeth. Here are some simple tips for healthy and beautiful teeth.

1. Avoid junk food

Junk food is rich in fatty acids and materials that corrode the enamel. Avoid too many sweets and junk food to keep your teeth healthy and shiny. Junk food takes away the shine from the teeth and fills them with a bad odor.

2. Eat more fiber

Fiber helps in keeping teeth strong and healthy. Add loads of fiber to your diet in the form of carrots, green vegetables, grains, and nuts.

3. Brush regularly

Brushing regularly and preventing cavities and other oral health issues. Follow up brushing with a good mouth wash to avoid bad odor and bacterial damage. Flossing once a week can also be done to keep food particles from sticking between teeth

4. Say no to tobacco

Tobacco is dangerous for oral health and leads to cancer. It is best to avoid tobacco if you care for your teeth. If you find it difficult to leave, seek assistance when needed.

Over to you, Oral health is fairly easy to maintain if taken proper care of regularly. Try to manage time to take care of your oral health because your smile is priceless!

title.rendered: Hitting Puberty? Follow These Helpful Tips!

content.rendered:
Getting into the phase of puberty can be challenging especially when you have little knowledge and loads of questions! The period of adolescence is a tricky one and you must deal with it with care as it is a vital phase of your life.

1. Eat well

Bulimia and other eating disorders are common during adolescence. Eat well during this phase of your life as your diet is very important and must not be neglected.  Avoid the rat race of becoming slim and following rigorous bodyweight fluctuations.

2. Take care of your private parts

Hygiene and taking care of private parts is very important as one steps into puberty and experience new things. Try to read more and get clarity before indulging in anything. Wash your private areas regularly, maintain sanitary conditions and avoid using shared washrooms.

3. Don’t blindly believe the virtual world

The virtual world is tempting but is largely misleading. Don’t believe everything you see on the digital screen. Try to be rational and not lose your self-respect.

4. It’s okay to not be okay

Stop comparing too often and focus on your mental and physical health. It is okay to not be okay as we are not hundred percent perfect. Everything seems picture-perfect but the real world is quite different.

5. Don’t shy away to open up

Puberty is a difficult time for both mental and physical health. Don’t shy away from opening up about yourself in front of your friends and families. Express your journey and emotions to someone you can trust and be comfortable around.

Over to you, Puberty is a tricky phase for both boys and girls as they step into the transition where bodily changes are remarkable. Try to take it as a journey and enjoy it to the fullest.

title.rendered: 4 Fiber-Rich Grains For Weight Loss!

content.rendered:
Tired of that same old rice for your meals while you look down at your belly fat and wonder why must you not try other trending grains that does more good for your weight loss journey! Here is a quick guide to a healthier future with these healthy and fiber-rich grains.

1. Oats

Oats, rich in fiber and minerals are great to keep your satiety levels up and consumption levels low. Oats make you fuller faster so you tend to binge eat less. Add oats into your diet in various forms like khichri, porridge, shake, pour, etc.

2. Quinoa

Quinoa is a superfood rich in many vital minerals and fiber. It is highly nutritious containing minerals like selenium, zinc, manganese, and phosphorus amongst many others. It is also rich in protein and low in carbohydrates. Have it as a salad or a replacement for your regular rice.

3. Ragi

Ragi is rich in calcium and fiber along with a host of other minerals that aid in maintaining a healthy weight, improving metabolism as well as increasing

4. Amaranth

Amaranth or ram dana is an ancient cereal that is beneficial during fasting and festive occasions. Consume it as a part of the regular meal in the form of Laddoo, chikki, or simply with milk. It is a very nutritious grain that our grandparents used to eat to stay healthy.

Over to you Staying in shape, especially this summer can help you boost confidence as well as prevent a host of lifestyle diseases. Replace your regular staple with these nutritious grains once in a while.

excerpt.rendered: Tired of that same old rice for your meals while you look down at your belly fat and wonder why must you not try other trending grains that does more … Continue reading 4 Fiber-Rich Grains For Weight Loss!

title.rendered: Recipe: Sprouts Salad

content.rendered:
Looking for a healthy snack that’s rich in nutrients, great for weight loss, and easy to prepare? Sprouts salad is the right choice. Try this salad that can be made with easily available ingredients and is very nutritious as well as filling.

Nutritional benefits:

Moong dal and Bengal gram are common pulses that are rich in protein, good fiber, and vital minerals. It is very good for digestive health and weight loss. Vegetables are rich in vitamins and minerals like calcium, zinc, iron, potassium, and manganese.

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup Bengal gram
  • 1 cup moong
  • ½ cup chopped carrots
  • ½ cup chopped onions
  • ½ cup chopped tomatoes
  • Coriander leaves
  • 1tbsp lemon juice
  • 1tsp chat masala
  • Few pomegranates
  • Salt as required

Procedure

1. Soak the dal separately well and change water repeatedly until sprouts emerge.

2. Add the chopped vegetables and mix well

3. Add salt to it and lemon juice.

4. Add chat masala powder to it and mix well.

5. Garnish with coriander leaves and pomegranates.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Have sprouts as a part of your daily diet as it is rich in minerals and fiber, requires no cooking, and are a filling food too. You may adjust the seasoning as per your choice.

title.rendered: Easy Workouts For Kids!

content.rendered:
As parents are you worried about the increased screen time and lack of physical activities amongst your kids? It is something that is best not neglected because it might have consequences on overall health as an adult and develop underlying health conditions.

Let’s look into some easy workouts for kids!

1. Early morning 10-minute exercise

Make it a habit to wake up early and perform easy free-hand exercises dedicatedly for 10 minutes at least. A light exercise to moderate exercise during the day can boost metabolism to a greater level. It may involve

a) Light jogging

b) Brisk walking

c) Rolling pelvic exercise

d) Stretching exercises

2. Midday play

Make sure your kids engage in some outdoor play like basketball, football, running games, catch-catch games, or some group activity. Make sure not to make them stay under the sun for too long and hydrate them regularly.

3. Take the stairs

Make it a habit to take the stairs and practice as parents to teach the kids. A 10-minute session of climbing up and down the stairs can be a form of exercise too. It will strengthen the calf muscles.

4. Afternoon games

Ditch the video game and walk up to the nearby park and spend time with other kids while also having fun.

5. Dance lessons

Dance is a good form of exercise and improves flexibility too. Enroll your kids in a dance lesson or a Zumba and watch them stay in shape and active.

Over to you Don’t neglect your kid’s inactivity, instead follow these simple to follow and easy to adjust routines in your kid’s routine.

title.rendered: 5 Foods You Must Include Post 60!

content.rendered:
There is very limited awareness about the need for nutritional attention for the elderly and often people fail to address their specific requirements. When you pass the age of 60, the body starts to show dramatic changes and it requires extra attention. Here is a guideline of five foods that must find their place on the plate if you are past the age of 60!

1. Banana

Bananas are great for the elderly as it is rich in minerals like sodium and potassium along with easily digestible fiber. Bananas are easy to chew and good for gut health. Include it whole or mashed. It can be paired with rice and milk too for a healthy meal.

2. Rice

Rice is easily digestible and contains simple carbohydrates which help in easy digestion and breakdown of the components. Have rice with curd or milk. It can be well balanced into khichdi with different types of veggies.

3. Curd

Curd is rich in probiotics and calcium which is also good for gut health. Include curd in your everyday diet to have a well-balanced meal. You can also prepare raita or shrikhand out of the curd.

4. Turmeric

Turmeric is rich in antimicrobial properties which are good for overall immunity. Since immunity reduces as one ages, it is important to have turmeric every day, preferably raw for a stronger body.

5. Sweet Potato

Sweet potatoes are rich in minerals like phosphorus, potassium, zinc, and magnesium. It is good for digestive health as well as filling the stomach. Have it boiled, roasted, or in a curry.

Footnote Elderly requires extra care and attention to remain healthy and increase longevity. Include these foods in your daily diet and take care of your digestive health.

title.rendered: Include These Foods For A Healthy Pregnancy

content.rendered:
Pregnancy is a vital time in the lives of every woman when extra care and pampering are needed. Women often feel confused about what to choose and what to eat. We are here to help you with a list of foods that will help you have a healthy and nutritious pregnancy.

1. Carrots

Carrots are rich in nutrients like Vitamin A and iron essential for healthy eyesight and skin health. Include it as salad, in curries or as a halwa.

2. Spinach

Spinach is rich in dark green components which is vital for good hair and skin health. It is rich in fiber and hence it is important for digestion too. Include it in your diet for a healthy pregnancy.

3. Milk

Include milk and milk products every day as it is rich in calcium and lots of vital minerals like phosphorus and zinc. Have paneer and avoid too many processed foods like cheese.

4. Nuts

Nuts are rich in zinc and selenium. It is important for proper skin and brain development as it is rich in omega fatty acids. Have sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, chia seeds, and flax seeds.

5. Turmeric

Turmeric is anti-microbial and has many health benefits. It will help in keeping you protected and improve immunity. Include it in everyday recipes and have it with milk too.

6. Cucumber

Cucumber is rich in water and cooling properties. It is important to have it as a salad or simply as a juice during midday.

7. Fatty fish

Fatty fish is rich in omega fatty acids which are beneficial for the proper growth and development of the fetus. Include it at least once a week.

Over to you Don’t neglect your health as your baby’s future is dependent on what you consume during your pregnancy.  Take extra care and make sure to include these foods in your pregnancy diet.

title.rendered: 5 Skincare Routines For Glowing Skin!

content.rendered:
Worried about what to follow and what not to amongst the truckload of information available on the internet with the desire to achieve a picture-perfect skin? Worry not as we list down the five skincare routines that everyone must follow for healthy and glowing skin!

Step 1. Cleanse

The first step to a better skin from within is to choose a perfect cleanser as per skin type and use it regularly. Go for an oil-based cleanser followed by a water-based one for added benefits. It is better to choose a good quality cleanser.

Step 2. Exfoliate

Scrubbing once a week is essential for clear skin and exfoliation improves blood circulation too. There are plenty of exfoliating agents available in both physical and chemical forms. Try to read the ingredients carefully.

Step 3. Toner

Toner helps in locking the pores and prevents skin damage. It is important to look for an alcohol-free toner for better long-term skin health. Many often tend to skip the toning step however it is crucial in making skin supple and hydrated. It also helps in preventing the development of fine lines.

Step 4. Serums

Serums are protecting agents and there is a wide variety of serums available in the market that are a huge craze recently. They are like targeted treatments for your skin to tackle specific conditions like skin aging, acne, fine lines, etc. Look out for serums of Vitamin C, vitamin E, hyaluronic acids, and retinol.

Step 5. Moisturize

Never skip moisturizer no matter what skin type are you! Moisturizer locks skin goodness and protects skin from external damage and harm. Choose aloe-based moisturizer during summers and intense cream for winters.

Over To You A routine of Skincare helps in keeping skin healthy, supple, and clear. Follow both daytime and nighttime routine every day for pampering and self-care you deserve.

title.rendered: Recipe: Oats Khichdi

content.rendered:
Oats khichdi is a healthy twist to regular khichdi and a new way to prepare oats which is a healthy and wholesome food ingredient. Try this recipe for your breakfast or lunch and serve it with pickles or crisps for a healthy day!

Nutritional benefits:

Oats are rich in good fiber and vital minerals. It is very good for digestive health and weight loss. Vegetables are rich in vitamins and minerals like calcium, zinc, iron, potassium, and manganese.

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup rolled oats
  • 1 cup moong
  • ½ cup chopped carrots
  • ½ cup chopped onions
  • ½ chopped cauliflower
  • ½ cup peas
  • Turmeric powder as required
  • Cumin seeds
  • Ginger garlic paste
  • 1tsp butter or ghee
  • Salt as required

Procedure

1. Heat butter or ghee on a pan and add cumin and ginger-garlic paste.

2. Add onions and stir well till golden brown.

3. add chopped veggies and cook until done.

4. Rinse the moong dal and add to the veggies. Add salt and turmeric as per taste.

5. Add oats and about 3 cups of water and pressure cook well.

6. Serve hot with preferred garnishing.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: This recipe is great for adults and kids alike. Try this healthy recipe which is low in carbs and high in fiber and minerals. It will supply a good amount of veggies too!

title.rendered: 5 Ways To Take Care Of Your Kid’s Health!

content.rendered:
Kids of this generation are no joke! The know-it-all, from being tech-savvy to knowing how to fight back or even deal with tricky situations leave even elders in amazement. On it one side, kids need extra attention to health and well-being for proper growth and development.

Find these five ways in which you can take care of your kid for better health.

1. Spend time

Kids grow up differently as per the time parents spend with them. With limited outside exposure during covid, it is important for the family to spend time together and listen to their stories and outlook on life.

2. Plan your meals

Planning meals in advance not only saves you time and money but also takes good care of your and your family’s health. Plan healthy meals after consulting with your pediatrician and nutritionist and leave out junk foods.

3. Don’t give into nagging

Kids are good at nagging. Don’t try to give in to their nagging, try to be logical and reasonable while shopping out. They tend to be attracted to all the new products on shelves, and don’t fulfill their demands easily. Look at what is best for their health before anything else.

4. Screen out

Be strict while monitoring their screen time and fix a time schedule when they can handle gadgets. Over usage will lead to several health issues like eyesight and mental health problems.

5. Give space

Give space to your kids when needed as they require scope for growth and development. Kids love to spend some time alone doing what they love as it pulls them out from constant supervision.

Over to you Follow these simple steps to take care of your kid’s health and watch them grow into beautiful human beings.

title.rendered: Why You Should Include Turmeric Daily!

content.rendered:
Turmeric the golden spice has been around for ages. Its health benefits and beneficial effects are known to everyone. It has high demand in foreign markets for reasons that validate its true potential. Here is a list of why you must include turmeric in your everyday diet!

1. Antibacterial

Turmeric has antibacterial properties which is the most important property. It has been used to cure several ailments and diseases.

2. Digestive health

Turmeric is vital for proper digestion, include this spice in everyday cooking like curries and teas. It is good for digestion for the elderly as turmeric milk is a go-to drink when it comes to digestion and sleep.

3. Color

 Turmeric possesses beautiful golden yellow color which is essential as a natural colorant in comparison to artificial ones. It is healthy and has no side effects when taken in limited quantities.

4. Aroma

Turmeric adds aroma and texture to food. Turmeric has a special aroma and raw turmeric has the optimum benefits.

5. Skin health

For Indian weddings, Haldi has been in use for ages. It is an important component in cosmetics too. But the best is when it is taken as a raw paste. It has tremendous skin benefits.

Over to you

Turmeric has no replacement and it can be taken in various forms. So what are you waiting for fore, don’t miss out on its beautiful health potential?

title.rendered: Fitness Regime For Everyone

content.rendered:
Fitness is not just for people looking for weight loss, it is for everyone! Staying fit and healthy can be done in many ways and forms as per individual interests and preferences. No matter what one must take it as a priority and take out time to remain fit and healthy.

Fitness is for everyone so feel free to choose what suits you best to remain active!

1. Running

Running is an amazing way to remain fit and healthy. It improves lung capacity and overall health, works on muscles, and can be often liberating.

2. Swimming

Swimming improves body shape and breathing capacity, and overall it’s like a lifesaving lesson. Take up swimming classes and watch how beautiful the feeling is.

3. Dancing

Dancing can be of many forms, it helps in improving flexibility while letting you stay fit. It is a great stress reliever and is a beautiful art form. Often exercise regimes are clubbing with dance-like Zumba which is an active and sporty way to lose weight.

4. Yoga

Yoga and its health benefits are incomparable. It is great both for mental as well as physical health. Learn yoga and you would see many ailments and body issues take a backseat.

5. Games

Games help you stay fit and active, outdoor games to be precise! Take up the weekly activity of football, basketball, table tennis, badminton, or any other sport that is as per your preference.

What’s Next?

Leave your couch and get going to pick up a hobby and watch how fun it is to remain fit!

title.rendered: Recipe: Apple Honey Pancake

content.rendered:
Looking for a healthy variety of pancakes to feed your kid? Look no further than this delicious and healthy pancake with the goodness of apple and honey.

Nutritional benefits:

Apples are loaded with nutrients comprising antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals along with dietary fiber. Honey has digestive health benefits and is a natural sweetener.

Ingredients:

  • 50ml Apple juice
  • 15g apple mashed
  • 10g all-purpose flour
  • 1 egg
  • 5g baking soda
  • 5g honey
  • 1tsp butter
  • Salt as required

Procedure

1. In a bowl mix the flour, baking powder, and salt well.

2. In another bowl stir together the egg, apple juice, honey, and butter.

3. Add all of it to the flour mixture and blend well.

4. Lightly coat a non-stick pan with butter and heat over medium heat.

5. Pour the pancake mix and cook both sides until the texture is achieved.

6. Garnish with extra honey and serve.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: This recipe is great for adults and kids alike. Try it as a breakfast recipe and top it up with fresh fruits for added benefits.

title.rendered: Mental Health Guide

content.rendered:
Are you finding yourself under constant stress and pressure that life throws? Our fast-paced life paired with high productivity is no doubt taking a toll on the mental health of everyone around us. It is important to focus on your mental and physical well-being for a beautiful and long life.

Not everything works for everyone, try out some of these steps to tackle your mental health in day-to-day life.

1. Take time to breathe

Sit back. Relax. Breathe. Stop being so hard on yourself and just take time to breathe. It will help your brain receive the blood and oxygen better and help you think better.

2. Pick up your hobbies

Often in busy schedules, you may forget to do what you always loved like dancing, gardening, painting, or singing. Pick up your past hobbies and make it a goal to do something at least once a week.

3. Connect

Connect with your loved ones, friends, and family for love and support. Don’t shy away from sharing your emotions with them.

4. Disconnect

Disconnect from toxic people and ones who worsen your mental health. Take time off and focus on your growth and health instead.

5. Journal it

Journal your emotions and feelings on a daily basis. It is a great way to unwind and rewind to vent out and gain clarity.

Over to you Taking care of mental health is as important as focusing on physical health so try out these steps and see what works best for you.

title.rendered: 5 Good Practices You Should Follow Every Day

content.rendered:
Habits form out of practices and it shapes who we are. We are all different individuals having a different routine but we all look towards having a good day. Good practices can make your day good too! So here are some five good practices that you should follow every day to bring peace, productivity, and success.

1. Brush daily

The importance of brushing twice daily is something hard to neglect. Other than the fact that you are expecting healthy teeth till your elderly years, it is important to brush your teeth daily and show your kids as an example too.

2. Take time for yourself

Some time for oneself is very important as it helps to keep the mind positive and healthy. Take time and think about yourself and your priorities.

3. Indulge in fun activities

Fun activities can be anything, be it swimming, painting, reading, or playing, try to indulge in at least one every day. Fun activities can also be interacting with your family members. Try to channel the inner you.

4. Stay hydrated

Simple thing but so very important to remain hydrated every day. Fry to keep a reminder on your phone to keep a track of your hydrating habits.

5. Make a planner

Building a planner on daily basis helps in channeling the thoughts and makes days productive. Keep a track of your schedules and commitments.

Over to You Some steps may seem very simple and ordinary but it is what makes the difference. Manage your day by following these simple steps and remain healthy by making healthy choices.

title.rendered: Tips To Tackle Dry Skin

content.rendered:
Dry skin may be a skin type but when dry skin is prominent amongst the ones who have oily or combination skin, it may be a sign of concern. Dry skin may differ as a result of changing seasons or changing nutritional profiles. There are several ways to tackle dry skin and we list here a few of them.

1. Use less harsh ingredients

There are several harsh ingredients in cosmetics that are harmful to the skin. Make sure to read the label carefully before purchasing. The more soap a product contains, the more tendency it is to wipe off the protective fatty layer.

2. Moisturize often

Moisturizer is important to replenish the skin with the lost moisturizer or due to frequent washing. Try to use good quality products as the skin needs care and proper attention.

3. Use sunscreen

Sunscreen is very important to maintain the integrity of the skin cells. Try to use sunscreen often and in good SPF as it is important to block harmful rays of the sun to prevent skin damage.

4. Hydrate more

Water is so very vital for the skin and overall health. It helps in keeping skin healthy and soft and it also helps in flushing out toxins from the body. Remember to hydrate more often and take it up as a regular habit.

5. Use gloves

Wearing Gloves while doing different chores is important in keeping hands healthy and soft. The nails and the surrounding skin remains in better condition when gloves are worn. Try to use gloves more often.

6. Include more fats

Fats present in nuts, milk, fish, and seeds help in providing essential omega fatty acids which keep skin healthy and well-nourished. Include them in your everyday diet in good amounts.

Over to you Follow these basic and simple tips and say goodbye to dry skin. Be careful not to overdo anything and use good quality products.

title.rendered: Recipe: Mango Popsicle

content.rendered:
Summers and coolers go hand in hand, and more so if it is also the season of mangoes. Coolers are a great way to take care of the digestive health while also satisfying the taste buds

Nutritional benefits:

Popsicle is a sweet treat for summers rich in good quality ingredients when prepared at home. It is a natural cooler. It is rich in vitamins and minerals and is also beneficial for digestive health. Mangoes are rich in vitamin C and A and are a great way to bring variety.

Ingredients:

  • 500ml Coconut Milk
  • 1-2 mango
  • Sweetener as required

Procedure

1. Boil milk till it thickens a bit. Set it aside to cool.

2. Pulp out the mangoes and blend in a blender.

3. Add the sweetener and condensed milk if desired.

4. Adjust the consistency with liquid milk. Pour it into molds and let it semi-set.

5. Add Popsicle sticks and let them freeze completely.

6. Unmold under running water and enjoy!

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Summer is all about ice creams, popsicles, and kulfis! Indulge in this delicious treat of mango popsicle to stay cool and refreshed this summer.

title.rendered: Top Vegan Recipes That Are Must-Try!

content.rendered:
Veganism gained popularity in recent years and the market is filled with products to cater to this customer base. Veganism is more than just avoiding consuming animals and animal products. It is more like a spiritual and ethical connection that binds the community together. While our diet is mainly plant-based, an animal-based diet has been part too. It is important not to neglect the health factor while choosing vegan foods.

Some of the top vegan recipes that you can try are:

1. Squash Soup

Squash is a source of a host of nutrients and when paired with nuts it just adds to the health benefits. Add loads of nuts and seeds like pumpkin seeds and seasoning of choice.

2. Sesame noodles

Noodles can be prepared without egg in a vegan way and when it has sesame as an ingredient, it is bound to add a nutritional quotient to the product. Have it with spinach and receive the goodness of various nutrients like calcium and iron in one go!

3. Nutty Cauliflower salad

Cauliflower is a healthy alternative to rice mostly preferred by keto dieters. It supplies a good amount of nutrients while being super healthy. Try adding it to your diet once in a while with loads of veggies and appropriate seasoning.

4. Quinoa mix

Quinoa is not only loaded with protein and other goodies but is also rich in fiber. It is surely going to build some good blocks! Try adding quinoa mix to your diet and stay healthy.

Footnote Ramp up your Vegan vibes with these trendy recipes that are surely going to take care of your health and wellbeing!

title.rendered: Why Exercising is important?

content.rendered:
Remaining fit is very important to stay healthy and this can be achieved by exercising regularly. The exercise which may seem tiring is very crucial for overall health as it is loaded with multiple benefits. Find the list of benefits of exercising below,

1. To manage a healthy weight

Exercise and fitness help in achieving a healthy weight and a fit body which is everybody’s target nowadays. Maintaining a healthy weight is important to prevent a host of possible diseases and disorders in the future.

2. To remain active

It is important to remain active and energetic throughout the day and exercising does just that. Staying active boosts overall health. It improves productivity as compared to staying idle and inactive.

3. To stay young

Exercising helps in taking care of every cell of the body and flushing out toxins to remain young with glowing skin. Indulge in some good exercise regimes and stay youthful throughout, year after year.

4. To improve mental health

A good exercise routine not only helps in improving mood but also brings down stress levels. Try to exercise every day to remain positive and full of energy. It is thus important to take time from your daily schedule and try exercising.

5. To live long

It is nothing new that exercising help in improving your years. It fills life with oxygen and drives positive energy. Staying fit, young, and healthy is a thing everyone dreams of.

Over to You Exercising has many health benefits and these are just some of them. Let us motivate you to grab on to your bestie and get exercising!

title.rendered: Beat Hair fall With These Nutritious Foods!

content.rendered:
Hairfall woes are everybody’s worst nightmare. Sometimes it gets extremely difficult to figure out the causes of hair fall. It might happen due to deficiencies, side effects of drugs or surgery, or environmental factors. No matter what may be the cause of hair fall, it is wise to add these nutritious foods to your everyday diet.

1. Eggs

Eggs are great for hair as they contain a good amount of protein, vitamins, and minerals. Have boiled egg at least 4 days a week and see the difference in your hair quality. It helps in strengthening the hair and reduces hair fall.

2. Green leafy vegetables

Green leafy vegetables like spinach are rich in fiber and iron which is crucial for hair growth. Green leafy vegetables contain a good amount of antioxidants, minerals, and nutrients that help in strengthening roots.

3. Black sesame seeds

Black sesame seeds contain iron and calcium which are crucial for healthy hair. Try to include black sesame in your everyday diet and watch your hair grow healthy and strong.

4. Nuts

Nuts like almonds, walnuts, pine nuts, and pistachios contain omega fatty acids and vitamin E which help in nourishing hair and making it healthy. It helps in combating hair fall and reducing breakage.

5. Curd

Curd is rich in calcium, protein, and minerals that help in making hair silky and smooth. Include curd as a part of your daily diet as it also helps in keeping your gut healthy.

Over to you Include these nutritious foods in your daily diet and say goodbye to hair fall woes. Also, make sure you invest in a good hair cleanser and conditioner for taking proper hair care.

title.rendered: Simple Steps To Stay Protected this Summer!

content.rendered:
Feeling like staying inside a refrigerator while temperatures outside keep soaring? Summers can be really trouble when you have a lot of things to juggle. Try keeping in mind some simple steps because it is important not to neglect some key factors that might affect health in the long run.

1. Keep spices down

Spices tend to heat up the body and make you feel hotter. Try to avoid spicy and rich foods and indulge in cooling foods. Spicy foods during summers may lead to several digestive issues too.

2. Stay covered when out

Sunstroke can be really harmful. Stay covered when going out with sunglasses, caps, umbrellas, hand shields, and scarves. Make sure not to let direct rays reach your eyes or head for too long.

3. Wear comfortable

Comfortable clothing is key to tackling summers. Wear cotton clothes that are light and sweat friendly. Avoid heavy clothing or synthetic material.

4. Hydrate often

Remind yourself to stay hydrated throughout the day with healthy drinks like sherbets, coolers, juices, and more.

5. Don’t forget the sunscreen

Sunscreen is a must-have while tackling summers. Be sure to apply a good amount of sunscreen for at least 20 minutes before stepping out to stay protected from the harmful ultraviolet rays of the sun.

6. Avoid carbonated beverages

Chilled carbonated drinks may be tempting but it is best to avoid carbonated beverages as they result in draining out even more. Instead of carbonated water, try to reach out for healthy natural drinks made out of herbs like mint and fruits like lemon, cucumber, etc.

Footnote Summer needs to be tackled carefully. Try following these simple steps to take better care of yourself during summers and stay chilled all season long.

title.rendered: Recipe: Bael Sherbet

content.rendered:
Bael or wood apple is an important part of Indian summers. It has been part of our culture for ages and finds its way to the modern-day as well because of its end number of health benefits.

Nutritional benefits:

Wood Apple or bael is perfect for cooling during summers as the temperature soar high. It finds its use for digestive health as well as treating ulcers naturally. It is good for constipation too. During summers many witness digestive issues and it is a perfect drink for the summer!

Ingredients:

  • 1 bael
  • 3 Cups water
  • ½ tsp cardamom powder
  • 2 pinch black salt
  • 6 tsp jaggery or sugar

Procedure

1. Crack open the bael and take out its pulp.

2. Add the scooped pulp on a bowl and add one cup of water

3. Soak this mixture for 20 minutes.

4. Add more water and strain the mixture well.

5. Add sweetener to the strained mixture followed by cardamom powder and black salt.

6. Mix well and pour in the glasses. Have it regular or chilled.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you:

Try this cooling summer drink this season which is not only easy to prepare but also tasty to drink. Have it at midday to stay refreshed and healthy.

title.rendered: Looking For Weight Loss? Try These Low-Calorie Fruits!

content.rendered:
Summer offers a wide variety of fruits to choose from lemons to melons, but summers also bring several digestive issues to many individuals. A summer diet must be comprised of light, easily digestible foods. Maintaining weight during summers is comparatively easy with these low-calorie fruits to choose from!

1.  Kiwi

Kiwi is rich in minerals, vitamin C, and antioxidants while also containing a good amount of water and fiber. It makes kiwi a perfect diet-friendly treat. Have it as a salad with low-fat cottage cheese or as a topping to your oatmeal.

2. Berries

Berries are rich in antioxidants, and flavor along with being low in calories. Try out seasonal delights like strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries. Add them to your oatmeal, or use them as toppings for your favorite drinks.

3. Cucumber

Cucumber has a cooling and refreshing property while being extremely hydrating. Try out a cucumber to beat the heat while never worrying about calories as it is a diet-friendly fruit. Although it is also considered a vegetable, while looking for something as the main ingredient for your salad, you cannot miss out on it.

4. Watermelon

Watermelon is naturally sweet and rich in vitamin C and antioxidants. It is also low in calories and loaded with water which makes it a perfect summer fruit. Try out watermelon as sorbets or simply as a midday snack.

5. Citrus fruits

Citrus fruits are rich in vitamin C while also mostly being low in calories. Try out mousambi or sweet lime, lemons, and oranges for a light punch to your day. Make sure not to have them on an empty stomach as they might result in several gastric disturbances.

What’s next? Be sure to add these super healthy fruits to your diet routine as they are low in calories and high in antioxidants and nutrients. It is best to have them raw and not process them into recipes that take away their benefits!

title.rendered: 4 Diet-Friendly Drinks To Beat The Summer Heat!

content.rendered:
Summer is all about beachy vibes, shades, comfortable clothing, and loads of coolers! While looking for ways to beat the heat, you cannot go wrong with these four cooling drinks that are not only refreshing but low in calories as well, making them perfect for your weight loss journey to a perfect summer body!

1. Cucumber cooler

Cucumber is the star to beat summer because of its amazing hydrating properties. Rich in water content along with a refreshing punch because of the mildly sweet flavor. It is rich in antioxidants along with being low in sugar, making it perfect for a diet-friendly dink!

2. Aloe lemonade

Aloe Vera is known for its soothing properties. Try out a refreshing drink out of aloe vera in regular lemonade and stay cool this summer. Aloe vera has amazing skin health benefits along with being digestive friendly.

3. Minty punch

Mint is rich in aroma and flavor which is also great for digestive health. Its cooling properties are used in many products. Mint when added to a regular drink, makes it lively. Try adding fresh mint leaves to water, along with honey and ice cubes for a refreshing drink.

4. Watermelon sorbet

What is summer if not for the watermelons? Try this star summer fruit and beat summer heat naturally. Although watermelon is sweet, the sugar content is natural and refreshing. It requires no addition of white sugars. It is perfect for an afternoon or a midday drink.

Over to You With loads of tropical fruits and ingredients available in the market, be wise to look for healthier ones. Try these amazing and simple drinks this summer and stay hydrated throughout!

title.rendered: Top Gluten-Free Foods For Your Kids

content.rendered:
Many foods are naturally gluten-free and often the market is filled with advertising gimmicks to try and push you to purchase stuff that you would have probably figured out yourself anyways!

Here we would help you figure out the list of top gluten-free foods for your little ones!

1. Amaranth

Amaranth which is also known as Rajgira is rich in antioxidants while being gluten-free. Include it in your diet replacing wheat-based cereal as it is great when taken with milk. Prepare them into ladoos and add them as toppings to your meals.

2. Potato

Potato is gluten-free so you may include it in many forms like potato wedges, mashed potato cutlets, and recipes in ways that can be interesting to kids. But make sure to control your portion and not to include a huge amount as it is rich in carbs.

3. Quinoa

Quinoa is a superfood that is nutrient-dense that can easily be filling as well as replace your regular staple which is gluten-rich like wheat. Include it in the form of salad, or rice, or add it to your veggies. Kids love their colors so make sure to make it colorful with veggies.

4. Chia

One thing that kids would love to indulge in which is undoubtedly healthy too is chia seeds. Include it as a healthy breakfast in the form of chia pudding, topping with berries, fruits, and nuts.

5. Corn

Corn or maize is a good gluten-free option however it is processed in a facility where wheat is also processed. So it is best to have corn in unprocessed form or store-bought. Prefer sweet corn, baby corn, or roasted corn with over-processed corn flakes.

Over to you Whenever you are in a dilemma about what to look for while searching for gluten-free options, grab on to the list we jotted down and watch your kids grow all strong and healthy.

title.rendered: Recipe: Nutty Sweet Potato

content.rendered:
Nutty sweet potato is a great way to include some unique taste while being extremely healthy. It can serve as a great snack as well as a meal accompaniment. Serve this easy recipe when you have guests around for a quick get-together!

Nutritional benefits:

Sweet Potatoes are rich in minerals and vitamins, which has added benefit to digestive health along with skin health. Nuts are rich in omega fatty acids and Vitamin E. Spices are loaded with medicinal and health beneficial properties.

Ingredients:

  • 5g nuts
  • 1 sweet potato
  • 1 egg white
  • ½ tsp pepper

Procedure

1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees

2. In a bowl mix the black pepper and nuts.

3. In a separate bowl beat the egg white until fluffy.

4. Split the sweet potatoes and dip them in the egg mixture and then in the nut mixture. Place it in the baking tray and bake for about 30 minutes or until tender.

5. Add dressing of choice.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Try this quick, easy, and gluten-free recipe which is also unique enough to bring variety to your regular diet. Charm your kids with new ways by trying this recipe.

title.rendered: 5 Spices That Must Find Their Way To Your Kitchen

content.rendered:
Spices are abundant in a country like India and their medicinal properties date back to the time of sages. While spices add various flavors and tastes to various cuisines but sometimes spices are beyond their aromatic and flavorful properties. Let’s look into the 5 top spices and their health benefits!

1. Turmeric

Turmeric is the queen of spices because of its endless benefits. This yellow spice finds its way into every kitchen and is a basic for Indian curries. It has antibacterial properties and anti-inflammatory properties. It is a good habit to consume raw turmeric every day.

2. Pepper

Pepper is an extraordinary spice with its rich taste and spicy aroma. It finds its use in various forms like as a seasoning, together with salt. It has benefits for colds and coughs because of its strong aromatic properties.

3. Cardamom

No Indian dessert is complete without cardamom. Its seeds as well as the shell are very aromatic and add a distinct aroma to the dishes. It has benefits on the digestive health and it is good for maintaining skin health as well.

4. Cinnamon

The spice list is incomplete without cinnamon bark as this rich and flavorful spice is used in lentils as well as desserts. It has anti-inflammatory properties along with an anti-bacterial effect. Try and add it to your everyday diet.

5. Fenugreek

Fenugreek seeds are a very important part of Indian cuisine. It finds its use to manage diabetes. It has sugar-lowering abilities and is great for digestive health as well.

Endnote List of spices available is endless and their potential health benefits are abundant too. Make sure to include these top spices in your everyday diet and stay healthy throughout.

title.rendered: Prenatal Care That You Must Keep In Mind

content.rendered:
The feeling of bearing a child inside you is an unparalleled and surreal experience. With this beautiful comes great responsibility and extra care. It’s important for would-be mothers to remain calm and composed during the phase. For extra guidance we got you covered with these simple tips.

1. Watch your steps

One of the vital and most simple things that you can do to be extra careful is to watch your steps. Try not to walk for too long or climb too many stairs. It is best to wear comfortable shoes with good soles rather than painful heels.

2. Give way to cravings carefully

Cravings are far more common so give way to cravings carefully. Try to have healthy munchies nearby and do not keep the unhealthy junks. It is best to learn to control unnecessary cravings by planning right. It is best to seek the guidance of a nutritionist for proper meal planning.

3. Adequate rest

Rest is so crucial both for the baby inside as well as the mother. Try to have adequate rest and sufficient naps in between work. Make sure you have a calm and soothing environment to sleep and rest peacefully.

4. Reach out

When in doubt it is best to reach out to people. Although some days may feel tough and exhausting, there are days that get better and brighter by sharing with your friends, family, or partner. Never shy away from your struggles and try to stay informed and aware.

Over to you

It is the right time to pamper yourself with some extra care and warmth as the baby needs some extra love growing within you. Try to follow these simple steps and enjoy the process!

title.rendered: Post-Partum Tips For New Moms

content.rendered:
The post-partum phase is an important phase of transition for every mom. While it’s a critical time for newborns to adjust to the new world outside the mother’s womb, it is also an important phase for mothers as they struggle with various bodily and mental issues.

A little help can go a long way and thus, some of our tips for new moms can be a helping hand for every mom reading this!

1. Breasts need love

Once the baby is born, the breastfeeding phase starts and it is a crucial phase for every mother-child relationship. Initially, breasts may seem swollen, heavy, and uncomfortable but keep in mind that it is where all the vital food for your baby is stored. Be gentle with your breasts and enjoy the process.

2. Saggy skin is okay

The phase of pregnancy has seen many changes in the mother’s body as it prepared and carried a whole new organism. Once the baby is born, skin is bound to be saggy and it would take time to return to its original state.

3. Be gentle

It is foolish to be harsh on yourself when you have won a war and given birth to a new living being. Try to be gentle with yourself and remind yourself of how special it is to be a mother. Try to talk to people and dedicate your time to something positive or engaging.

4. Everything takes time

Everything in nature has its own course of time, and so does this phase. Learn to be patient and calm even in tough situations. Focus on your physical and mental health and listen to some good music to calm your moods.

Over to you Always seek personal or professional help whenever you feel you are struggling with this phase. Talk to new moms and learn about their struggles and winning stories.

title.rendered: 5 Colors That Must Find Its Way To Your Kid’s Plate!

content.rendered:
Kids love colors and there is no denying it. When it comes to food, parents find it hard to look for ways to feed kids so that they recipe adequate nutrition and health crucial for their growth and metabolism.

Here we list some five colors that must find their way to your kid’s plate!

1. Red

Gorgeous and bright red can be found in foods like pomegranate, watermelon, tomato, and beetroot to name a few. It is rich in antioxidants, fiber, and loads of vitamins and minerals crucial for kids’ health. Add them in various forms like smoothies, juice, or simply as salads.

2. Yellow

Yellow-colored fruits and vegetables are vital for eye health as they are rich in carotene and vitamin C. make sure to add papaya, mango, pumpkin, muskmelon, yellow capsicum, egg yolk, orange, and other citrus fruits. Have them during the day for enhanced protection and building a healthy system.

3. Green

Kids often refuse to eat greens as they find them less tasty but in fact, they are the ones loaded with nutrients. Find ways to incorporate greens into an everyday diet like spinach, bitter gourd, leafy vegetables, and capsicum. Add them as salad, curries, smoothies, and shakes.

4. Purple

Purple is an attractive color and is sure to add to the diet with purple cabbage, grapes, onion, brinjal, berries, figs, and plums. Mix them with various dishes and let their creative senses awaken.

5. White

White-colored foods are quite common like guava, cucumber, water chestnut, banana, gourds, etc. It’s important to include these in their diet for a healthy upbringing.

Over to you

Feeding should be fun for kids and it can become an adventure when a wide range of colors found naturally in these foods are introduced to kids. Nature is abundant with healthy and colorful foods and it’s the time kids enjoy eating foods high in nutrients.

title.rendered: 4 Amazing Milk-Based Recipes For A Successful Weight Gain!

content.rendered:
Looking for weight gain recipes to bring extra charm to your everyday life? Look nowhere beyond these amazing and easy-peasy milk-based recipes for a healthy weight gain!

1. Choco Almond smoothie

Star ingredient in one recipe- chocolate, almonds, and milk! Smoothie tastes a hell lot better when it has chocolate in it to tempt anyone. Add in your touch of health by including oats and bananas in it. It is a filling recipe that is bound to gather some healthy weight.

2. Paneer Kofta

Kofta made out of paneer or cottage cheese is a yummy accompaniment to any meal. Soft and spongy paneer in rich gravy not only tastes divine but is also good for weight gain. Have it with freshly cooked steamed rice or with chapattis and add some variety to your meals.

3. Mango Pudding

Puddings are much loved in almost all seasons, be it summer or winter. Mango pudding when chilled is a delicious snack in itself. Use whole milk for some extra good fats but be sure to take control of portion size as excess might lead to digestive issues.

4. Rice kheer

Any Indian festival is incomplete without kheer. Kheer can be made out of many ingredients but one constant ingredient is milk. When paired with rice, nuts, and cardamom, the dessert is hard to resist. It is also a healthy and filling option.

Over to you

Weight gain might get challenging at times but with these simple recipes, you are sure to put on some healthy weight but be sure to control added sugar and the portion size.

title.rendered: 5 Tricks For Weight Loss This Summer

content.rendered:
Sweaty training sessions during summers can be challenging as the temperatures keep soaring high every day. Make it a point to follow these simple steps for your weight loss journey this summer!

1. Fluids in

It is nothing new that summer means hydration! It is also a great way to detox your body. Opt for loads of fluids this summer to stay fit and in shape. Make a cucumber, watermelon, muskmelon, bael, and other summer fruits part of your daily diet as they are rich in water content and low in unhealthy calories!

2. Sweat it out

Exercise during summers may seem difficult as outdoor sports are out of bounds due to scorching heat. But this should not be the reason to skip training and exercise. Set a time to exercise either during the evenings or early mornings. Hit the gym or plan out an extensive play and enjoy a cool and comforting bath to refresh yourself!

3. Keep light

Keeping light meals is a good option to stay fit and healthy. Try to avoid heavy meals and foods rich in fats and oils. During summer it’s advisable to take extra care of the digestive system as many often face bowel issues.

4. Sleep well

Adequate sleep is vital for proper metabolism and body functioning. It is crucial to have sufficient sleep and stay hydrated. Make sure to keep dinners light and healthy and get a continuous sleep.

5. Stay away from

To stay fit and healthy it is important to stay away from certain things this summer. Too much time on the couch should be avoided. Avoid excessive screen time and use it productively, maybe by reading a book. Avoid oily meals, alcohol, carbonated beverages, and junk food this summer.

Over to you

Summer is an ideal season to work on your body goals as your lifestyle and food habits are in tune with a healthy life. Stick to these tricks and your fab body is under your grasp!
