title.rendered: Importance Of Warm-Up For Pre Workout

content.rendered:
As much as exercising daily is important, it is equally important to focus on the phase before and after a workout. Warming up and cooling down exercises are crucial before embarking on full-fledged exercises. Light exercises like jogging, climbing stairs, and cycling, can all be done as a part of the routine. Read on to know about the importance of these exercises before a workout.

Importance of warming up before exercise

1. Improves performance

Warming up exercises helps in contracting and relaxing muscles better. It improves nerve transmission and metabolism thus resulting in efficient muscle performance.

2. Improves blood flow

Blood flow is improved on warming up as the circulatory system prepares to go into proper exercise mode. Blood flow is very important for healthy skin and heart health.

3. Reduces stress

Light exercises before a proper workout help in reducing stress on the system. It helps in diving into exercise mode better. Stress is one of the most crucial aspects that exercise takes care of. Working out helps in relieving stress and letting the feel-good fluids flow.

4. Improves lung health

Lung health is very important for overall health. Pandemic has shifted the focus primarily on lung health. Breathing exercises help in taking care of lung health and improving oxygen load, breathing capacity, and much more. It helps in filling the lungs with fresh air.

5. Reduces risk of injury

Warming up exercises reduces the risk of injury as the pace at which one goes into extreme workout mode is reduced. The risk of suffering injury and having cramps is largely reduced. It helps in mentally preparing for the exercise hence the chance of suffering an injury is largely reduced.

Over to you

People often neglect warming-up exercises to save time but it is crucial to focus on a good warm-up regimen to notice positive results of workouts and lead a healthier life.

excerpt.rendered: As much as exercising daily is important, it is equally important to focus on the phase before and after a workout. Warming up and cooling down exercises are crucial before … Continue reading Importance Of Warm-Up For Pre Workout

title.rendered: Recipe: Peach Mint Cooler

content.rendered:
Running out of options while searching for coolers to beat the heat and also stay fit and healthy? Store-bought drinks are loaded with additives and ingredients which make you thirstier. Instead, try this delicious and easy recipe and add some color to your daily diet.

Nutritional benefits:

Peach is a rich source of vitamin C, vitamin A, antioxidants, and minerals like potassium, manganese, and zinc. It is good for keeping the stomach cool and maintaining skin and heart health. Mint is rich in antioxidants, aroma, and cooling properties.

Ingredients:

  • 2 peaches
  • Fresh mint as required
  • 1 tsp ginger chopped
  • 1 tsp lemon juice
  • Sweetener of choice
  • Ice cubes

Procedure

1. In a pan heat chopped peaches till they are pulpy and soft.

2. Add ginger, and water and adjust consistency.

3. Add lemon juice once cooled.

4. In a blender blend the mixture, pour into glasses and tip it up with mint leaves.

5. Add ice and serve cool.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you:

Try this peach mint cooler at home every time you feel the need for some tangy twist to your regular summer days!

title.rendered: 4 Diet-Friendly Travel Treats

content.rendered:
Treats while traveling is an important aspect that many often end up neglecting. Finding the right food on the go might be really difficult-especially while traveling to a place with remarkable cultural differences. It is best to carry healthy treats that not only meets your satiety but also prevent you from falling ill.

Here is a list of four diet-friendly travel treats that is sure to fit in with your travel plan.

1. Granola bars

Nothing like the aroma of freshly baked granola loaded with the goodness of nuts, berries, and dry fruits. Granola comprised of millets, oats, and seeds is a good source of fiber and nutrients that will keep you full and healthy while traveling. They are handy, easily stored, and are nutrient-dense.

2. Trail mix

A good mix of seeds, nuts, and berries supply ample energy on the go. They are healthier than deep-fried chips and junk foods. Add trail mix comprising of seeds of watermelon, pumpkin, chia, flax, and sunflower along with cranberries, almonds, walnuts, and pistachios. Add in your preferred seasoning and be sure to keep salt content low.

3. Ragi bakes

Ragi is rich in calcium, iron, and fiber. It is good for bone health. Make ragi bakes part of your travel diet and never miss out on healthy goodness. It is a healthier alternative to all the junk that is available in almost every store.

4. Makhna

Makhna is loaded with nutrients like calcium, manganese, and fiber. It is easily prepared into various tastes as per the type of seasoning. Make sure to carry a pack of makhna and indulge in some delicious healthy treat every time you find something to munch on while enjoying the view.

Endnote

Falling sick while traveling is the last thing that you would want. Rather than relying on snacks relying outside on on, try to keep these treats handy and stay healthy even on the go.

title.rendered: Recipe: Gulkand Kulfi

content.rendered:
What is summer if not for the wide range of delicious treats like kulfis! Add a twist to regular kulfis by adding Gulkand to it. Gulkand is already a star for keeping the tummy cool during summers while also taking care of digestive health.

Nutritional benefits:

Kulfi is a sweet treat for summers rich in good quality ingredients when prepared at home. Milk is a great source of calcium and Gulkand is a natural cooler. It is rich in vitamins and minerals and is also beneficial for digestive health. Nuts are a good source of protein, vitamin E, and fatty acids essential for skin and brain health.

Ingredients:

  • 500ml Milk
  • 15g Gulkand
  • Unsweetened condensed milk as required
  • ½ cup low fat cream
  • 1 tsp Cornflour
  • Pistachios and almonds finely cut

Procedure

1. Boil milk till it thickens a bit. Let it cool.

2. Add cornflour and mix well. Bring it to boil. Once it thickens let it cool.

3. Add cream and gulkand to it and mix well. Do not add any extra sugar as gulkand is already sweet.

4. Add condensed milk and nuts to it and mix well.

5. Adjust the consistency with liquid milk. Pour it into kulfi molds and let it semi-set.

6. Add kulfi sticks and let them freeze completely.

7. Unmold under running water and enjoy!

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Summer is all about ice-creams and kulfis! Indulge in this delicious treat of gulkandkulfi to stay cool and refreshed this summer.

title.rendered: 4 Different Ways To Add Fruits To Your Diet

content.rendered:
One thing that is undeniably true is that fruits are the magic portions of life, abundant in color, nutrients, flavor, and options. Fruits are rich in fiber, essential vitamins, and minerals while being delicious. There are innumerable types of fruits throughout the year so you should not run out of options. However, people often neglect fruits and focus mainly on the staples. But there are many ways you can add fruits to your daily diet.

Let’s take a look at some of them.

1. Add them to salads

No better way than to have a good bowl of fresh fruits along with other fiber-rich ingredients like lettuce, feta, and chia seeds. Include your favorite fruits like watermelon, mango, pear, kiwi, and pomegranate, to name a few, and make them into a delicious salad.

2. Have them in a breakfast bowl

A fresh bowl of oatmeal is incomplete without the touch of fresh, seasonal produce. Pomegranates, kiwi, apples, and bananas are great as toppings to oatmeal. Have them in your breakfast bowl and stay healthy throughout.

3. Blend them into smoothies

Fruit smoothies along with vegetables are a great way to detox the system. Have an apple, spinach, and blend into a smoothie. Bananas are a must-have in smoothies. Drink smoothies made out of nuts, bananas, and milk for a workout drink, or have a cooling shake post an activity.

4. Make them into desserts

Fruits make desserts even more special. Mango curd, orange shrikhand, blueberry cheesecake, strawberry muffin, and berry parfait are just some of the many options that fruits can provide as desserts.

Over to you

Fruits make life colorful and healthy. Be sure never to miss out on the goodly treats by incorporating them into your daily diet and amazing recipes.

title.rendered: 5 Calorie-Dense Foods For Healthier Weight Gain!

content.rendered:
When it comes to weight gain, finding the right source of calories is very important. Unhealthy junks rich in unhealthy calories will only result in weight gain that’s harmful to the system. Having a healthy source of calorie-dense food should be your approach if you are looking for a healthy weight gain.

Take a look at these 5 foods that are calorie-dense in a healthy way!

1. Eggs

Eggs are rich in healthy calories along with being nutrient-rich in protein, vitamins, and minerals, particularly biotin. Eggs must be consumed whole along with the yolk if you are looking to gain weight healthily.

2. Milk and milk products

Whole milk or standardized milk is rich in healthy fats which is essential for the proper functioning of various processes. Add milk and milk products like cheese, paneer, curd, smoothies made out of whole milk. It is rich in minerals like calcium too.

3. Nuts

Nuts are a good source of PUFA and MUFA, the omega fatty acids crucial for brain development and skin health. Nuts like almonds, walnuts, pistachios, pine nuts must be part of your daily diet for a healthy weight.

4. Avocado

Avocado is a source of healthy fats and great keto-friendly food. Add it to your diet if you are looking for healthy ways to gain weight. Have it on top of a toast, as a dip or a salad, it tastes delicious!

5. Fatty Fish

Omega fatty acid-rich fatty fish should find their place on your plate if healthy weight gain is what you are looking for. Do add fatty fish to your diet as it helps in maintaining not only a healthy weight but also keep skin, hair, brain, and eye health healthy!

Over to you Seeking healthy sources for a healthy weight gain is crucial for a sustainable approach to healthy living. These foods are not only calorie-dense but nutrient-dense too. Make them part of your daily diet if you are looking for ways to have a healthy weight gain.

title.rendered: 5 Foods To Boost Immunity

content.rendered:
Immunity has been one of the most buzz-worthy words ever since the pandemic happened 2 years back. The craze surrounding immune-rich foods has not subsided yet but many took it a chance to market their products. As a consumer, you must be careful not to indulge in foods based on false claims.

Follow this list of 5 foods that aid in boosting immunity and thus reduce the chance of catching illnesses.

1. Turmeric

An age-old cure to several illnesses, turmeric is the golden spice rich in antibacterial and anti-fungal characteristics. Include turmeric in your everyday diet to boost immunity. Have it as an ingredient to your daily cooking or consume it raw with milk for added benefits.

2. Probiotics

Probiotics like yogurt, kefir, are rich in live microbes which are beneficial for gut health. Have probiotics daily to keep your gut healthy. Make sure to include fruits and vegetables in the diet to supply a good amount of fiber.

3. Green leafy veggies

Green leafy vegetables are rich in vitamins and minerals along with pigments that have phytochemical properties. Fiber present in green leafy vegetables is crucial to maintaining the overall systems of the body.

4. Citrus fruits

Rich in vitamin C, an important antioxidant, include citrus fruits in the form of lemons, oranges, pomelo, and sweet lime in everyday diet.

5. Nuts

Nuts are a rich source of vitamin E and omega fatty acids along with several minerals like zinc, selenium, iron, calcium, magnesium, and manganese to name a few. These vitamins and minerals are vital for various body processes involving the immune system.

Footnote Immunity is not an overnight achievement but a continuous process. To build a strong immunity include these foods in your daily diet along with a proper sleep schedule, exercise, and water intake.

excerpt.rendered: Immunity has been one of the most buzz-worthy words ever since the pandemic happened 2 years back. The craze surrounding immune-rich foods has not subsided yet but many took it … Continue reading 5 Foods To Boost Immunity

title.rendered: 5 Ways To Tackle Choosy Eaters

content.rendered:
Spinach? Out. Carrots? Out. Capsicum? Out. Peas? Out. Beetroot? Out. Bitter Gourd? Definitely Out! Such is the plight of a mother while dealing with a fussy eater. Kids are a struggle in themselves, more so when it comes to feeding them anything healthy. But it is important to tackle choosy eaters else it might result in nutritional deficiencies.

Here are 5 ways to tackle choosy eaters,

1. Find alternatives

If your kid doesn’t like a particular food, try to find an alternative way of cooking or preparing them like spinach if your kid doesn’t like it as a vegetable, add them in the batter of dosa or make it into a smoothie. Make sure you don’t deprive your kid of vital nutrients.

2. Make them presentable

Compared to unpresentable meals, presentable meals attract kids and hence they consume them with enthusiasm and willingness. Make attractive figures like a bear, stars, moons, etc.

3. Add colors

Having meals colorful and attractive makes kids involved and engrossed. It makes the task of feeding easier as they are involved in the process of eating and not distracted from it by means of television or smartphones.

4. Educate and involve them

Parents who involve their kids in the kitchen during their early years have a greater tendency to have a better understanding of the benefits of food and the demarcation of healthy and unhealthy foods. It is easier to explain to them the merits of a particular food they feel like avoiding.

5. Be persistent

Don’t give up easily to your kid’s nagging. Be persistent in your approach and try to find ways to make them accept the specific food they love avoiding so much. It’s always wise to focus on your child’s health before anything else as their growth and development depend on it.

Over to you Tackling fussy and choosy eaters can be very challenging. Follow these simple steps and make sure not to compromise on your baby’s health while they rant about how they hate having those bites of capsicum.

title.rendered: Recipe: Cucumber Chia Popsicle

content.rendered:
Looking for ways to stay cool while losing weight this summer? Try this refreshing and cooling Popsicle that is sure to keep you hydrated and nourished to beat the heat in a healthy way.  With minimal ingredients, this can just be your go-to summer treat!

Nutritional benefits:

Cucumber is rich in vitamins, minerals, and pigments that are naturally cooler. It is rich in water content and a natural hydrant. Chia seeds are rich in soluble and insoluble fibers and are a great source of omega fatty acids. The presence of chia seeds gives a nutty taste.

Ingredients:

  • 1 cucumber juiced
  • Few cucumber slices
  • 1tbsp. chia seeds
  • 50g mint leaves
  • Sweetener of choice

Procedure

1. Juice out the cucumber and strain to remove any solids.

2. In it add in mint leaves or water-soaked with mint leaves

3. Add in sabja seeds or chia seeds and sweetener of choice.

4. Pour in Popsicle stand along with sticks and freeze until done. Enjoy when ready!

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Summer is incomplete with the star ingredients- cucumber, mint, and chia seeds. Add them to your diet as a gateway to a refreshed, summer treat!

title.rendered: Try These 4 Drinks For A Perfect Summer Body!

content.rendered:
Summer is around the corner and are you still hungover those winter weights? Summer is the season you can’t hide your belly fat under layers of clothes and it’s time to embrace your body in full swing! It’s wise to stay away from a diet rich in calories and prefer these low-calorie, diet-friendly drinks instead!

1. Cucumber cooler

Refreshing, cooling, and loaded with nutrients, this summer cooler out of cucumber should be your go-to option this summer, especially after a sweaty exercise routine or a run. Have it chilled or with crushed ice, it tastes best when taken with a few leaves of fresh mint!

2. Mint chia lemonade

Nothing beats the good old lemonade as a summer drink, but what if there is a healthy twist with chia seeds and cooling freshness of mint leaves! Add sweetener of your choice, salt if desired and it supplies an apt amount of electrolytes as well. Keep it healthy by avoiding refined sugar and try adding honey instead.

3. Tropical drink

Have refreshing tropical drinks made out of tropical fruits like pineapple, dragon fruit, papaya, lychee, etc. Choosing seasonal fruits is a great way to supply the body with essential vitamins minerals and phytochemicals.

4. Aloe buttermilk

Buttermilk is a refreshing summer necessity. Over it is good for gut health and perfects to ease digestion. Paired with aloe vera, it is an excellent detox drink and best when taken on an empty stomach. Aloe is rich in many vital vitamins and minerals and has many medicinal properties.

Footnote Achieving a perfect summer body may seem challenging but it gets easier when simple steps are incorporated into an everyday diet. Try out these amazing low-calorie drinks which will take you closer to that summer body you are aiming so dearly!

title.rendered: Ways To Make Lean Kids Gain Weight Healthily!

content.rendered:
Wondering why your lean kid is not gaining weight while the counterparts are well built and healthy? Making lean kids gain weight can be a struggle and it is not something you can achieve overnight!

Before we dive into the points, it is important to note that every kid is built differently with various factors affecting their growth and development like hormones, genetics, lifestyle, etc.

Below are some simple steps you can follow to make your kid gain weight healthily!

1. Healthy calories

Opting for unhealthy calories to gain weight can be easy but never sustainable. It might even result in several health complications. It is best to stick to healthy sources of calories. Nutrient and calorie-dense foods like banana, whole milk, carrot halwa, etc. should be included.

2. Frequent meals

Kids are often very active and for active kids, it’s crucial to supply a good amount of energy. Give nutrient-dense foods at frequent mealtime. Make sure your kid eats a balanced breakfast and never skips it. Try to inculcate healthy meal choices in them.

3. Keep an eye on output

When our energy output is more than the intake we lose weight. Be sure to supply enough energy as kids tend to lose a lot of energy while playing. Follow the recommended dietary intake for the specified age group. Make sure he or she has a healthy BMI.

4. Importance of Protein

Protein is important for building and strengthening muscles. Adequate protein is essential for healthy growth and developmentso it is essential to supply a good amount of protein to growing kids in the form of eggs, pulses, legumes, nuts, and milk.

5. Gut health

Poor absorption of nutrients results in poor weight gain. The core of it may lie in poor gut health. Take care of the gut and digestive health to have proper digestion and absorption of nutrients. Include a good amount of soluble and insoluble fibers along with probiotics like curd and yogurt.

Over to You Children are often fussy about eating healthy foods and it is hence even more important to find ways to feed them good food for proper growth and development. These simple ways can help your kid gain weight healthily. Keep in mind to focus on foods that are nutrient-dense and be patient throughout the process of growing up.

title.rendered: Splash Some Healthy Color This Holi With These Healthy Recipes

content.rendered:
Colors radiate positivity, warmth, and hope. Holi, the festival of colors, is all about playful fun and feasting. When everything from décor, attire to the air is so colorful, why leave behind the food from being radiant!

So, add in nature’s gift of wholesome foods and make your Holi platter healthy and colorful with these simple recipe ideas!

1. Fruit punch

Fruits are abundantly colorful! Choose any season’s best and turn it into a colorful and healthy punch. Avoid the colas for a change and make your own drink with natural fruits like pomegranate, orange, apple, watermelon, and many more! Season it with mint, add in crushed ice, and beat the heat while dancing on the beats!

2. DahiVada

Nothing like the tanginess and spiciness of a good Dahivada. Have it as a quick snack that will keep you energized throughout. Instead of grabbing unhealthy junk, have homemade Dahivada with fresh ingredients and enjoy with your entire family!

3. Paneer Skewers

Paneer skewers are a quick snack option for those dancing maniacs who are too busy to skip a beat! Pick up a skewer and bite them down while never missing the fun! Marinate the paneer with different ingredients to make each skewer look colorful by using spinach, tomato, or beetroot! Add in the natural goodness with these vegetables.

4. Mixed chat

A handful of different lentils, chopped colorful veggies, crispy bhujiya, garnished with lemon and coriander leaves accompanied by papri or nachos, and your taste buds are sorted for the evening! Chat is a healthy and filling recipe and of course a crowd favorite. Add your own twist and come up with different varieties.

5. Shrikhand

Cool down with an aromatic, colorful, and healthy dessert-like shrikhand. Prepare it fresh with hung curd, powdered sugar, and a flavor of your choice. Elaichi shrikhand and orange shrikhand are crowd favorites. Make sure you are ready with shrikhand well beforehand as it takes time to set! You can top it up with a scoop of gulkand as well!

What’s next? Jot down your menu, the order in your ingredients, and never miss out on the fun of feasting with these healthy and delicious recipe ideas that is sure to make your Holi gathering crave for more!

title.rendered: Recipe: Carrot Idli

content.rendered:
Bored of regular Idli? Add a healthier twist to your regular Idli by incorporating some healthy ingredients that are tasty as well and make kids gaga over them as they love colors. So, next time you are planning to have Idli don’t forget to follow this recipe!

Nutritional benefits:

Rice is an instant source of energy which is also good for digestion.Urad dal is rich in vitamins and minerals along with fiber. Carrots are good for vision as they are rich in carotene. It is a great way to feed kids vegetables.

Ingredients:

  • 30g Carrots grated
  • 20g Rice
  • 15g urad dal
  • 10g onions finely chopped
  • 15g yogurt or curd
  • 1 tsp. oil
  • Salt as per preference

Procedure

1. Wash rice and dal thoroughly and soak them separately and keep them overnight.

2. Drain the water from the rice and add little water and blend into a coarse paste.

3. Drain the water from the dal and make it into a fine paste by adding water.

4. Add curd to it and water if needed to adjust the texture.

5. Add salt to it and maintain a thick consistency of the batter. Keep it covered overnight an let it ferment.

6. Add onions and carrots to the fermented batter.

7. Add little oil to the Idli mould. Put the batter on the idli maker and steam for 15-20 min.

8. Let it cool once done and serve with chutney and sambhar.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: This simple recipe is a great way to add healthy ingredients and make your kids meet the nutritional requirements. Try this nutritious recipe and stay healthy and energized throughout the day!

title.rendered: Here Are The Ways To Lose Weight While Sitting All Day During Work

content.rendered:
A sedentary lifestyle is on the rise as more and more people spend hours working while being seated in front of the computer, be it home or office. As a result of it, many tend to gain weight by the lack of physical activity and more of bingeing on unhealthy snacks.

Here are some simple ways in which you can lose weight gained due to working all day sitting.

1. Take the stairs

It’s wise to be punctual and take the stairs whenever there is an option. Instead of a lift or escalator, take the stairs as it will help you move those leg muscles. People over the period of time stay fit by avoiding the lift and taking the hard way!

2. Choose snacks wisely

Rather than binge eating unhealthy snacks during work, try to keep healthy snacks and food around. Instead of grabbing unhealthy junk snacks, try to keep healthy options like nuts, granola, veggie sticks, roasted pulses, etc.

3. Walkaround

Take time to get up from your seat and move around once in a while. Also, move your eyes away from the screen and move eye muscles often. Stretch whenever required and find ways to stay active amidst the sedentary life.

4. Remember to hydrate

Often while working you might forget to drink sufficient water. Make sure to have enough water throughout the day. It helps you to concentrate better and stay refreshed. Opt for healthy beverages instead of colas and coffee every time.

Over to you Working all day in front of the screen can be taxing and the sedentary lifestyle along with it is bound to gain a few pounds. Follow these simple steps and prioritize your health while keeping in mind the adverse effects of a sedentary lifestyle on the body.

title.rendered: Five Healthy Drinks To Replace Your Regular Sports Drink!

content.rendered:
Still, stuck with your same old regular sports drink which seldom does any good to the body? It’s time to rethink and try your own healthy drinks and reap far more benefits out of them.

Sports drinks are usually rich in artificial colors and additives with little mineral content. Instead of it, try these 5 simple recipes that serve as a great pre as well as post-workout drink!

1. Ragi shake

This serves as a great drink during workouts and sports activities. Ragi is rich in calcium and minerals essential for bone health. Together with milk as a shake, it serves as a good source of energy to keep you going.

2. Mint chia coconut cooler

Tender coconut water is rich in natural electrolytes which helps in replenishing electrolytes lost during sports activities or workouts. Paired with mint and chia seeds, it serves as a cooler rich in vitamins and minerals.

3. Pomegranate punch

Pomegranate is rich in antioxidants and counters the free radicals in the body. Many sports drinks available in the market are pomegranate flavored. It’s better to try out real pomegranate juice rich in vitamins and minerals. It is great for the circulatory system as well.

4. Turmeric latte

A cool turmeric latte is a soothing drink rich in protein, antioxidants, and healing elements. It helps to nourish as well as replenish. Have a cup of cool turmeric latte and ditch the store-bought sodas and unhealthy beverages.

5. Cucumber mint cooler

Cucumber is the best answer to a hard, sweaty session of the game. It is crunchy, refreshing, and loaded with water. Coupled with mint, this serves as an extremely refreshing drink after a hot game or run under the sun.

Footnote Next time you pour out your money on stacks filled with colorful energy drinks, think twice for you can relish far more nutritious and healthy drinks by preparing them at home.

title.rendered: 5-minute Breakfast Bowl

content.rendered:
Running out of time amidst the busy schedules and fast-paced life? Spend a minute reading about the delicious breakfast recipe that can be prepared in just 5 minutes, perfect for your busy mornings!

Nutritional benefits:

Yogurt is rich in calcium, probiotics, and protein essential for various body functions. It is crucial for your gut and immune system. Berries are loaded with vital pigments, antioxidants and keep the heart and mind healthy. Complex grains are a good supply of fiber and healthy carbs to supply energy to get you going.

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup yogurt
  • 10g mashed strawberries or pureed
  • Multigrain granola
  • Berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
  • Date syrup or honey if required

Procedure

1. In a bowl mix the puree and the yogurt well. Keep it refrigerated for some time if desired.

2. In the amazon jar put in the yogurt, granola, berries, and sweetener if desired.

3. Garnish with fresh berries, cinnamon powder, and eat immediately!

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: No more skipping breakfast with this quick recipe that will just perfectly squeeze into your everyday routine. Try out different varieties of it and get pumped up throughout the day.

title.rendered: Recipe: Pumpkin Apple Smoothie

content.rendered:
Why stop with just the basic flavors for a smoothie when you can dice out amazing health benefits by simply pairing apple and pumpkin into a smoothie? This unique recipe is a hassle-free option to get your kids pumped up with the goodness of nutrients.

Nutritional benefits:

Apple is rich in antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals. It is s a basic go-to fruit for many. Pumpkin on the other hand is rich in vitamin A, fiber, and vitamin C. Both are nutrient-rich foods and are great when paired together.

Ingredients:

  • 15g oats
  • 20g yogurt
  • 20g apples cut
  • 15g pumpkin cut
  • 100ml milk of choice
  • ½ tsp. cinnamon powder
  • Sweetener if required

Procedure

1. Blend the oats in the blender until fine texture is achieved.

2. Add the remaining ingredients together to it and blend until smooth texture is achieved.

3. Pour in some more milk or ice if required.

4. Garnish with a bit of cinnamon powder and serve cool.

Note: keep the peels of the fruit for better nutrition benefits.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Try this unique and refreshing smoothie next time your kid’s nag while eating pumpkin or apples and watch them gulp down an entire glass! Try not to add too much sugar and enjoy the natural sweetness present in the ingredients.

title.rendered: Four ways To Get Rid of Dry Skin This Spring

content.rendered:
The end of winters and the start of spring is a tricky time for skin health. With the change in season, a series of complications arise.It is important to change skincare with the change in season to keep skin healthy. Often the use of improper products, harsh soaps, taking too many hot showers rips the skin off its moisture and turns it dry and flaky.

Here are some remedies to deal with dry skin in these changing weather conditions!

1. Coconut oil

Coconut oil has no bounds when it comes to benefits on the skin. It is a natural moisturizer that keeps the skin soft and supple. It has many medical and therapeutic benefits too and serves as a great massaging option. Take time and massage your skin before bath.

2. Vitamin C

Vitamin C is essential for collagen synthesis and maintaining skin health. It is a natural antioxidant that protects the skin from harmful radicals. Be sure to use vitamin C serum or any products with vitamin c as an ingredient. Continue using it throughout the winter and spring season.

3. Lock Moisturizer

Moisturizer if not properly locked does little benefit to the skin. In the dry season, skin is even more prone to lose out moisture. Try to out in lotion or cream while the skin is damp so that moisture doesn’t lose out easily. Be sure to choose the right kind of moisturizer as per skin type and season.

4. Night care

A night care routine is very important as during sleep skin needs to relax and be nourished as well. Apply oil or lotion on cracked heels, elbows, knees, and other areas where it is more prone to get dry.

Footnote Try these simple steps to beat the weather blues on the skin and revert skin damage in a natural way. Be careful while adjusting to this change in season and enjoy spring to the fullest!

title.rendered: Stress And Weight Gain: 5 Ways To Manage It

content.rendered:
Stress and Weight is highly related, despite having every step to tackle to manage both. Stress can manifest in the form of weight loss or weight gain but stress-induced eating is far more common which eventually leads to weight gain.

Here are some of the ways in which you can manage the link between stress and weight gain.

1. Move thy muscles

One of the most effective ways to manage weight gain and stress is by exercising. Working out and exercising releases a feel-good hormone that reduces stress. Also, it helps in burning calories and building muscle.

2. Avoid strict diets

Strict and restricted diets often lead to opposite effects by ending up binge eating. The tendency to reward oneself for following a strict diet often leads to weight gain. The stress levels associated with strict diets are also more. Be sure to follow a balanced diet and not restrict yourself.

3. Careful during meal times

Take care of the portion size during meals. Avoid overindulging in a particular type of food, especially calorie-dense food. Often junk foods and calorie-rich desserts release the feel-good hormone which gives the feeling of reducing stress but eventually impacts health in a negative way.

4. Caffeine

Caffeine at breakfast is an unhealthy practice as it may momentarily give the feeling of reducing stress but it impacts metabolism and digestion. It eventually results in reduced absorption of nutrients, especially Vitamin A and C.

5. Keep at a distance

Stress-induced eating is common. Whenever you feel like binging, keep at the same distance from all the unhealthy foods and opt for healthier snacks and treats. Keep foods that manage stress as well as weight like oats.

Footnote Be careful of stress-induced eating and opt for healthy options whenever you feel like binging. Follow these steps and tackle both weight and stress at the same.

title.rendered: Better Fitness with Right Nutrition

content.rendered:
Amongst many things that the pandemic did to us, one of the most positive aspects would be to change in shift to a healthier and more active lifestyle. Many who have been living a sedentary life have been picking up activities, sports, and any form of exercise to remain fit. While exercise is very important, it is also important to back it up with a healthy diet and correct nutrition.

Here is a list of some nutritious food that will help in bettering your fitness and leading an active lifestyle.

1. Dry fruits and nuts

Dry fruits and nuts are the reserves of energy as well as a good amount of vitamins and minerals. The nuts contain omega fatty acids which are essential to maintain cell integrity and healthy hair. Along with it is also beneficial in maintaining brain health. They can be a great snacks option so be sure to ensure a handful in your everyday diet.

2. Milk

Milk is considered complete nutrition. It is rich in vitamins and minerals specially calcium which is essential in maintaining bone health. It complements working out as it helps in strengthening the bones as well as supplyinga good amount of protein. Include milk whether as a shake or a turmeric latte in your daily routine.

3. Salad

Nothing beats the nutrients derived from a fresh bowl of salad. Rich in antioxidants and fiber, salads have endless varieties. Include freshly cut veggies like tomato, cucumber, lettuce, carrots, beetroot paired with appropriate dressing. Add in quinoa to improve its nutrient quotient.

4. Sprouts

Freshly germinated sprouts are loaded with nutrients as required for a new growing plant. It is rich in vitamin C and a great source of antioxidants and fiber. It regulates satiety and keeps you active and fresh for longer times. Soak in moong or Bengal gram overnight and include a bowl of sprouts every day.

Over to You: As much as working out is important to maintain a healthy lifestyle, the right nutrition is equally important to maintain all the hard work in the long run. Be sure to have a healthy diet to optimize the benefits that workout and fitness regime has on the body.

title.rendered: Pink Pancake

content.rendered:
Kids love colors and when a colorful and healthy recipe can be prepared at home all naturally without the use of any artificial color then why not? This pink protein pancake is a perfect breakfast option to add some brightness to the day, more so when Holi is round the corner, isn’t it?

Nutritional benefits:

Oat is rich in dietary fiber and improves digestion while also maintaining satiety levels. Beetroots are rich in antioxidants and minerals like iron and folic acid. It is good for building immunity as well as maintaining a healthy weight. Beet is also great for the digestive system and improving metabolism.

Ingredients:

  • 10g oats flour
  • 10g almond flour
  • 5g semolina
  • 20ml milk
  • 15g beetroot
  • Salt and pepper as per preference
  • 5g olive oil or butter
  • Berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries) for topping
  • Vanilla essence if required
  • Date syrup or honey

Procedure

1. Blend the beetroot in the blender until smooth.

2. Mix the beetroot puree with milk and set it aside.

3. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well until a smooth batter is formed.

4. In a pan heat oil or butter and pour the batter as per the shape and size that is desired.

5. Cook until it’s done and flip to cook evenly. Add honey or date syrup on top as required and top it up with fresh berries.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: This pink reddish recipe is bound to attract kids as colorful things mostly do. Make it more interesting and attractive by cutting out in different shapes and sizes and décor the platter into different creative setups!

title.rendered: Your Checklist To A Healthy Weight While Trying To Gain Weight

content.rendered:
Gaining weight may seem simple but can be really a task for many lean souls desiring to bulk up. One must be familiar with the ways in which one can attain a healthy weight which is not only rewarding to the health but also is sustainable at the same time.

Following is the checklist for a healthy weight gain!

1. Set up a goal

Setting up a goal is very vital in achieving a target. Make sure to plan out your goal step by step and divide your targets in an orderly manner. It is important to take guidance from experienced professionals at this point so that you are on a right track. Don’t forget to let your loved ones motivate you too!

2. Assess your calorie requirements

Calorie estimation is very important to plan out a proper diet chart. Make sure to assess your daily requirements and focus on a small goal at a time. Understanding RDA is also crucial in planning out your meals. Be careful not to indulge in unhealthy sources just to meet the calorie requirements.

3. Avoid overeating

Overeating can be disastrous and will result in an increase in weight unevenly and lead to the risk of several health hazards. Avoid overeating and instead, plan out meals in different frequencies. Eat calorie-dense foods and prepare meals that are balanced and nutritious.

4. Don’t neglect exercise

While everyone might say exercise is for the ones trying to lose weight, exercise is actually for everyone. People aiming to improve or increase weight need to indulge in light to moderate exercise to have better digestibility and absorption. Exercise will along increase hunger and thus result in better food consumption capability.

5. Sustainable approach

No matter what, be sure to adopt a sustainable approach. Look for ways in which a long-term benefit can be seen and not just a short-term gimmick. Look for naturally occurring calorie-dense foods like bananas and full-fat milk.

Footnote: Gaining weight can be demanding for many but the right guidance and approach can go a long way in bringing positive results. Seek love and support from your near and dear ones and embark on the journey which makes you feel the best!

excerpt.rendered: Gaining weight may seem simple but can be really a task for many lean souls desiring to bulk up. One must be familiar with the ways in which one can … Continue reading Your Checklist To A Healthy Weight While Trying To Gain Weight

title.rendered: Small Changes That Can Help You Lose Weight

content.rendered:
Losing weight for some can be tougher than others. While there are many factors that govern an increase in weight and losing it, often it is harder than it seems. Genetic predisposition, change in lifestyle, postpartum weight can be a few of the many conditions leading to overweight. But for many who ends up gaining weight by unhealthy food and lifestyle choices can lose weight by focusing on a few simple points.

Here is a list of small changes that can help you lose weight.

1. Don’t skip breakfast

Many embarking on losing weight end up starving and skipping meals. It is a wrong approach as it will only harm the body. Eat a well-balanced breakfast and include colorful fruits and veggies. Be sure to include complex carbs and fiber-rich foods.

2. Stay hydrated throughout

Hydration is very important to keep all the body processes running. Have a sufficient amount of water throughout the day and be careful not to indulge in unhealthy, sugary drinks and carbonated beverages while thirsty. They are loaded with sweeteners and empty calories. Instead opt for low-calorie healthy drinks.

3. Mindful of sugar and starch

Skip sugar and starch when you can. Try alternatives to white table sugar and include natural alternatives like honey, jaggery instead. Avoid refined and starchy foods and be mindful while consuming packaged foods rich in fats, sugar, and salts.

4. Protein has the power

Protein is vital in building strong muscles and thus strengthening the body. Increase protein intake and focus on exercise. Include good amounts of legumes, eggs, milk, and nuts in your daily diet but be sure of the fat content. Couple it with a good exercise regimen and have proper pre and post-workout meals.

5. Consistency is the key

No matter what you embark on, consistency is the key. Exercise regularly as consistency will bear true results. Pair nutrition and exercise along with little lifestyle changes for a fitter body.

Footnote: Gaining weight may be easy for some due to an unhealthy lifestyle but losing it and getting back to a healthier lifestyle that is consistent and continuous can be challenging. Be sure to be consistent in your approach and have patience throughout.

title.rendered: 5 Creative Autism Friendly Recipes for Children

content.rendered:
Children, in general, tend to be picky eaters, and their nagging when it comes to food knows no bound. It is even more challenging when it comes to autistic kids as they prefer to have foods presented in a certain way and are particular about the textures of the food. The temperature, type, and taste need to be considered a priority too when it comes to feeding autistic kids.

Here are some creative recipes you can try:

1. Chocolate pudding

Almost every kid loves chocolate and when served as a pudding, they are bound to love it. This creamy and delicious recipe is prepared with cocoa powder, almond milk, vanilla, and honey combined with healthy flour. Stir occasionally till it thickens. Cool and serve it with fruits and nuts.

2. Berry parfait

This gorgeous-looking recipe can be made out of fresh berries like raspberry, strawberry, blueberry in alternating layers in a glass jar with yogurt and nuts. Refrigerate and serve as a healthy dose of prebiotics and probiotics. You can also add in a layer of muesli or home-baked granola.

3. Fruit Sorbet

Kids love sorbets, especially when summer is around the corner. Add in favorite summer fruits like watermelon, or lichee along with mint, honey, and crushed ice. You can also prepare them by freezing in different shapes as kids love to engage in shapes and sizes. They can also be taught about shapes while eating this way.

4. Buckwheat pancakes

Buckwheat pancakes are healthy and will bring a change in taste and break monotone. This can be a great breakfast option. Prepare like your regular pancakes but with buckwheat. Cut out in various shapes like stars, geometric shapes, or animal figures and top them up with berries, Choco syrup, or honey.

5. Mango Cheesecake

Cheesecakes are no doubt a wonderful creation. It is even more special when prepared at home with fresh ingredients. Bake or freeze fresh cheesecake and top with fresh, juicy mangoes that are bound to make kids wanting for more!

Over to you: Autistic kids have a heightened sense of surroundings and it is important to take special care of the recipes to make them indulge in some tasty and delicious treats. Try these easy recipes that are much loved by kids. Include different combinations of shapes, sizes, and colors as they love engaging in them.

title.rendered: 6 Nutrition Tips For Every Athlete

content.rendered:
Health, both mental and physical, for an athlete is like an asset.  Keeping a healthy lifestyle by following good nutrition, training, rest, and healthy life choices, in general, is important for every athlete. There is no uniform requirement for an athlete as every one of them is built differently with different requirements.The requirements of every individual athlete are different as per their sport, body structure, goals, training, etc. Thus a tailor-made diet concerning sports nutrition is key to optimum health.

Here are some nutritional tips that every athlete can follow:

  1. Don’t begin empty

Don’t begin training on an empty stomach or while being dehydrated. This will affect your performance. Try to avoid fasting and focus on a good diet that suits your regimen. Many who skip their meals, especially breakfast, soon run out of capacity and it strains the body even further. Be sure to have meals on time.

  • Plan in advance

It’s important to plan meals well in advance which suit your training and routine. The power of diet planning and nutrition is very important as it will enhance endurance and capacity and aid in better performance.

  • Healthy calories

Choose healthy calories always. Calories are not bad as you need sufficient energy to train hard. Be sure to opt for good quality sources of carbohydrates and proteins as a part of your meals. Including a good amount of complex carbs is a good way to supply healthy calories.

  • Power of protein

Protein is important for every athlete focusing on muscle building and strength. However excess protein needs to be avoided. Focus on the amino acids that are crucial for your goals.

  • Fruity friends

Fruits are rich in antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals. Have seasonal and fresh fruits every day. Instead of indulging in packaged snacks, have fruits which is a very healthy option to meet mindless hunger as well as nutrient requirements.

  • Healthy drinks

Many athletes rely on sports drinks and energy drinks. But most often they are loaded with very few percentages of fruit content and more of additives and sugars. Be careful to read labels before relying on them. Look for alternatives in vegetable juices and smoothies that can be easily prepared at home.

Over to you: Staying in shape and form is very crucial for every athlete to stay at the top of the game. Sport and nutrition should go hand in hand to yield optimum results. No matter what your game is, these nutrition tips are sure to keep you healthy and fit!

title.rendered: Berry Nutty Parfait

content.rendered:
Tired of your kids nagging while trying to feed them something healthy and looking for new recipes? Well, this recipe is surely not going to disappoint as it is a power pack of nutrients and taste all the while being attractive too!

Nutritional benefits:

Berries are rich in antioxidants, essential minerals, and fiber. Nuts supply a good amount of PUFA and MUFA which is essential for growth and development. Together with yogurt, the recipe acts as a good source of both probiotics as well as prebiotics thus supporting gut health. It is a good source of calcium and protein as well.

Ingredients:

  • 50g Yogurt
  • 2-3 almonds
  • Assorted berries (strawberry, blueberry, raspberry, cranberry, etc.)
  • Seeds (flax, chia, sunflower, watermelon, pumpkin, etc.)
  • 1 tsp. cinnamon powder
  • Vanilla essence if required

Procedure

1. In a jar or a small bowl, add in the almonds, vanilla essence, and cinnamon powder and mix it well.

2. In a glass jar layer the yogurt with the almond mix and berries alternatively.

3. Add seeds and berries on top of it.

4. Serve fresh or store in the freezer and have later.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: This colorful and yummy recipe is sure to keep your kids engaged in healthy goodness. Try a different combination of nuts and fruits and make interesting variations of it.

title.rendered: Unexpected Weight Gain: Here Are The Common Reasons And Solutions

content.rendered:
Weight gain often happens gradually over a while. But there are certain instances when there is sudden weight gain despite not a major change in eating habits. While there are many reasons for weight gain, it is essential to look out for causes to determine the intervention better. Early intervention is essential to avoid health complications related to being overweight which might result in a medical emergency too.

Some of the reasons for sudden weight gain might include:

  1. Hormonal Changes

Hormonal changes due to any underlying conditions or lifestyle may end up manifesting as weight gain. Stress-induced hormonal changes result in poor eating habits and may take a toll on overall health as well.

  • Pregnancy

Pregnancy proactively results in weight gain as the requirement of pregnant mothers shoots up to meet both the needs of the mother as well as the growing fetus. It is generally not a matter of concern unless some underlying issues are manifested.

  • Menstruation

Weight gain during menstruation is common in women. Women may face bloating and water retention along with hormonal changes which makes the tummy look bulged. Several women end up binge-eating due to cravings during PMS as well.

  • Fluid retention

An increase in body weight due to fluid retention is quite common, especially for individuals under certain causative medications kidney and heart problems. It is important to seek medical assistance for proper guidance.

  • Side effects

Several medications have side effects manifested as weight gain. Be sure to read instructions, dosage, and consult an expert before embarking on new medications. Often food and a drug interaction may also result in such side effects.

Some suggested solutions include

  • Practice stress-relieving activities like yoga, medications, and exercises which help in tackling stress-induced weight gain. It also improves body flexibility and improves physical health.
  • Control portions and frequency of meals as it helps in distributing energy and puts less stress on the body to metabolize it. Pay attention to the source and seek healthier alternatives.
  • Take medications as prescribed by the doctor to tackle hormonal imbalances. Often side effects go if medications are altered.
  • Seek the help of a doctor for any weight gain resulting from underlying conditions. In case of rapid change in weight within a short period be sure to get yourself diagnosed.

Over to you: Several reasons may end up as unexpected weight gain as every individual and their body structure is different. Be aware of your body and look for causes if any sudden change is noticed. Don’t shy away from seeking the help of doctors and nutritionists.

title.rendered: 5 Tips To Minimize Nutrient Loss While Preparing Meals

content.rendered:
There are certain food groups that reap maximum benefits when eaten raw like fruits and some food groups which must be well cooked to prevent infection and pathogenic diseases like meat and dairy items. Cooking often results in nutrient loss but is essential for better absorption and digestibility and also to prevent illnesses. However, there are certain tips if followed while preparing meals can lead to minimal nutrient loss and thus reap optimal benefits.

  1. Follow a set cooking time

Cooking time and temperature is crucial to avoid nutrient disintegration and also to make food safer for consumption. Beyond a certain time and temperature, degradation of nutrients may take place and also denaturation of proteins. Cook for a minimum of 65 degrees for veg items and 75 degrees for non-veg items.

  • Have fruits and vegetables with peals

Having fruits and vegetables with peels help in retaining the nutrients and also protect them from environmental degradation. The peels supply soluble and insoluble fibers which are also prebiotic.

  • Store appropriately

Storing food at an appropriate temperature is very important to retain the nutrients of the food. Avoid cutting fruits and vegetables and storing them as they will result in nutrient loss. Perishable food items like flesh and dairy items require extra attention and storage conditions.

  • Choose cooking methods wisely

There are various methods to cook foods like sautéing, boiling, deep-frying, roasting. Baking, etc. It is useful to choose the correct method of cooking to retain maximum nutrients. Boiling and baking retain more nutrients than deep-frying. Opt for sautéing over deep-frying to retain maximum benefits.

  • Don’t wash fruits and vegetables after cutting.

It will result in the loss of water-soluble nutrients if foods like fruits and vegetables are washed after cutting. The same goes for washing grains too many times. Try to wash fruits and vegetables well with their peels on to avoid nutrient loss.

Footnote Every health-conscious individual seeks maximum nutrients with minimal nutrient loss while preparing meals, which should be a common goal. However, oftentimes while looking for taste we compromise on nutrients. It is important to know about basic ways in which you can get maximum benefits while preparing meals and these simple tips will surely help!

title.rendered: Things To Keep In Mind This Holi

content.rendered:
Colors make our life beautiful, and Holi celebrates the very essence that makes our life so beautiful and colorful. It is the time of enjoying the end of winters and relishing spring in full energy, with friends and family. This Holi take our top tips and play it safe!

1. Go natural

Go for natural colors and not synthetic ones which will affect your skin, eyes, and hair. Indulge in eco-friendly colors guilt-free! You may also use colorful flower petals to add a natural touch!

2. Protect it well

With covid still around, be extra careful. Mask up, maintain distance and avoid crowded parties. Prepare well for the holi, oil your hair, or tie it nicely. Figure out your attire and don’t forget the sun protection lotion and shades. Bring on your desi swag this Holi and capture many good memories.

3. Serve colorful healthy drinks

Ditch the sugary drinks and go for healthy and tasty ones with colorful fruits and vegetables. After all, what is holi if not celebrating the goodness of colors we have in fruits and vegetables! Add wood apple, pomegranates, almond shakes, kiwi cooler as some of the items on the menu.

4. Munch on delicious tasty treats

Apart from lassi and sweet treats, indulge yourself in some tasty treats like nut trails, chikkis, and baked snacks. Be sure not to overindulge and keep your health a priority. Have fun while staying healthy!

5. Do something meaningful

What best way to spend Holi than being a reason for someone’s joy by adding some color into their lives. Do something meaningful this Holi by donating something, planting trees, spending at an animal facility, gifting books and clothes to the underprivileged.

Over to You: Holi is all about colors, fun, and folly! Add in a bit of sunshine by making the occasion meaningful and fun at the same time. With the corona virus still around, be sure to follow safety guidelines while playing it cool as well!

title.rendered: Troubled Figuring Out How To Gain Weight Healthily? Follow These Simple Tips!

content.rendered:
In the sea of people chasing weight-loss goals, there is a section of people wondering how to gain weight healthily! Gaining weight can be often challenging for some as there isa host of reasons leading to lack of weight gain. Gaining weight via unhealthy means can be easy, but not at all sustainable in the long run and may lead to a predisposition of health disorders and diseases.

Why you may not be gaining weight?

In order to follow the tips to gain weight in a healthy way, it is essential to understand the probable causes leading to it.

  • Genetic predisposition
  • Improper diet
  • Lack of absorption of nutrients
  • Imbalanced diet
  • Energy output is more
  • Irregular routine
  • Underlying health issues

How can you gain weight healthily?

There may be one or multiple causes leading to poor weight gain. It is important to find the right cause to follow the right approach. Here are some tips to follow for a healthy weight gain:

  1. Healthy calories

Lack of calories in diet may lead to poor weight. Make sure to eat sufficient as per your height, weight, and age that is recommended in guidelines. Meals should be nutrient-dense and not just empty calories.

  • Focus on protein and exercise

Rather than fat, focus on building muscle mass and consume sufficient protein. Exercise everyday focusing on your muscle building. Include loads of animal protein like egg, meat, and plant protein like nuts, lentils, and grains.

  • Take care of the gut

Often an issue with the digestive system or the gut can result in poor absorption of nutrients. Eat a good amount of probiotics and fiber-rich foods like fruits and grains. Stay hydrated and exercise regularly for a healthy digestive system.

  • Fix your schedule

Having a proper schedule of sleep, meals and exercise are very important for proper absorption of nutrients. Rather than overeating, try to eat healthy and frequent meals.

  • Avoid unhealthy sources

Having unhealthy junk foods rich in unhealthy calories may result in weight gain but it is not sustainable and will lead to several health complications in the long run. It is best to refrain from unhealthy foods and focus on healthy sources.

Over to you: Don’t be disheartened as you are struggling with weight gain, follow these simple tips and be consistent with your approach. Rather than grabbing unhealthy junk, always look for sustainable and healthier ways!

title.rendered: Colorful Paneer Skewer

content.rendered:
The colorful paneer skewer is a great appetizer for your meals which is also healthy and tempting for kids as well! The skewer is prepared by coating the paneer with marinades and serving with crisps for a delightful dinner accompaniment.

Nutritional benefits:

Paneer is a rich source of protein and calcium which is loved across all age groups. It is essential for the bone health of the kids. Paired with colorful veggies which are rich in antioxidants, it enhances the nutrient values and makes it tasty as well.

Ingredients:

  • 150g paneer
  • Oil as required
  • Salt and pepper as per taste

For First marinating

  • Fresh basil pesto
  • 20g Low-fat yogurt
  • 3-4 pieces of green bell peppers

For Second marinating

  • 20g low-fat yogurt
  • Tahini
  • ½ tsp garlic powder
  • ½ tsp onion powder
  • ½ tsp cardamom powder
  • 3-4 pieces of onion cuts

For Third Marinating

  • 20g low-fat yogurt
  • 5g sun-dried tomatoes
  • ½ tsp lemon juice
  • 3-4 pieces of red bell pepper

Procedure

1. Prepare the marination in different bowls as per the different colors.

2. Marinate paneer in each bowl and leave overnight or a couple of hours.

3. Brush some oil on the skewer and add in the paneer along with the veggies and transfer to the oven.

4. Cook at 150 degrees for about 5-7 minutes or until done. Serve with pickle, lemon, and crisps.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: This simple recipe is a great way to make your kids indulge in some healthy, colorful veggies along with some fun time! This can be a great evening snack as well. Go on, give it a try!

title.rendered: Postpartum Tips For New Moms!

content.rendered:
Postpartum is a challenging phase for all mothers, and more so for new mothers. As much as the pregnancy brings forth the excitement of being a mother, the phase after giving birth while the body adjusts back to the pre-pregnancy state is a challenging one as well.

During this phase of adjustment, mothers face many issues, like

  • postpartum depression,
  • stretch marks,
  • hair loss,
  • body image issues,
  • hormonal misbalances,
  • mood swings,
  • irregular routine

Tips for new moms!

Here is a list of tips for new moms to deal with the postpartum phase

1. Stay positive

A positive outlook and mindset solve most of the problems of this phase. Since it is a phase of transformation, mood swings, body image issues, and stretch marks are bound to happen. Take it as a part of the process and spend your thoughts and energy taking care of your body and your child.

2. Practice yoga and meditation

Exercising routinely along with yoga and meditation not only tackles the body but also the mental health. It helps in instilling calmness and positivity. Take some me-time and practice something you love which will help you to stay focused and calm.

3. Focus on diet

Take proper meals at proper times along with breastfeeding. Be careful not to overindulge in addictive foods and foods that are rich in caffeine. Seek the assistance of a nutritionist who can plan what is best for you and your child.

4. Rest adequately

It gets tiring dealing with a newborn and you are always extra careful protecting your baby. Be sure not to neglect your health as you require adequate sleep amidst breastfeeding your baby and changing their diapers!

5. Speak to other moms

Nothing better than reaching out to other moms who are in the same phase or have been already in the phase. You may come across some vital tips and stories that will surely help. Also, it is important to seek a support system from your partner, friends, and family.

Over to you: Since after-birth is a vital phase as much as pregnancy, it is important not to neglect yourself while devoting everything to the newborn. Believe in yourself and uplift your spirits with the love and success of being a mother- after all, you have always been a fighter!

title.rendered: Green Bowl

content.rendered:
Looking for a recipe that’s good for your weight loss regimen and is loaded with nutrients as well? Look no further than this bowl of green goodness which is low in calories and high in nutrition!

Nutritional benefits:

The green color comes from the pigment chlorophyll which has phytochemical properties in the body. One of the essential ingredients, Spinach, is rich in Vitamin A, vitamin C, Vitamin K, folate, and is rich in iron as well. Quinoa is a superfood rich in nutrients. The recipe cleanses the system and its fiber content is great for digestive health.

Ingredients:

  • 15g quinoa
  • 40g spinach
  • 20g peas
  • 10g onions
  • 10g tomato
  • 10g boiled beans
  • 2-3 garlic cloves
  • Few mint leaves
  • Few Coriander leaves
  • 1 tsp. lemon juice
  • Half cup veg broth or water
  • Salt and pepper as per taste

Procedure

1. Boil the quinoa until water is half absorbed.

2. Make a puree out of Spinach, mint, peas, and coriander. Set aside.

3. In a saucepan add onions, garlic, tomato, and beans and sauté till tender.

4. Add the quinoa, green paste, salt, and pepper.

5. Bring them to boil until quinoa is fully done. Add lemon juice to the end.

6. Garnish with coriander and mint leaves and serve.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Add this healthy bowl of green goodness to your daily diet and let your body absorb all the nutrients!

title.rendered: Glowing Beet Smoothie

content.rendered:
Looking for glowing skin and a healthy gut at the same time? This beetroot smoothie should be the go-to option. The blood-red smoothie is a good detox and sure to keep your health glowing!

Nutritional benefits:

 Beetroot is rich in pigments which has a positive effect on the circulatory and digestive systems. It is rich in folate, vitamin c, and iron. It cleanses the system and its fiber content maintains gut health. Paired with carrots, ginger, lemon juice, and mint, the benefits increase and make it tasty as well.

Ingredients:

  • 20g beetroot
  • 20g carrot
  • 1 slice ginger
  • 1 tsp. lemon juice
  • Fresh mint to garnish
  • Salt and pepper optional

Procedure

1. Cut the beetroot and carrot and blend them along with ginger till a smooth consistency is achieved.

2. You can strain to have it as juice or blend well into a smoothie. Pour it into a glass jar.

3. Add lemon juice, salt, and pepper as per preference.

4. garnish with fresh mint leaves and serve.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Add color to your diet with this healthy recipe which can be your way to healthy and glowing skin! Have it as a breakfast smoothie or a midday drink!

title.rendered: Here’s Your Self-Care Schedule For Valentine’s

content.rendered:
They say Love is in the air this time of the year for it’s Valentine’s Day! Whether you are the lovey-dovey ones or find the entire thing cringe-worthy, there is no denying that in all this there should be one constant thing- and that is self-love!

Gear up this weekend to shower yourself with all things lovely by taking time off from hectic schedules as we list down some much-needed self-care routines!

1. Start and end with a Beauty sleep!

All beauties swear by beauty sleep too, so commit yourself to a better sleep schedule as nothing feels more refreshing than waking up after a good night’s sleep with fresh and glowing skin! It is a great way to relax your body and mind, to de-stress after a long day, and remain motivated and positive. Take care of your bedding and pillow covers too.

2. Power Yoga

Let your body reap the benefits of the age-old tradition of meditation and yoga by committing at least 15-20 min each day. The goodness of exercise and yoga does wonders to your mind and body and takes care of your digestive health too.

3. Skincare pampering

What better way to pamper yourself than to go for proper skincare! Follow the basic CTM routine every day and decide on your favorite facial masks for the weekend! Put on homemade packs or book an appointment at the salon for a relaxing time.

4. Therapeutic activity

Be it cooking, gardening, crafting, painting, knitting, or journaling, take up your favorite activity that acts as therapy and just engage yourself in some positivity.

5. Treat Yourself

Treat yourself anything you love, be it a full brunch platter or a tasty munch! It works as a great mood uplifter as well. Go on a self-date or bring your goodies at home while watching your favorite movie or show.

Over to You: While taking care of everyone around, we often neglect ourselves. This Valentine’s pamper yourself with all the goodness, love, and warmth. Go ahead, because you deserve it!

title.rendered: Omicron: Beware Of These Symptoms In Kids Under 5
How to Maintain Postpartum Positive Body Image?

content.rendered:
Giving birth to a new human being is a different feeling altogether, but it becomes challenging when there are other battles that new mothers go through within themselves. Pregnancy involves a drastic change in the entire physiology of the body and the phase after giving birth is no easy! Many mothers face serious postpartum depression along with several issues as the body gets ready to go back to pre-pregnancy state.

Postpartum is a phase that begins at delivery and lasts up to 6-8 weeks post-delivery as the body gets ready to reach the pre-pregnancy state. Postpartum depression and facing body issues is one of the major ones. Here are simple tips to maintain a positive body image during postpartum.

  • Remember weight gain is normal

As the body prepares itself to carry a child within, every change in the body is in favor of the fetus, including weight gain. What may seem a body image issue is actually the thing that giving birth made possible. After childbirth body magically does not return to the previous state at once. So be patient as it is a normal process.

  • Stop comparing

Every bodytype and every new mother is different. Although insecurities about self-image may creep in when you chance upon a leaner mother, avoid comparing and focus on breastfeeding and taking care instead. Be confident and avoid negative thoughts.

  • Wear comfortable clothes

Soon after pregnancy, do not be adamant to fit into your old clothes. Wear loose and comfortable clothes which are breathable. Avoid wearing tight clothes with elastics as it will be torture to yourself unnecessarily.

  • Don’t be hard on yourself

As you would care for your newborn, care for yourself too. It surely gets hard with added tasks, breastfeeding, and sleepless nights but it is all worth it in the end. Be gentle on yourself as you require as much love, support, and strength.

  • Focus on diet and exercise

Many new mothers follow crash diets and weight loss programs soon after giving birth. It is important to understand that you are in a lactating phase so a proper diet meeting the recommended requirements is crucial along with an exercise pattern that is not too aggressive.

Over to you:

It is an obvious thing that pregnancy and childbirth will bring forth new challenges, but it is important to maintain a positive mindset and to love your body throughout, it is a temporary phase and your body will be back to how you desire in no time. Talk to someone you love and don’t shy away from seeking support when needed.

title.rendered: Prenatal Nutrition Library for New Mommies

content.rendered:
Going into pregnancy and finding yourself right into the dilemma amongst the sea of Google searches and health articles? New mommies are always extra cautious and worried, and it is nothing uncommon. Pregnancy and prenatal care are extremely important and taking appropriate nutritional guidance is the right choice, after all, it is about a beautiful, new being coming into the world!

Key Nutrients to focus on:

This phase demands extra nutrients for meeting the demands of the mother as well the growing fetus. These are the key nutrients that should be on focus during pregnancy:

1. Iron

Iron is extremely important as it helps in forming the reserves of the growing fetus and also meets the demands of the mother and also to prevents anemia and hair loss.

2. Folic acid

Folic acid is crucial for the proper growth and development of the fetus. It maintains the nervous system and circulatory system.

3. Calcium

Calcium helps in developing strong bones and reduces several risks associated with low calcium levels. It maintains the bone density of mothers and the proper growth of the fetus.

4. Zinc

Zinc is one vital nutrient that one must never neglect as it is important for spinal cord formation and nervous system development. Take the recommended amounts and meet by taking supplements after consulting with your doctor.

Foods to eat during pregnancy

Add in this goodness in your diet for healthy prenatal care:

Rich in omega fatty acids, fatty fish aids in proper brain development and overall functioning of the nervous system.

Meet the calorie requirements by eating sufficient amounts of whole grains rich in complex carbs.

Include dairy products in the form of curd, cottage cheese and incorporate milk in various recipes like milkshakes and smoothies.

Colorful veggies and fruits are rich in antioxidants and fiber necessary for the healthy growth of the fetus as well as the mother.

Include a handful of nuts and seeds every day for the daily supply of vitamins and minerals like zinc and selenium.

Foods to avoid during pregnancy

Be extra careful around these foods and try best to avoid during this important phase:

Over to you: Fret not at this challenging and exciting part of your life, take care of yourself as much as you would think of the baby growing within you, you Superwoman!

title.rendered: How to Deal With Postpartum Hair loss and Restore Hair Growth!

content.rendered:
Pregnancy is a phase where a woman’s body undergoes several physiological and hormonal changes. The levels of estrogen, progesterone, oxytocin, prolactin, etc. rises and blood volume rises by 50 percent too. It is extremely important to take good nutritional care during this period of life.

How does pregnancy affect your hair?

The hormonal changes are the prime reason for changes in the hair during pregnancy, leading to increased hair loss called postpartum hair loss.

Increased nutritional requirements while bearing a child if not met adequately, especially for iron and calcium causes the hair to fall more than normal. The hair fall may go on for months but there is nothing to panic about as it is fairly common.

How can you prevent postpartum hair loss?

Though oftentimes we have little to do with the physiological changes and their side effects we can reduce the extent of damage and focus on recovery and re-growth.

As a preventive measure, try to take good care during pregnancy and be aware of the effects that drugs or certain foods might have.

  • Exercise regularly with light to moderate exercises. It improves the blood supply and boosts hair health.
  • Have a well-balanced diet and supply a good amount of iron to your body.
  • Visit the doctorfrom time to time and have regular check-ups done to regulate the levels of various hormones and nutrients.

How to stop postpartum hair loss and restore it instead?

  1. Reduce stress

Stress is one of the leading causes of hairfall and imbalance of hormones. While trying to recover from already existing hormonal imbalances try to minimize stress levels as much as possible. Indulge in relaxing activities and exercise every day.

  • Eat nutrient-dense foods

Nutrient-rich foods should be preferred over empty calories. Don’t try to go back to old, unhealthy habits once pregnancy is over as it will worsen recovery. Have a whole boiled egg, lots of green leafy vegetables, seasonal fruits, and fatty fish.

  • Skip the heat

Avoid using styling products that use heat and chemicals. It is best to dry hair naturally and try to keep it short if you had the habit of drying with a blow-dry.

  • DIY care

It is important to take good care of hair and tackle it gently. Try these natural home remedies using products that are easily available in the kitchen.

  • Curd

Curd is the safest and best way to strengthen hair and prevent them from falling. Just apply plain curd on hair, massage it and leave for 15-20 minutes.

  • Coconut oil

Have a good massage with coconut oil which is a time-tested remedy for hair loss.

  • Fenugreek

Soak fenugreek in water overnight and massage with the water for 10-15 min.

  • Hibiscus

Both hibiscus leaf and flower can be used to make a paste and apply it on the scalp and hair for 10-15 minutes.

Over to You: Invest in a good shampoo and follow good care of your hair as an everyday ritual while taking care of your diet, sleep, and exercise. Pamper yourself with DIYs and visit the doctor regularly.
