The levels of estrogen, progesterone, oxytocin, prolactin, etc. rises and blood volume rises by 50 percent … Continue reading How to Deal With Postpartum Hair loss and Restore Hair Growth!

title.rendered: Five Winter Activities to Burn Calories

content.rendered:
Weight gain during the winter months is common as we enjoy staying indoors, all cozy under the blankets, and don’t mind hiding the belly wrapped under layers of winter wear. While it may be temporarily satisfying, the effects of such a sedentary life backed by poor health practices will have repercussions.

Winter offers a wide range of interesting and fun activities that not only help you manage weight but also take care of your mental and social wellbeing. So grab your favorite pair of gloves and get going!

1. Skiing

As interesting as it looks, skiing is a very engaging activity. Popular amongst tourists and health activists alike, it is something that you should not miss during winters. It is adventurous, fun and helps in burning as many as 300 calories.

2. Indoor Rock climbing

In recent years there have been many indoor activity spots that offer adventure sports for enthusiasts. Winters is a good time to engage in activities like rock climbing and burn extra calories. It helps in strengthening muscles and building coordination of the body. It specifically works on the hands and legs along with improving lung capacity.

3. Shoveling

In areas of high snowfall, shoveling is a necessity and it can be made a fun and easy task if more people join in. plan out a group gathering, or volunteer at an organization and help the community while also engaging yourself in healthy activity. So brave the cold, put on your protective gear, turn on the music and get shoveling!

4. Knitting

Mostly a thing of the past, knitting is a great way to work on muscles of fingers, wrists, hands, and shoulders. It helps in eye and body coordination and is great for managing stress. It is popular amongst the elderly but is being picked up by many younger populations with a contemporary twist. Instead of idling around, pick it up as a hobby and impress everyone around with your creation. It is important for the elderly too for maintaining their eye health and body movements.

5. Ice Skating

We all can agree that ice skating is very tempting whenever we watch it on TV. Ice skating and roller skating is very popular winter activity and is even available in artificial setups all year round! It is enjoyed by adults and kids alike and a great family outing option too! It makes the body flexible, works on the legs and waist, and helps in burning calories while having so much fun. You will fall multiple times initially but it’s always worth getting up and mastering the activity.

Over to You: Don’t let the cold laze you around when you can engage in such fun activities by being a little bit brave. So take inspiration from the upcoming Winter Olympics and pull up your favorite socks to burn some calories while having so much fun!

excerpt.rendered: Weight gain during the winter months is common as we enjoy staying indoors, all cozy under the blankets, and don’t mind hiding the belly wrapped under layers of winter wear. … Continue reading Five Winter Activities to Burn Calories

title.rendered: 5 Ways to Foster Healthy Habits When It Comes To Feeding Kids

content.rendered:
Inculcating good habits and healthy practices in kids from an early age goes a long way. It helps in developing strong and intelligent adults who understand the importance of a healthy lifestyle, and thus protect themselves from diseases and health complications.

Rather than nagging and doing correct things for them, try to teach them in a way that they perform healthy habits by themselves without telling them every time. Such behavioral change is crucial in developing healthy and wise individuals. But it is extremely important for parents to take the proper approach in building those changes.

It is a known fact that dealing with kids is no easy task, more so if you wish to pull them off from addictive, unhealthy habits into healthy ones. But we list down some simple approaches you can adopt in fostering healthy eating habits.

1. Washing hands before eating

Thanks to the increasing awareness during Covid about the importance of washing hands in combating illness, more and more people are adopting it as a part of their regular habit. Try to teach your kids to wash hands thoroughly with soap and water for a minimum of 20 sec, especially before eating. Give them a demonstration and explain interestingly how not washing hands can make them sick.

2. Teach them about portion sizes

It is extremely important to teach portion size to kids to prevent several lifestyle disorders associated with overeating. It can help prevent obesity, eating disorders, indigestion, gas, bloating, and many other digestive issues. Teach them to read food labels and the importance of serving sizes and self-control.

3. Encourage chewing and track eating time

Kids often become slow eaters taking long hours to finish meals or are too quick. It has adverse effects as too slow or too fast consumption of meals will lead to poor absorption of nutrients. Many kids end up gulping food with water to finish food quickly or to get done with boring foods which is a very bad practice. It is important to chew well and take appropriate time in finishing meals.

4. Discourage multitasking while eating

It is a bad practice to watch TV or to use a phone or multitask while eating as it can directly lead to poor eye health and obesity. As parents try not to follow it and instead take measures to focus them on food alone. Eat together as a family at a properly designated area meant for eating.

5. Make them know the difference

Nothing will be feasible in the long run unless they have hands-on experience on the difference between healthy and unhealthy practices. Involve them in the kitchen and teach them with examples.

Over to you: Once you know how to approach your kids to inculcate healthy changes, the tasks get pretty simple. It is important to have patience and to take time in understanding your kid as every kid is different with different mannerisms. Overmore, try to set a good example by practicing healthy habits as parents since kids tend to watch and learn most of the things. Adopt these simple techniques and go on to become a perfect and healthy family!

excerpt.rendered: Inculcating good habits and healthy practices in kids from an early age goes a long way. It helps in developing strong and intelligent adults who understand the importance of a … Continue reading 5 Ways to Foster Healthy Habits When It Comes To Feeding Kids

title.rendered: 5 Foods Kids Should Eat In Winter Everyday!

content.rendered:
Winter is pretty much loved by everyone as it provides respite from the heat and for kids, it’s traveling and playing in the snow! While winters may have all the perks, it’s a season that parents get most worried about due to the effect of seasonal changes on their health. Kids are more susceptible to infections and allergies where common cold, flu, skin issues, and asthma are far too common.

Worry not mommies and daddies for we got you covered with the five foods that kids should eat this season everyday!

1. Citrus fruits

Winters and oranges go hand in hand so include them in the diet of your kid everyday and let them relish all the nutritional goodness of the seasonal fruits. Citrus fruits like oranges, pomelo, kinnow, etc. are rich in vitamin C which is crucial in warding off infections this season. Be sure to include at least one citrus fruit a day.

2. Nuts

Nuts like almonds, walnuts, cashew, and peanuts are rich in good fatty acids like omega 3 and 6 and loaded with vitamins and minerals like vitamin E, zinc, selenium to name a few. It is important for the overall growth and development of your kids. It also helps protect the skin from winter dryness and keep it nourished and healthy.

3. Jaggery

One of the winter delicacies is the abundance of jaggery which is an excellent source of minerals like iron, important in various body functions. Give it in the form of sesame peanut laddoo, with paratha, or mixed with milk.

4. Eggs

An egg supplies a good amount of nutrients and is often called a complete food. It is an excellent source of protein, vitamin D, and iron. It keeps skin and tissues healthy and supple and combats hairfall which is common during winters.

5. Sweet Potato

Sweet potatoes are rich in B-carotene, potassium, and fiber. It is a great winter food which is also healthy. Have it as a salad, as a snack by simply baking or roasting, or prepare them into tikkis! Add in herbs and vegetables to increase its nutritional benefits.

Over to you: Along with all these foods, it is important to keep them warm and covered, have proper sleep and play-time to boost their immunity. Serve food hot and fresh, keep cozy, and enjoy the season!

excerpt.rendered: Winter is pretty much loved by everyone as it provides respite from the heat and for kids, it’s traveling and playing in the snow! While winters may have all the … Continue reading 5 Foods Kids Should Eat In Winter Everyday!

title.rendered: Follow These 10 General Guidelines for AYUSH-Based Holistic Care During Covid-19

content.rendered:
Ayurveda and its practices have been around for centuries, using natural remedies for treating ailments and in general maintaining health and wellbeing. Covid-19 has posed serious challenges in several ways and in a time like this, going back to the roots and embracing the benefits of natural foods can be extremely beneficial.

Holistic and sustainable care incorporates all the domains of wellbeing- be it physical, mental, social, or spiritual. Here are some simple home remedies and AYUSH-based holistic acre during Covid-19.

1. Frequent intake of lukewarm water. Boiling water before consumption helps in killing microbes and consuming lukewarm water is good for the throat as well for the digestive system.

2. HaldiDoodh– turmeric latte, a contemporary name given to our age-old turmeric milk is consuming half tsp. of turmeric powder or raw turmeric in a cup of hot milk once or twice a day.

3. Fruits and vegetables should be thoroughly washed and cleaned. Preferring organic and naturally grown fresh fruits and vegetables should be the practice.

4. Gargling with warm water with a pinch of salt and turmeric should be regularly done.

5. Spices like turmeric ( Haldi ), dry ginger (saunth), coriander (dhania), garlic (lahsun), cumin (jeera), and others that have medicinal properties should be used in cooking.

6. Oil pulling– use 1 tbsp. of sesame or coconut oil and swish in the mouth (do not consume) for 2-3 minutes and spit it off followed by a warm water rinse. Proper tongue cleaning with a copper tongue cleaner.

7. Nasal application of 1-2 drops of coconut oil or sesame oil in each nostril two times a day.

8. Steam inhalation with plain water or with pudina (mint), ajwain (caraway seeds) once a day to clear nasal passage. Be sure not to overdo it as it will lead to cell damage.

9. Consume Amla (Indian gooseberry) and other fruits rich in vitamin c.

10. Adopting yoga as a part of daily routine and practicing yoga asanas, meditation along with a proper sleep cycle should be practiced.

Footnote: These simple guidelines if followed on a daily basis will help not only prevent infections and seasonal illness but also bring out a positive approach towards life. It is important not to rely too much on heavy drugs on a daily basis and junk foods, but to find a way back to the roots and live healthily.

excerpt.rendered: Ayurveda and its practices have been around for centuries, using natural remedies for treating ailments and in general maintaining health and wellbeing. Covid-19 has posed serious challenges in several ways … Continue reading Follow These 10 General Guidelines for AYUSH-Based Holistic Care During Covid-19

title.rendered: Recipe: Kiwi and Quinoa Mix

content.rendered:
Flavorful quinoa salad paired with the goodness of kiwi is a refreshing recipe to keep you active and in good shape!

Nutritional benefits:

Quinoa, rightly termed as a superfood, is a source of many vital nutrients like calcium, magnesium, zinc and is rich in protein and fiber. It is low in calories and gluten-free. When consumed as a salad with colorful vegetables it manifolds the nutritional benefits. Kiwi is one of the richest sources of vitamin C and contains a good amount of B vitamins.

Ingredients:

  • 20g quinoa
  • 10g cucumber
  • 10g onion
  • 10g cherry tomatoes
  • 20g kiwi
  • Chili flakes as required
  • Oregano as required
  • 5g Olive oil
  • Salt and pepper as per taste

Procedure

1. Chop the vegetables and bake them in a tray with olive oil till they turn golden.

2. Cook quinoa till they turn soft. Make sure not to overcook it. Drain the water and set it aside.

3. Peel and chop Kiwi into small pieces. In a bowl transfer the roasted vegetables and quinoa and toss well. Add the seasonings as per taste.

4. Add the kiwi to it, you may also add fresh cottage cheese and enjoy fresh.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Add variety and color to your diet with this healthy recipe which can be relished as a breakfast salad or a side dish to your lunch!

title.rendered: 4 Flavorful Homemade Recipes for a Healthy Gut

content.rendered:
There is a saying which says a healthy gut is a way to a healthy life. Rightly so as the gut regulates many bodily processes and important functions including immunity, mental health, mood swings, skin and hair health, body weight, and many more.

Nutrition for gut

Adding a varied diet including probiotics, fiber, good fats, and complex carbs can be a simple yet effective way to maintain gut health. Our gut contains hundreds of good bacteria and microbes which constitute the microbiota and its composition varies from person to person. These microbes are responsible for better digestion and absorption of nutrients. They release many enzymes and acids which have many health benefits and are crucial for our wellbeing.

Here are some easy homemade recipes to take care of gut health.

1. Fruity Overnight Oats

This recipe works wonders for the gut and is fairly pretty simple to prepare. All you need to do is soak rolled oats, chia seeds, flax seeds, and your choice of nuts with a little honey in a jar of milk and store in a chiller overnight. Make sure milk is double the quantity for the grains and seeds to soak it. Next morning take it out and garnish with freshly chopped fruits and berries. It supplies a good amount of prebiotic fiber and pectin beneficial for gut health.

2. Kimchi chicken rice

Kimchi is a fermented dish originally from Korea which is known to be extremely good for the gut. Have it at lunch as a side dish pickle every day or toss it with a bowl of rice and cooked chicken for a flavorful meal. The process of fermentation releases short-chain fatty acids and helps in the proliferation of good bacteria. It aids in overall better digestive health.

3. Banana sour cream pancakes

Bananas are great for the gut as it contains a good amount of fiber which are easy to break down. It is rich in minerals that protect cell integrity and releases the feel-good hormone serotonin. Paired with sour cream, flour, milk, or egg, banana pancakes can be easily prepared for healthy mornings. Top with fresh fruits and honey to increase the nutritional factor.

4. Berry parfait

Prepare berry parfait with roasted granola, choice of nuts and seeds with yogurt, and fresh berries like strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, etc. Yogurt contains probiotics or the live strains of good bacteria which is crucial for gut health. When paired with fruits, millets, or cereals, it acts as prebiotics supplying a good amount of soluble and insoluble fibers which the microbes can feed on.

Over to You: Maintaining a healthy gut is crucial for managing weight and having good health. Try these easy recipes that are superfoods for the gut and watch them reflect in your overall health!

title.rendered: Ways to Tackle Childhood Obesity

content.rendered:
It is no hidden fact that childhood obesity is on the rise as there has been a rapid shift in lifestyle and food habits in recent years. A growing number of the younger population, especially the school-goers, are joining the bandwagon of overweight and obesity.

Parents need to notice the change and take early steps in combating obesity as it puts them at a higher risk of several related disorders like diabetes and CVD. To understand how to tackle it, it is important to take a look at the possible causes that lead to obesity.

  • Sedentary lifestyle
  • Lack of outdoor activities
  • Pressure of studies
  • Eating unhealthy junk food
  • Overeating
  • Increased screen time
  • Frequently eating out
  • Lack of proper knowledge
  • Improper sleep and meal timings
  • Genetic factors

Here is how you can tackle childhood obesity and prevent it to progress into adulthood,

1. Refer to the growth chart

It is important to know the recommended weight for a particular age group and height. Follow the guidelines of WHO and identify early if your child falls beyond the normal range. Visit your pediatrician and nutritionist for additional guidance.

2. Cut down on Junk food

Junk foods are high in sugar, salt, and unhealthy fats which not only puts a burden on the system but also leads to increased cravings and thus, overeating. Avoid giving way to their nagging and look for healthier alternatives.

3. Focus on home food

Freshly cooked meals at home are nutritious and healthy. As compared to store-bought items, home-cooked food doesn’t contain additives and harmful chemicals.

4. Participate in outdoor activities

Fix a time where both parents and kids can go for a light run or games. It not only maintains the overall health of the family as kids learn from elders but also boosts mood and mental health. Encourage kids to play and run outside with other kids instead of staying indoors all day.

5. Keep an eye on the screen usage

With virtual learning on the rise, screen time has gone up for the kids as well. Check their screen usage and limit when not necessary as it is highly addictive. Make them stretch and do eye exercises in between.

6. Check portion size

Often overeating goes unchecked as the portion size is seldom controlled. Try to regulate serving and portion sizes and be sure to include more fibrous items rather than refined foods. Unnecessarily don’t try to overfeed them just to finish excess food.

7. Educate early on

Behavioral change should be focused more than authoritative procedure as kids who are restricted often finds a way out. Start inculcating healthy habits and let them take part in healthy cooking activities.

Over to You: Early intervention is the key to stopping childhood obesity from progressing into adulthood. Be extra cautious if the family has a history of lifestyle disorders. Follow these simple lifestyle modifications and visit your nutritionist for proper guidance.

excerpt.rendered: It is no hidden fact that childhood obesity is on the rise as there has been a rapid shift in lifestyle and food habits in recent years. A growing number … Continue reading Ways to Tackle Childhood Obesity

title.rendered: Manage Weight This Winter with These 4 Warm & Diet-Friendly Drinks

content.rendered:
Winters can be challenging in many ways, one being the urge to indulge in sugary and calorie-rich drinks while cozying up in couches. And before you know it, you would have gained a few extra kilos by the end of the season! It’s important to stay fit and healthy during winters as the risk of catching infectionsis pretty high during this time of the year.

Here we list down four warm and diet-friendly recipes to protect your health and well-being!

1. Ginger Basil Lemon tea

A powerful combination yet a simple preparation to start your day or evenings. The medicinal benefits of ginger, basil, and lemon help in warding off infections while also maintaining digestive health. It relieves stress and has anti-inflammatory properties. Have it simply by boiling ginger slices in water and adding basil and lemon, or by sweetening with honey.

2. Choco-Oats Smoothie

Add a healthy twist to your regular hoy chocolate by pairing it with oats. Oats are great for weightloss as it is loaded with fiber and cholesterol-lowering properties. It reduces unnecessary cravings and keeps your satiety levels in check. Together they boost metabolism as well as mood. To prepare the smoothie have chopped dark chocolate, almond milk, rolled oats, banana, almonds, chia seeds, and water. Blend them all till smooth consistency, top it up with dark chocolate and serve!

3. Spicy Nut Milk

Nut milk is great to boost metabolism and a vegan-friendly indulgence. It can be consumed by individuals who are on a dairy-restricted diet. Coconut milk and almond milk are not only healthy but also tasty. Combined with spices it turns into a warm and healthy drink to boost your immunity. To make this recipe all you need is nut milk, turmeric, ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, peppercorn, and honey. Combine all and heat on a low flame. Add chia seeds and serve.

4. Turmeric Spiced Latte

Turmeric spiced latte is a warm and soothing drink that is best during evenings or before bedtime for a restful sleep. Turmeric has anti-bacterial, anti-inflammatory properties and spices like cinnamon, pepper are good for digestive health as well. For this, heat raw turmeric in milk till the color turns golden. Add a pinch of cinnamon and remove it from the flame. Add pepper to it as it increases the absorption of turmeric in the body. Serve warm.

Over to You: No more running out of options for healthy and tasty drinks and reaching out to calorie-dense ones! Leave behind the unhealthy, sugary drinks and stay fit this winter with these amazingly healthy drinks!

excerpt.rendered: Winters can be challenging in many ways, one being the urge to indulge in sugary and calorie-rich drinks while cozying up in couches. And before you know it, you would … Continue reading Manage Weight This Winter with These 4 Warm & Diet-Friendly Drinks

title.rendered: Here’s How Omicron Can Affect Your Gut Health – Symptoms to Look Out For

content.rendered:
Omicron (B.1.1.529): SARS-CoV-2 which is classified as the Variant of Concern has been quite contagious as it spreads rapidly leading to the third wave of the coronavirus outbreak. 

Although the symptoms of omicron are not as severe as the previous variants it is still a matter of concern. The vaccinated population is dealing with the infection better as rigorous research is undergoing on the novel virus.

As per the latest report it has been stated that other than the respiratory tract, omicron is affecting the gut health too. More and more people infected by the new strain are experiencing abdominal symptoms. It is important to understand the symptoms better to distinguish them from regular digestive cases and to isolate oneself.

Here are the symptoms to watch out for:

  • Nausea
  • Vomiting
  • Abdominal pain
  • Loss of appetite
  • Backache
  • Diarrhea
  • Stomach ache

The relation between Omicron and gut health

Although definitive research is still underway, as per reports there has been a strong connection between gut health and omicron. “This may be due to Omicron infecting the gut mucosa and resulting in inflammation”, says Dr. ManojGoel, Director, Pulmonology, Fortis Memorial Research Institute, Gurugram, as quoted by Hindustan Times. He also warns not to pass it off as regular abdominal pain and look out for symptoms to isolate oneself.

Doctors said to avoid self-medication as it may result in complications. Mild symptoms may not be a matter of concern but taking good care should be an utmost priority.

Tips to take care of gut health

  • Eat freshly cooked meals rich in fiber and minerals
  • Avoid eating outside and avoid sharing meals with others
  • Wash raw fruits and vegetables thoroughly washed before consuming
  • Maintain food safety and hygiene at all times
  • Wash hands properly before consuming food
  • Stay hydrated

Over to You: The Omicron variant of coronavirus is spreading rapidly and it is best to keep oneself safe at all times following covid-19 safety protocols. Avoid stepping out unless necessary and look out for symptoms if any. It is rightly said as prevention is better than cure, so follow a balanced diet, proper sleep, exercise, and consult the doctor if you experience the symptoms.

title.rendered: 7 Natural Suppressants That Must Be a Part of Your Winter Diet

content.rendered:
Winter is a season of comfort and coziness when we prefer to stay indoors, wrapped under the blanket than braving the cold outside. With reduced physical activities, sun exposure, and an increased tendency to binge eat, winter is also a season that has the potential to affect health negatively if not taken care of properly.

Appetite suppressants

We tend to sleep and eat more during winters and the festivities may add a few extra kilos by the end of the season. It is important to suppress unnecessary cravings to avoid burdening our system. There are some natural food products that act as suppressants to these hungers and cravings and help to keep our bodies warm as well. They help in maintaining the energy balance and keep you active.

So, control your appetite with these natural goodies this season:

1. Apples

Apples help in regulating blood glucose by giving you an energy boost without making you gain weight. It is a good source of fiber and minerals essential in various bodily processes. Have an apple at breakfast or midday for a sustained energy release. Add a twist by having a warm mashed apple with a pinch of cinnamon.

2. Oats

Oats contain a good amount of fiber which meets our satiety and keeps us full for longer. It thus helps in cutting down unnecessary cravings and affects the body positively by reducing cholesterol levels as well.

3. Spinach

There is no doubt that spinach is one of the healthiest food items as it is rich in plenty of vitamins, minerals, and fiber. It is low in calories and helps in maintaining the metabolism. Incorporate it into the diet in various delicious recipes or as a fresh salad.

4. Beetroot

Beetroot, loaded with antioxidants, is a good replacement for unhealthy sugars. Grab a bite of beetroot salad to stay refreshed throughout the day or have it as dried chips for snacks.

5. Almond

Having 3-5 soaked almonds every day in the morning shows a marked difference in overall health. Almonds are rich in vitamin E in their natural oils and are a good source of omega fatty acids.

6. Caffeine (controlled)

Caffeine present in dark chocolate, coffee, and green tea is a natural suppressant. It helps in controlling hunger and increasing metabolism, thus helping in being in shape. It improves alertness and concentration too, however, it is recommended not to consume in excess.

7. Fenugreek

Fenugreek has a host of health benefits including blood sugar regulation, cholesterol reduction, managing appetite, and hunger. Soak fenugreek in water overnight, consume it in the morning and incorporate fenugreek in various recipes.

Over to You: Start prioritizing your health by bringing in small changes in your daily life. Ditch the unhealthy junk food and try the natural appetite suppressants to keep you healthy and in good shape all winter long!

excerpt.rendered: Winter is a season of comfort and coziness when we prefer to stay indoors, wrapped under the blanket than braving the cold outside. With reduced physical activities, sun exposure, and … Continue reading 7 Natural Suppressants That Must Be a Part of Your Winter Diet

title.rendered: Are You Feeling Stressed Or Guilty About Your Eating?

content.rendered:
Gorging on something you love and feeling guilty soon after? Do you calorie count everything you eat every day and get stressed if it doesn’t fit your plan? Are you constantly worried about putting on weight while eating anything? Well, it’s okay to keep a track of diet plans and healthier habits but not to a length that makes you feel stressed and guilty.

Take a note of these points to overcome your problem and enjoy the process of eating:

1. One single food won’t lead to weight gain

Weight gain happens over a period of time and a meal may contribute to weight gain rather than a single food ingredient. Suppose a piece of brownie won’t result in weight gain as much as a full brownie added with a scoop of ice cream would do. It is better to focus on healthier alternatives while also understanding the quantity of food.

2. Control your portion size

To make a diet plan effective it is important not only to focus on the ingredient and menu but also to take care of the portion size. When preparing meals, keeping in mind the serving size helps in controlling portion size. Often we end up eating more to avoid food wastage. Try to have frequent meals instead of heavy meals at once.

3. Avoid overindulgence

One of the many perils of the fast-food industry is the attentive nature of the products which leaves us craving for more. Often packaged products contain hidden sugar and addictive substances which leads to overindulgence. Binge-eating while watching TV is also bad for health. The temptation of our favorite dish also leads to over-consumption. Rather than feeling guilty about it, try to fix a quantity at a time and try to consume at different intervals rather than at one go!

4. Stop being hard on yourself

Food nourishes and protects our body which is why we should not treat it as an enemy. Try to take care of your body and seek the help of dietitians and nutritionists who would understand your requirements better. Over more, stop being hard on yourself as punishing yourself would do no good. Try to build a healthy harmony with food for a positive outlook, both physically and mentally.

Over to You: Rather than constantly feeling stressed or guilty about eating, focus on understanding your body needs better and follow simple steps that will help in attaining a holistic approach towards health and wellness.

excerpt.rendered: Gorging on something you love and feeling guilty soon after? Do you calorie count everything you eat every day and get stressed if it doesn’t fit your plan? Are you … Continue reading Are You Feeling Stressed Or Guilty About Your Eating?

title.rendered: Seven Major Health Complications Associated With Eating Disorders

content.rendered:
Eating disorders are often neglected and go unnoticed till the body responds to serious complications that go within the systems. Poor mental health manifested as eating disorders affect overall health to an extent that it impairs everyday functioning. It includes both overeating and self-starvation which can affect both social and personal life. Leave behind the stigma associated with it and look for the signs before it results in grave complications.

Some of the major health complications associated with eating disorders are listed below,

1. Nausea and vomiting

One of the most common and immediate effects is nausea and vomiting. It results in indigestion and people often end up throwing food to an extent that anything one consumes feels like it would be thrown out. Purging by vomiting depletes the body of essential nutrients and electrolytes. It inversely affects muscle contraction and issues of the digestive tract soon arise.

2. Intestinal infections and ulcers

The disruption in eating patterns results directly affecting the intestine as they are responsible for digestion and absorption. The villi lining wears out and ulceration takes place. It results in serious digestive issues and absorption of nutrients is remarkably reduced. As a result, it causes bowel issues too. It in turn affects overall health and takes time to recover.

3. Constipation

A Series of complications in the digestive tract leads to constipation as poor consumption of food results in poor digestion and disruption of stool formation. The intestinal muscles weaken and it becomes difficult for the body to release stools.

4. Heart health

Eating disorders result in poor heart health due to many inter-linked factors. The energy requirement is not met from healthy sources, it weakens the heart muscles and affects blood pressure. The blood vessels of the heart cannot supply essential nutrients and an unhealthy diet raises cholesterol levels.

5. Hormonal issues

Reduced calorie intake affects the brain and hormone production. It in turn affects organs like the thyroid and also affects fertility. The hormonal imbalance disrupts the menstrual cycle and leads to severe health complications.

6. Mental health problems

Mental health and eating disorders are interlinked. Poor mental health results in eating disorders and it, in turn, impairs proper brain functioning. Starvation, fasting deprives the brain of nutrients and drain the body, it affects the everyday functioning of the body, with insomnia, fatigue, reduced concentration, and memory.

7. Hair and skin problems

One of the clinical signs of poor diet and nutrient absorption is manifested as poor skin and hair health. Low levels of nutrients result in dry, flaky skin, chapped lips, and brittle hair. It may also result in increasing stress levels and greying of hair. Over to You: Early intervention is the key to tackling eating disorders. Talk to a professional or your loved ones and seek help to avoid these complications that might even prove life-threatening in the long run. Bring a positive outlook towards your body and health as it is never too late.

title.rendered: Diet Quality & Covid-19 – Focus on Plant-Based Nutrition

content.rendered:
Amongst the numerous ways in which the Covid-19 pandemic impacted our lives, one would be undeniably the focus on health and diet. It was a hard way to learn that our health is indeed our wealth. Scientists, researchers, and health professionals have emphasized the importance of diet quality in preventing the severity of the disease and also aiding in recovery.

The approach

Even after an individual has recovered from Covid, the aftermath is nothing less of a battlefield with several complications ranging from fatigue, anxiety, insomnia, weakened immune system, and several complications affecting lungs and the heart. A diet targeted at these complications helps in easing the situation. As WHO recommends having a balanced diet focused on building immunity and strength is essential in battling Covid. Several studies have also indicated the importance of plant-based nutrition in tackling complications.

Plant-based diet

A plant-based diet must not be confused with a vegan diet which debars consuming any animal product or by-products. Plant-based nutrition focuses mainly on plant produce like fruits, vegetables, cereals, grains, seeds, legumes while also consuming animal products as per preference. The focus would be including more plant-based items which are rich in phytochemicals, antioxidants, and fiber.

Tips for a plant-based nutrition

1. Your daily diet should include assorted colorful fruits and vegetables. The pigments that result in the color have health benefits.

2. Opt for seasonal produce as they are nutrient-dense and a chance of adulteration is less. Have seasonal fruits and locally available foods more.

3. Include grains and millets like ragi, bajra, jowar, quinoa, and oats. Cut down refined grains.

4. Try not to deep fry foods, instead prefer foods and vegetables grilled, boiled, or stewed to retain maximum nutrients.

5. Consume foods as fresh as possible rather than storing them for days. Avoid storing cut fruits and vegetables. Opt for freshly prepared salads.

6. Include lean protein and soy products like tofu, tempeh.

7. Focus on your gut health and consume naturally probiotic foods like yogurt.

8. Add seeds and nuts to daily diet like chia seeds, pumpkin seeds, watermelon seeds, etc.

Benefits of a plant-based diet

1. They provide a good amount of fiber, minerals, vitamins, and phytochemicals.

2. They improve metabolism and the digestive system.

3. They reduce the onset of lifestyle disorders and improve immunity.

4. It aids in weight loss.

Over to You: Covid-19 affected individuals with existing conditions harshly and left healthy ones with several morbidities. This proves it is a long battle to be fought and the sooner we adopt a healthier lifestyle, the better it is.

title.rendered: Binge-Eating A Lot While Working From Home? Explore Healthy Snack Options

content.rendered:
With the onset of the coronavirus outbreak, more and more companies are shifting into work from home model to tackle the crisis. While it may have the perks of being in pajamas 24*7, the refrigerator is easily accessible too. This has resulted in increasing binge-eating unhealthy snacks which can be the root cause of several health complications coupled with a sedentary life.

Worry not as we have curated these healthy snack options that would keep your cravings in check!

1. Roasted Makhanas

Foxnuts or makhanas are a great source of minerals like calcium, zinc, folate, and manganese. It is helpful in keeping cholesterol levels down and provides good fats and protein. It is good for heart health so make sure to include it as a healthy snack.

2. Nutty trail mix

Nothing like a good trail mix of nuts and dry fruits. Mix almonds, walnuts, cashews, pistachios, raisins, apricots, dry dates, and seeds of pumpkin, sunflower, watermelon, flax, and chia together with your favorite seasoning if required. Store in an airtight jar and much on a handful in between work.

3. Granola bars

Freshly made granola bars out of millets, oats with cranberries, nuts, and dates are a great way to tackle hunger pangs as they are filling and nutritious at the same time.

4. Popcorn

Although too much popcorn is not good, an adequate amount of popcorn is a healthier option as compared to a pack of deep-fried chips. Have popcorn simply salted and avoid adding too much butter.

5. Roasted pulses

Roasted pulses are low in fat and rich in proteins and minerals. Have roasted pulses like moong, chickpea, and Bengal gram. It is a high-protein snack and low in calories. Simply soak pulses overnight and dry roast them with spices for a healthy munch.

6. Veggie sticks

Baked veggies or air-fried veggies with seasoning and dips are a healthier snack option to munch in between work. It is rich in antioxidants, fiber, and minerals.

Over to you Stock up the healthy goodies in your next grocery shopping and indulge in a healthy evening with these snack options. They will take care of your hunger and cravings in a healthy way while also keeping you in shape.

title.rendered: Makar Sankranti Treats

content.rendered:
The harvest season is celebrated differently all across the country, from Lohri in the north to Pongal in the south, Uttarayan in the west to MaghBihu in the east. MakarSankranti too marks the beginning of this festive season with celebrations ranging from flying kites to preparing delicacies with the new harvest.

These festivals are a reminder of our cultural unity and diversity and it is important to engage kids in the festivity. MakarSankranti is the day when the sun travels into the new zodiac Capricorn, with Makara being Capricorn and Sankranti standing for the movement of the Sun.

One of the most significant aspects of the festival is the celebration of harvest and food. Here is a list of traditional foods that are an integral part of the festival and the recipe ideas that can be easily prepared.

1. Sugarcane

Sugarcane or “ganna” is very significant, produced especially in the northern parts of the country. It is turned into jaggery and sugarcane sticks are very important in rituals too. Sugarcane is one of the best sources of energy as it provides glucose to the body. It is good for digestion and is recommended to have during midday. It is drunk as juice, eaten straight from the sticks, or used in various preparations as jaggery.

2. Rice

Rice is a very important part of the festival and the celebrations surround its harvest. A host of recipes with rice as the main ingredient is prepared across the country. Rice is used to prepare Pongal (sweet, chakkara), curd rice, payasam, kheer, pithepuli, Nolen gurerpayesh, badam halwa, and barfi to name a few.

3. Jaggery

Jaggery is aromatic during winters with fresh palm harvests and it is loaded with healthy minerals like iron which is important for treating anemia. It maintains reproductive health and reduces fatigue and tiredness. It is used in the preparation of pithe, kheer, laddoos, bars, halwa, tilgud, along with various other sweet dishes.

4. Sesame seeds

These nutritious seeds are a must-have this festive winter season. Loaded with calcium, zinc, and iron it is essential for a strong and healthy bone and immune system. Recipes made out of sesame seeds include til Laddoo, til peanut chikki,

Over to You Food is an integral part of our culture and no better way to celebrate it than MakarSankranti. Add these to your various recipes and celebrate the festivity in a happy and healthy way. Engage your kids and let them be part of the cultural diversity across the states.

excerpt.rendered: The harvest season is celebrated differently all across the country, from Lohri in the north to Pongal in the south, Uttarayan in the west to MaghBihu in the east. MakarSankranti … Continue reading Makar Sankranti Treats

title.rendered: Sesame Laddoo

content.rendered:
Sesame Laddoo is a perfectly healthy and delicious munching option that has been part of our culture and rituals for ages. Sesame seeds, commonly called til, is very nutritious too. When paired with the goodness of jaggery it makes it a perfect winter recipe. With harvest festivals like MakarSankranti and MaghBihu round the corner, this easy recipe is a must-try!

Nutritional benefits:

Sesame seed is a rich source of calcium that helps to keep bones healthy. It helps in women suffering from osteoporosis and poor bone health. Jaggery is a good source of iron and minerals which helps in preventing anemia along with keeping the digestive tract healthy. It is a flavorful and aromatic recipe that is good for overall health.

Ingredients:

  • 20g sesame seeds
  • 10g jaggery
  • 1 cardamom
  • 1 tsp ghee
  • Water as needed

Procedure

1. In a pan dry roast the sesame seeds with cardamom on low flame till the color changes to golden and aroma is released. Be sure not to burn them. Set aside and let it cool completely.

2. In another pan add jaggery and little water to create a syrupy texture.

3. Now add the jaggery to the sesame seeds with cardamom. Add little ghee to it and mix well.

4. Form in the shape of smallladdoos and let them cool. Once cooled, store in an airtight container.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Try this simple and quick recipe of tilladoo and make sure to incorporate at least one in daily diet as it is loaded in calcium and iron essential for good health. Share them with your friends and family this festive season.

title.rendered: The Do’s and Don’ts to Keep Your Asthma in Check

content.rendered:
Asthma, also termed bronchial asthma, is a condition that affects the airways and makes it difficult to breathe as they become inflamed, narrow, and produce extra mucus. It can be a minor condition or it can lead to a life-threatening attack. It is often a chronic condition that can last for years or be lifelong.

The common symptoms include chest pain, difficulty in breathing, and coughing. Asthma can make several conditions like Covid infection more difficult to deal with. It is important to be aware of the condition and make wise decisions in everyday life. Here are some do’s and don’ts that will help manage the condition.

Do’s

  1. Check for symptoms– it is important to keep a track of your symptoms early on and not avoid the warning signs. Also, let your near ones know about it and keep emergency contact details handy.
  1. Keep surroundings clean and dust-free– Dust and smoke affect the condition greatly so keep your home and surrounding clean. Avoid air-polluted areas and smokers.
  1. Exercise and yoga– light, breathing exercises, and yoga are very beneficial in managing asthma. It helps in managing stress and inducing good sleep. Consult your trainer to guide you better for specific exercises.
  1. A healthy diet- A diet rich in antioxidants especially vitamin C, Vitamin A, zinc are crucial for a healthy life. Include loads of fruits and veggies in your diet on a daily basis.

Don’ts

  1. Don’t smoke– Smoking is a strict no for asthma patients and it is recommended to avoid being around smokers too. Smoking, be it active or passive is harmful to all individuals and may lead to many respiratory conditions in the long run.
  1. Don’t forget your inhaler– an inhaler can be helpful for tackling asthma. It is advised to consult the doctor and follow instructions on its usage.
  1. Don’t overdo– knowing your condition and limits, don’t overdo anything that may jeopardize your health. Try not to over-exercise and keep things moderate. Over-exercising may aggravate your conditions.
  1. Do not eat foods that trigger– certain foods containing sulfites are particularly not suitable for asthma patients. Avoid foods that trigger allergic reactions and inflammation. Some of them might be peanuts, processed foods, soy, and tree nuts.

Over to you Hang in there as you are not alone in this struggle, Asthma is pretty common and manageable. Follow our tips that would be effective in managing your condition better!

title.rendered: Here’s How to Eat Your Iron

content.rendered:
Iron is an important mineral associated with growth, development, circulation, and various physiological processes. Iron is associated with making hemoglobin which carries oxygen throughout the body. Iron is specifically important for women as it is crucial during pregnancy and lactation. It is important for prenatal development too. Anemia due to iron deficiency is far too common in the population hence it needs to be addressed.

Here are some simple ways you can improve your iron levels,

1. Go Green

Green leafy vegetables are a rich source of iron and it is important to include dark leafy vegetables in the diet. Include red saag, spinach, kulekhera in the diet. The water of kulekherasaag is very beneficial for improving iron levels.

2. Jazz with Jaggery

Jaggery is rich in iron along with other minerals. It is important to incorporate it into the diet like as chikki or laddoos with peanuts and sesame seeds. Many recipes also incorporate pulses and jaggery which is a good way to supply iron.

3. Fix a date with Dates

Dates should be part of your daily diet as they are loaded with nutrients. Have a handful of dates every day as a snack or after-meal treat. Include it with vitamin-rich food for better absorption.

4. Rajgira Rules

Rajgira or amaranth is a rich source of calcium and iron. It is a very nutritious grain and is considered a superfood. It is low in calories and carbohydrates. It can be eaten as porridge, parathas, Laddoo, or as roasted and seasoned.

5. Edgy Eggs

Eggs are a good source of heme iron which is crucial for many developmental processes in the body. Incorporate egg in your diet, better in the boiled form to receive its maximum benefits.

6. Kadhai Cares

Cooking in iron Tawa or kadhai is often practiced to supply iron in food as the cast iron supplies iron to the food that is cooked in it. However excess of anything is harmful so be mindful.

Over to You

Having sufficient iron in the diet is very important to have a healthy life and to prevent risks associated with deficiency. Including these foods will help in supplying both heme and non-heme iron in your body.

title.rendered: Top 5 Myths on Sexual Health Busted

content.rendered:
Even today there are taboo surrounding sex and sexual health that prevents many to speak about it openly. Sex education is also not properly discussed which has resulted in the birth of several myths and misconceptions. People find it uncomfortable, shy, and even anxious when they are asked about sexual health.

Lack of proper communication and awareness has resulted in the birth of several myths and we plan to bust some of them for you!

1. Condoms are not effective?

Condoms are one of the most easily accessible and affordable contraceptives available in the market. It is essential for safe and protected sex. It not only protects against pregnancy but also against a host of diseases that can be transmitted because of unprotected sex. While one may feel it doesn’t protect oneself completely, it may be partly true because a chance of lapse may happen. However, it is either due to inappropriate size, tear, or hole in the condom.

2. Sexual Health checkup is not for the ones having exclusive and limited sex?

Even if you don’t have sex that often it is essential to go for regular checkups for early detection of any symptoms you might be having which often can go unnoticed. This is a precautionary step towards better and safer sexual health.

3. Oral sex can make you pregnant?

No, oral sex or ingesting sperms will not make you pregnant as sperm needs to be fused with the egg released from the fallopian tube in the vagina to be able to get you pregnant. It is important to practice safe sex and to use a condom even during oral sex as many STDs can be transmitted during the process.

4. You can get STDs even if you don’t have penetrative sex?

STDs can spread from skin to skin contact and in bodily fluids hence they can be transmitted via any type of sex be it vaginal, anal oral, or even sex toys. It is important to use physical protection and contraception whenever one is with an STD-infected individual. It is important to go for regular health checkups too.

5. Hormonal birth control is bad?

While it is really an individual’s choice as to what one prefers, it is however important to consult your doctor and gynecologist for any possible complications or side effects as per one’s body system and condition.

Over to You

It is important to discuss sexual health and fact-check rumors and misconceptions for a healthier and safer society.

title.rendered: The Right Way to Lose the Vacation Weight

content.rendered:
Truth be told, soon after a good and relaxing vacation is over and you are back at your regular routine one thing that you can’t stop noticing is the post-vacation weight! It’s absolutely normal as vacation and holidaying is something one must enjoy, relax and eat at heart’s content. But there are some drastic steps people often take soon after a vacation like starving or following crash diet trends.

Crash diets do more harm than good to the body as it causes imbalance and may even lead to serious complications. Don’t let it spoil the good times spent, instead follow these simple tips to tackle vacation weight:

  • Go slow

Let your body adjust to the change and instead of being too harsh on it, take it slow. After a vacation body needs to tune in to a routine and instead of burdening it even further, try focusing on adjustment. Sudden crash diet and starving should be completely avoided.

  • Increase fiber

Fiber aids in metabolism and keeping digestive and gut health healthy. Incorporate good amounts of vegetables and fruits daily.

  • Get moving

Nothing better than some regular exercise to lose the added weight. With a proper exercise schedule, you can get back into shape in no time.

  • Avoid fad diets

Don’t enroll in rapid weight loss diets or fad diet trends for a quicker approach towards weight loss as they might give quick results but will often lead to a manifold increase in weight later on.

  • Drink plenty

Drink loads of water and incorporate healthy juices and herbal tonics out of fresh herbs and spices. They not only help in better metabolism but also keep weight in check.

  • Be consistent

Jot down your weekly routine and be determined to consistently follow it as nothing beats a good, consistent approach towards health.

Over to You Remember, good health is a lifelong affair so be generous and gentle to your body while you try to embark on losing weight. Instead of going for crash diet courses, look for a sustainable approach by following these simple tips!

title.rendered: 2021 Flashback: Key Healthcare Trends That Will Shape Your Health In 2022

content.rendered:
As we welcome a New Year wrapped up in new hopes and new dreams, we bid adieu to 2021 for all the hardships, learning, and experience it provided us with and eventually shaped a majority of our approaches towards this New Year. In the world of medical and healthcare, it is no different as we saw a remarkable increase in co-dependence of healthcare on technology and how it is shaping our future to make lives simpler and better.

Let’s look into some of the healthcare trends that can shape the health industry of 2022 in a greater way.

  • Genomics

The customized and personalized health system has evolved to go into our genomes for better results and solutions to things that were not possible until a few years back. Genomics and gene editing is very crucial to treat complicated conditions and diseases. The specific traits are inherited by living cells and they determine the phenotypes and genotypes. By manipulating these phenotypes, scientists are advancing towards treatments of various diseases like cancer, heart ailments, and muscular dystrophy.

  • Biohacking

A trend that is gaining popularity in western countries is simply a technique of tracking your body cycle and controlling your own biology. It is a product of the individual traits and environmental factors affecting one’s body and system. By altering some basic steps one can achieve the best version of oneself, thanks to biohacking!

  • Flexitarian Diet

Over time this diet is gathering popularity because of its approach of a gradual shift from non-vegetarian to a vegetarian diet and finally to a plant-based diet. It focuses on sustainability and reducing carbon footprints. Instead of rapid shift, this focuses on slow but steady progress to be flexible enough. It also limits the consumption of highly processed, refined, and sugar items.

  • AI

AI or artificial intelligence is crucial to look into a patient’s Electronic Health Record (EHR) and predict possible health outcomes. It is an important tool to prevent conditions and early diagnosis and detection. Digitization of data like from Covid-19 tests has helped in intertwining to build AI models which will help in discovering new treatments and aid in research.

Over to You It is important to stay aware of the latest news and trends that are going on in the health industry. The advancement of technology in recent years has shaped the industry largely and it is important to look at how they evolve in time to come.

title.rendered: Here’s How to Control Your Cravings during Festive Season

content.rendered:
We wait all year-round to celebrate festivals with joy and togetherness, and not to forget the food and feasting that comes along with it. Many even engage in strict diets before a festival so that they can indulge guilt-free during the occasion. Being surrounded by delicacies, however, many can’t control their cravings and end up overindulging, leading to weight gain and a host of other complications.

Cravings ain’t hunger

There is quite a difference between hunger and cravings. Hunger is a normal mechanism of the body’s demand for food which occurs mostly if you skip or delay your regular meal timings, or after working very hard. Hunger is mostly accompanied by stomach grumbles, headache, fatigue and they mostly go away after providing the body with energy and food.

Cravings on the other hand are mostly a mind game where your feelings and desire to eat something overpower. You may not be hungry when you are craving some food. It mostly is targeted at delicacies and unhealthy junk which makes us “feel good” after consuming whatever we have been craving. Often the quantity is not regulated and overindulgence is common.

Here are a few tips to control your cravings this festive season-

  • Avoid starving yourself. This way you will avoid overindulging, especially upon unhealthy junk food. Try following a proper meal schedule and grab a healthy snack whenever cravings kick in.
  • Avoid caffeine and alcohol as it drains water and causes dehydration. It also causes mood swings resulting in craving food and drinks while not being hungry. It also increases our sugar cravings which are detrimental to health in the long run.
  • Cut down foods that are rich in fats, sugar, and salts including highly processed items. A pack of chips has addictive substances which increase cravings and thus are bad for health.
  • Incorporate a fiber and protein-rich diet. Adding loads of vegetables, fruits, and lean meat is a great way to tackle unnecessary hunger as they help in regulating hormones and metabolism.
  • When thirsty reach out for water instead of aerated and sugary drinks which not only makes you even thirstier but also are bad for your health. Try having herbal juices or decoctions instead of carbonated drinks.
  • Realize your craving pattern and keep a note of it. Instead of punishing yourself and indulging guilt-free, try having your favorite food once in a while.

Over to You Avoid being too hard on yourself all at once, instead, keep short-term goals to understand your body better. It is easy to meet goals when you have strong determination and a track laid out. Follow these simple tips as the first step towards tackling your mindless cravings this festive season.

title.rendered: Cinnamon Apple Fruit Squares

content.rendered:
Bring warmth and aroma to your winter evenings with fruit squares made out of the goodness of apple and cinnamon. Try this easy recipe to cater to your cravings in a healthy way, any time of the day.

Nutritional benefits:

Oats is used as the main ingredient which is rich in fiber and nutrients to keep our satiety level in check and maintain digestive health. Beta-glucans in oats is used to control cholesterol levels in the body. Apple is a good source of essential nutrients like vitamin C and magnesium. Flax seeds are rich in fiber and omega fatty acids. Cinnamon is an important aromatic spice with immense medicinal properties.

Ingredients:

  • 20g rolled oats
  • 1 apple sliced
  • 1 tsp ground flax seeds
  • 2 dates
  • ½ tsp cinnamon powder
  • 10g butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract
  • Salt as per taste

Procedure

1. In a pan dry roast the oats over low heat until brown along the edge. Remove from the heat and set aside.

2. In another bowl mix the ground flaxseed with warm water and set aside to thicken for about 5 minutes.

3. In a blender blend butter, dates, vanilla extract, cinnamon powder and salt. Add the flaxseed powder until smooth.

4. Add the oats to it and mix well. Add the apple slices into it as well.

5. Spread the batter on to the baking tray and chill until firm for at least 30 minutes. You can try baking in the oven as well if you want it hot and baked.

6. Once chilled, cut into square shapes and serve.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Add variety to your diet with these delicious cinnamon apple fruit squares that are easy to prepare and can be enjoyed any time of the day.

title.rendered: 5 Healthy Drinks to Keep You Warm and Merry

content.rendered:
With every change in the season, there needs to be a change in diet and lifestyle for the body to adjust to the weather changes. Change in the season also makes one susceptible to various viruses and microbes resulting in common cold, flu, cough, and runny nose which are very common during winters. Winters brings back sweaters, jackets, caps, and gloves along with the indulgence in steamy foods and warm drinks.

Hot beverages are a blessing during winters so, make no mistake and try these delicious healthy drinks to get you going this winter.

1. Cinnamon milk

Switch your regular coffee rich in caffeine with a cup of cinnamon milk for a warm and healthy evening. Cinnamon is an amazing aromatic spice that goes well with milk. It keeps the body warm and provides many health benefits like better sleep and reducing stress along with taking care of the digestive system.

2. Spice tea

Several spices and herbs when mixed with tea give an aromatic experience along with health benefits. Try masala teas made out of ginger, tulsi, cloves, bay leaves, and cardamom instead of regular teas once in a while. You can also try Kashmiri khawa tea which is beneficial for your health along with being aromatic.

3. Kadhas

Decoction of several herbs and spices serves as a great winter drink to keep the common cold and flu at bay. Try Kadhas made out of ginger, turmeric, cardamom, tulsi along with honey in water. They have individual medicinal properties along with keeping your body warm and healthy.

4. Millet drink

Try having a healthy and filling drink made out of millets like ragi or cereals like oats in milk. It is a great way to incorporate nutrients and ditch unhealthy drinks. Try having nuts like walnuts, almonds, and pistachios for added benefits.

5. Turmeric latte

Nothing beats a warm cup of turmeric latte during winters. It has anti-bacterial properties essential to ward off infections and is also essential for inducing a night of good sleep. It also keeps the digestive system healthy. Have it in the evening or at bedtime for a sound and warm sleep.

Over to You Ditch your regular caffeine-rich drinks and switch to healthier alternatives with these amazing drinks that are healthy and tasty to keep you all warm and cozy this winter!

title.rendered: Winter Diet Tips – 5 Mistakes to Avoid During Winter

content.rendered:
Winter is here and so are the cozy blankets to hibernate into an unhealthy lifestyle only to come out at the end of it regretting while looking back at all the winter mistakes that have already have been done. Wait, it’s not done yet as we are here with our warning call to prevent you from making 5 common mistakes this winter.

1. Reminder: Water

Reduced thirst and perspiration lead to low water consumption during winters as compared to summers. But don’t let it lead to dehydration as water is required in sufficient amounts for various body functions like transportation of nutrients and elimination of wastes, regulating temperature, and keeping your skin healthy. So, fill up your bottles and make sure to finish them by the end of the day.

2. Check your carbs

During winters our activities reduce too and we tend to spend lesser energy but make sure you adjust your diet accordingly. Carbohydrates need to be cut down a bit if the energy expenditure is reduced else it will lead to unnecessary weight gain. Try shifting to more complex carbs rather than refined ones and keep dinners light.

3. Cut short caffeine

The 3 Cs of winter would probably be Chocolate, Coffee, and Caffeine! We often end up consuming quite a great deal of caffeine in the form of hot chocolates, chocolates, teas, and coffee to warm us up but what it really does, in the long run, is adversely affect it and also increase dehydration. Make sure not to over-consume caffeine this winter.

4.  Binge eating

Nothing like the comfort of sitting on a warm couch wrapped in a blanket, catching up on your favorite shows, and binge eating, endlessly. Wait, did you keep a track of those packs of snacks? By the time you finish your show and get up, you would have done the damage of overconsuming a junk or unhealthy snack! Switch them with a limited portion of healthy snacks like nuts, dates, seed mix, fruits, veggie sticks, or roasted pulses.

5. Vitamins C and D

Lastly, don’t forget to focus on your vitamins as it will help in adjusting to the weather change and reduce the chances of catching cough and cold. Take the best of the season by consuming lots of citrus fruits like those fresh oranges and basking in the winter sun!

Over to you Don’t let the harsh winters take the best of your health, instead, enjoy the weather while taking care of your health while following these tips to avoid mistakes that you would end up regretting!

title.rendered: Top Health Myths of 2021 Busted

content.rendered:
Coming across several myths have become a part and parcel of daily life as an overload of information in the various platform are on the rise.

As we end 2021, let’s look at some of the popular myths and bust them with facts for a healthier approach in the future.

Myth 1: Cholesterol is bad for health

Fact: Cholesterol is a fatty substance that is necessary for several body mechanisms like nerve transmission. However, it is the type of cholesterol and the amount that matters. Most of the cholesterol, about 80% is produced by our liver and the rest comes from food sources of animal origin like eggs, meat, dairy, etc.

Myth 2: Finding a lump in the breast means you have breast cancer

Fact: often the lump found in the breast does not lead to cancer hence early diagnosis and intervention are very important. Try self-examining your breasts and in case you find a lump don’t panic but visit your doctor without delay.

Myth 3: Sunshine supplies vitamin D

Fact: Sunshine helps in converting the inactive Vitamin D into an active one which the body then can process. Vitamin D is very common as people don’t consume enough vitamin D-rich foods. Make sure to have foods fortified with vitamin D like milk and milk products. Also fat is essential for its absorption in the body.

Myth 4: Diet and nutrition has no relation to depression

Fact: Poor diet and unavailability of proper food are the main causes of depression. Poor dietary habits like having foods rich in fats, salt, and sugar are some of the leading causes of cravings, mood swings, and depression. On the other hand, there are many foods rich in antioxidants and fiber that are known to reduce depression.

Over to You It is important not to follow everything related to health and food one finds on the internet as most often the trends turn out to be myths. Fact-check from reliable sources as we attempt in busting some common myths and misconceptions of 2021!

excerpt.rendered: Coming across several myths have become a part and parcel of daily life as an overload of information in the various platform are on the rise. As we end 2021, … Continue reading Top Health Myths of 2021 Busted

title.rendered: Here Are Some Forgotten Foods that You Should Really Consume

content.rendered:
There are many foods that used to be part of our diet and culture but are soon vanishing over the years as more processed and junk foods are finding their way into the market. Often we hear our grandparents narrate about certain foods and recipes we never heard of but were a nutrition powerhouse.

These foods are not only rich in nutrients but are essential to maintain biodiversity and beat climate change. In this fast paced-life let’s pause and look at some forgotten foods that should find their way back into our plates.

1. Rajgira (Amaranth)

Long before oats or quinoa became hype, we had our own superfood called rajgira or amaranth. It is consumed as saag and the grain-like seeds are nutritionally dense being rich in vitamins and minerals like calcium, protein and have low calories. It has several health benefits like it reduces the risk of cancer, heart diseases, maintains bone health, fights inflammation, and keeps the digestive system healthy.

2. Targola/ Taal (Ice apple)

This is a type of palm having delicate fleshy fruit coated with a hard exterior that is available during summers. It is rich in vital nutrients and minerals like potassium, magnesium, calcium, and vitamins like C, A, E, and K. it is a low-calorie food that keeps the system cool and is rich in phytochemicals.

3. Phalsa (Indian sherbet berries)

These are tiny berries that are dark purple in color and are available seasonally. They are extremely healthy, nutritionally dense, and are rich in calcium, iron, magnesium, phosphorus, and vitamin C. It is similar to blueberries but is smaller. It is perfect for summers because of its cooling property. It is consumed simply with salt or spices but can be prepared into syrup or jam.

4. Bael (wood apple)

Also called Bengal quince this is a rare tree native to the Indian subcontinent whose leaves are used to worship and the fruit in a hard shell is consumed as sherbet in summers. It has a cooling property and has a host of health benefits like curing digestive issues, maintaining liver health, and is anti-inflammatory.

Over to You Take a break from all the processed and packaged foods and try looking for these native items that are rich in vital nutrients but are slowly being forgotten.

title.rendered: Get Started For 2022- 20 Best Tips To Watch Out For

content.rendered:
As we come to the end of another year renewed with the hope of the New Year 2022 to bring with it the motivation and zeal to have a healthier life. So, let’s get started with the 20 best health tips to watch out for this New Year!

1. Beauty of Sleep

Take our advice and make it a resolution to stick to your sleep routine of adequate sleep. It will not only provide you renewed energy throughout the day but also prevent many illnesses. So, have your beauty sleep!

2. Hydrate-Hydrate-Hydrate

Make sure to ditch unhealthy beverages and have sufficient water throughout the day. Install a reminder app in case you are too occupied to remember every time.

3. Limit Packaged foods

Packaged foods are often highly processed with far more salt, sugar, and fats than is recommended. Try to fix the number of processed items you would consume in a week and slowly but steadily bring it down.

4. Snack healthy

Switch unhealthy snacks and junks with healthy ones like roasted pulses, seeds, nuts, and dates.

5. Get moving

Go for a morning jog or evening run whichever works best and make sure to leave your couch and get moving!

6. Watch what you drink

When thirsty, avoid reaching out to colas and sugary drinks. Instead, try having cucumber juice, mint lemonade, etc.

7. Increase season’s goodness

Indulge in a variety of seasonal fruits and vegetables that are rich in phytochemicals, fiber, and antioxidants.

8. Reduce screen time

Cut-off screen time and spend more time on activities and spending time with family and friends. Set a timer for your screen to monitor better.

9. Run away from fad diets

Don’t fall for diet trends and fast weight loss programs, rather adopt a sustainable approach towards your diet and have balanced meals.

10. Pack your lunch

Instead of eating unhealthy food outside, carry your lunch and plan it well in advance as it makes the task easier. You will save money too!

11. Quit unhealthy habits

Take time and figure out your unhealthy habits and try to quit them this year. Ask your friends and family for help if needed.

12. Take up your hobbies

Go back to your paintbrush, piano, or dancing shoes and make it a point to indulge in your lost hobbies at least once a week.

13. Go Green

Surround yourself with plants and watch positivity radiate out and within. You can take up kitchen gardening as well.

14. Gather experiences

Tick off the list of experiences you always wanted to do and go for it, like scuba diving or paragliding, whatever you always wished.

15. Lift weights

Strength training is very crucial for proper muscle growth so try doing it throughout the year diligently.

16. Take time off

Balance your personal and professional life and take time off when needed. Go for trips or meet up with old friends.

17. Know what’s bad

Limit alcohol and foods you know would do more harm than good in the long run. Set short goals and achieve them.

18. Beat the stress

Reduce stress and indulge in activities that keep you cool and composed. Have stress buster foods and exercise regularly.

19. Don’t skip meals

Don’t skip your meals be it breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Manage your time well and resort to healthier options, always!

We often take for granted our sleep cycle as something manageable throughout the day but

20. Find inner peace

We can’t focus enough on the importance of meditation and yoga in promoting good health. It takes care of your mental health as well as your physical one!

Over to you It’s better late than never, as the saying goes! So get down and set your goals by following our tips for a healthier lifestyle and have a splendid year of 2022!

title.rendered: Low-Carb Healthy Rice Substitutes That You Should Definitely Incorporate Into Your Diet

content.rendered:
Rice has been a staple food for millions over the centuries. Rice is a good source of energy that is readily available. However, in recent years the sedentary lifestyle has increased due to desk jobs and several other lifestyle changes. Our diet thus seeks less refined carbs and more fiber and nutrients. Weight watchers, keto-dieters, and people looking for healthier alternatives to White Rice, which contains a fair amount of starch, is on the rise recently. We list out a few low-carb rice substitutes that you can incorporate into your daily diet.

1. Quinoa

Quinoa is considered a superfood because of the nutrient-dense nature of the grain which is not lost during processing. It is rich in protein calcium, fiber, and vital minerals which makes it a good rice substitute. You can incorporate it in meals or have salads out of it. It keeps you full longer thus is great for weight loss.

2. Amaranth

Amaranth or rajgira is a native Indian grain that is like quinoa rich in nutrients particularly calcium. It has good satiety value and has a series of health benefits including promoting bone and muscle health, aiding in digestion, protecting against certain types of cancers, protecting heart health, and aiding in weight loss.

3. Cauliflower rice (Grated cauliflower)

Keto-dieters opt for this low-carb rice substitute in their diet plans as grated cauliflower, also called cauliflower rice is tasty as much as it is healthy. It can be prepared quickly and is low in calories. Prepare with colorful vegetables and a healthy meal is ready!

4. Cabbage

Recently, there has been a lot of craze surrounding cabbage amongst weight watchers as it is low in calories, promotes satiety, and is rich in minerals and fibers. Have it chopped and replace rice with it once in a while.

5. Other rice varieties

People who can’t give up on rice and are looking for white substitutes in other healthier varieties or forms should definitely try having brown rice which retains the bran which is rich in nutrients and fiber and is good for heart health, diabetes, and obesity. A little quantity of it can keep you full for longer. Another option is shirataki rice which is low in calories and rich in fiber.

Over to You Replacing white rice with these substitutes at least once in a while will promote good health and wellbeing as they are loaded with fiber and nutrients beneficial for weight watchers and combating several lifestyle disorders.

title.rendered: How Food Can Be Our Medicine

content.rendered:
Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food- Hippocrates

The above saying of Hippocrates has stood the test of time as it is true in every respect. It emphasizes the importance of nutrition to prevent and cure diseases and ailments. What and how much we eat affects our body composition. Food has various functions in our body like growth and development, protecting from ailments, and nourishing every cell. With proper guidance of food, one can prevent many serious diseases and complications.

Food as medicine?

As long as scriptures dates back, several foods have been related to curing several ailments as studies and Ayurveda are based upon. Foods like herbs and spices, several roots and flowers are associated with medicinal properties. Even today, the extracts of such herbs and plants are used in several expensive formulations and medicines. Foods like ginger, basil, honey are known to cure the common cold and flu, foods like jamun and aloe vera is good for diabetes and probiotics for digestive and gut health.

Balance is the key

A balanced diet rich in protein, carbs, fats, fiber, antioxidants, and other vitamins and minerals helps in maintaining good health. Several lifestyle disorders like obesity, diabetes can be prevented with the proper use of food and diet. Food maintains health of all organs like liver, kidney, heart, gut as well as brain. An imbalance in food results in various complications and diseases. Consumption of foods that are unhealthy like heavily fried foods, carbonated beverages, foods rich in saturated fats and trans fats and a diet low in nutrients and fiber, and more in empty calories does body serious harm in the long run. Hence it is important to understand the difference what a food source can make to make wise choices.

Food as therapy

 Food has therapeutic properties too as it helps in faster recovery from any condition and for any complicated treatment, food is a vital factor in recovery. Food can bring out the best in your body and what you consume on a daily basis largely determines your body composition. Consuming adequate and the right nutrients can prevent various deficiencies as specific nutrients have specific functions in the body.

Over to you Having a complete and balanced diet rich in nutrients should be a daily practice as it will help in avoiding various health complications. Rather than relying on high dosage of drugs and pills every time, let food do the magic of nourishing your body with all the goodness, everyday!
