title.rendered: Save Your Vision At Workplace With These Tried And Tested Methods

content.rendered:
Digital screens have become an inevitable part of our daily lives and we almost cannot do without them. Recently, with longer screen times due to work be it in office cabins or as work from home, eyes are taking all the burden. Unlike physical paper or books, digital screens have emissions, and a combination of glare, contrast, light, and brightness causes harm to the eyes as eye muscles are not that adaptive to those settings for longer hours. We often tend to blink less when we look at screens and the distance between the eyes and screens is often compromised.

It is important to take care of eyes while working in front of screens as it has serious repercussions other than poor or blurred vision, some being directly affecting the nervous system and brain, leading to dizziness, headache, and loss of balance. Indulging in late-night digital screens affects the sleep cycle and results in insomnia too.

Here are some quick and simple methods to improve your eye health while working.

1. 20-20-20 rule

Experiencing burning sensation, watery eyes, itchiness or strain is very common while working long hours in front of the screen. To combat that follow the 20-20-20 rule per which you need to take a 20-second break after every 20 minutes. During that time look for some distant objects and relax your eye muscles. Eyeball movement is also recommended.

2. Use anti-glares

Anti-glares are the anti-reflective coating that is applied to eyeglasses to reduce the amount of glare that is reflected from the screen. It helps in reducing fatigue and improves focus.

3. Wash often

Splashing water once in a while not only cools the eyes but also reduced eye dryness and itchiness. The screens and air-conditioned setup tend to make eyes dry. Try having some eye drops handy as well and rinse with water often. It improves concentration and thereby productivity.

4. Blink more

While continuously looking towards the screen we often blink less. Be alert and try to blink more for eye muscles to work properly. It helps to release strain and focus better.

5. Vitamin A rich diet

Vitamin A in form of retinol and beta-carotene is directly related to eye health. It improves vision and prevents many eye-related problems like night blindness, bitot’s spots, etc. Include vitamin A-rich foods like green leafy vegetables, carrots, and eggs.

Over to You It is important not to neglect eye health as it might lead to eye damage in the long run. Apart from following these methods, go for regular eye checkups to keep your eyes in good health.

title.rendered: Water As A Nutrient

content.rendered:
Water is one vital component to good health that we mustn’t take for granted as it is essential for the basic sustenance of the human body. There are days, especially in winters where we often forget to have sufficient water and it affects the body in some way or the other. Poor hydration is linked to low concentration, poor performance and recently has been associated with several chronic conditions.

Water is the key

About 60-65 % of the human body is composed of water right from the blood that flows throughout the body to digestive juices, water is essential for every cell integrity. Water excretes out waste products from our body in form of perspiration and urine, hence for the proper functioning of kidneys too we require sufficient water every day. An adult requires about 3-4 liters of water per day as the requirement increases over summers. Even though our perspiration is low during winters, we should not skip the daily requirement.

Water: a vital nutrient 

  • Lubricant

Water act as a lubricant that helps the body to defend against shocks. It is present as fluid matter in cells and tissues and makes movement easier. It is present in fluids and mucus which are very essential.

  • Transport system

One of the major roles of water in the body is to transport nutrients and electrolytes to every cell in the body as blood and flush out toxins via urine and sweat. Water is very essential for the proper functioning of all organs.

  • Body temperature regulator

Staying hydrated at all weather conditions is vital for regulating the temperature of the body as water helps in releasing heat via sweat and regulates the thermal state of the body. Likewise, the temperature of the water itself helps adjust to changing weather conditions.

  • Creates Saliva

Saliva is one of the crucial factors of digestion as amylase in saliva begins the process from the mouth. Water is essential in creating saliva as lack of it makes our mouth and throat dry. Hence, adequate consumption of water is essential for sufficient saliva formation.

  • Skin integrity

Water helps maintain the rigidity of each cell and is very important for healthy and glowing skin. It makes skin supple and delays the aging the skin.

Over to you Water is a basic necessity of life and one must take care of having safe water every day. Try having different healthy decoctions and beverages along to increase the nutrient content and even maintain a reminder app in case you have the habit of forgetting about having water timely!

title.rendered: Intimacy Nutrition: Focusing On Sexual Health And Wellbeing

content.rendered:
We rarely find information on nutrition concerning sexual health and intimacy as the internet is flooded with tons of articles targeting other aspects of the body. But Hush! Hush! no more as we bring forth one of the most neglected but important aspects of health: intimacy nutrition.

Intimacy is often mistaken to mean just sex but it encompasses several forms of affection and care. There are foods that help in improving intimacy and sexual health thereby reducing stress and improving fertility in both men and women. An increase in stress results in a host of issues like insomnia, high blood pressure, weak immunity, irritable bowel syndrome, and many others. Here are some tips and tricks to improve your intimacy and sexual health.

1. Eat right

A diet rich in phytochemicals, minerals like zinc, selenium, iron, calcium, and healthy fats like omega fatty acids helps in improving sexual health and wellbeing. Try having nuts like almonds, pistachios, cashews, walnuts, and seeds of watermelon, pumpkin, flax; fish, and fiber-rich fruits and vegetables.

2. Exercise

It is very important to exercise every day to maintain a good physical and mental state. The hormones released during exercising and workout improve mood and help in thinking better. Try practicing yoga and meditation early morning to receive all the good vibes and positive energy. Exercising and doing yoga together with a partner also improves intimacy.

3. Pamper yourself and your partner

Once in a while indulge in a good pamper like spa therapy, massage, manicure, pedicure, and top it up with a good bath. Pampering and taking care of one’s body helps in releasing feel-good hormones and also releases stress and toxins from the body.

4. Sleep cycle

Improving sleep cycle and maintaining a proper routine keeps the day in balance and improves mood, concentration, and sexual health. Limiting screen time at night is also very vital. Try resting when you feel exhausted and maintain a proper sleep routine, even a nap helps in rejuvenating the body.

Over to you Improving intimacy helps in releasing stress and combating several ailments related to it. As important as it is to take care of everything else, it is equally important to take care of your sexual health and wellbeing.

title.rendered: Geriatric Wellness- Basic Stretching Routine To Keep You Going

content.rendered:
Most of the workouts are centered on adults and very few focus on the elderly. It is true that with age body’s ability to move and mobility reduces but with proper lifestyle and exercises one can live stronger. Exercise and workouts for the elder population are important as they need to be aptly designed to suit the metabolism and the age factor.

Several physiological changes happen as one gets old, from reduced appetite, reduced metabolism to several underlying health issues. Thus, exercise for the elderly has to be simple and less straining. Here are some basic stretches to swear by during old age.

1. Shoulder stretch

Shoulders are important to perform basic functions like wearing clothes and grabbing things from a higher shelf. Shoulder stretching should be done daily during the morning and evening by small slow rotations. It will keep the joints motile and healthy along with muscle relaxation.

2. Neck stretch

This stretch is beneficial for the tensed muscle around the neck and easing out pain and discomfort. Try various neck stretching exercises like moving the neck sideways or tilting front and back. It will help make the neck less stiff and more flexible. Also, pay attention to the pillow and the level at which pillows are kept. Try not to do a certain work resting neck at a position for longer durations and move from time to time.

3. Ankle rotation

This part is often overlooked but is very important for maintaining body balance and posture. Rotating the ankle can help reduce stiffness and prevent falls and injuries by stumbling. Wear proper foot wares which are anti-skid and soft soles. For this exercise, keep your feet straight on a plane surface and rotate your ankles and move sideways.

4. Backstretch

Elderly, especially women are prone to osteoporosis and poor bone health. Many face back issues and trouble sitting or standing for long durations. Follow basic stretches of the back to ease back pain and discomfort. Try touching feet by bending down slowly and getting up and facing backward. Put your hand on the waist and rotate the pelvic area round and round. One can also stretch sideways by grabbing the waist on both sides.

Over to You Exercise and workout should be part of every age group including the elderly which requires special attention. Stretching and light-free hand exercises not only help in strengthening the body but also help in increasing longevity.

title.rendered: Recipe- Sweet Potato And Chestnut Soup

content.rendered:
Winter is the season when relishing soups feels the best and it is also the season of a great many varieties of vegetables. The goodness of sweet potato paired with the crunchiness of chestnut is bound to add some variety to your regular diet. It is loved by all age groups including the kids and the elderly and is fairly simple to make.

Nutritional benefits:

Sweet potatoes are a good source of fiber and nutrients particularly vitamin C, manganese, potassium, and magnesium. It is good for treating constipation and other digestive issues and enhances skin health as well. Chestnuts are rich in antioxidants and improve the nutrient profile of the dish. It is low in calories and rich in nutrients.

Ingredients:

  • 35g sweet potato
  • 15g chestnut
  • 1-2 cloves of garlic
  • 15g onions
  • 100ml vegetable stock
  • 1 teaspoon olive oil
  • Salt and pepper as per taste

Procedure

1. In a deep pot heat oil and add the onions. Fry till they turn golden brown.

2.  Add the rest of the ingredients except the chestnuts and sweet potatoes. Cook for about 5-7 minutes.

3. Add the chopped sweet potatoes and chestnuts and boil for 30 minutes or until they turn soft.

4. When the soup gets boiled, let it cool and transfer all the contents to a blender. Blend till puree consistency is achieved.

5. Reheat it if desired and serve in a bowl garnished with coriander leaves.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you: Sweet potato and chestnut soup is bound to add variety to your diet while being low in calories. Add this recipe to your to-do list this season and get a boost of healthy nutrients while catching up on your favorite shows.

title.rendered: 5 Ways To Stay Healthy, Energized And Fit This Winter

content.rendered:
Adjusting with the change in season might feel a little uncomfortable as we shred the laziness off the winter blanket and prepare to bloom with spring. No doubt, winter brings with it the lethargic feeling and so it is even more important to stay fit and energized and not let the seasons have their toll on health.

If you are worried about where to start from, we got you covered with 5 ways you can stay healthy, energized, and fit this spring.

1. Hydration is the key

Often due to change in seasons we rely on thirst and forget about drinking water. However, it is important to have sufficient water and healthy beverages to keep you hydrated throughout the day. Have herbal teas, smoothies, juices along with a regular water routine to supply essential nutrients along with. You may even download an app to remind you to have water.

2. Load up seasonal produce

The best way to get ample nutrients from nature is to consume seasonal and fresh produce. The seasonal produce offers the essential nutrients that are metabolized in the body better. Also, avoid consuming foods that are non-seasonal as they often tend to lack adequate nutrients.

3. Get moving

One way to beat lethargy and laziness is to be active on a daily basis by exercising, playing, or running. A sedentary lifestyle is the root cause of many illnesses and disorders and leads to poor muscle and bone health. Try exercising for at least 30 minutes five days a week.

4. Immunity focus

Immunity is a key focus area to combat illness and to avoid getting sick due to changes in weather conditions. The shift in seasons causes one to be more prone to catching cough, cold and common flu as microbes thrive better when temperatures are ambient. Make sure to have loads of antioxidant-rich foods like fruits and vegetables and prepare healthy drinks and herbal teas.

5. A sound Sleep

The last one is a very important one which is ending the day with a sound sleep. A night of good sleep is vital to unwind the body, reduce stress, and energize the body on waking up. Insufficient sleep will result in headaches and lethargy throughout the day so it’s important to have good quality sleep. Maintaining sleep time is equally important.

Over to You A shift in season can be challenging but keep in mind the above pointers and stay energized throughout the new season.

excerpt.rendered: Adjusting with the change in season might feel a little uncomfortable as we shred the laziness off the winter blanket and prepare to bloom with spring. No doubt, winter brings … Continue reading 5 Ways To Stay Healthy, Energized And Fit This Winter

title.rendered: Debunking Health And Nutrition Myths

content.rendered:
The dilemma surrounding what to eat and what not to? Confused about which health tips to follow and which myths to bust? Worry not as you aren’t alone and we got you covered by debunking some common misconceptions and myths related to health and nutrition.

Myth 1: Carbs are bad for diabetes

Fact 1: It is the type and quantity of carbs that determines whether it is bad for diabetes or not. No doubt refined carbs are not recommended for diabetics but including complex carbs in daily diet can manage diabetes better. Thus, all carbs are not bad and complex carbs that help in keeping satiated longer and manage blood glucose levels.

Myth 2: Label with fat-free can be consumed limitless

Fact 2: Food packages labeled fat-free may contain preservatives, sweeteners, and other additives which is not recommended to be consumed in huge amounts. These products may be rich in calories, have trace fats, and are not completely fat-free. Consuming such products by reading the entire label thoroughly and limiting consumption should be the key.

Myth 3: While eating out, salads are the best options

Fact 3: Ready-to-eat salads are generally high in calories and have dressings that are rich in fats. Preparing homemade salads using fresh ingredients is not only nutrient-dense but safer as well. Often store-bought salads have no guarantee of freshness or may contain unnecessary preservatives.

Myths 4: Gluten-free diet is the healthiest

Fact 4: Gluten-free diet is meant for individuals with celiac disease or persons who are sensitive or intolerant towards gluten. It is not a weight loss diet and neither was it meant to be one. People without gluten-related complications are not recommended to follow it.

Myth 5: Vegan and vegetarian diets don’t supply enough protein

Fact 5: There are plentiful vegetarian and vegan options to supply a good amount of protein but one must consume adequate quantities. Animal protein tends to get absorbed easier and plant sources contain many anti-nutrients to counter it. Make sure to include loads of beans, pulses, legumes, grains, leafy vegetables, and soybean and soy products.

Over to You Rather than following a diet trend or eliminating an ingredient blindly by following a post or article on the internet, it is better to consult the dietitian or nutritionist for proper guidance. It is better to fact-check before giving way to myths and misconceptions.

title.rendered: Lemony Herbed Potato

content.rendered:
Lemony Herbed potato with the goodness of basil is a perfect meal accompaniment as well as a delicious and healthy option for snacking on the go. Pair it with your favorite rice preparation and chapattis and add a twist to your monotonous diet.

Nutritional benefits:

Potatoes, other than being a good source of energy and starch, are rich in minerals like calcium, phosphorus, zinc, and selenium as well as B and C vitamins. Basil is rich in phytonutrients and vitamins and minerals like iron, Vitamin A, C, and K. Lemon is a flavorful ingredient rich in Vitamin C.

Ingredients:

  • 1-2 potatoes
  • 1/4th cup chopped basil leaves
  • 1 tsp olive oil
  • ½ tsp lemon zest
  • 1 tsp lemon juice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Procedure

1. Pre-heat the oven and cut potatoes in ½ inch cubes.

2. Add in little olive oil and toss the potatoes together. Spread them on the baking sheet and roast.

3. Add the basil leaves, lemon juice, lemon jest, and olive oil together.

4. Toss the lemon basil oil with the potatoes and season them with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Nutritional info per serving:

title.rendered: 7 Keto Benefits

content.rendered:
A keto diet is a diet plan that focuses on the consumption of healthy fats, a good amount of protein, and a few carbohydrates. The diet primarily targets on fats from healthy sources and limiting carbohydrates to a minimum. The soul energy provider which is fats gets utilized and the reduced carb intake doesn’t get stored in the body instead it depletes the sugar reserve.

The Keto diet has shown several benefits however careful planning and close monitoring and guidance are recommended. Here is a list of seven benefits of the keto diet to look up to.

1. Supports weight loss

A diet low in carbs works far better than a diet low in fats as the carbs are no longer stored and are utilized along with the main energy source which is fats. It also meets the satiety level so cravings are controlled as well. This shift of energy source results in rapid weight loss, much quicker than diets with low fats. However one must take note that this can work for a maximum of 6 months following which it works just like any other weight loss program.

2. Improved heart health

The healthy fats supplied in a keto diet are beneficial for the heart as omega fatty acids are known to maintain heart health. The source of fats however needs to be healthy as unhealthy fats will fail the cause. Avocadoes for example when consumed reduced the levels of VLDL and LDL cholesterol.

3. Reduced blood sugar levels

Reduced carbohydrate intake results in reduced blood glucose and thus is good for preventing many diseases. It reduces obesity and overweight and manages glucose in the blood.

4. May Lower Blood Pressure

The Keto diet is good for lowering blood pressure and reducing hypertension as a diet low in carbohydrates reduces the chances of stroke, heart attack, and kidney issues. It helps in regulating blood sugar levels thus preventing the risk of many diseases.

5. Improve Brain Function

Fat is extremely beneficial for brain health as it improves concentration, memory, and several neuroprotective benefits. Extensive research is being conducted around the world for its potential to treat several brain conditions.

6. Potentially reduces seizures

The Keto diet is known to treat several cases of seizures and epilepsy where a diet rich in fats is extremely beneficial. It is useful in treating patients with Alzheimer’s and several brain disorders.

7. Reduced Appetite

Many give up on diets because of increased hunger cravings which ultimately result in increased food consumption but the keto diet supplies a good amount of healthy fats which meets satiety and reduces appetite.

Over to you The Keto diet has many benefits, some of which are mentioned here. However, one must follow the guidance of a nutritionist or dietitian for an effective diet plan that is sustainable at the same time.

title.rendered: Five Foods To Avoid On A Keto Diet

content.rendered:
It may sound tempting that one can eat tasty fats while trying to manage weight with the help of the keto diet but one must be careful of the source of fats. Consuming unhealthy fats and refined grains in the keto diet is a strict no as they are no good to our system. While you may be clear with what to include on a keto diet, it is better to look at the list of foods to avoid.

1. Juice

Juice and sugary drinks supply a good amount of sugar which readily shoots up the blood glucose levels. It hinders the process that the keto diet follows and makes you hungrier. Once in a while juice is okay to supply essential nutrients and vitamins but it is best to avoid sugary fruit juices and drinks. Consume coconut water or decoction of herbs if you seek some refreshing hydration.

2. Starchy vegetables

Starchy vegetables are rich in starch which is basically a carbohydrate. One must avoid starchy vegetables like potatoes, tapioca, yam, corn, squash to name a few when following a keto diet. Opt for non-starchy vegetables for which options are plenty.

3. Cereals

Breakfast cereals are loaded with carbs and hidden sugars which are not at all healthy. Corn flakes are cereals made of refined carbs that are strictly to be avoided. Rice, rice flakes, semolina, sago are best left out from the diet. Opt for a non-carb source like quinoa which is rich in essential vitamins and minerals and also being keto-friendly.

4. Unhealthy junks

While keto allows consumption of a fat-rich diet it does not mean one can have deep fried foods and unhealthy junk foods rich in fats. One must avoid heavily fried and fatty foods which are rich in trans-fats and saturated fats which increase the levels of bad cholesterol.

5. Sugary dishes

Snacks and desserts rich in sugar are to be avoided on a keto diet as they are rich in carbohydrates and increase the level of glucose in the blood rapidly. Avoid sweetened yogurts and desserts made out of refined grains and sugar like payasam and kheer.

Over to you One must be careful while selecting food items to include and avoid while following a keto diet. Avoid this list of foods that are not at all keto-friendly and seek the advice of your nutritionist for a more personalized keto-diet plan.

excerpt.rendered: It may sound tempting that one can eat tasty fats while trying to manage weight with the help of the keto diet but one must be careful of the source … Continue reading Five Foods To Avoid On A Keto Diet

title.rendered: Five Foods To Eat On A Keto Diet

content.rendered:
The Keto diet brings forth a shift in macronutrients which was primarily focused on carbohydrates to a diet that is low on carbohydrates and high in fats. Planning a keto diet is not too easy and one needs proper and careful guidance to do the switch. It does not involve completely removing carbohydrates from the diet or gulping on foods rich in unhealthy fats.

While on a keto diet, many find themselves in the dilemma of whether certain food will be good for the diet or not. Here we have curated a list of five foods that one can consume on a keto diet.

1. Eggs

Eggs are a nutrition powerhouse, albumin rich in protein and the yolk rich in healthy fats, vitamins, minerals, and biotin. Eggs are low in carbohydrates, thus making them a good keto diet option. Have an egg or two a day in various recipes like salad, pudding, omelet, French toast, or simply consume boiled.

2. Low carb veggies

One important switch to be made in a keto diet is replacing starchy vegetables like tubers and potatoes with leafy, fibrous vegetables like spinach and kale. Cauliflower and cabbage are popular keto diet veggies like pizzas made out of cabbage base and rice made of cauliflower instead of wheat and rice respectively. Include veggies like broccoli, mushroom, green leafy vegetables which are rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals are known to have a protective effect on the body.

3. Seafood

Seafood is rich in minerals like zinc, potassium, selenium, and natural salts which are good for the keto diet. Include seafood like oysters, squids once in a while and fatty fish can be consumed guilt-free in a keto diet. The carbohydrate content in seafood varies as per type but they are generally low in carbohydrate.

4. Meat

Lean meat and red meat, both can be consumed on a keto diet as per preference however target should be to choose ones that are low in carbohydrates and high in protein and fats. They are essential for building muscle mass and providing energy for daily activities.

5. Avocado

One of the many perks of following a keto diet is to relish tasty foods that are rich in fats, guilt-free, like avocado for example. It is a delicious and must-have option while on a keto diet as it is essentially rich in healthy fats and vitamins. Include it in the diet as a salad or a dip or upon toast with garlic and chili flakes for a yummy snack option that is filling at the same time.

Over to you Include these keto-friendly foods in your keto diet which are a source of healthy fats and nutrients instead of looking for unhealthy fatty foods which do the body no good. Consult your nutritionist for personalized guidance on a keto diet.

title.rendered: 5 Keto Diet Tips for Beginners

content.rendered:
Shifting from a regular routine to a new planned diet may get challenging initially for beginners and will involve a lot of learning in the process. The key factor whenever a new diet like a keto diet is being followed is to be consistently patient and not to give up halfway. Here we provide a list of five tips on a keto diet for beginners.

1. Reduce Stress

Stress indirectly affects the body’s ability to respond to a keto diet. Cortisol, the stress hormone ends up elevating the body’s blood sugar levels. Thus, due to the presence of excess sugar in the blood prevents the body from burning fat for energy. Chronic stress can, therefore, severely hinder the body’s ability to enter ketosis.

2. Prioritize Sleep

Maintaining a proper sleep cycle every day is essential for good health and wellbeing. Adequate sleep and having a proper schedule are crucial to reducing stress levels and thus make the keto diet effective. Studies indicate that a proper sleep of 8-9 hours helps in effective weight management and mental wellbeing.

3. Exercise Frequently

Exercising at least 5-6 days a week is important to utilize the stored energy reserve as glycogen stores effectively. While exercising, fats, carbs, amino acids all get utilized and muscle formation takes place too. On a keto diet, the transition from a high-carb diet to a high-fat diet takes place smoothly and effectively.

4. Regulate Salt Intake

Generally, it is advisable to reduce salt intake and keep it to a minimum. However, in the case of the keto diet, salt intake can be up a little bit. In a keto diet, the carbohydrate intake is reduced and the insulin is reduced too, excretion of salts takes place in comparatively larger amounts. Thus, regulating salt intake while on a keto diet is essential.

5. Drink plenty of water

Staying hydrated is very crucial while on a keto diet since reduced carb intake increases water release from the body. Also, exercise when done with the keto diet releases more sweat than usual.  Include hydrating recipes of healthy drinks along with water.

Over to you A Keto diet may seem difficult to follow for beginners but careful planning and proper guidance can do wonders to meet your health goals. It is important to consult your nutritionist before shifting to a keto diet as it may not seem easy to shift from a diet that is high in carbs to a diet that focuses on fats.

title.rendered: Seven Amazing Health Facts You Must Know About

content.rendered:
Debunking myths in recent times has become a herculean task when everyone looks up to search engines like Google as the on-the-go Encyclopedia. While everything on the internet is not false, most of the trends and popular opinions often lack scientific backing.

After some research, we put forward seven health facts that you may have some confusion about. These facts range from various sections like sugar to meal timings. Take a look at these seven facts that you must know about.

1. Skipping breakfast is not the key

Breakfast is one of the most important meals of the day and while many opines that breakfast will help in losing weight and is good for the metabolism, skipping breakfast will do the body more harm than good.

2. Sugar is no good than a cigarette

Sugar is addictive and it is a source of nothing but empty calories. Just how a cigarette causes harm to the body, sugar particularly white sugar does the body no good. Try to reduce your everyday sugar intake and include vegetables and fruits rich in fiber instead.

3. Store food in glass containers and not in plastic ones

Glass containers may be fragile and break easily but from the food safety point of view, it is always advisable to store food ingredients in glass containers and not on plastic ones as leaching and reactions occur via plastic containers.

4. Coffee can reduce your depression

Excess coffee consumption is no doubt not advisable but little consumption of coffee on a regular basis has been shown to reduce depression by 20% in a study. The caffeine in coffee has been shown to improve mental wellbeing and mental clarity amongst the subjects.

5. Meal timings are as important as your meal preparation

As much as it is important to focus on meal planning and preparations, it is equally important to consume meals timely regularly. Irregularities in meal timings can affect health drastically.

6. The stretching before running may lower endurance

While a little warm-up and stretching are practiced before any physical sports activity, stretching before running may lower the stamina and affect endurance. A light warm-up can be done however, stretching before a run is not advisable as stretching relaxes the body and is mostly reserved after completing an activity.

7. It is beneficial to have pumpkin seeds raw

Pumpkin seeds are rich in vitamins and minerals particularly zinc and selenium. It is often used in various preparation or is consumed roasted. It is best to consume pumpkin seeds raw to avail the maximum benefits from the seeds.

Over to you Before following any online trends or opinions, it is best to fact-check from authentic sources and rely on scientific reasoning. We hope to clear some confusion and help you take a step towards healthy living.

title.rendered: This Too Shall Pass- 5 Ways In Preventing Kidney Stones

content.rendered:
Kidney stones are the small, hard deposits of minerals and acid salts that form in the kidney and are often painful when passed. These deposits stick together in concentrated urine and cause pain but usually don’t cause permanent damage.

The stones can form from uric acid which is a by-product of protein metabolism and can also occur when calcium combines with oxalate. If one develops kidney stones, it can be medically diagnosed and there is short-term treatment involved. However, if you want to prevent developing kidney stones in the first place then you need to take care of a few things as listed here.

1. Check your protein consumption

High protein diets can lead to increased levels of uric acid and with it the chances of developing kidney stones. Aim for a balanced diet rich in fruits and vegetables. Balance your protein intake from both animal and plant sources without overindulging in any.

2. Increase fluid intake

Drinking adequate water and healthy fluids is one of the important steps to prevent kidney stones. Have enough water throughout the day and urinate often to get your body rid of excess calcium that may deposit. Have electrolytes and fluids like coconut water, mint water, etc.

3. Consume appropriate calcium

Calcium is vital for many body processes and its intake through regular food is essential. One should consume adequate calcium to prevent kidney stones. Make sure to consume the recommended amount of calcium for the age group and avoid taking elemental calcium unnecessarily.

4. Reduce sodium

A high sodium diet is not at all good for the health as it may trigger kidney stones. A diet with low sodium is recommended for preventing kidney stones. Additionally, a diet low in sodium will help in maintaining a healthy heart and plod pressure.

5. Keep a check on your weight

Keeping a healthy weight is essential as excess weight will increase the chances of kidney stones. Being overweight or obese will put extra pressure on the kidneys and can contribute to kidney stone formation.

Over to you Kidney stones are far common and necessary diagnosis and treatments are available too. However, it is best to take care of your kidneys with an appropriate diet and lifestyle early on to avoid incidents of kidney stones.

title.rendered: Try These Healthy Drinks To Stay Warm This Winter

content.rendered:
When it comes to the cravings for a cup of hot beverage during winters it often ends with tea, coffee, or hot chocolate, all of which are quite high in caffeine. Overconsumption of caffeine can lead to several health complications. Switching to a healthy diet should also accompany swapping sugary and carbonated beverages with healthier drinks.

Winter is also a season of flu accompanied by a change in weather. It is important to take extra care of oneself and opt for healthier alternatives that have added health benefits. This winter, try these healthy drinks to stay warm and cozy.

1. Turmeric latte

The golden spice as we call it, turmeric is a spice that is available in every household. It has several health benefits including antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, and immune-boosting. Turmeric latte is prepared with milk and the golden drink is a must-have during the chilly winters. It also reduces joint pains that are so common during the winter season.

2. Herbal tea

Switching regular black teas with herbal teas is a step towards healthy living. There are different varieties of herbs and spices that make up different types of herbal teas. You can add some herbs along with green tea leaves for added benefits. Some herbal and floral teas include Chamomile tea, Lavender tea, Rose tea, mint tea, ginger tea, lemongrass and basil tea, and blue pea tea.

3. Cinnamon milk

Cinnamon is an aromatic spice with many health benefits. It enhances the taste of any dish and has several medicinal properties. It is good for the heart and is best enjoyed during the winters with a different mix of ingredients. Have cinnamon with warm milk before bedtime for a blissful sleep or enjoy the concoction with chocolate, milk, and cream as an evening drink.

4. Warm spiced nut milk

An exotic drink that can be enjoyed during the festive winter season is a beautiful creation of several spices with nut milk. For this, make nut milk like almond and coconut paired with spices like nutmeg, ginger, cayenne pepper, and ground vanilla and simmer for a while. Top it up with cream and spice dust.

Footnote Winter is a season of chilly winds, warm blankets, and festivity, also of increased incidents of cough and cold. Add a bit of warmth with these healthy yet delicious drinks this season and keep you and your family warm and healthy.

title.rendered: 5 Healthy Munching Recipes

content.rendered:
Whenever we talk about snack time we think of grabbing a pack of chips or cookies that are easy to munch on while working or watching our favorite show. Munching on unhealthy junk is one of the leading causes of rising obesity and lifestyle disorders. Opting for healthy snacks is important as they can increase the overall nutrition quotient of the day and manage hunger and metabolism more healthily. Planning snacks that are healthy is an important step towards managing weight in the long run.

While it might seem confusing when it comes to healthy snack options, we have got you covered with 5 easy healthy munching recipes.

1. Fruit yogurt

Fruit yogurt is a healthy snack option loaded with probiotics and prebiotics. For this, take a cup of Greek yogurt and your desired fruits like strawberries, pineapple, mangoes, etc. in either chopped or puree form and mix well with the yogurt.

2. Chia pudding

Soak chia seeds in water or milk and preferred sweetener overnight in a refrigerator and let it swell. Once it is done and thick, garnish with desired toppings of fruits and nuts. This recipe provides a good amount of fiber and omega fatty acids from chia and vitamins and minerals from the fruits.

3. Trail mix

Healthy trail mix can be easily prepared at home with nuts and seeds blended with preferred seasonings. Mix a cup of mixed nuts and seeds comprising of cashews, almonds, pistachios, seeds of sunflower, watermelon pumpkin, flax, and chia. Season it with herbs and spices or keep it sweet with honey. A trail of roasted pulses like moong, chana, and chickpea seasoned with pepper and spices tastes delicious as a snack item too.

4. Fruit cheese salad

Freshly cut fruits like mangoes, berries, papaya, pineapple with fresh cottage cheese crumbs is a great snack option that’s filling and healthy. As a mid-meal option, this is a healthy choice supplying good amounts of fiber, phytochemicals, and healthy calories.

5. Avocado toast

Sliced avocado on buttered toast topped with chili flakes, salt, and a dash of olive oil is a great munching option supplying healthy fats that will keep you full for longer. Avocado can also be made into a dip and paired with crackers or toast chips.

Over to you Whenever the cravings hit, opt for these nutritious and delicious recipes that are wholesome instead of highly processed, less nutritious options. This will help in weight management and living a healthy life throughout.

title.rendered: Why Do You Gain Weight Overnight?

content.rendered:
One morning you wake up and look down at your weighing scale and your entire day is ruined. This is a nightmare for everyone when suddenly the weight machine shows numbers that has no serious justification and we assume the scale is broken. Is it really possible to gain weight overnight?

Despite keeping a track of what and how much you eat, tracking the fitness schedule and overall routine, you still gain some pounds. Before you panic you should know that weight fluctuations are normal and they happen to pretty much everyone, experts say.

What factors cause overnight weight fluctuations?

While the definite cause for weight changes overnight is hard to determine but it can be a result of various causes like:

  • Water retention
  • Constipation
  • Bloating
  • Eating a large meal
  • Binge eating throughout the day
  • Hormonal changes
  • Varicose veins or leg swelling
  • A gain in muscle weight

These factors are often hard to determine and occasionally it might not cause any problem in the long run. There are however many voluntary steps that can prevent such weight fluctuations. Having a dinner party, enjoying a family gathering or festive season can often cause irregularity in the schedule but it is okay not to be on a restrictive diet all year round.

What can be done?

Doctors and nutritionists suggest not to keep a track of weight every single day unless you have some serious health complications as this will only make you anxious. The sustainable step towards weight management is to take time for the body to adapt to changes and once in a while a change in routine due to traveling, festivals, or occasions is inevitable.

The weight gained overnight is often not the gain in fat and most of it is a temporary issue. It is important to take care of several factors like sleep, work-related stress, improper meal timings, etc., which can affect the digestive system and hormonal regulations.

Doctor recommends keeping a track of:

  • The type and combination of foods that you are consuming
  • Improper fitness schedule
  • Mood and hormonal issues
  • Menstrual cycle
  • Sleep and meal timings

Over to you Don’t panic if you find you have gained some extra pounds overnight, most often it is a temporary issue the body is facing and is completely normal. Try not to get anxious and avoid weighing every day. Often the weight gain is an increase in muscle weight and not fat. If the weight fluctuations happen often and consistently, do visit your doctor or physician for added guidance.

title.rendered: Why Maintenance Diet Is Important After Weight Loss?

content.rendered:
The journey towards weight loss is challenging but it doesn’t end on hitting the desired weight. The real challenge lies in maintaining the weight in the long run as data suggests that about only 20 percent of the dieters who start off overweight end up successfully losing weight and maintaining it in the long term. But don’t let this discourage you as we brief you about the maintenance diet and strategies around it.

Why do people regain weight?

The unrealistic picture that is presented all around regarding weight-loss strategies is tempting to many and thus, there are few common reasons why people tend to gain back the weight they lose.

  • Wrong mindset

Many think of diet as a quick fix rather than a step towards better health in the long run. They tend to give up and go back to old habits.

  • Lack of sustainable approach

Fast fad diets are focused on immediate results and not on the behavioral change of lifestyle. Often the core reason for the change in habits is not explained and people fail to have a sustainable approach towards weight loss.

  • Restrictive diets

Diets focused on extreme restriction and rigorous calorie counting slows the metabolism and creates an imbalance of hormones, all of it resulting in rapid weight gain soon after losing some.

Why it does not end at weight loss?

The journey is a long-run process and it does not end after attaining the ideal weight one aimed for. Often people go for “cheat meals” or “cheat habits” as a way to reward themselves after a tough, restrictive week. This approach hinders the body processes that could be avoided with the help of slow and sustainable changes in the habits. Weight loss, after all, is a journey more than a goal and it is important to maintain the weight.

How to maintain weight loss?

  1. Don’t skip breakfast: eating breakfast helps in maintaining healthy habits better like exercising and having more fiber and micronutrients.
  • Exercise regularly: Exercising every day for at least 30 minutes helps in maintaining weight and preventing the accumulation of unnecessary fats.
  • Be mindful of refined carbs: be mindful of the carb sources and opt for complex over refined carbs.
  • Don’t overindulge: break down big meals into smaller ones to avoid overindulgence at a time.
  • Stick to your plan: be consistent with your goals and don’t give up.
  • Make sustainable lifestyle changes: incorporate small changes in the lifestyle that are easy to maintain every day.

Footnote Following fast diet trends does the body more harm than good as they seldom have any sustenance in the long run. A sustainable diet is a key to a healthy weight loss that could be maintained in the long run.

title.rendered: Antibiotic Overdose And Its Threat To Human Health

content.rendered:
Incidents of flu, common cold, infections, sore throats, and fever due to seasonal variations are fairly common and affect everyone once in a while. The instant response has increasingly become to seek a doctor’s prescription of antibiotics or buy them off the counter if everything else fails. The concept of a quick recovery and gulping down strong antibiotics restricts the power of natural healing and in the long run, it comes with grave consequences.

How do antibiotics work?

To understand their mechanism it’s important to understand the two important germs- Bacteria and Viruses.

  • Bacteria – They are living microorganisms that are present almost everywhere. While most are not harmful, some even being beneficial for the gut health and digestion, few are however the cause of severe infections. They multiply rapidly and can cause several illnesses and infections. Antibiotics are effective against bacteria because they restrict the proliferation of bacteria.
  • Viruses- They are non-living microorganisms that require a host body to grow and reproduce. While the body’s defense mechanism fights off viruses, colds, and cough if caught has to run down the course. Antibiotics do not work against viruses.

Antibiotic Overdose and its threat

Frequent and unnecessary use of antibiotics has an adverse effect on the body. It hinders the body’s ability to fight against microbes and increases the resistance of microbes to antibiotics. Antibiotics kill the bacteria, and the ones it fails to kill proliferate further, and thus next time the antibiotic dose becomes ineffective against the microbe. This results in the continued use of higher dosage which is very harmful to our system.

Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) calls antibiotic resistance ‘one of the world’s most pressing public health problems.’ Bacteria that were once highly receptive to antibiotics have become more and more resistant. Infections like ear infections, sinus, and pneumonia which were easily treatable are now hard to treat due to overdose.

Another setback of antibiotics is they cannot distinguish between the good and the bad bacteria. This results in the killing of all the bacteria present including the good ones. The good bacteria often found in the gut is very essential for the proper maintenance of the system, depletion of which affects the whole body in a way.

Over to You It is advisable to let milder infections run their course instead of gulping high-dose medicines every time. This will help in strengthening the body’s immunity and fighting ability and prevent antibiotic-resistant germs to divide further. Consult your doctor for proper guidance and avoid taking self-medication every time you feel sick.

title.rendered: The Must-Haves Of Fitness Nutrition

content.rendered:
Fitness and nutrition go hand in hand for all valid reasons. Both are the crucial and basic pillars for good health and wellbeing. Nutrition caters to almost all body ailments and conditions along with workout and fitness regimes. One who is a fitness enthusiast cannot overlook the power of nutrition along with the fitness routine. When both are paired correctly, it can do wonders to the body in the present and the future as well.

Here are some aspects of fitness nutrition that should be part of your daily life.

  • Power of protein

Protein is the building block of the body and it is essential to consume a good amount of protein for proper bodybuilding. It is an important macronutrient for building strong bones and muscles as well as for the repair of tissues. Add a good amount of protein from various plants and animal sources like pulses, legumes, quinoa, lean meat, and eggs.

  • Don’t cut off the carbs

The recent diet trends mostly suggest eliminating carbs and showing them in the bad limelight as something harmful that makes you fat. However, carbs are extremely essential for the proper functioning of the body, particularly the digestive system and the gut. It provides energy and bulk for the stools. Swap refined carbs with complex carbs like oats, quinoa, whole wheat, and brown rice for a fitter body.

  • Rainbow platter

A plate full of colorful fruits and veggies is essential for a fit body as they contain essential phytochemicals, antioxidants, and nutrients that help protect against diseases and build a strong immune system. Include colorful veggies like pumpkin, carrot, beetroot, and fruits like pomegranates, kiwi, papaya, orange, berries, grapes, etc. in good amounts every day.

  • Fuel it right

Many feel that exercising on empty stomach first thing in the morning is healthy but it is not. It is very important to provide enough fuel for the exercise else it will only burden the system to overwork and as a result get fatigued. However, it is also important not to exercise right after meals as it can make you sick. Fuel your body right with pre-workout snacks that are light enough like dry fruits, juices, and smoothies.

Over to You Incorporating the right nutrition into your fitness regime is very important for prolonged and healthy life. Don’t follow the fad diets blindly as they may have long-term adverse effects. Instead, incorporate these must-haves in your daily fitness routine.

title.rendered: 5 Post-Workout Homemade Drinks To Boost Energy

content.rendered:
Options of healthy pre-workout snacks and drinks are plenty but people often find themselves in a fix as to what to consume post an intensive workout session dripping sweat and feeling all drenched. Are you amongst those who gulp down chilled water or store-bought drinks right after an intense workout not finding enough options? Not anymore as we list down 5 homemade drinks that are apt for a post-workout regime to replenish and refresh the body.

  1. Coconut water with mint

Coconut water is a natural electrolyte loaded with vitamins and minerals. It will help to replenish the lost electrolytes in sweat and along with some mint leaves, it will act as a natural coolant without ice. It is best to have tender coconut simply or with mint leaves for added benefits.

2. Green mango cooler

Green mango is a summer favorite and the tangy-sweet drink made out of it is a great coolant as well as good for the digestive system. It is also rich in antioxidants and vitamin C which help the body fight against diseases. Mix the pulp with a little salt, chili powder, and jaggery or honey for enhanced taste.

3. Berry blush with chia

Berries are high in antioxidants and phytochemicals which have a protective effect on the body. In a blender add the berries along with a few mint leaves into desired consistency and garnish with chia seeds. This drink is rich in fiber and nutrients which is great post work out a drink that tastes absolutely fresh and delicious.

4. Kale kiwi smoothie

Both kiwi and kale are rich in vitamin C, fiber, and antioxidants. Together it serves as s healthy boost to the system which also acts as a detox. It will help clear out toxins post-workout and leave you feeling refreshed and light.

5. Carrot beet juice

Carrot and beetroot contain essential nutrients and phytochemicals which are beneficial for various bodily processes. Together they blend their tastes and properties really well and are a great detox drink. It keeps the digestive system clean and is extremely good for the gut and skin health. Blend them into desired consistency with or without any sweetener.

Over to You Instead of consuming carbonated beverages or health drinks with false claims, it is best to have fresh drinks made at home with easily available ingredients. These drinks will help in replenishing the body along with flushing out toxins released during a workout. Try the listed recipes after your workout session and notice the difference in how you feel.

title.rendered: Breastfeeding Beyond Nutrition- The Psychological Impact Of Bond

content.rendered:
Breastfeeding is an inevitable part of child-rearing and it is more than just supplying nutrients to the baby. The art of breastfeeding and the parameters related to it is quite varied and complex. We intend to break down certain aspects of breastfeeding and put forward how breastfeeding goes beyond nutrition, as something much deeper.

Breastfeeding promotes bonding

Breastfeeding initiates the bond that a newborn shares with a mother, and a mother with her child. The universal love and affection for one’s child reach a new leap when an infant suckles a mother’s breasts. The process releases several hormones in both mother and child’s body which also determines the depth of the relationship shared by them. The motherly feeling and “the instincts of a mother” as we call it also unknowingly rises and so does the baby’s attachment with the mother.

Skin-to-Skin Contact

More than the breast milk that is fed to the child what is important is the physical closeness shared by the mother and the child. One of the most important reasons for the bond is skin-to-skin contact. Studies show that infants who suckle breasts are more attached and close to the mother than those who are bottle-fed. The contact releases oxytocin which increases the bond too. Infants who suckle breast or have skin contact within one hour of birth releases more positive hormones and enhance calming sensation and reduce anxiety.

The ABCs of breastfeeding

The three things that will simplify the art of mastering breastfeeding include:

  • Awareness

It is important for the mother to be aware and catch the cues that the baby is providing when it wants milk. Initially, it might take some time to catch on cues like bringing hands to mouth, thumping on breasts but upon closely observing it gets easier.

  • Being Patient

Being patient is the key to great nursing as different babies latch and feed for different durations.

  • Comfort

Taking short breaks and sufficient rest is important as it helps to reduce fatigue and help feed comfortably.

Advantages of Breastfeeding

Apart from the bonding, there are several advantages for both the mother and baby.

  • Lifelong health

Breast milk contains antibodies, anti-allergens, and other immune-boosting components that stay lifelong. It is important for the strong and healthy development of the baby.

  • Cognition

Adequately breastfed babies show high intelligence and cognitive development as they grow.

  • Comfort

It promotes calming effect and reduces pain as well as gives a sense of security from the vulnerable environment.

  • Recognition

The proximity enables babies to develop scent and voice recognition. This aids in recognition in an unfamiliar environment and seeking comfort.

  • Improves sleep

The hormones released during breastfeeding induce good sleep in babies which is very important for good health.

Over to You Breastfeeding goes beyond breast milk to provide an eternal and lifelong bond between a mother and the child and develop several emotions of love, affection, closeness, and apathy which are important for years to come. Enjoy the precious phase of breastfeeding and motherhood with your child!

title.rendered: 5 Foods Breastfeeding Mothers Should Avoid Consuming

content.rendered:
Extensive breastfeeding for at least six months is vital for the proper growth and wellbeing of a newborn as it provides necessary nutrients and antibodies. Lactating mothers must pay extra attention to their diet and lifestyle as it will largely affect the newborn as well.

Research suggests there are some foods like fenugreek seeds, oatmeal, etc., that enhance the lactation process and increase breast milk supply. Consuming nutritious food by the mother is important for a good quality milk supply and likewise, certain foods may adversely affect the contents of breast milk and it is best to avoid those foods. However, it varies from infant to infant how they react to certain odors or flavors. Some may not tolerate spicy or strong-flavored foods like onion, whereas some babies might.

Here is a list of 5 foods that are best to be limited or avoided by lactating mothers.

  1. Caffeine

Caffeine mostly present in coffee, tea, soda, colas, and chocolates is not recommended for lactating mothers as there is a chance it gets into the breast milk and affects the baby’s health as they can’t metabolize that. Accumulation in the body may result in adverse effects too like irritability and disturbed sleep.

  • Alcohol

During the extensive phase of six months of breastfeeding, it is best to completely avoid drinking alcohol. According to CDC, consuming alcohol can reduce breast milk output by 20 percent. Frequent and excessive alcohol consumption can disrupt sleep patterns, delay psychomotor skills, and delay cognitive development.

  • Highly Processed Foods

Highly processed foods are mostly rich in calories and lack nutrients. They also contain additives, colorants, and flavors that are not recommended for breastfeeding mothers as they might affect infants’ health.

  • Herbal Supplements

Most herbal supplements found in the market don’t have enough research on lactating mothers. Over-the-counter supplements and medicines with health claims are best avoided by breastfeeding mothers. Do read disclaimers before purchasing any such items.

  • Certain spices

Some babies turn intolerant towards certain spices or herbs in food and it is best not consumed by the mother. Take time and observe the baby’s reaction and observe their stools. Many spices are adulterated with harmful colors and substances and hence, one must be careful while purchasing. Most babies show unacceptability towards asafetida, saffron, and garlic.

Over to You Childbirth and lactation are important phases for a mother and it is best to be extra cautious about one’s diet to avoid adverse effects on the baby. Follow our guidelines and observe your baby carefully to understand what best suits your child.

title.rendered: Recipe: Strawberry Oats Kheer
Vitamin A Rich Foods For Kids

content.rendered:
How often have you heard parents telling their kids how rabbits don’t wear glasses because they eat carrots? Quite often, right? Well yes, vitamin A deficiency amongst kids is quite common and it has some serious effects on eye and skin health in particular. Most of the vitamin A-rich foods are found in colored vegetables and fruits like spinach, beans, capsicum, broccoli, carrots, pumpkin, papaya, etc. which kids often avoid. It is important that parents don’t give in to their nagging and instead incorporate vitamin A-rich foods in the kid’s diet.

Here is a list of 5 Vitamin A-rich foods for kids that are nutritious and tasty as well.

1. Spinach and kale crackers

An interesting way to incorporate spinach and kale into the diet is by making them into bite-sized crackers that are easy to munch on as snacks instead of unhealthy chips. Both spinach and kale are loaded with vitamin A and to best retain the nutrients it is advisable to bake or air fry instead of deep-frying them. Add in some herbs and pepper to enhance the taste.

2. Carrot walnut cake

Kids love cakes and pastry and what a great way than to have carrot as the main ingredient. Carrot cakes are very tasty and much loved by kids as well. Add in their favorite nuts and sprinkle some cinnamon too.

3. Eggs benedict

An egg is rich in vitamin A and is good for eye health. It is also loaded with nutrients like iron and zinc. Make sure not to leave out the yolk and carefully prepare it with bread as an accompaniment. Add salt, pepper, and seasonings as per taste.

4. Beet-Carrot-ginger juice

The combination is a great drink for kids and adults alike. Have it as a mid-meal and ditch carbonated beverages and processed fruit juices for it. Add a bit of lemon juice and serve with shredded ginger for garnishing. It is great for gut health too.

5. Pumpkin Pie

Pumpkin is a great source of carotene, zinc, vitamin C, amongst others which is a great ingredient for a pie as well. It goes well with winter dishes and pumpkin being naturally sweet adds a natural sweet taste to the pie. Add in your favorite spice, whipping cream, and flavor. Have it as a snack or a dessert.

Over to you Other than the tactic to convince kids to have carrots, try these delicious and nutritious recipes rich in vitamin A. Do let us know which ones your kid loved the most!

title.rendered: Easy And Instant Ways To Add Veggies To Your Kid’s Diet

content.rendered:
Probably every parent on the planet must have dealt with their kids nagging while eating veggies at some point while growing up. That is how common the issue is and while the kids are picky eaters, they are often deprived of the essential nutrients crucial for their growth and development.

Kids can be fussy but parents are a step ahead looking for ways to incorporate the most disliked veggies in the most interesting way possible. While you may run out of tips and tricks, we got your back with some interesting ideas that are easy and a quick way to include those veggies in their diet.

1. Pancake

Pancakes are a great way to include veggies like spinach, beetroot, and carrot in the batter and make colorful pancakes that are interesting to look at and eat as well. You can cut them out into different shapes with a cutter like moons, stars, bears, etc. A thinner and more flavorful version would be cheela with all the herbs and mild spices.

2. Smoothies

Smoothies can be made into endless types by a myriad combination of ingredients and are probably the best way to mix veggies. The most avoided vegetables like spinach, carrots, and beetroot can be easily camouflaged in a smoothie. It’s easy to prepare and consume at the same time. Smoothies are good breakfast and mid-meal options.

3. Dal

Dal is an essential accompaniment to Indian meals and it is a great protein source along with other vital nutrients. Increase the nutritional benefits of dal by including vegetables like lauki, spinach, carrots, and peas amongst many others. Mash it up while feeding rice and it would be a great way to feed healthy vegetables.

4. PavBhaji

Kids love tasty foods that need to look interesting as well. PavBhaji is like burgers but healthier. It is a flavorful, yummy, and perfect way to add in some pumpkin, beetroot, and beans once in a while to improve the nutritional quotient.

5. Cutlets

Cutlets are easy to prepare and are much-loved bites amongst the kids. Prepare cutlets out of beetroot, sweet potato, corn, mushroom, and other seasonal vegetables and make interesting dips along with it. You can make cutlets into various animal shapes and platter them interestingly.

Over to You All the Supermoms and Superdads looking for ways to tackle your little monsters from being too picky when it comes to veggies, try these great ideas to incorporate the most avoided veggies in the diet and watch your kids go nom-nom till the end.

title.rendered: Food For Thought- 4 Heart Healthy Fats To Add In Your Diet

content.rendered:
The heart is one of the most important organs that keep working round the clock every day to keep us alive. It pumps blood throughout our body tirelessly, supplying all the nutrients and oxygen. Hence, a heart-healthy diet is extremely important to protect the organ from many life-threatening diseases. Managing a diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean meat, and low-fat dairy is extremely beneficial for the heart. While many food groups are crucial for the heart, fats generally aren’t seen in a good light. But fats are important for many functional roles and it’s wise to know the heart-healthy fats at a glance.

  1. Fatty Fish

Omega fatty acids found in fatty fish are good for the heart and also for the brain. Mackerel, salmon, trout are good sources of omega fats. Fats contained in lean meat like fish are the good ones as compared to the saturated fats found in red meat that are harmful to the heart. Fatty fish should find its place in the staple everyday diet.

  • Avocados

Most fruits are low in fat but avocado is all about fats- the good ones! It is rich in MUFA and also antioxidants. Incorporate it in your diet often as a toast, salad, or omelet but be sure not to over-consume it.

  • Olive oil

Olive oil is a light oil with a low smoke point which makes it great as a dressing and dips, thus retaining its nutrients. It is low on saturated and harmful fats and has a good amount of monounsaturated fatty acids. It also has anti-inflammatory properties thus reducing the risk of heart diseases. Make sure not to use olive oil for deep frying as it has a low smoking point.

  • Nuts

Although nuts are the concentrated sources of fats, they are great for protecting the heart as they contain good amounts of omega fatty acids and vitamin E. They also help in reducing the bad cholesterol and maintain the levels of the good cholesterol, that is, HDL. Add almonds, walnuts, cashews, pecans, and pistachios to your diet.

Footnote It is crucial that we take good care of our heart and not burden it with unnecessary things that would put it at risk. Limit the consumption of foods high in cholesterol, saturated fats, trans fat, and sodium, and increase these fats that are good for the heart.

title.rendered: Learn The Portions- How To Portion Your Daily Fat Intake

content.rendered:
Fat has seldom been shared limelight for good reasons amongst the health community. Weight watchers, athletes, people suffering from lifestyle disorders check their fat consumption rigorously. While overconsumption of fats will lead to serious health complications, it is important to choose the right source. All fats aren’t bad, being macronutrient fats are essential for the proper functioning of all our systems. Some of the functions include:

  • Nerve transmission and brain development
  • Insulation
  • Absorption of fat-soluble vitamins like A, D, E, and K
  • Treating several conditions like Alzheimer’s
  • Source of energy
  • Protecting organs

Fats to limit:

Trans fat and saturated fats

Trans fats and saturated fats reduce the levels of good cholesterol and increase the portion of bad LDL and VLDL cholesterol. Healthy individuals should limit the consumption of these fats mostly found in processed bakery items, vanaspati, high-fat dairy items, processed meats, and margarine.

The focus should be more on:

MUFA and PUFA

These are good fats which include omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids having a beneficial effect on the body like lowering inflammation, maintaining brain health. You will find them in nuts like walnuts, almonds, and pistachios as well as seed oil of safflower, sunflower, olives, and avocados.

Tips to manage your daily fat intake

  • Limit visible fats like butter, cheese, cream and consume invisible fats
  • Swap cheese dips with hummus or chutneys.
  • Instead of too much butter, mayonnaise and cheese, use avocado, hummus, and fruits as spreads.
  • Choose lean meat and include low-fat ingredients like vegetables.
  • Adopt baking, roasting, grilling, boiling over deep-frying to minimize nutrition loss and limit fat consumption.
  • Try greek yogurts and fermented dairy products like buttermilk instead of heavy shakes and ice creams.
  • Cook with minimal oil and prefer sautéing vegetables.
  • Consume salads with olive dressing.
  • Use lemon instead of crème in various preparations.
  • Include seeds and nuts rich in omega fatty acids.
  • In case of prepared soups that need to be refrigerated, remove the hard layer of fat that forms at the top as it includes mostly concentrated fats.
  • Choose toned milk or double toned over whole milk for individuals battling heart issues.
  • Have a good amount of low-fat protein sources like tofu, beans, egg white.
  • Limit the consumption of animal fats that have a higher percentage of cholesterol.
  • Use a measuring spoon instead of pouring fat down. This will help in keeping the quantity in check. As a rule, visible fat should be limited to about the size of a thumb.
  • Increase the consumption of fiber and complex carbohydrates. It will help in the metabolism of the macronutrients better.
  • Look for the nutritional labels that mention different types of fat content and their percentage.

Over to you Understanding different types of fats and their sources is very important in making a conscious choice while planning meals. These tips to manage daily fat intake will reduce the risk of several disorders and bring you a step closer to healthy living.

Weight watchers, athletes, people suffering from lifestyle disorders check their fat consumption rigorously. title.rendered: Incorporate These Winter Foods In Your Diet To Maintain A Healthy Weight

content.rendered:
It is that time of the year of cozy mornings and bringing out your favorite scarf, sipping on a cup of hot chocolate, and sleeping a little more. With all these comes the desire to binge eat and exercising seems to be on the to-do lists but never gets done anyway. During winters people tend to gain weight and find it okay to hide the belly fat under the sweaters! However, a few months of irregularities can be hard to do away with later on. Some of them are more prominent in winters,

  • Lack of Vitamin D
  • Less water consumption
  • Lack of exercise
  • Binge eating

Winter is also the time of the year where the market is flooded with fresh, colorful fruits and vegetables. Make the most out of the seasonal gift and relish them in your diet- all the while maintaining a healthy weight.

  • Citrus Fruits

Winter brings with it the abundance of oranges, grapes, tangerines, berries to name a few. They are rich in Vitamin C and great for skin and overall metabolism. Make sure to include them every day.

  • Colorful veggies

Seasonal produce of colorful and fresh veggies is in abundance. Include green vegetables, carrots, pumpkin, and beetroot, among many others which are rich in essential vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. They will provide you with fiber and keep you in good shape.

  • Soups

Nothing eases winter better than a warm bowl of soup. Chicken soup along with vegetables is a great way to supply essential nutrients and is a healthier alternative to deeply fried items. Include spinach and tomato soups too. It will keep you full and prevent overeating during meals.

  • Dates

Dates supply a good amount of iron and are a great snack option. Instead of reaching out to a pack of chips, have some dates and nuts instead. It will healthily cater to your sugar cravings.

  • Sweet potatoes

Baked, roasted, or boiled- sweet potatoes are a great winter food. It is rich in nutrients and fiber which maintains your sugar levels and maintains your digestive health too.

  • Herbal teas

Herbal teas including spices like turmeric, cinnamon, and cardamom are extremely beneficial for winters as they are warm and also have protective properties from common cold and flu which is common during winters. They help in metabolism and in curing inflammation and infections at the same time improving digestion.

Over to you Incorporate these winter wonders into your daily diet and enjoy the season without having to worry about extra kilos. Make sure to maintain a balanced diet while relishing the seasonal produce and stay healthy throughout!

title.rendered: Maintaining Healthy Weight under Stress

content.rendered:
In recent years stress has seen a dramatic rise across all age groups. The fast and competitive life, pressure of studies, increase in screen time, and lack of proper sleep are some of the contributing factors that lead to increased stress. Along with it, the eating pattern has been affected too. People under stress often resort to binge eating unhealthy junk food and sugary items to ease their stress levels. It becomes even more difficult for individuals who are trying to lose weight if they are under stress.

To address that it is important to look into some stress-induced unhealthy habits that might be preventing you from maintaining a healthy weight.

  • Sleeping inadequate

Waking up red-eyed, tired along with a headache and just gulping down coffee first thing in the morning to make up for the insufficient sleep at night is no way to start your day. Stress leads to sleep deprivation which affects overall metabolism. It either leads to sudden weight loss or weight gain.

  • Skipping meals

Stressful lives are often accompanied by irregular eating habits like skipping meals and gulping on unhealthy fast food.

  • No time for exercise

Anxiety and stress out of responsibilities, workload, and balancing everything leaves no time for exercise. Sedentary work life too leaves no scope for exercise.

How to break the cycle of stress and attain a healthy approach?

  • The first leap of motivation

Often all you wait for is to take the first step of motivation. Set a plan for the next day the previous night and chalk out activities to prioritize your health. Start slowly by setting small goals.

  • A good night’s sleep

Make sure not to exhaust yourself and sleep at a set time. Pamper yourself with some self-care like a hot bath or spa before bedtime and relax.

  • Stay hydrated

Dehydration adds to stress and fatigue. Make sure to stay hydrated with adequate water and healthy beverages. Avoid colas and caffeine-rich drinks.

  • Mindful activities

Begin your day with relaxing yoga or meditation. Take some time off and travel to rejuvenate yourself. Join an activity club or take up a long-lost hobby.

  • Plan your diet

Do your groceries wisely. Ditch the unhealthy midnight snacks and include loads of fruits and vegetables which help in bringing down stress levels and regulating metabolism. Plan out your meals so that you don’t skip your meals. Seek the help of a nutritionist to guide you throughout.

Over to you It is important to tackle stress to follow healthy eating practices and lifestyles to maintain a healthy weight. At the same time, adopting a healthy lifestyle will help in reducing stress levels. Follow these simple tips to break the stress cycle and motivate yourself to start with small steps towards a healthy and happy life!

title.rendered: 6 Ways To Boost Your Child’s Immunity

content.rendered:
Children need extra care and love as they get accustomed to the world around them, experiencing new things every day. They are a vulnerable class of beings who often fall prey to infections and illness. Nothing is more disheartening than watching your child fall sick and suffer, be it a common cold or something more prolonged. When a child begins schooling, contagious infections are almost impossible to avoid, over more they are more than reluctant to take medicines. It is important to build strong immunity that will help fight diseases lifelong.

Here are a few simple tips to strengthen your child’s immunity and reduce the risk of infections.

1. Engage them in outdoor activities

Children living in an utterly clean and sanitized environment often don’t develop the herd immunity that one gets while playing outdoor games. Also, outdoor games provide necessary amounts of Vitamin D which is essential in building immunity.

2. Incorporate more fruits and vegetables

Fruits and vegetables especially colorful ones are rich in antioxidants and fiber which is important for the immune system. Make sure to include loads of fruits and veggies in the diet in different forms.

3. Limit gadget use and screen-time

Excessive gadgets and screen use harm brain cells and thereby immunity. It leads to a sedentary lifestyle that is not for the health of the child. It affects mental state and sleep cycle too.

4. Maintain proper sleep cycle

Having a proper sleep time and sufficient good sleep is vital for the immune system. Children require more sleep than adults so make sure they are rested well.

5. Include probiotics

Probiotics are great for gut health and for essential enzymes that stimulate and boost immunity. It enhances the body’s ability to fight infectious diseases. Make sure to include curd, buttermilk, and probiotic drinks in the diet.

6. Hygiene habits

Basic personal habits are essential in avoiding common infections. Inculcate washing hands before eating, brushing regularly, cleaning after visiting the loo, etc. as part of the daily curriculum. Explain the importance of cleanliness and tidiness to ward off infections.

Over to you It is important as guardians to be role models in inculcating healthy habits to kids. Having a properly balanced diet, sleep cycle, and regular outdoor activities and exercise should be taught early on for building a strong immune system as the child grows up.

excerpt.rendered: Children need extra care and love as they get accustomed to the world around them, experiencing new things every day. They are a vulnerable class of beings who often fall … Continue reading 6 Ways To Boost Your Child’s Immunity

title.rendered: 4 Ways You Can Manage Dental Care Of Your Child

content.rendered:
Oral hygiene is one of the most important aspects of a child’s health which often gets neglected. Children with dental problems are far more common as they indulge in candies, chocolates, and everything sweet! Well, you can’t blame them, we all love candies as a kid, is it not? However, without timely care, it can lead to severe plaques, cavities, and gum problems. But worry not, they can relish the delicacies while maintaining good oral hygiene and care by following these simple tips!

  1. Inculcate early on

It’s important to make kids understand the importance of regular brushing and encourage them to take it up as a habit. Teach them the right way and for sufficient time. Make sure the brush has soft bristles and is gentle. You can play a rhyme on brushing or make them watch their favorite character do it.

  • Be a role model

Children follow their parents in most of the activities and they mostly watch and learn. They love to imitate others and it is the right opportunity to inculcate good values. As parents, you can show them oral hygiene practices and may take them up as a family ritual to brush together. Make it a fun activity so that they don’t feel it’s a compulsion.

  • Limit certain foods

It’s hard to restrain kids from having their favorite candy but make sure not to provide excessive sticky and sugary items especially gummy candy, roll-ups, and candy floss. They stick to the enamel and erode it if not properly washed. Make sure to rinse their mouth after having such foods.

  • Regular check-up

Parents often wait for an issue like plaque, cavity, or pain to occur to visit a dentist, however, it is recommended that one visits a dentist for a regular checkup once or twice a year at the least. A regular checkup can help in detecting dental and gum problems early on and thus reduce complications.

Over to You Make sure your kids take good care of their teeth-be it the milk teeth or the permanent ones and you as role models inculcate it into their everyday lifestyle. Early oral health intervention as a part of a routine is very important to maintain strong and healthy teeth lifelong.
