title.rendered: Healthy Weight at Every Size

content.rendered:
Every day we are bombarded with myths, fads, and trends disguised as information. It often gets confusing for readers amongst all of it which is viable and which isn’t. The diet trends are fast-changing and seldom impactful. Most of the trends are focused on the strict regime and short-term results which are not only baseless in the long run but also harmful. One must be careful about the source the information comes from and look for something lifelong and not a fad.

Sustainability is the way forward

Behavioral change for someone who has been accustomed to an unhealthy way of living is difficult but not impossible. But the main focus should be on understanding the fact that sustainable and healthy weight is the way forward. No matter how much you starve today to fit into your favorite dress, your body will have to repent more than that. Temporarily fixed weight as per short-term needs is hugely burdensome to the body.

A sustainable and healthy approach to weight needs to start early. While the entire beauty industry sets the standard for what’s normal, a real-life scenario isn’t likewise. One needs to understand that irrespective of what and how much you consume, you have a body type that may be different from someone similar to you. The sustainable approach does not restrict or indulge you, rather it is a lifelong habit that begins with a positive approach towards weight.

Relationship with Food

Food should be enjoyed. It should nourish and protect you. It should not make you feel less or insufficient. A positive body image and accepting that it needs care and not torture is very important. Let the force come from within and guide you towards simple changes like practicing yoga, going for a walk, cutting down on foods you know will be harmful in the long run, controlling portion sizes, staying hydrated, and indulging more in your cultural cuisines and diverse local produce.

Over to you

Understand that good things take time and the sooner you begin to accept the fact that you need to see your actions from the perspective of a sustainable and long-term impact, the better it is. Your body has its own tune to adapt to things and unhealthy habits are often easy to adapt to and tough to leave. Love yourself and accept yourself for who you are and now how much you weigh. Healthy weight week is observed since January 1994 on every third full week of January. The next healthy weight week begins on Sunday, January 16th, 2022. So, start preparing the list of things you would do to bring a long-term health impact and love your body a little better!

title.rendered: 5 Snack Ideas For Weight Gain

content.rendered:
The market is flooded with unhealthy products that lead to weight gain and obesity, meanwhile, the internet is popping up with weight loss techniques and recipes. In the midst of it all, gaining and maintaining a healthy weight often gets lost. Weight gain might seem easy, by indulging in junk and fast food we see all around but it will only result in poorer health and a host of other lifestyle disorders and underlying health complications. Gaining weight uniformly and not just in the belly, is important. It is dependent on all the healthy calories, good fats, and complex carbohydrates from sources that best suit your health. A sustainable approach to weight gain is essential which will not only improve your outlook but also improve the quality of life. 

No, don’t reach out for a pack of deep-fried chips just because you can! Instead, here are some amazing snack ideas for all the souls looking for a healthy weight gain.

  1. Roasted pulses and chat

Roasted pulses like kidney beans, chickpeas, horse gram, and moong are great snack options loaded with healthy calories, fiber, and protein. Add roasted peanuts too and pair it with a chat prepared with tomatoes, onions, cucumber, puffed rice, coconut slices, Indian spices, and lemon.

  • Nuts and seed trail mix

Trail mix prepared out of nuts like almonds, walnuts, pistachios, pecans, cashews, and peanuts paired with seeds like pumpkin seeds, watermelon seeds, flax, and chia seeds tastes amazing as a nutty evening affair. Add in dry fruits like dates, dried cranberries, apricots, figs to enhance taste and nutritional quotient. This trail is rich in antioxidants, omega fatty acids, minerals like zinc, manganese and is low in sodium.

  • Baked fish chips with avocado dip

Add healthy fats to your diet with this snack recipe made out of baked fish chips which are loaded with omega fatty acids and avocado is a great source of healthy fats. Over more, this is a super filling dish rich in aroma and herbs. Make your avocado dip ultra-creamy and flavorful by adding garlic, lime juice, and chili flakes.

  • Sweet potato salad

Sweet potato is a great salad option rich in good carbs and minerals. Add in spinach, celery, or kale along with walnuts, almonds, and flax seeds for all the healthy fats and minerals.

  • Sago Upma

Sabudana or sago is a great fasting option as it keeps you full and is super healthy. Prepare sago upma with roasted peanuts, coconuts, pulses, Indian spices, and condiments. It is a tasty as well as a healthy snack option.

Over to You Stop yourself from indulging in unhealthy junk foods for the sake of gaining weight guiltless and instead reach out to these amazing snack ideas that are loaded with healthy fats and good calories and can be easily prepared at home!

title.rendered: Fact v/s Fiction: Skipping Breakfast helps in losing Weight

content.rendered:
Weight loss strategies are plenty, amongst them are the views surrounding the first meal of the day- the Breakfast. Some say skipping breakfast is the key to weight loss, others prefer having only liquid in the morning. Some add green tea as the magic portion, others prefer to have breakfast like a prince! The overload of information around it can make you suffer from nutritional deficiency. So it is important to segregate fact and fiction and make wise choices before adopting a weight-loss strategy.

We break down certain myths and help you take a step towards healthy weight management in the long run.

Myth 1

Skipping breakfast aids in weight loss

Sure it does, but the weight loss is starvation. In the long run, skipping breakfast will lead to severe nutritional deficiency and malnutrition. After a fasting state during the night’s sleep, it is important to break the fast with a well-balanced breakfast. A properly planned breakfast can lead to proper weight management too, you don’t need to deprive your body of food. A healthy breakfast is essential as it supplies essential nutrients to the body and energy to get you through the day. It helps in proper brain functioning and enhances concentration and thereby productivity. Make sure to include a good amount of fiber and vitamin-rich foods in the morning, they would help in managing your weight better. Add healthy smoothies, oatmeal as delicious breakfast bowls!

Myth 2

Green tea in the morning burns fats

This is probably one of the most believed myths that have no scientific reasoning. Green tea is great for the body no doubt as it has antioxidants and phytochemicals, but it has no role in burning fats. It is better than regular tea as it has retained the nutrients but it is rich in caffeine too. Also, it has anti-nutritional factors in it so if paired with breakfast it hinders absorption of other nutrients. Green tea sure can boost metabolism but has no significant effect on weight loss.

Myth 3

Instead of cooked foods, one must consume only raw foods in the morning for weight loss

Many believe that raw foods are more nutritious and healthy and have a great role in weight loss. Although fruits are best when eaten raw over prepared dishes, not all food groups can be eaten raw. Cooked foods are great and easy to digest, it breaks anti-nutrient factors. It gets absorbed in the body easily. Also, cooking foods combines various ingredients which increases the nutritional quotient. The addition of herbs and spices increases metabolism as well as the sensory attributes of foods. Of course, the type of cooking matters as deep-frying surely won’t help, but boiling, grilling, roasting, and baking would!

Footnote Losing weight in a healthy way is very crucial for the proper functioning of all systems. It is important to know what can harm your body in the long run and to stay away from such strategies. But surely, breakfast can be your best friend in the journey of weight loss when planned right!

title.rendered: 5 ways to Stay Healthy, Energized and Fit this Winter Season!

content.rendered:
It’s that time of the year when little extra sleep won’t hurt and a warm cup of hot chocolate is what would comfort us on a chilly evening! As winters are set to begin, it marks a host of modifications in lifestyle and habits. Nonetheless, dietary habits must change too. People are more prone to fall sick during this time of the year and binge eating is most common.

This is also the season when a sedentary lifestyle is on the rise which leads to winter weight gain. Be sure to modify your habits with the change in season to stay fit, healthy, and energized by following these simple tips.

1. Go colorful, seasonal, and local

Winter means markets filled with local produce that are so varied and colorful that you won’t run out of recipes. Switch to local and fresh produce of fruits and vegetables.  Make sure to have carrots, beetroot, beans, peas, bell peppers, oranges, apples, pomegranate, kiwi, cherries, strawberries, raspberries, and the list is endless. They are rich in antioxidants and vital minerals.

2. Immunity is the key

Cough and cold are very common during winters. Make sure to have food items that boost immunity like vitamin C, Vitamin A, Vitamin E, zinc, and selenium. Have oranges, kiwi, and strawberries rich in immunity-boosting components. Herbal decoction once a day and including ginger, turmeric in the diet will help keep flu at bay!

3. Don’t neglect water

We tend to forget to drink enough water during winters due to reduced water loss as sweat. Despite not feeling thirsty, make sure to remain hydrated and drink sufficient water. Avoid carbonated and caffeinated beverages as they tend to make you thirstier. Opt for juices, soups, herbal teas, and decoctions instead.

4. Move those legs

Lack of activity and laziness is bound to happen during winters but don’t let the weather get the best of you. Follow a regular routine of exercises like walking, jogging cycling, or even playing outdoor games like badminton and tennis.

5. Check your sleep cycle

We tend to feel more sleepy during winters and the cozy blanket weather demands so. However, do check the timings as oversleep can be harmful too. Make sure not to oversleep during naps and keep doing your regular activities to avoid getting into a sedentary lifestyle. A sound night’s sleep is very vital for proper metabolism and renewing energy.

What’s next? Bring out your winter clothes, picnic plans and to-do recipes with all the fresh winter produce that nature has to offer while keeping these 5 points in mind to thoroughly enjoy while remaining fit and healthy!

title.rendered: Recipe: Exotic Stir-Fry Vegetables

content.rendered:
This simple recipe of Exotic Stir-Fry Vegetables is a quick way to add essential nutrients to your diet. Seasonal and colorful vegetables used in the recipe are loaded with phytonutrients that promote good health and well-being.

Nutritional benefits:

Broccoli, cabbage, and bell peppers are great sources of vitamin C, K, and folate. Carrots are great for beta-carotene essential for eye health along with providing fiber. Mushrooms are a good source of Vitamin D, potassium, and magnesium. The colorful pigments supply antioxidants and phytonutrients essential in various body processes.

Ingredients:

  • 20g broccoli
  • 20g onions
  • 20g carrots
  • 20g mushrooms
  • 10g cabbage
  • 20g zucchini
  • 20g bell peppers
  • 15g baby corn
  • 2-3 green chilies
  • 1 tbsp. Cooking oil
  • Salt and pepper as per taste

Procedure

1. Wash all the vegetables properly and chop them as per desired sizes.

2. Then in a wok heat olive oil and add all the vegetables.

3.Stir fry the vegetables until done. Add salt as per taste

4. Remove from flame, sprinkle pepper, and seasonings of your choice. Serve.

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to You Add color to your diet with these fresh, seasonal and colorful vegetables prepared with minimal oil to retain its nutrients. It is a great accompaniment to rice, chapatti and breads.

title.rendered: Are You Looking For Some Healthy Beauty Changes? Here Are Some That Can Make A Big Difference

content.rendered:
Tired of the same, old, stressful routine and looking for some rejuvenation? Nothing better than pampering oneself with a dose of self-care. While tackling so many responsibilities and chores, we often neglect our skin and its care. Make-up sure can cover up but what skin needs is some care for a healthy, radiant, and supple outlook. Running to the beauty parlor every time might not be feasible. So, here we are listing down steps towards healthy skin that are easy to follow and can be easily part of daily routine!

Small routines make big differences

  • Clean-up

Cleaning skin properly is very essential for healthy skin. It removes dirt, grease accumulated in pores and reduces the chance of developing pimples and acne. Choose a milk cleanser that suits your skin type best. Once a week go for homemade ubtan that is very effective in having clear skin. Use sandalwood, milk, besan, turmeric as it suits the skin.

  • Add Vitamin C

Vitamin C is an essential component for the formation of collagen and maintaining the elasticity of the skin. Along with consuming Vitamin C-rich fruits, apply some like tomato, papaya to the skin as well. Make sure not to apply lemon juice as it’s too acidic. Use Aloe Vera gel as a face mask and watch your skin brighten.

  • Exfoliate

Building up of dead skin and debris makes our skin dull and lifeless. In order to remove them make sure to exfoliate once or twice a week as per your skin type. Exfoliating also helps in increasing blood flow and makes your skin smooth and shiny. Be sure not to overdo it as it will harm your skin. You can use natural exfoliators like coffee and honey and wash them off gently.

  • Moisturize

An important stem not to be missed as the skin needs to retain its suppleness by applying adequate moisturizer. Choose moisturizer as per your skin type and weather. During summers opt for light moisturizers and winters try creamy ones. It will nourish your skin and prevent skin from breaking. Try a homemade moisturizer by adding aloe vera gel or vitamin E and coconut oil. Many use milk as a natural moisturizer too.

  • Night care

Lastly, not to forget the important step most people often neglect- Night care! Nighttime during sleep is the most vital time for skin to restore its goodness. Hence, it is extremely important to take care of skin at night. Make sure to remove all makeup before bedtime and apply a good night cream. Apply face mask at night once a week followed by adequate moisturizer.

What’s next? Don’t forget to stay hydrated and have a sound sleep along with eating plenty of fruits and veggies for all the mentioned beauty routines to have optimum effect on your skin and get radiant, healthy, and nourished skin all year round!

While tackling so many responsibilities and chores, we … Continue reading Are You Looking For Some Healthy Beauty Changes? Here Are Some That Can Make A Big Difference

title.rendered: Recipe: Baked Eggs with Roasted Vegetables

content.rendered:
As much as it is important what and how much you consume a food item, it is equally important how you prepare it. A potato can be healthy if it’s baked, the same potato can be very unhealthy if it’s deep-fried and consumed as French fries or chips! Bring a twist to your regular egg preparation and have it our way- Baked and with loads of healthy, roasted vegetables!

An egg is a good source of protein in a diet along with many nutrients. When paired with veggies, it serves as a great meal accompaniment or a snack in itself. Also, get your kids to have those veggies by following this simple, healthy, and attractive recipe!

Nutritional benefits:

Egg supplies a good amount of protein and amino acids along with some vital nutrients. Fresh veggies like Broccoli supplies a good amount of fiber, Vitamin C, Vitamin A, and phytonutrients for various body processes. Sweet potatoes are great for the vision and digestive system and are loaded with minerals like magnesium and potassium. The preparation followed in the recipe ensures optimum retention of nutrients and is a healthier alternative.

Ingredients:

  • 1 egg
  • 25 gram Broccoli florets
  • 15 gram sweet potato
  • 10 gram potato
  • 15 gram onions
  • 1/2 tbsp. olive oil
  • Salt and pepper as per taste

Procedure

1. Pre-heat the oven at 200 degrees and coat the baking tray with some cooking spray.

2. In a bowl add the broccoli, onions, potatoes, and sweet potatoes. Add a bit of salt.

3. Place the mixture on the tray and spread it evenly. Roast for about 10-15 min or until they start browning. Make sure not to burn them.

4. Allow them to come to room temperature and chill in the refrigerator for a day. Remove from the refrigerator and bring it to room temperature.

5. Coat with olive oil and bake again for 5 minutes in the oven.

6. Prepare well like shape in the vegetable mixture and break an egg upon it. Bake the entire thing for 5 minutes until yolk starts thickening up.

7. Sprinkle little salt and pepper and it’s ready to be served!

Nutritional info per serving:

Over to you Choose this healthy preparation of eggs and veggies over fried and unhealthy options. It is a great breakfast and snack option as well as an accompaniment to meals. What’s more? It retains an optimum amount of nutrients and its attractiveness is appealing to kids!

title.rendered: The Perfect Pre-Flight Meal Plan

content.rendered:
Reality check of your flight journey with wailing babies, cramped leg space, annoying neighbor, and on top of it a disgusting in-flight meal is nowhere close to what one gets to see in movies and advertisements. Many people suffer from bloating and poor digestive health during a flight and it’s worse if the journey is long. That’s no way to land on your important meeting or a much-awaited trip.

While you can’t often control the external environment, you can easily maintain your internal system so that you have sound travel no matter how long it is. Make sure to follow our tips for the pre-flight meal for a pleasant experience.

Do’s

  • Hydrate with herbs

Along with your regular water have an herbal infusion which is great to maintain the digestive system. Have mint lemonade, floral or herbal teas instead of caffeinated and cola beverages.

  • Fruity yogurt won’t hurt

Yogurt is great for the gut we all know that. It is even great when paired with fruits and berries. It is a light pre-flight snack or a post-lunch dessert that maintains your gut and prevents flatulence. Also, it tastes great!

  • Fill with protein that’s lean

Avoid heavy foods rich in unhealthy fats and oils. Instead, restore to lean meat that keeps you full without making you sick. Have it steamed, baked, or grilled for better nutrients.

Don’ts

  • No to sodium

Refrain from consuming sodium-rich foods like fried foods, pizza, French fries, etc. They are super unhealthy and result in water retention and a bloated feeling.

  • Cheesy ain’t good

Cheesy foods can make you greasy inside which will disrupt your digestion process and may even lead to vomiting. It’s better to keep your stomach light before a flight.

  • Say no to Colas

Carbonated beverages like colas are dehydrating and make your stomach and gastric issues rise. Say no to colas before a flight.

Endnote Have a light meal or snack before a flight. Having a heavy meal rich in greasy food and unhealthy fats will worsen your digestive health and make your journey uncomfortable. Make sure to visit the loo before a flight. Grab those tips and have a pleasant trip!

title.rendered: Why Can’t Kids Top Eating Junk?

content.rendered:
It’s a nightmare of every parent to give in to the nagging of their kids for junk foods, and what’s worse is if parents indulge in junk food regularly too! The entire food industry is focused on the business at the cost of human health and especially targeting children because they are easy to attract. Every day shelves are bombarded with new products, new varieties, and new flavors of junk foods. They are attractive, tasty convenient, and often cheaper than healthier options. But in the long run, they come with the added cost of ill-health and disorders.

This trend of junk foods has given rise to obesity remarkably among adults as well as children. Children often learn from their parents and if they can’t inculcate the good habits, they definitely pick on the bad ones. Junk foods are bad for a number of reasons. They are,

  • High in unhealthy and empty calories
  • High in salt content
  • High in sugar content
  • High in unhealthy fats
  • Addictive
  • Low in satiety

Despite the red flags, we often indulge in junk foods once in a while. Although we can control our urges and make constructive decisions, children are often unaware and naïve about the consequences of consuming them. Before finding ways to stop or control, it is essential to understand the reasons why children cannot stop indulging in it.

  • Fast-paced life

With both working parents on the rise and a fast pace life along with it, outside food is more common and readily available than cooking at home. It is easy to pace nagging kids with a pack of chips or a bar of chocolate than resorting to healthier alternatives.

  • Addictive

Truth be told, junk foods are addictive. Often they don’t fill your stomach but bring in a feel-good feeling. It results in over-indulgence and results in a host of health complications. They are high in salt and sugar along with artificial flavors which make them addictive.

  • Monotonous food

Children are often picky eaters and they avoid home-cooked food which they find boring and monotonous. Eating healthy and the way of life is boring for them and hence they grab on bites of junk food which tastes better and looks appealing.

  • Peer pressure

Often kids influence kids into bad habits by choosing unhealthy alternatives. They are not mature enough to take wise steps hence fall prey to peer pressure and bullying easily.

  • Attractive Ads

Appealing and attractive ads on TV and social media are targeted towards children. They end up demanding unhealthy junk food that gets newly launched and is adamant enough for parents to give in.

Endnote While it’s important to find solutions, it is equally crucial to understand the cause behind such poor eating habits of the children. Take time and analyze the physiological and psychological aspects of kids indulging in junk to take definite steps to curb it.

excerpt.rendered: It’s a nightmare of every parent to give in to the nagging of their kids for junk foods, and what’s worse is if parents indulge in junk food regularly too! … Continue reading Why Can’t Kids Top Eating Junk?

title.rendered: Feeding Right From The Start To Prevent Growth And Development Disorders

content.rendered:
A wholesome and healthy diet goes hand in hand with child growth and development. It is vital to pay attention to the health of the children right from the start to avoid the development of future complications and lifestyle disorders. Since the years right after birth till adolescence is a period of growth and development both mentally and physically, it is important to pay attention to the essential nutrients required for it.

Right from poor intellectual health to hormonal imbalances and growth delays, problems concerning children are plentiful. Many often, issues go undetected before it’s too late to reverse. Here are a few key points to take care of while focusing on your child’s nutrition.

  • Calorie intake

The metabolism of a growing child is quite high and it is different for different age groups of children. Make sure to increase the energy intake of your child as per age and body composition as they tend to grow very fast. Don’t include junk food in the name of calories.

  • Macronutrients

Carbohydrates, protein, fats along with water and fiber need to be increased for the proper functioning of all systems. Look for healthier alternatives like complex carbohydrates, lean meat, and healthy fats instead of harmful ones.

  • Iron-rich diet

Iron is crucial for proper hemoglobin formation, blot clotting, and various functions of the circulatory system. Improper iron intake can result in decreased absorption of nutrients and oxygen to cells. Include vegetables, eggs, and fortified cereals in the diet.

  • Calcium and Vitamin D

Calcium and vitamin D is crucial for bone health and development thus affecting overall growth. Have adequate milk and milk products along with green leafy vegetables every day. It is essential to pair it with adequate outdoor activities, enough sunshine, and supplements if required.

  • Zinc and folate

Zinc and folate are essential for proper brain health and a healthy nervous system. Include seafood and vegetables in your diet. It helps in building memory and developing cognitive health.

  • Vitamin A

Children tend to avoid vegetables, especially green ones. It can lead to vision issues early on. Try to find innovative ways to include greens in your diet like spinach, capsicum, coriander, broccoli, and other green vegetables for adequate vitamin A crucial for eye health.

Endnote Children are often fussy eaters and it may affect their growth and development. Find innovative ways to include these nutrient-rich foods and pay close attention to your child’s needs as it varies from child to children in various age groups.

excerpt.rendered: A wholesome and healthy diet goes hand in hand with child growth and development. It is vital to pay attention to the health of the children right from the start … Continue reading Feeding Right From The Start To Prevent Growth And Development Disorders

title.rendered: Feeding Smart From The Start To Prevent Neurological Glitches

content.rendered:
One of the most important parts of the human body, the brain, controls almost all functions of the body. Its health is very important for the proper functioning of the entire system. A single glitch in brain functioning can affect multiple body processes and manifest in terms of physiological and psychological malfunctioning.

While most of the aspect of brain health is developed as a fetus, it is essential to focus on brain health since the start to avoid the future manifestation of issues from developing. Neurological disorders are a broad term and have various causes, complications, and symptoms.

The pediatric population manifests many neurological defects and disorders including autism, cerebral palsy, brain injury, etc. Hence careful diet and adequate nutrients are important for both a pregnant mother as well as children in their early years. Following are some nutrients that need more attention:

  • Omega fatty acids

PUFA and MUFA including omega 3 and 6 fatty acids are vital for brain health. It is essential for cognitive development, memory, and proper neurological transmission. They are found in fish oils, walnuts, almonds, chia seeds, and flax seeds to name a few.

  • Zinc

Zinc is essential for spinal development and avoiding neurological tube defects and stillbirths. Include a good amount of seafood including shellfish, oysters along with vegetables.

  • Folate

Folate and folic acid are crucial for brain health. It is an important nutrient in several neurotransmission processes. Include a good amount of green vegetables, chickpeas, and nuts in your diet.

  • Vitamin B12

It helps in repairing nerve damage and maintaining healthy tissues. Its deficiency can affect the system largely. Make sure to include meat, liver, eggs, and dairy in your diet.

  • Vitamin K

Vitamin K is rarely found in diet but is very important for various brain functions. It is essential in blood clotting processes too. Include vegetables, mushrooms, and Alfa Alfa in your diet.

  • Choline

Choline is found in eggs, peanuts, and spinach. It is essential for the release of acetylcholine which carries signals in the brain and is important for its proper functioning.

Endnote Diet focused on brain health is crucial for a healthy fetus and a healthy growing baby. It is essential to include these vital nutrients as early as possible to avoid future complications. Make sure right from a pregnant mother to the growing child, these nutrients find their place on the plates.

title.rendered: Debunking Top 5 Myths of Breastfeeding

content.rendered:
Information is plentiful surrounding breastfeeding along with hosts of myths which is bound to make a mother, especially a new mother gravely confused and anxious. There are several contradictions in matters concerning the lactation phase and breastfeeding over the internet, word of mouth, and various print media. Here we bring you certain myths and debunk them to bring clarity and ease out your journey of breastfeeding your newborn.

Myth 1

You must eat bland food during breastfeeding

Myth Busted: Foods take time to be digested and broken down. Ginger, garlic, and other flavorful spices in the diet won’t affect the quality of milk. It is essential to add herbs and spices to the diet but in moderate amounts. Some items might be having allergic components and it’s best advised to avoid colorants and additives but a bland diet is not at all recommended during breastfeeding. Keep a food diary and see how the baby reacts after you consume certain ingredients.

Myth 2

You need to feed every 2 hours round the clock for sufficient food for baby

Myth Busted: requirements of babies vary and so does the lactation of mothers. Most newborns need to be fed every two hours, however, rather than focusing on the clock, focus on the instinct and response of the baby. If you are worried about the baby not consuming enough, keep a track of dirty diapers and the weight of the baby. Consult a pediatrician to diagnose your baby better.

Myth 3

If you are sick, you must not breastfeed

Myth Busted: The situation varies with the type of illness. Most mothers can breastfeed during a mild illness, however, in case of heavy medications and drugs, chances are residues might travel to babies so it’s best to consult your doctor on the nature of your illness. Other than that antibodies created in the mother’s body benefit the babies.

Myth 4

Medications need to be avoided during breastfeeding

Myth Busted: It is important to convey to your doctor that you are a breastfeeding mother so that doctor can adjust the type of medications and dosage accordingly. Doctors can also guide according to the type of medication if it’s suitable for breastfeeding and adjust the timings. Also, it is possible to pump milk beforehand and take the medicines.

Myth 5

You have to “Pump and Dump” after you drink alcohol

Myth Busted: As a responsible mother, it is best to avoid alcohol during breastfeeding to avoid any adverse effects on the baby. If at all one feels consuming alcohol, it is better to wait 6 months of exclusive breastfeeding duration and also check on the quantity of alcohol. Wait for at least 3 hours before feeding again after alcohol consumption or you may as well pump milk for the baby prior. However, make sure to not waste quality milk production and put the baby’s health at risk.

Endnote Don’t fall under the gigantic pile of myths and misconceptions instead make sure to make an informed choice and be aware of scientific reasoning. Try consulting your doctor and nutritionist to cater to your personalized issue.

excerpt.rendered: Information is plentiful surrounding breastfeeding along with hosts of myths which is bound to make a mother, especially a new mother gravely confused and anxious. There are several contradictions in … Continue reading Debunking Top 5 Myths of Breastfeeding

title.rendered: How Lactating Mothers Can Take Care of their Nutrition

content.rendered:
Childbirth and rearing a newborn is a roller coaster ride for a new mother. Often breastfeeding mothers juggle a lot of things together, be it work-life, responsibilities at home, and the added attention of a newborn which includes a lot many tasks. Mothers often lack sufficient sleep and energy while handling all the responsibilities and meals are often in jeopardy!

However, it is very crucial for lactating mothers to pay close attention to nutrition and diet so that sufficient nutrients are available for both the mother and the baby. It is as much important to take of oneself as the baby since the baby derives the nutrients through breast milk and the mother needs an increased amount of certain nutrients to replenish the stored reserves and for proper breast milk production.

Tips and guidelines for the nutrition of lactating mothers and their babies:

  • Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water along with healthy drinks like buttermilk, juices, smoothies, and shakes, etc. Refrain from consuming alcohol, carbonated beverages, and caffeinated drinks.
  • Include good amounts of whole grains, millets like ragi, jowar, bajra, amaranth, and include oatmeal once in a while. Restrict too much consumption of refined cereals.
  • Eat sufficient amounts of vegetables, including leafy greens and yellow vegetables like pumpkin.
  • Include at least two whole fruits per day. They are rich in antioxidants and phytochemicals.
  • Increase your consumption of zinc and iron. Check for your hemoglobin levels and if you are following a vegetarian diet, make sure to include Vitamin B12 supplements, after consulting with your doctor.

Essential nutrients that need to be focused on:

  1. Carbohydrate

Increase the consumption of complex carbohydrates to meet the increased energy requirements during the lactation phase. Incorporate whole grains and cereals, fiber-rich vegetables, and a good amount of fruits.

  • Protein

Proteins including essential amino acids are essential for lactating mothers. Increase the amount of protein by consuming good amounts of pulses, lentils, beans, eggs, and lean meat.

  • Iron

Iron requirements are highest during lactation to build good reserves for the baby as well as to replenish the mother’s reserves. It is essential to avoid anemia and fatigue.

  • Calcium

Essential for milk production, calcium should be taken plentifully. Have a good amount of milk and dairy products, green vegetables, and sesame seeds.

  • Zinc and folic acid

Zinc and folic acid are crucial for a baby’s brain development and maintaining the spinal cord. Continue focusing on these nutrients by including lots of nuts, seeds, and fruits.

Endnote Because of the increased requirement of nutrients for producing milk for the baby, adequate attention needs to be given to the mother’s diet. Take care of yourself equally as you would of your baby.

excerpt.rendered: Childbirth and rearing a newborn is a roller coaster ride for a new mother. Often breastfeeding mothers juggle a lot of things together, be it work-life, responsibilities at home, and … Continue reading How Lactating Mothers Can Take Care of their Nutrition

title.rendered: Feeding Smart From The Start To Prevent Vision Problems

content.rendered:
The eye is one of the most important organs in our body and it helps us to see this beautiful world. Eye health if neglected early on can result in various vision-related problems which are incurable. Children who lack proper diet and essential nutrients during the initial years show eye issues and it is fairly common among kids. Hence feeding smart from the start can help in preventing vision-related problems largely.

A healthy diet rich in antioxidants is very essential for kids. Children tend to be picky eaters, avoiding healthy green and nutritious vegetables and fruits and such behavior must be dealt with carefully. Parents must take care that kids are provided with essential nutrients that help in maintaining vision and eye health. Here is a list of foods rich in goodness to keep eye problems at bay!

  • Green vegetables

Green vegetables especially the leafy ones are rich in chlorophyll and helps in the synthesis of Vitamin A in form of retinol which directly maintains eye health. Include loads of spinach, kale, amaranth, and local saags. Have a diet rich in green vegetables like beans, capsicum, and gourds.

  • Eggs

Eggs contain a good amount of vitamin A, zinc, iron, and other essential elements. It helps in maintaining eye health and block harmful blue rays damaging the retina. Make sure to include the yolk in your diet and the best possible to consume egg is by having it boiled.

  • Orange and yellow fruits and vegetables

Orange and yellow-colored fruits and vegetables like pumpkin, carrots, mangoes and papaya contain a pigment called carotene which is great for vision. It is essential to prevent night blindness, cataracts, and more serious eye problems. Have them every day in the diet in raw, boiled, or juice form.

  • Fish

Fish is a great source of vitamin E and omega fatty acids which are essential to maintain eye integrity. Iron helps in proper blood circulation to the eyes and prevents them from getting pale. Have fish liver oil which is an excellent source of vitamin C.

  • Milk

Milk contains complete nutrients which help in maintaining eye health. Iron, calcium, magnesium, vitamin A provides loads of benefits. It helps to maintain the neural circuit responsible for proper vision.

  • Nuts and seeds

Nuts like almonds, walnuts, peanuts, and seeds like sunflower, pumpkin, chia, and flax seeds are loaded with vitamin E and omega fatty acids which are essential for eye and brain health. The eye is interconnected with the brain for all the transmission of optic nerve impulses hence proper maintenance of it is essential.

Endnote Be sure to have enough water and prevent your eyes from getting dry. Avoid polluted areas and dust along with limiting screen time. Have adequate sleep and include these beneficial food items in your diet for maintaining your eye health.

excerpt.rendered: The eye is one of the most important organs in our body and it helps us to see this beautiful world. Eye health if neglected early on can result in … Continue reading Feeding Smart From The Start To Prevent Vision Problems

title.rendered: Obese Child: A Parental Neglect?

content.rendered:
In our society being fat and well-built is perceived as something healthy and that you are fed well and on the other hand being lean or thin is considered underfed and undernourished. The line that divides the perception of being healthy and obese is often fine and blurred. New to the bandwagon are the rising cases of childhood obesity. Parents and relatives tend to overfeed children with the notion that it’s good to be fed more. But does it get too late before they realize they turn kids obese instead?

Childhood obesity is rising remarkably and many factors are leading to it. Obese children are the ones whose BMI is on the higher side above the normal and weight is more compared to height and age. Childhood obesity often leads to various health complications and it is extremely important to track the real cause of it.

Is it parental neglect?

Many children are genetically predisposed to be obese if the genes run in the family and the situation is not tackled early on. Others turn obese due to various lifestyle choices and the surroundings one grows up in. Data shows childhood obesity is largely prevalent in urban cities with easy access to junk foods, a fast-paced lifestyle, and poor daily habits. Often working parents don’t pay enough attention to diet and prefer outside food over home-cooked ones. Children are heavily attracted to the junk foods targeted at them and parents often comply with their nagging. On top of it, if parents themselves lack discipline and indulges in an unhealthy lifestyle, children are bound to see and follow that. Children often hide from their parents and consume unhealthy fast food if they are prevented from consuming them.

With a lack of playtime and outdoor games, having a sedentary lifestyle with increased screen time, children are bound to develop obesity early on. Parents fail to inculcate healthy values in children and refuse to acknowledge the problem of obesity by objecting with the excuse of body positivity.

How to tackle childhood obesity?

It’s never too late to realize the root issue and take preventive and corrective actions to tackle it. Here are some pointers,

  • Consume home-cooked meals
  • Check portion control and teach children to understand their appetite and to respect that
  • Avoid overfeeding
  • Include simple healthy choices
  • Make them play outdoors
  • Check their screen time
  • Keep distractions away during eating
  • Let them contribute in the kitchen
  • Explain the downsides of processed and packed junk foods
  • Exercise together
  • Keep healthy snacks handy

Endnote It is important to tackle childhood obesity early on to avoid future complications of serious health issues. It is never too late to inculcate a healthy lifestyle. Do consult a doctor to diagnose any associated health complications.

title.rendered: Recipe- Spinach And Lentil Blend

content.rendered:
Increase the nutritional quotient of your regular dal by adding the goodness of spinach to it. Spinach and lentil blend is a great way to incorporate greens to your diet. It is simple and easy to prepare and great way to have your kids consume greens they so determinately avoid!

Nutritional benefits:

Spinach is rich in antioxidants, calcium, phytochemicals and loads of minerals along with providing good dose of fiber. Lentils are great protein source with good amount of amino acids. By incorporating spinach to lentils, it retains its nutritional benefits to a great extent. Together with aromatic spices, it provides a host of health benefits.

Ingredients:

  • 15g lentils
  • 50g boiled spinach
  • 15g chopped onions
  • 15g chopped tomatoes
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • ¼ tsp Turmeric powder
  • ¼ tsp Coriander powder
  • Red chilli powder as preferred
  • ¼ tsp lemon juice
  • Chopped coriander leaves
  • 1 cardamom
  • Cooking oil
  • Salt and pepper as per taste

Procedure

1. Soak the lentil after washing for 30 min and drain the water.

2. In a pressure cooker, cook the dal in 2 cups of water and add salt and turmeric till 3 whistles.

3. In a pan heat oil and sauté the onions. Add tomatoes and boiled spinach followed by all the spices as per preference. Mix well for a few minutes.

4. Add the dal to it and cook together for 7-8 minutes.

5. Once done, remove from the flame and add lemon juice and garnish with chopped coriander leaves.

Nutritional info per serving:

Ending Note: Try this delicious recipe as an accompaniment to a healthy and nutritious meal. It is easy to make and great way to incorporate greens in your daily diet. Pair it up with hot rice or chapatti with a spoon of ghee and it would hit straight at your soul as a comfort food!

title.rendered: Essential Nutrients To Include In Diet To Boost Fertility Naturally In Men

content.rendered:
The topic of Fertility and childbirth is often surrounded largely around women and maternal health. In the process nutrition surrounding the fertility of men is often overlooked. Difficulty in conceiving a child can be directly associated with diet and lifestyle which impact the potency of sperm. Research shows poor dietary habits, smoking and alcoholism can lower the quality and quantity of sperm. Increase your chance of conceiving by developing good dietary habits and lifestyles.

Terminologies:

  • Reduced sperm count
  • Abnormal sperm morphology
  • Semen volume
  • Slow sperm motility

Nutritional guidelines:

Restrain from eating heavily fried junk items, smoking, and alcohol consumption. Foods rich in trans fats are directly related to lower sperm count. According to studies, a diet rich in omega fatty acids, nuts, whole grains, and vegetables are good for healthy sperm.

Nutrients that help in boosting sperm count:

  1. Zinc

Infertile men tend to have lower zinc levels compared to fertile men. Zinc helps in regulating both sperm count and quality. Include seafood, oysters in the diet along with various nuts, beans, and whole grains.

  • Vitamin E

Vitamin E is an important antioxidant that helps in maintaining the reproductive system both in men and women. It helps in protecting the sperms from damage. Consume almonds, walnuts, and plant-based oils and seeds.

  • Folic Acid

Folic acid is very vital for fertility in both men and women as well as child health. Studies show men with low folic acid face difficulty in conceiving. Have adequate green leafy vegetables like spinach, asparagus, and a variety of fruits and dairy products. An egg is an important source too.

  • D-aspartic acid

This amino acid regulates the male sex hormone testosterone. Include egg, low-fat milk, oats, yogurt, and dried fruits in your diet.

  • L-arginine

This amino acid is vital for sperm functioning. However high doses can be harmful hence it’s better to consult your physician before taking supplements. Try adding a few pumpkin seeds and peanuts to your diet every day.

Endnote Start adopting a healthy lifestyle early on to avoid any future complications and when it comes to conceiving men needs to be careful as much as women do. Quit smoking and alcohol consumption and follow these nutritional guidelines. Consult your doctor for added guidance as it is never too late to seek medical advice.

title.rendered: Decoding The Link Between Cancer And Sugar Consumption

content.rendered:
Sugar may taste sweet but it isn’t a sweet treat for many. People struggling with diabetes and obesity, with a strict diet regime often have this particular food category under restriction. Is sugar just the white sugar we all know of? Certainly not! Sugar is a type of carbohydrate which is naturally found not just in sugar cane, but in all fruits as fruit sugar. White sugar is the refined byproduct of sugar cane. We can also find the sweetness of sugar in various forms like the unrefined form, brown sugar, jaggery, molasses, honey, malt, etc. Some of them are rich in minerals, fiber and holds medicinal properties.

Does any link exist between sugar and cancer?

Excessive consumption of sugar has been associated with various health hazards like

  • Obesity
  • Diabetes
  • Tooth decay
  • Dementia
  • Cardiovascular diseases
  • Kidney disorders

However, no direct link has been found that sugar consumption leads to cancer or aggravates it. The conception is that cancer cells require energy in form of glucose to survive, grow and multiply. By cutting down sugar, cancer cells won’t be able to survive. But this is untrue since all our cells require glucose to synthesis ATP as energy and our brain can only work on glucose. There is no way for the body to supply glucose to healthy cells leaving the cancer cells out. Hence, a sugar-free diet can’t practically revert or prevent cancer although high consumption is not recommended at all.

Why worry about sugar?

Sugar can be the secondary cause of cancer as its higher consumption directly affects various body functions. One must always keep it in moderation and from healthier sources. Obesity increases the chance of developing cancer as adipokines released by fat cells can damage DNA and cause tumors.

What should be done?

  • Control source

Consume complex carbs and avoid refined products. Look for white sugar substitutes and consume foods with a low glycemic index.

  • Control portion

Make sure not to overindulge in sweet items. Sweet products increase our cravings and addiction. Hence, proper balance is necessary.

  • Add more fiber

Both soluble and insoluble fibers are essential for proper metabolism, satiety control, and gut health. It regulates sugar better.

  • Stay hydrated

Hydration is very important to keep blood sugar in check and kidneys healthy. Drink adequate water and refrain from sugary, carbonated beverages.

  • Manage stress levels

Often depression, anxiety, and stress result in a craving for sweet products. It results in overeating, mostly unhealthy items. Keep your stress levels in check and engage in meditation and exercise.

Endnote While the direct association is not there between sugar and cancer but overconsumption of sugar especially refined ones is hazardous to health. Follow the mentioned guidelines and stay healthy.

title.rendered: Reciepe- Pallak Makhana

content.rendered:
The combination of the goodness of spinach and foxnuts (makhana) is sure to add an extra “oomph!” to your meals. Try this delicious recipe which is easy to prepare and an excellent accompaniment to bread and chapattis.

Nutritional benefits:

Spinach is rich in antioxidants, phytochemicals, vitamins like A, C, and K, and loads of minerals like folate, iron, manganese, and calcium along with providing a good dose of fiber. Foxnuts or makhana are great protein sources with a good amount of amino acids and fiber. This recipe is a great way to add variety to your diet along with retaining optimum nutrition.

Ingredients:

  • 50g spinach
  • 20g foxnuts
  • 15g chopped onions
  • 15g chopped tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste
  • ¼ tsp cumin seeds
  • ¼ tsp Turmeric powder
  • ¼ tsp Coriander powder
  • Red chilli powder as preferred
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 1-2 green chilies
  • Cooking oil
  • Salt and pepper as per taste

Procedure

1. In a pan heat oil and add cumin seeds, onion, ginger garlic paste, bay leaf, and green chilies.

2. Add chopped onion and tomatoes and cook till onions turn golden. Add spinach to it along with the rest of the spices. Cook until half done and blend into a fine paste.

3. In another pan add a little oil and dry roast the makhanas.

4. Roast the spinach paste with a little bit of water and bring to boil. Simmer for few minutes.

5. Add the roasted makhanas to it and stir well. Remove from flame, serve and enjoy with chapattis. You can add a spoon of ghee for added flavor.

Nutritional info per serving:

Ending Note: This recipe is a great way to incorporate greens in your diet and is loved across all age groups! Try this simple and delicious recipe for a great accompaniment to chapattis.

title.rendered: It’s Time To Rethink Food Positively

content.rendered:
In recent times, people’s perception of food has changed largely. It has transformed from something that is a source of happiness and nourishment to barely either being a necessity or something that is directly related to putting on weight. In these times when the health industry is fast evolving, one must take care that food is not being related as something negative.

One’s self-esteem and eating habits are highly related to what one perceives around. Often we hear how having a pizza is a “cheat meal” or someone even avoiding a piece of birthday cake thinking it is going to contribute to weight gain. Some people even go for feasting followed by rigorous fasting with a sense of guilt towards feasting.

Food is meant to be enjoyed, and not seen as a punishment. It is okay to indulge in favorite foods as it gives a sense of positivity and happiness. Outlook towards food can be changed positively and we list few tips for the same!

1. Distribute in different mealtime

Denying oneself of pleasure out of favorite food and then indulging should not be seen as a guilty pleasure. Often we end up consuming a lot together just to cater to the cravings we denied so long. This will suddenly burden your system. Instead proportionate it into different meal timings, like instead of finishing a sundae jar together keep some for the next day to relish.

2. Bring on a positive mindset while eating

Focus on what you are eating and avoid distractions like gadgets and television. This way you can focus and chew properly, sense the food better and eat calmly. Food is meant to be enjoyed with a positive mindset.

3. Choose better

Often tasty foods are unhealthy loaded with fats and oils. However, there is always a choice to decide better. If you like cookies, pastries, or burgers, there is no harm in having them once in a while. If you are too tense, you can try cooking yourself as it will bring a great sense of happiness.

4. Take it easy

You need not be so hard on yourself for having a piece of muffin and train tirelessly. There is no need to punish yourself for eating something you love. Once you bring in a positive outlook towards food, it will help in better functioning of the body too as our mind is very much related to everything that is going on in the body. Plan out your meals better and don’t force-feed just because you read somewhere it’s healthy.

Endnote Having a positive approach towards food is very essential. One must not be too hard on oneself, instead, go easy and enjoy the food, after all, food is meant to be loved and consumed.

title.rendered: Ways To Avoid Winter Weight Gain With 5 Simple Tips

content.rendered:
Winter brings forth many joys of life along with the warm, cozy feeling of wrapping under the blankets. The three-month hibernation kind of state brings with it woes we all want to avoid- Weight Gain. Lack of enough physical activity, binge eating, and a lazy state of mind all contribute towards putting on some extra kilos that can well be hidden under your winter wear. However, it will result in serious complications if not tackled in a healthy way rather than relying on sudden strict diets.

Following are some of the tips to prevent those extra kilos from gathering.

1. Cut down outside meals

Start cooking at home with all the fresh ingredients that the winter season has to offer rather than indulging in outside meals and takeaways now and then. Avoid binging on unhealthy junk and processed foods while binging your favorite shows. Focus on your portion size and make sure to add loads of different fruits and vegetables every day. Take proper meals on time and keep your satiety level in check.

2. Move your body

No matter how difficult it would feel to get up and exercise in winters, you need to do it. Rather than having a completely sedentary lifestyle, go for short jogging or run, freehand exercises and yoga may help too. It will keep the body warm and bring in a feel-good feeling.

3. Hydration is important

Often in winters, we drink less water because of reduced thirst. However for the body to function properly, staying hydrated is very important. Make sure to drink water timely and other healthy beverages. Keep a reminder to avoid skipping drinking of water.

4. Consume enough fiber

Fiber intake is essential for the proper metabolism of various functions and to aid in proper digestion. It will keep your hunger in control and also help in better absorption of nutrients. Add loads of seasonal vegetables and fruits to your diet which are rich in fiber and antioxidants.

5. Balance your nutrients

Due to reduced activity and body heat usage, carbohydrate consumption needs to be kept in check. Avoid indulging too much in fried products and instead have protein consumption increased. Pair it up with a good exercise pattern and it will prevent you from gathering unnecessary weight.

Endnote Indulge in the wide variety of healthy fruits and vegetables that winter has to offer, play outdoor sports, and remember to keep yourself hydrated. Follow these simple tips and keep extra kilos at bay.

title.rendered: Pro Tips for Healthy Weight Gain

content.rendered:
The narrative of the health industry has mostly surrounded weight-loss strategies and the market is flooded with products aiding in weight loss due to the increased incidents of obesity across age groups. The other end of the spectrum however lies the underweight which is equally a matter of concern. Being underweight does not necessarily result from a lack of food or inadequate food. Rather, the matter of concern is much deeper concerning absorption and utilization of nutrients.

While it’s easy to gain weight by unhealthy means, it is not feasible in the long run as they bring forth series of health complications and one might find himself in the loop of health and lifestyle disorders. We bring forward tips and strategies to gain weight in a healthy manner which will uplift the overall health of the individual. It’s important to gain weight healthily and not follow some fad and fast diets.

1. Obtain healthy Calories

Individuals with a small appetite should consume high-calorie and nutrient-dense foods which should be of a healthy origin. Try incorporating smoothies and shakes that are easy to consume, do not require much time, and are super healthy. Add bananas, full-fat yogurt, nuts, seeds, nut butter, and whole milk along with your favorite fruits. Avoid unhealthy junk and fried foods loaded with empty calories.

2. Up your fiber intake

Have foods rich in fiber and minerals which will regulate your appetite and satiety levels. They also help in increased absorption and availability of nutrients in the body. Have both soluble and insoluble fibers. Eat fruits with peels, have sprouts and salads. Include complex carbohydrates and whole grains.

3. Enough protein

Carbohydrates and protein both are essential in balanced amounts to improve weight. Eat a good amount of protein and amino acids which will help in developing muscle mass and strength. Have pulses and animal protein like eggs and meat in your diet.

4. Weight Training

It is a wrong concept that exercise and weight training is for weight loss. Specific exercise aid in weight gain too in a healthy way by regulating appetite and increasing metabolism. It also contributes to building muscle mass and strength along with strong bones.

Endnote Being underweight is not healthy. It will lead to several health complications if early intervention is not done. Follow these tips and maintain a good routine of sleep, exercise, and meal timings as they are all interrelated to metabolism.

title.rendered: Pregnancy Hygiene Tips- All You Need To Know

content.rendered:
The journey of carrying a life inside you is both challenging as well as fulfilling. It can be scary at times too, with the need of extra precautions to protect the growing child. Pregnancy brings forth a list of new responsibilities and adjustments every trimester to suit the ever-changing conditions. While taking care of both physical and mental health through diet, exercise, environment, fun activities, safety is always a priority. Thus, pregnancy demands extra care on personal hygiene to keep yourself and the baby inside safe at all times.

Apart from washing hands regularly, staying away from dirty areas, strong odors and keeping the environment clean, there are many aspects related to your body that needs to be taken care of during pregnancy.

Why should I focus on Personal Hygiene during Pregnancy?

Personal hygiene is one of the basic things that should be followed by every individual in general to remain healthy and also to prevent others from getting sick. But during pregnancy extra care on it needs to be given because any lapse can put the baby at risk too. The immunity of women lowers during pregnancy and the risk of infections are higher than ever. Pregnant women thus falls under the vulnerable category. Poor personal hygiene and neglect can put you at risk of diseases and infections and may have long-term complications on a growing child.

While it may sound scary but we have got you covered with some simple tips to take care of during pregnancy to meet your increased personal hygiene requirements.

Oral Hygiene

Taking care of dental health is vital because whatever you eat, baby eats too! Along with focusing on eating healthy, maintain teeth and gum health too by brushing twice a day regularly and flossing when required. Keep a track on plaque formation and see a dentist at the earliest if any issue arises. Also, avoid tobacco, smoking, and other harmful substances that may lead to toxicity.

Breast Care

Breasts undergo several changes during pregnancy. Adjust bra size accordingly and avoid wearing tight bras. Wear comfortable ones that are easy to breath in and of preferably cotton. Some mothers experience leaks so make sure to change bra pads when they get wet. Breasts may feel itchy and swollen so apply lotion and massage whenever required.

Hair care

Increased requirements during pregnancy for the growing child leads to certain deficiency too. Anemia being one of them. Lack of iron in particular results in increased hairfall during pregnancy. Many mothers prefer to cut hair short for easy maintenance, especially during monsoons and winters where wet hair can lead to catching cold. Use gentle shampoodevoid of harsh chemicals.

Skincare

Skin feels tender and easily reacts to extremities. Make sure to adjust the temperature of your bath water and don’t spend too much time in shower. Avoid cosmetics and products that are loaded with harsh toxins and chemicals. Wash hands regularly and sanitize whenever necessary. Avoid shaking hands or direct contact with unnecessary surfaces.

Clothing and footwear

Avoid wearing tight clothing especially at the waistline. Switch to kaftans and loose cotton clothing. Footwear needs to be clean, comfortable and balanced. Rinse washed clothes with disinfectants.

Intimate care

Pay extra attention to your intimate area to keep it clean and avoid infections. Opt for wash that are gentle and maintains the pH balance. Keep toilet seats and bathroom clean at all times. Avoid tight innerwear and wash them regularly and rinse with antiseptic liquid. While conditions of every pregnant women is different with different requirements, the aforementioned points are basic to all mothers to protect their baby in womb. For specific requirements it is better to consult your doctor and nutritionist for enhanced guidance during this important phase of your life.

title.rendered: Recipe- Nutty Rava Pongal

content.rendered:
Pongal, a specialty of South India, is much loved across the country for its authentic flavors and aroma. By replacing the main ingredient which is basically rice, with semolina or Rava in our recipe, we have given it a healthy twist. Paired with yellow lentil, aromatic spices, and nuts this recipe of Nutty RavaPongal will be your go-to option for breakfast as well as snacks!

Nutritional benefits:-

Semolina is rich in fiber, protein and vitamins like thiamine and niacin. It has a glycemic index lower than that of rice and hence is replaced in many recipes involving white rice. The crispy texture, earthy aroma brings out the essence of recipes even more. It is beneficial in managing diabetes, cholesterol and controlling weight gain.

Yellow lentil is a light, aromatic pulse, rich in proteins. It is easy to digest and helps in enhanced metabolism. Nuts used in the recipe like cashew nut and almonds are rich in omega-3- fatty acids, calcium, amongst many other nutrients.

Ingredients

  • 50g semolina
  • 25g yellow lentil (dal)
  • Chopped onions
  • 5 nos. cashews
  • 5 nos. almonds
  • 3-4 curry leaves
  • 1 tsp cumin seeds
  • 1 tsp oil
  • 1 tbsp ghee
  • Salt, turmeric, and pepper as per taste
  • Coriander leaves and lemon to garnish

Method of Preparation

  • In a pressure cooker, pressure cook the yellow lentil (dal) with a little salt, turmeric, and oil up to 2 whistles.
  • Once boiled, mash the lentil and keep it aside.
  • In a pan, roast the semolina with little ghee till it releases an aroma.
  • Heat another pan and add ghee to it. Add cumin seeds until it pops following which, add the cashews and almonds till they turn golden. Be careful not to burn them.
  • Add the curry leaves followed by salt and pepper as per taste.
  • Add about 1.5 cups of water to it. Next, add the Rava carefully so that lump formation doesn’t take place.
  • Add the cooked yellow lentil and mix well. Cook until done.
  • Garnish with coriander leaves and serve with chutney and lemon.

Nutrient info per serving:

Ending note: This quick and easy recipe is healthy and is loved across all age groups. Bring something different to your platter with this flavourful Nutty RavaPongal.

title.rendered: 5 Home Remedies To Regularize Your Menstrual Cycle

content.rendered:
A menstrual cycle is calculated from the first day of a period to the first day of the next which on average is 28 days. This number however varies from month to month and woman to woman. It is considered regular if periods happen every 21 to 35 days. Many women are distraught with irregular periods which can be a result of either underlying health conditions or lifestyle changes and hormonal imbalances.

To treat such irregularities, cause identification is very vital. Keep a check on your weight pattern, sleep cycle, and eating habits. A good way to keep track is to maintain a period journal where mentioning symptoms, flows, health conditions during periods, etc. can help in identifying the cause better. In medical terminology, Oligomenorrhea is used to define the condition of infrequent menstrual periods and is quite common amongst women. Many wish to adopt natural treatments over gulping heavy medicines which have adverse side effects.

So, here is a list of some simple home remedies that may help in regulating your periods safely without any side effects and also maintain overall health and wellbeing.

  • Yoga and meditation are the keys– Stress is one of the major factors to cause an imbalance in hormonal levels. It can mess up the system! Yoga and meditation are great ways to beat stress and to ensure the flow of all the good hormones. Take few minutes of the day and try to calm your senses with yoga and meditation.
  • Cumin can cure– Found in every household, this little spice can help in regulating irregular periods. It is said that cumin has nutrients that aid in contracting uterine muscles. In a cup of water soak 2 teaspoons of cumin overnight and drink the decoction on waking up in the morning regularly instead of caffeinated beverages.
  • Ginger has it– Gingerol present in ginger help in lowering inflammation and maintaining hormonal balance. It has many other health benefits too against a host of diseases. Include ginger in your everyday diet while cooking or simply sip tulsi ginger tea with a bit of honey.
  • Piece of pineapple a day– Pineapple has an enzyme called Bromelain which helps in easing pain, has anti-inflammatory properties. It also helps in the proper flow of blood and blood circulation.
  • Cinnamon the savior– The aromatic spice present in almost every kitchen is a holy grail loaded with health benefits. It helps in regulating hormones and blood flow to the uterus. It relieves menstrual cramps, abdominal pain, and digestive issues amongst many other health benefits. Incorporate it in delicious recipes or simply have it by adding to a glass of milk before bedtime

Many women with underlying conditions of PCOS experience irregular periods too. It is best to consult your doctor if the symptoms are too severe and the irregularities are persistent. Adjust your routine to a healthy lifestyle balancing sleep, dietary habits, and exercise.

title.rendered: 7 Ways To Manage Weight Problems In Children

content.rendered:
A drastic change in lifestyle over the recent years has contributed to the rise in weight problems in children. Parents often think that being fat as a kid is healthy and that they are nourished well, with little knowledge about the recommended requirements as per age groups. Unhealthy weight gained during childhood goes into contributing to adult obesity and with it several underlying health conditions.

The food industry is bombarded with unhealthy products that are lucrative enough to target children. Lack of physical activities, increased screen-time, sedentary lifestyle, consumption of junk food are some of the many factors that have contributed to childhood obesity. Dieting is not the only option to tackle this and hence an overall approach should be in place. Here is a list of 7 ways in which you can manage weight problems in kids before it’s too late:

1. Make Healthy Swap

Begin by replacing unhealthy snacks like fried and packaged items loaded with salt, sugar, and fats with healthy options like baked veg sticks, roasted pulses, fruit salads, yogurt, nuts, and seeds trail mixes, etc. Ensure that they consume more balanced, home-cooked foods. Unhealthy foods will only increase their cravings.

2. Keep child-sized portions

Many times parents end up overfeeding a child by making them eat adult-like portions. Every child’s requirements are different, so keep a check on the portion size. Include frequent small meals rather than few heavy meals.

3. Avoid distractions during eating

Make sure your child focuses on what they are eating and is not distracted by watching TV or gazing at phone screens. Often the child will end up eating far more or less than what is required. Make them enjoy eating and not perceive it as a duty.

4. Avoid introducing junk food

Don’t fall for marketing gimmicks targeting children to consume products like chips, carbonated drinks, chocolates, etc. Control their urges and don’t give in easily to their demands. Junk foods are loaded with trans-fat, sugar, and salt which will lead to long-term health complications.

5. Engage in physical activities

Adequate physical activity is important for proper growth, strong bones, building immunity, regulating mood, and maintaining a healthy weight. No matter how addictive video games and sedentary pass times are, make sure they are socializing and playing outdoor games.

6. Ensure adequate sleep

A night of good sleep is essential for proper metabolism and regulating appetite. Children need more restful sleep but make sure they don’t oversleep. A proper sleep cycle is also essential so make sure they aren’t up until late with recreational activities or studying.

7. Inculcate healthy decisions

Making them understand the importance of healthy habits at an early age. Good parenting techniques in inculcating healthy habits will result in behavioral change in children even when not under supervision. They would as a result control urges and not give in to peer pressures. Start managing your child’s weight early by slowly inculcating healthy practices and reversing bad ones. Consult your pediatrician and nutritionist for a customized approach to managing your child’s health.

title.rendered: Know the Difference between Sports Drinks and Energy Drinks

content.rendered:
The fitness industry is fast emerging and evolving, more so in recent times with health and fitness buffs on the rise. The market is flooded with products catering to every little thing and demand. There are multiple variations and flavors of simple things like health drinks. Many people without much knowledge of the products end up purchasing and regretting soon after. In order to know what works best for you, having the proper knowledge is very important.

Health drinks come in many forms. Market shelves are lined with energy drinks and sports drinks. While the advertisements may look tempting, they might be harming you! We address certain questions to clear confusion on the topic.

Are energy drinks healthy? Do they really provide energy?

Energy drinks are seldom healthy. They are very different from health drinks. They contain caffeine and other stimulants, along with sugar. The caffeine and other stimulants in it mimics and fools or nervous system to stay alert and energetic. They are loaded with calories too in the name of energy. If they are sugar-less, they are loaded with artificial sweeteners, colorants, and flavors.

They are not long-lasting and gives a momentary feeling of being alert and energetic which soon fades away. From a nutritional point of view, they aren’t at all favorable. In fact, the ingredients are mostly addictive. They make the body dehydrated soon after and are not good for distance running. It is also not recommended for children.

Caffeine and additives in energy drinks can be a health hazard in the long run and they do little benefit to the body. Such stimulants may give an energetic feel before a match but will soon drain you out.

Are sports drinks meant for all sportsperson?

Sports drinks are comparatively healthier as they contain carbohydrates, electrolytes, and added minerals like sodium, potassium, calcium, magnesium which are often lost in sweat. They provide instant replenishment of balanced nutrients to the body during exercise, intense workouts, or playing sports. They don’t cause GI distress as fizzy drinks do.

Sports drinks however are not for ordinary people with a moderate or sedentary lifestyle. It is designed to cater to the needs of sportsperson who engage in intense activity and games on a regular basis. Adults and children can engage in sports drinks in moderation once in a while but not regularly. The best way to stay hydrated is to drink water and fizz-free drinks.

Endnote Energy drinks are loaded with stimulants that give momentary effects whereas sports drinks are designed to cater to intense activity needs. Read product labels and make a conscious choice before buying.

title.rendered: Make Own Natural Protein Drinks at Home

content.rendered:
With exercise and intense workouts comes the need for a healthy nutrition guide. While every fitness buff has his/her own goals and requirements, Protein shakes are a must-have item on the list. Protein shakes complement well with exercise regimes and is immensely beneficial in building strong bones and muscles. A workout paired with a protein shake is the ideal starter pack for meeting your fitness goals.

Protein supplements and mixes are available in the market for ages but have gained momentum in recent years. It is no longer limited to athletes and fitness coaches but is for anyone who wants to be fit and healthy. A healthy glass of protein shake can be for anyone who seeks a dose of nutritional benefits, but it is best of course to pair with regular workouts.

Protein shakes available in the market are mostly expensive and it gets difficult to consume on a regular basis. Try out these healthy protein shake recipes that can be easily prepared at home and is low on pocket pinch too.

1. Banana Peanut Butter Shake

In a blender add 2 bananas, 2 spoons of peanut butter ( can be smooth or crunchy), 250ml of milk, ½ cup of Greek yogurt, 1 tsp of chia or flax seeds, and 2-3 nuts like almonds or walnuts. Blend them well to obtain a smooth smoothie-like texture. Add additional milk and blend again to have the desired consistency of the shake. Sprinkle few chia seeds on top and enjoy!

2. Choco Protein Shake

Who can resist a healthy chocolate protein shake! For this add 2 spoons of grated dark chocolate, 1 tbsp of cocoa powder, ½ cup Greek yogurt, 2-3 walnuts and almonds, ½ chopped apple, and 250 ml of milk in a blender. You can also include almond butter. Blend all the ingredients well till desired consistency is achieved. Garnish with nuts and chocolate and serve chilled!

3. Berry chia Protein Shake

This antioxidant-rich drink is so flavorful and healthy. Add berries like strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries in a blender. Add 1 cup Greek yogurt, 1 cup milk, 1 spoon almond nutter, 2-3 walnuts, 1 tsp chia seeds, and 1 spoon of honey. Blend all the ingredients well till a smooth smoothie-like texture is obtained. Top it with your favorite toppings like nuts and chia seeds and enjoy.

Endnote So next time you wonder how to cater to your cravings post-workout, try these amazing protein shake recipes and let your body absorb all the nutritional goodness!

title.rendered: Foods You Should Add In Your Post-Workout Diet For Fast Muscle Recovery

content.rendered:
It is not a new fact that regular exercise is essential for good health and a healthy lifestyle. Regular physical activity and fitness are essential for better lung capacity, improving stamina and strength, building immunity, better absorption of nutrients, and overall health. It aids in better oxygen circulation throughout the body and helps in lowering the risk of various ailments and lifestyle disorders like diabetes, obesity, cardiovascular diseases to name a few.

Nutrition is very important in conjunction with the workout. A post-workout diet is as essential as a pre-workout snack. It tunes the body for proper utilization of nutrients, decreases muscle protein breakdown, increases muscle growth, and improves recovery. Post-exercise our muscles turn sore but get strong later. Do include the following foods for faster muscle recovery after a workout.

Sweet potatoes

This starchy vegetable has immense benefits, one being a great post-workout snack option. Rather than gulping sugary items, try this naturally sweet, starchy item that restores your glucose. Sweet potatoes are a great source of vitamin C, beta carotene, and minerals. Have it baked, grilled, or boiled in your salad. Have it fresh.

Paneer (cottage cheese)

Paneer is a great source of protein in the diet and a great post-workout option. A good amount of carbs, vitamins, minerals like calcium and phosphorus keeps bone health strong too. It will keep your satiety levels and rehydrate your body. Have it fresh in a salad with your favorite greens.

Turmeric

This super ingredient in our kitchen is great for keeping inflammation at bay. Post-workout munching on a piece of raw turmeric can be immensely beneficial for muscles by keeping soreness in check. It reduces oxidative damage to the body and promotes muscle repair. Include it raw or incorporate as turmeric latte with milk, or even a ginger and turmeric decoction tea can come at the rescue.

Nuts and seeds

Loaded with essential amino acids and PUFA, MUFA namely omega fatty acids, nuts, and seeds are a house of antioxidants. The amino acids are extremely essential in protein building and muscle recovery. Minerals like zinc, selenium, calcium, potassium are essential in metabolism and muscle contraction, and relaxation processes. Make sure to include a handful after a workout.

Cherries

Cherries are a great source of antioxidants, reducing inflammation and maintaining muscle health. It helps in flushing out toxins built up and its juice can calm and soothe after an intense workout. Add it to your smoothies or simply have them fresh for a better muscle relaxation phase.

Spinach

A rich source of fiber, minerals, and phytochemicals, spinach is a great option to reduce cell damage and boost recovery post workout. It helps in acting against the free radicals. Add it fresh in a salad or have it boiled, juiced, or as a smoothie.

Endnote It’s important to incorporate the right ingredients in your diet post-workout for optimum benefits as muscle recovery is extremely important. Try having these after your intense workout regime and witness the difference!
