title.rendered: Lifestyle Disorder Guide- All About Diabetes

content.rendered:
The rapid change in lifestyle and eating patterns has impacted all forms of life and has resulted in a host of health issues, diabetes being one of its major offshoots. The cases of diabetes are on the rise each year, and it is something that can’t be cured but only can be managed.

What is diabetes mellitus?

Diabetes mellitus is a metabolic disorder that prevents the body to utilize glucose partially or completely. This is manifested by increased blood glucose concentration and effect in metabolism of all macronutrients namely protein, fat, and carbohydrate. This can be due to the failure of the formation of insulin or its failure of its action. This results in a host of interrelated issues and complications affecting body tissues, retina, infections, nephropathy, and heart disease to name a few.

What are the types?

1. Type-1 diabetes

This is also called juvenile diabetes as it affects the younger population. It is an autoimmune disease as the immune system is attacked which destroys the cells in the pancreas that produce insulin. As a result individuals with type one diabetes needs insulin therapy throughout life.

2. Type-2 diabetes

This is by far the most common type of diabetes which affects adults. It is due to the impairment of the action of insulin as the body becomes resistant to it. This is caused due to various genetic and lifestyle factors and being obese living a sedentary life increases its risk manifold.

3. Gestational diabetes

It occurs to women during pregnancy and their chance to develop into type-2 diabetes increases if they have gestational diabetes. Make sure to routinely check, and maintain a healthy lifestyle.

What are the risk factors?

  • Genetics: the risk of having diabetes increases if someone in the family has diabetes or is present in the genes.
  • Race: Asians are more predisposed towards having diabetes than any other race.
  • Age: Male above 40 years and females above 45 years of age are at higher risk.
  • Lifestyle: a sedentary lifestyle, acute stress levels, having high blood pressure and obesity are several contributing factors to develop diabetes. It is very essential to have a healthy lifestyle to prevent the onset of diabetes.

What are the signs and symptoms?

  • Hyperglycemia
  • Polydipsia (increased thirst)
  • Polyuria (frequent urination)
  • Polyphagia (increased hunger)
  • Tiredness and fatigue

Dietary Guidelines

Diet is very vital for the management of diabetes and proper guidance goes a long way.

  1. Consume high fiber foods and include fruits with peels.
  2. Consume foods with a low glycemic index that doesn’t shoot up blood glucose levels.
  3. Include non-starchy vegetables and have loads of green leafy vegetables like spinach, bottle gourd, bitter gourd, and cabbage.
  4. Replace white rice with brown rice, barley, oats, and quinoa.
  5. Refrain consuming processed and refined products.
  6. Include water and antioxidant-rich fruits and vegetables.

Maintaining your sugar control is essential along with regular exercise and sleep patterns. Medications may be essential but they should go hand in hand with dietary management.

title.rendered: 5 Nutritional Guidelines For Men With Prostate Cancer

content.rendered:
Prostate cancer is one of the leading causes of cancer deaths amongst men. It is like a slow killer which progresses slowly and never becomes clinically evident until it’s too late. It needs to be treated at the earliest to prevent it from spreading.

Look for the following symptoms:

  • Hematuria
  • Frequent urination
  • Dysuria
  • Difficulty in urination

Diet plays an important role in managing prostate cancer and it is essential to follow a personalized diet to help manage it. Research studies have revealed that a low fat, plant-based diet is particularly beneficial along with avoidance of processed meats, red meats, and high-fat items.

Here is a list of 5 dietary guidelines to get you through:

  • Include fish in your diet:

Increase intake of fresh fish rich in omega 3 fatty acids and protein. It is very helpful in managing prostate cancer. Include fish like salmon, trout, mackerel about 2-3 times a week. But make sure not to consume it fried, instead have it baked, steamed, or grilled.

  • Fruits rich in antioxidants and cruciferous vegetables needs to be increased:

Incorporate a variety of fruits and vegetables in your diet and make sure to have a variety of colored ones like berries, plums, grapes, and pomegranates. Include cruciferous vegetables like cabbage, cauliflower, and broccoli. The pigments present in them are very essential.

  • Limit your sugar consumption:

Say no to highly processed and refined items like cola, sugary sweets, pastries, fried foods, etc. increase your fiber intake and keep your blood glucose level in check. Replace white sugar with jaggery, or date palm. Try to consume naturally sweet products like fruits. Avoid store-bought juices.

  • Avoid high-fat foods:

Consumption of little fat is vital for the proper functioning of the body but avoid high-fat foods as it will create an imbalance and increase your weight. Maintain your weight and consume healthy fats. Keep a check on your cooking oil too and avoid cheese, butter and opt for healthier alternatives like olive oil.

  • Keep animal protein in check:

Be careful with animal proteins especially red meat, dairy, and animal fat as they are directly associated with prostate cancer. Avoid processed meat completely like sausage and salami. Switch to a plant-based protein like flax seeds and fibrous beans and nuts.

Endnote: Practice all the points mentioned above routinely and inculcate them for healthier choices. For a personalized approach, it is best to consult your dietician.

title.rendered: All You Need To Know About Menstrual Cups

content.rendered:
Periods and their woes torment women across the globe every month. Associated with it is the fear of spotting, sudden onset of periods unprepared, PMS, cramps, menstrual hygiene, and the confusion regarding which product to use- pads, tampons, or cups?

Most women are used to using pads and tampons and the market is flooded with it despite many women facing discomfort, leakage and are environmentally burdening. Recently, menstrual cups are in the spotlight for a variety of reasons. Despite being in the market since the 1930s, it gained momentum recently due to conscious consumer choices being on the rise. Many women are now shifting from pads and tampons to cups and it’s liberating! Here’s all you need to know about menstrual cups!

What exactly is a menstrual cup?

A menstrual cup is a small, funnel-shaped flexible cup made up of safe rubber or silicone which gives better hygiene and protection by collecting the blood and fluids. It is designed in a way that it can be easily inserted and taken out. They come in different sizes and capacities as per the size of the vagina and flow of menstrual blood. These cups hold more blood than tampons and pads. They can be worn for a longer duration of up to 12 hours without any issue and don’t lead to spotting or leakage. And the best part of it is they are reusable, cost-effective, and environment-friendly!

How does it work?

Menstrual cups being small and flexible are designed in a way to collect the menstrual flow and fluids from the spot where it releases, thus it does not disturb the urine flow. It can be bent and inserted just like a tampon. One needs to take care of the size for proper results as too large or too small can be uncomfortable. Once it is inserted, it can collect and keep the blood for hours. It can then be easily taken out with the help of a protruding outlet and blood can be discarded. Menstrual cups don’t absorb or soak blood, instead, it collects the blood. The cups thus can be washed well and reused. You may also discard it after one cycle, however, it can safely be used for multiple cycles. You can sterilize in boiling water but make sure to follow the instructions mentioned on the pack.

Pay attention to the size!

The size of menstrual cups is very important. Make sure to check the range of a brand to understand the best fit. Correct size is important to fit in right and to hold in the blood properly. There are certain factors that you can take care of before deciding on the size:

  • Age
  • Length of cervix
  • Flow rate and amount
  • Firmness and flexibility of cup
  • The capacity of cup
  • History of Vaginal birth

Comparative chart:

Endnote: Most women who switched to menstrual cups wished they had done it sooner because of the liberating experience. Give yourself a try!

title.rendered: 6 Transformative Health Hacks For Boosting Workplace Productivity

content.rendered:
The Covid pandemic has brought a great shift in the work culture with work from home being immensely popular across companies. Be it anywhere, productivity at work is very important to meet targets and deadlines. Keeping up the morale and focusing on healthy choices is very important, not only to meet short-term goals but to also keep good health in the long run- both physically and mentally.

Here is a list of health hacks that would boost your workplace productivity and prevent you from getting exhausted.

1. Healthy steps

There is always a choice whether to take the lift or climb the stairs. Make sure to manage time well and take the steps instead of that crowded lifts. Of course, during emergencies lifts are a viable option but by being punctual, you can exercise those legs by taking the stairs, calmly and slowly. The stress associated with the “rush” can be damaging mentally.

2. Maintain your meals

Cutting short the nibbling habit while working and instead focusing on eating a good home-cooked meal is essential to maintain good health in the long run. Avoid consumption of too much junk and fried foods and instead, have a healthy breakfast and lunch at work. Also, be careful about the portion size as heavy meals lead to sleepy and lazy feelings, thereby reducing productivity.

3. Remember to stretch

Sitting for hours and gazing at the screen can be disastrous to the entire body and not just posture or eyes. Make sure to do eye exercise every half hour and get up, stretch and walk a bit frequently to avoid exhaustion.

4. Snack wisely

Carrying healthy snacks like nuts and seed trails, granola nutrition bars, fruits, and roasted pulses is a great way to maintain health and prevent overeating. Healthy snacking helps to keep the brain sharp and alert hence lets you focus better.

5. Stay hydrated

Adequate water consumption is very important as it helps us to remain alert, focused, and healthy. Make sure to refill water bottles and consume them in a relaxed mind. Have seasonal fruit and vegetable juices too to remain hydrated and supply essential electrolytes. Choose coconut water over carbonated beverages.

6. Plan it out

Having a proper plan to start the day and diving the time accordingly not only helps in meeting targets better but also helps in having a relaxed mind and finishing tasks ahead of time.

Endnote Add sticky notes, manage time by sorting tasks and follow these simple tips to enhance your productivity which will help in maintaining a good work and personal life balance.

excerpt.rendered: The Covid pandemic has brought a great shift in the work culture with work from home being immensely popular across companies. Be it anywhere, productivity at work is very important … Continue reading 6 Transformative Health Hacks For Boosting Workplace Productivity

title.rendered: 4 Power Packed Smoothie Ideas

content.rendered:
Whether you are out of time and looking for a quick yet nutritious fix or you just love combining the goodness of different ingredients- Smoothie is the answer to it! Smoothie is a great way to have a nutritious packed and filling meal option, mostly at the start of the day as breakfast. What’s more appealing about smoothies is that they can be quite versatile by having an end number of combination options, right from a green veggie smoothie to a protein-packed milk-based one. Western countries started the tread of smoothie bowls with an amazing topping of choice that is bound to make your mornings bright and get you through the day!

Let’s look into 4 delectable smoothie ideas that will make you fall in love with the goodness of smoothies!

1. Get Set Green Smoothie

Start your day with a healthy dose of fresh greens which you can customize as per your mood! Green smoothies are a great source of antioxidants, fiber, and minerals which not only help with various physiological processes but also keep you lean and in great shape.

Ingredients

  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • ½ cup coconut water
  • 5-6 Spinach leaves
  • ¼ cup kale
  • 1 banana
  • 1 tsp flax or chia seeds

Process

Blend all the ingredients and enjoy fresh!

2. Detox Smoothie

Detox smoothies cleanse your system of toxic chemicals and free radicals. It is great for the digestive and circulatory systems.

Ingredients

  • ½ beetroot cut
  • ½ carrot cut
  • ½ cup milk
  • Sweetener of choice
  • 1 tsp chia/flax seeds

Process

Blend the ingredients well in a blender. Consume freshly prepared.

3. Choco Love Smoothie

Who doesn’t love chocolates! When taken in moderation, it has great health benefits. This can be your go-to smoothie any time of the day or when you need to cheer up and just uplift your mood!

Ingredients

  • Half a bar of dark chocolate
  • ½ cup cold milk
  • 1 frozen banana
  • 1 tsp instant coffee powder
  • Cinnamon powder as desired
  • Maple syrup/sweetener if required

Process

Blend all of them together. Sprinkle a bit of cinnamon powder and enjoy! It is best enjoyed when chilled!

4. Very Berry Smoothie

This one is packed with antioxidants hence fighting off radicals all the while being oh-so-flavorful. It is loved by kids and the elderly equally!

Ingredients

  • 2-3 Strawberries
  • ¼ cup blueberries
  • ¼ cup raspberries
  • ½ cup yogurt
  • Little cardamom powder
  • Water as desired

Process

Blend them together and enjoy! You can have it as a dessert too to cater to your sweet cravings in a healthy way!

EndNote Smoothies are a great way to combine the benefits of various ingredients and are quick to prepare and consume. However, one must be careful about the quantity as too much of it may lead to GI tract disturbances. Stick to the recommended portion size and try these great smoothie recipes to get you going throughout the week!

excerpt.rendered: Whether you are out of time and looking for a quick yet nutritious fix or you just love combining the goodness of different ingredients- Smoothie is the answer to it! … Continue reading 4 Power Packed Smoothie Ideas

title.rendered: Recipe- Jamun Smoothie Bowl

content.rendered:
This seasonal delight is something hard to miss. Loved by all ages, this simple recipe of Jamun smoothie bowl will have everyone spoon licking. Add some goodness to your monotonous platter by including this refreshing bowl which is power packed with nutrients and health benefits. Combination of Jamun and yogurt is short of words!

Nutritional benefits:

Jamun is extremely beneficial to our body and a holy grail for diabetics. It is a good source of phytochemicals and antioxidants essential for building immunity. It helps in maintain heart health and reduces risk of cardiovascular diseases and aids in managing diabetes. Paired with yogurt, it supplies essential prebiotics and probiotics and thus maintaining our gut health. It also serves as a great healthy snack and dessert option, but best suited as breakfast bowl (smoothie lovers can have it anytime of the day!)

Ingredients:

  • 5- 6 no. Jamun
  • 1 cup regular yogurt
  • 15g rolled oats granola
  • 1 ripe banana
  • 1 tsp chia or flax seeds
  • 3-4 almonds
  • Toppings of choice

Procedure

1. Deseed the jamuns after washing it well. Cut into small pieces.

2. In a blender add the Jamun, yogurt, banana, almonds, chia or flax seeds and blend them together until smooth

3.  Pour it in a bowl and add the rolled oats granola upon it. You may add honey or sweetener of choice.

4. Garnish with fresh Jamun, nuts, seeds of choice and serve chilled.

Nutritional info per serving:

Ending Note: This easy recipe is great to incorporate healthy ingredients at once. It is easy and quick recipe and can be consumed on the go even if you are running late in the mornings. Jamun is a great source of antioxidants and this recipe is a great way to include it in diet.

title.rendered: Recipe- Stuffed Quinoa Dosa

content.rendered:
Quinoa is a super-food loaded with nutrients. Giving regular Dosa a healthier twist, try replacing rice with quinoa to avail all the goodness of this delicious Dosa and kick start your day! This can be a great breakfast or snack option.

Nutritional benefits:

Quinoa is a gluten-free grain which is often called a super food since it is loaded with many nutrients. It is a good source of fiber, protein, essential vitamins and minerals. It is low in fat and doesn’t shoot up the blood glucose level. It is a great option for diabetics and weight-watchers as well as anyone willing to switch to healthier food options.

Ingredients:

  • 30g Quinoa
  • 15g Urad dal
  • 1/2 tsp fenugreek seeds
  • Salt as per preference
  • 1 tbsp cooking oil or ghee

Procedure

1. Rinse quinoa in water twice to release the bitter component

2. Soak Quinoa, urad dal and methi (fenugreek) for about 3 hours

3. Drain excess water while keeping some and blend together to form batter. Make sure there is not any coarse particle and the batter is smooth

4. Let it ferment in ambient temperature overnight about 12-15 hours

5. Add salt to the batter and stir and mix gently

6. Check the consistency and the batter is ready

7. Add oil on tawa or non-stick pan and heat it. Make sure it isn’t too hot.

8. Add a ladle of batter and flatten it in circular motion to give it the shape of dosa.

9. Smear some oil on sides to avoid sticking and cook until it turns golden. Fold the dosa with your desired stuffing and serve with chutney and sambhar.

Nutritional info per serving:

Ending Note: Incorporate quinoa into your diet with this simple yet healthy option and add variety to your platter. Add loads of veggies in your stuffing to maximize health benefits. Quinoa will give a nutty, crispy texture and is worth a try.

excerpt.rendered: Quinoa is a super-food loaded with nutrients. Giving regular Dosa a healthier twist, try replacing rice with quinoa to avail all the goodness of this delicious Dosa and kick start … Continue reading Recipe- Stuffed Quinoa Dosa

title.rendered: Recipe- Avocado Toast

content.rendered:
Avocado is one such food that has been on the buzz in recent times mainly because of keto diet as it is rich in good fats and tastes delicious! While you may wonder how to bring out variety to your regular bread-butter breakie, this Avocado Toast is sure to be a stellar option amongst all, including fussy kids!

Nutritional benefits:

Avocado is loaded with healthy fats and contains fatty acids vital to maintain heart health and bring down cholesterol. It is rich in minerals like folate, magnesium, potassium, and vitamins like Vitamin C, E, K, B6, B2, and B3. Paired with whole wheat or multigrain bread as a toast, it is a great breakfast and snack option that will keep your satiety in check.

Ingredients:

  • 1 ripe avocado (peeled)
  • Whole wheat or multigrain bread
  • ¼ teaspoon lemon juice
  • Salt and pepper as per preference
  • 1 clove of crushed garlic
  • Red chilli flakes or any seasoning (optional)

Procedure

1. Toast a slice of bread until it’s golden and done.

2. Poach the avocado in little amount of water and remove the pit.

3. In a bowl mash the avocado with a fork to your desired consistency.

4. Add the crushed garlic, salt pepper and red chilli flakes as desired.

5. Spread it on top of the toast. You may add any extra seasoning you prefer.

6. Enjoy it freshly prepared!

Nutritional info per serving:

Ending Note: Add variety to your monotonous diet with this amazing avocado toast that is healthy and nutrient dense, keeping you full for longer. Enjoy it with your favorite beverage and best company of people!

excerpt.rendered: Avocado is one such food that has been on the buzz in recent times mainly because of keto diet as it is rich in good fats and tastes delicious! While … Continue reading Recipe- Avocado Toast

title.rendered: Recipe- Berry Chia Conserve

content.rendered:
Jams and conserve found in stores are loaded with artificial sweetener or sugar, colors and preservatives. It is in no comparison to freshly prepared one with good ingredients devoid of any harmful substances. Over more, it’s fairly very simple to make and tasty. The presence of chia will give a nutty flavor as well as increase the nutritional quotient. Spread it upon your favorite toast, add it to your smoothies, yogurts or just simply indulge!

Nutritional benefits:

Berries are rich in antioxidants and pigments essential to maintain several biological functions. They are also rich source of vitamins like vitamin C and E which is great for skin health. Chia seeds are rich in omega-fatty acids, calcium, magnesium, zinc and dietary fibers.

Ingredients:

  • 30g berries like strawberry/raspberry/blueberry
  • 1 tsp raw chia seeds
  • 1 tsp honey/sugar
  • ½ tsp lemon juice

Procedure

1. In a bowl of water soak the chia seeds for 10 minutes until it swells up and thickens.

2. Chop the berries and heat with little water on a non-stick pan until juice is released.

3. Mash the berries to attain desired consistency.

4. Add the soaked chia seeds to it followed by honey/sugar and the lemon juice.

5. Let it cool and set it for some time.

6. Chill it and enjoy freshly made berry conserve!

Nutritional info per serving:

Ending Note: It is best to consume it fresh and chilled for the natural flavors and nutritional benefits to be optimum. Enjoy this healthier option with your breakfast or as a spread on your favorite dessert. Also, it pairs great with cheesecake too!

title.rendered: Feeding Smart From The Start To Prevent Premature Greying

content.rendered:
Are you witnessing grey hair at a young age? Is premature greying of hair related to diet? Can pre-mature greying of hair be delayed by watching what you consume? There are endless questions regarding premature graying of hair as it is becoming very common in the younger population, including children and teens.

Graying of hair prematurely doesn’t pose any harm directly however there may be several underlying conditions and deficiencies that are manifested with premature greying of hair. There may be several reasons associated with it- it may be genetic or due to psychological stress too. Before addressing how to overcome the problem, let’s look into some of the root causes of it.

What could be the reasons?

1. Genetic– Just how baldness appears suddenly as one grows up due to genetic factors, premature graying of hair too could be genetic. If parents and grandparents faced a similar condition, likely, you are genetically predisposed to it.

2. Stress– with a lifestyle change, extreme stress is on the rise. It has resulted in early greying of hair, together with environmental stress loaded with pollutants. Both psychological and environmental stress can be one of the reasons.

3. Anemia– Anemia which is common in women, is associated with the early onset of grey hair. Iron deficiency is also associated with fatigue and lethargy.

4. Unhealthy eating pattern– Young population loves junk food and highly processed food items. They bring forth loads of health issues, graying of hair being one of them.

Once the root issue is found out, work towards it as it is impossible to reverse graying of hair. Very little could be done for genetic issues however a close watch on diet pattern and lifestyle is essential to delay it as much as possible.

Tips to tackle premature greying of hair:

1. Cut down on junk foods and carbonated beverages. Highly processed packaged foods needs to be avoided too.

2. Incorporate fiber-rich, antioxidants-rich foods as they counter the free radicals. Include loads of colored fruits and vegetables in your diet.

3. Increase protein intake as they help in maintaining healthy hair growth. Include loads of plant proteins as well proteins from non-vegetarian sources like eggs and lean meat.

4. Iron and Vitamin B12 need to be included in the diet and include loads of seeds, dates, green leafy vegetables, bananas, etc. They are vital for healthy hair.

5. Practice yoga, meditation and exercise regularly to calm your mind. Keep your environment clean and away from health-hazardous substances like soot and pollution. A well-balanced diet paired with a healthy routine can avert premature graying of hair. Start early on as the earlier it’s tackled, the better. Also, maintain a good hair care routine that suits best.

title.rendered: Post-Covid Workout Routine To Increase Lung Capacity

content.rendered:
Covid pandemic taught us several things in life and shifted our priorities to a great extent. One such being to prioritize our health and that of our loved ones. Coronavirus affects the lungs primarily and several organs consequently hence it’s important to focus on building lung capacity and perform exercises specifically focusing on it. Exercises targeted at building lung capacity will reduce the risk of severity and enhance energy and flexibility.

Celebrity fitness trainer Yasmin Karachiwala who is known to shape several B-town celebrities like Katrina Kaif, BipashaBasu, DeepikaPadukone to name a few, shared on her feed about post-Covid workout routine. The trainer recovered from the disease and swears by this routine after recovery. Recovery and post-Covid strategies are as important as prevention strategies of the virus. Weakness and fatigue are common amongst covid recovered individuals and special care must be taken to avoid future complications.

Points to take care of:

1. Start your regime slowly and not at once

2. Limit your exposure to too much information and contradiction of facts

3. Look for any post-Covid complications that must be addressed

4. Key to recovery is to regain strength and building up the lost energy

Along with a video of exercises that can be done at home, the trainer wrote, “Waiting to get back to your exercise routine after Covid? I would like to share with you some of the exercises that I did when I recovered, which really helped me increase my lung capacity and make my body less stiff! Do note that my symptoms were mild. If your symptoms are not mild or you are yet to fully recover, please consult your physician/doctor before doing any of these exercises. I started these exercises very slowly with lowintensity doing only as many reps as my body felt comfortable doing. I was also constantly listening to my body, which is the most important thing any of us can do Post Covid.”

The list of exercises that would help to build lung capacity include:

  • Abdominal Breathing Diaphragmatic
  • Lateral Lung Breathing
  • Side Bend – Single Lung Breathing
  • Cat & Cow – Spine Mobilization
  • Twist & Hold (Spinal Rotation with Breath)
  • Mini Swan – Thoracic Extension
  • Hip Flexor Stretch (Releasing tightness due to sitting all day)
  • Butterfly Stretch – Stretch Hips, Glutes, Groin & Inner Thigh)

It is important to address the fact that heavy medications and complications are bound to make an individual weak. Proper guidance can help in speedy recovery correctly. Follow the guidance of the trainer and slowly incorporate them into your routine. Make sure to consult your doctor or medical personnel in case of complications.

title.rendered: Make Way For Turmeric For Its Anti-Cancer Effects

content.rendered:
Turmeric, “The Golden Spice” which is native to India has found its way to the rest of the world because of its extremely beneficial properties ranging from anti-bacterial to anti-cancer effects. It has been in existence for ages and found its reference in Ayurveda for its medicinal and nutritive properties. Indian Cuisine, especially Indian curries are just incomplete with this essential spice.

The bright yellow color of turmeric is due to the presence of an extremely important pigment which is also an anti-oxidant, called Curcumin. It has several medicinal and health benefits such as anti-bacterial, anti-inflammatory, anti-cancer effects to name a few. A concoction of turmeric is almost a must during any cough and cold. It boosts immunity and is often a great combination with milk.

Anti-Cancer Effects of Turmeric

  • Studies carried out at the National Institute of Nutrition suggest that turmeric has anti-cancer properties
  • Tumerin isolated from turmeric is a potent antioxidant and anticarcinogen
  • It is reported to reduce cholesterol and severe irritation in the stomach
  • It has the potential to convert and detoxify harmful drugs to metabolites that could be excreted.
  • Curcumin has potent inhibitory effects on breast cancer, which is the most common type of cancer amongst women.

Incorporate Turmeric every day

1. HaldiDoodh or Turmeric Latte

Recently turmeric latte has been a household recipe to boost immunity. Do have raw turmeric crushed or dried ones powdered and mix a teaspoon with a glass of milk before bedtime. Add a pinch of pepper for added benefits.

2. Turmeric ginger tea

Replace caffeine-rich drinks with a Decoction of turmeric ginger tea. Add few fresh leaves of Tulsi or holy basil for an aromatic and health-beneficial effect.

3. Curries

A pinch of turmeric powder goes almost in all Indian dishes, especially curries, meat preparation, fries, and fritters. Make sure you add it along with the rest of your spices but don’t overdo it!

4. Seasoning

Turmeric can be seasoned with any vegetables during stir-frying. Toss it along with your favorite spices. You can add it during tempering too. Add it to lentils during boiling with little salt and oil.

5. Bite it

You can simply take a bite of raw turmeric every day but make sure it’s a small tiny piece. Overconsumption will lead to toxicity. It is best to have turmeric freshly ground to avoid adulteration. Raw or dried turmeric roots are available in the market in abundance so make sure to grab some during your next grocery shopping. Include this magical spice every day in little amounts for long-term benefits from various illnesses and to avail of its anti-cancer benefits.

title.rendered: Fertility And Diet- Is There Any Connection?

content.rendered:
A healthy lifestyle is intertwined with a healthy diet. Diet can be used to treat and maintain health and avoid complications like obesity, heart diseases, liver, and digestive issues, to name a few. Likewise, diet plays an important role in pregnancy and ovulation too. However, healthy eating should be a lifelong process and not one time approach to attain fertility. Women need to take extra care of their health especially during fertility to bear a healthy child and also remain healthy themselves.

Several issues and complications may emerge with a lack of proper knowledge of diet and practices. Some practices if followed can help maintain fertility via ovulation and proper hormonal balance. Although, there isn’t any magic formula to improve fertility and help to get pregnant, taking care of certain things can help in conceiving along with maintaining a healthy life.

1. Check your water consumption

Consume adequate water and include loads of hydrating drinks like juices, buttermilk, coconut water, etc. Limit the consumption of alcohol, carbonated beverages, tea, and coffee.

2.  Cut down on sugar and trans fats

Stop the consumption of heavily processed foods loaded with sugar and trans fats as they affect several bodily processes, ovulation being one. They also impact the hormones and creates a misbalance. Avoid consuming carbonated beverages.

3. Look for healthier options

Switch junk fried foods with boiled, stewed, or baked items. Include lots of fruits, vegetables, nuts, and seeds. Include colorful vegetables and fruits which are rich in phytonutrients. Foods rich in antioxidants and vitamin E, Vitamin A, needs to be added too.

4. Include Folate

Folate is an essential nutrient for maintaining reproductive health and decreases the incidents of fetal abnormalities. Folate plays a key role in fertility so make sure to include lots of greens and seeds.

5. Have iron-rich foods

Iron is essential in several bodily processes and helps in lowering the risks of infertility. Make sure to include loads of iron-rich foods in form of green leafy vegetables, black sesame seeds, dates, and eggs. Include loads of vegetables and fruits in your diet.

6. Exercise and maintain a healthy weight

Maintaining a healthy weight is very essential for the healthy functioning of all systems of the body. It is vital in regulating periods and maintaining reproductive health. Make sure to engage in various activities and exercise regularly to maintain a healthy weight. Change in lifestyle and adoption of unhealthy habits has resulted in increasing infertility amongst people. It is something that will require maintaining a long-term health goal. In some cases, medical intervention may be required but maintaining a balanced and healthy life while focusing on key areas is crucial.

title.rendered: 5 Tips Of What’s Normal And What’s Not About A Menstrual Cycle

content.rendered:
The internet is flooded with opinions and articles surrounding the menstrual cycle and every aspect of it, be it period cramps, blood flow, hormonal changes, or PMS. All of it is bound to make readers confused. Having healthy periods is a reflection of a healthy overall system too, as many underlying conditions affect menstrual cycles too. It is thus, important to know what is normal during periods and what isn’t and requires attention.

 What’s normal during periods?

  • Regular periods– A normal menstrual cycle is of 28 days but it can vary from woman to woman. Often due to environmental changes of routine or stress can lead to delay or early occurrence by 2-3 days. Your menstrual cycle is typically considered in a healthy range if periods occur every 25 to 35. What is important is the consistency of periods every month within the healthy cycle range.
  • PMS– Pre-menstrual symptoms or PMS occur due to hormonal changes which can be manifested in terms of increased food cravings, breast tenderness, mood swings, acne on the skin, and headaches to name a few.
  • Cramps– Period cramps are common amongst a lot of women before and during the periods. Cramps typically occur in muscles of the legs, thighs, arms, and stomach. There is increased discomfort due to the contraction of the uterus and the shredding of linings. Light exercise and drinking adequate fluids can help ease the discomfort and cramps. Leading a healthy lifestyle can largely ease-out pains during periods.
  • Clotting– Blood clotting is during periods is normal and nothing to worry about. About a quarter size of the blood clot is very common during periods and is not harmful. Along with clots, there are discharges too. However, some people experience hemorrhages, or larger clots on a regular basis which may result from complications, and is best to consult a doctor immediately.

What’s not normal during periods?

  • Irregular periods– periods may get delayed or occur earlier by a day or two which is okay but if periods occur at irregular intervals consistently it is an unhealthy sign. There may be several underlying complications like PCOS, hormonal disturbances, uterus cancer, or pelvic inflammatory diseases. Periods however get irregular during pregnancy or while nearing menopause, which is completely normal.
  • Consistent heavy bleeding– heavy bleeding on few days of periods occasionally is okay but is a matter of concern if the heavy bleeding occurs on a regular basis during periods. Abnormal hefty bleeding during periods called menorrhagia needs to be checked timely.
  • Longer bleeding durations– bleeding during periods lasts for 3-5 days which is normal but occasional disruptions might be there. However, there may be longer bleeding more than seven days which is a matter of concern and it is better to consult a doctor.

There are many myths and misconceptions surrounding periods since ages and it is best to seek medical and scientific advice regarding any irregularities. Maintain a balanced, healthy lifestyle for a healthy menstrual cycle.

title.rendered: Self Breast-Examination, A Step Towards Self Awareness

content.rendered:
Often Breast Cancer can be avoidable with early detection and timely treatment. Lack of awareness is prominent amongst the masses who don’t know what self-breast examination is or how to perform it. Breast self-examination is the regular examination of breasts on your own to detect breast cancer early on. It increases the chance of successful treatment because of early detection. Coupled with screening methods, this self-examination of breasts can be highly effective. We provide you step by step guide for an effective self-examination:

Step 1

Is there a difference between the breasts?

Start observing your breasts carefully in a resting position in front of a straight mirror either while sitting or standing position. Examine each breast for any visible lumps or unusual features between the two breasts. Observe for any redness, indentations in the breast tissue, or any other changes in the nipples.

Step 2

Observe with your hands on different postures

Sometimes in resting position lumps may not be visible. Observe the peculiarities mentioned in Step 1 but this time with hands pressed on the buttocks with elbows facing forward. This position may bring out lumps that would not have been otherwise visible. Slowly move your elbow side to side keeping your hand on the buttocks and observe anomalies in different angles.

Observe any dimpling or puckering of the skin by lifting the hand and keeping it straight up above your head. When you raise your arm, the lump if present rests and pulls your skin inwards.

Step 3

Examining with first three fingers

This examination involves feeling your breasts. The examination needs to be carried out while laying down. For this rest your head up on a pillow and place your arm behind it. Use the first three fingers of the right arm to examine the left breast and vice versa. Take three fingers, i.e. index, middle, and ring fingers, and press down the breast gently and the area around it. This will help in distinguishing lumps from normal breast tissue. Increase pressure gently to examine better.

Step 4

Feel the area around your breasts

Along with examining breasts, it is important to check the area around the breasts too. Use circular motions and increasing pressure starting from the collarbone to underneath the breasts. The feel will be different like swelling of lymph nodes, a size of a pea or walnut. In such cases immediately visit your gynecologist.

Step 5

Regularly test every month

Make sure to carry out a routine examination of your breasts every month around the same time. Try to avoid the menstruating cycle as there are menstrual-related breast changes like swelling happening during periods. Menopausal women can try examining any time of the month but at regular intervals. Initially, it may seem confusing and difficult to examine your breasts, but once you garner the tactic it is easier than you think. Take time for yourself every month and examine your breasts for a better future, as the saying goes, prevention is better than Cure!

title.rendered: 5 Healthy Snacking Ideas For Navratri

content.rendered:
The auspicious occasion of the 9-day festival of worshipping MaaDurga, called Navratri, is incomplete without the essence of food, especially its sweets and snacks. Festivals like Navratri involve lots of preparation amongst all the fun and fasting. Hence, one must take care of the health aspect too while fasting to avoid falling sick on those days. Of course, who wants to fall ill at one of the biggest festivals of the year?

So, here to the rescue is a list of some easily digestible, healthy as well as tasty snack options to get you through the Navratri:

  • Sago/Sabudana

Sabudana is a prerequisite in almost all fasts for ages. It maintains the satiety value and gets you through the fast. It supplies a steady and abundant supply of energy and prevents you from fainting or feeling lethargic. It helps to regulate better blood flow too. Enjoy it as a simple khichri using ghee.

  • Fox Nuts/ Makhana

Makhana or fox nuts derived from lotus is not only auspicious but also loaded with nutrients. It finds its way in Ayurveda too! It is rich in micronutrients like potassium, calcium, iron, and magnesium. Enjoy it lightly roasted in ghee with pepper and salt. You can prepare it as a kheer too.

  • Pulpy Juices

Have unstrained juice of vegetables and fruits for all the vital nutrients as well as detoxification. It will help relax the system which will aid in better absorption. It will keep you better hydrated. Include beetroot, tomato, apple, carrot, or green juices of spinach, celery, and cucumber to name a few.

  • Dry Fruits and Nuts

Who doesn’t love dry fruits and nuts? Include apricots, figs, almonds, walnuts, cashew, raisins, prunes, and pistachios in your diet. They are a powerhouse of vitamins and minerals and help in regulating several body functions.

  • Fruit Custard

Simply eating fruit salad can get boring. Add a tasty twist to it by preparing fruit custard out of either cow milk or coconut milk. This light, fluffy snack option is loved by all age groups. Add loads of fresh fruits like pomegranates, apples, kiwi, cherries, and enjoy it with everyone. Snacks are often indulgent loaded with unhealthy fats and salt. This can lead to digestive issues especially during fasting extensively. Take good care of your health by including the above-mentioned healthy as well as tasty snack options that are loved across all age groups. They will take care of your energy levels as well as nutrients and micronutrients while being light on the body so you enjoy Navratri to the fullest.

title.rendered: Time Tested Tips To Combat Hairfall & Promote Hair Growth

content.rendered:
As monsoons drench us in rain, there are thousands of women wailing for their fallen hair. But for some, the woes of hair fall are almost all year round. Long or short, we know how precious our hair is to us. Hair loss has been linked to low self-esteem, higher stress, and insecurity. Before taking measures to combat it, the root cause of hair fall needs to be found out first.

Reasons for increased Hairfall?

In general, it’s normal to shred about 50-100 hair each day. But some individuals lose far more in number. Some of the reasons may be:

  • Stress and Anxiety
  • Improper diet
  • Hormonal imbalances
  • Underlying diseases
  • Side-effects of medications
  • Genetic
  • Environmental factors like water quality, pollution
  • Use of harsh hair products and heating equipments
  • Lack of proper care and attention

Nutrients for healthy hair

Often inadequate nutrients lead to increased hair fall. Some vital nutrients that help in maintaining healthy hair include:

  • Protein: egg, milk, lentils, soya
  • Zinc & Selenium: Seafood, nuts and seeds
  • Iron: Green vegetables, eggs, dates
  • Biotin: Eggs, green vegetables
  • Vitamin E: nuts like almond, walnuts; sunflower seeds, fatty fish
  • Vitamin C: Gooseberries, citrus fruits, green vegetables, kiwi

Supplements can also be taken as per issue after consultation from doctors and nutritionists.

Tips to fix physical hair damage

Physical hair damage is very common if you regularly blow-dry, style it with heat, use harsh chemicals and colors, resulting in broken hair, split ends, and hair fall. Here is what you can do:

  • Avoid combing wet hair as they are prone to breakage
  • Don’t over-oil hair and rinse-off oils and residues properly
  • Switch to gentle shampoos and avoid products loaded with harsh chemicals like sulphates and parabens
  • Avoid heat regularly. Use heat protection spray or serum
  • Avoid tying hair too tightly and change partition often
  • Wash hair with care and regularly, to avoid sweat and dust buildup

Easy Home Remedies

Amla

Amla or Indian gooseberry has excellent hair growth-promoting activity and helps in the proliferation of dermal papilla cells.

Steps

  • Apply fresh amla juice on your scalp evenly and leave for 30 min
  • Rinse off using a gentle cleanser
  • You can do this 1-2 times a week

Onion juice

Several studies have shown the effectiveness of onion oil in combating hair fall. Rather than chemical products try this instead,

Steps

  • Take half onion and blend and strain to obtain the juice
  • Apply the onion juice to your scalp and leave it for 40 minutes
  • Rinse properly with water

Hibiscus

Hibiscus or China rose is an age-old tradition for silky, healthy hair. It also helps in combating hair loss.

Steps

  • Blend 1-2 hibiscus flowers with 3-4 hibiscus leaves
  • Add a little coconut oil to it
  • Apply the mixture on scalp and hair and leave for 30 minutes
  • Rinse it off and follow it up with gentle shampoo and conditioner

Coconut oil

It can help reduce damage and breakage caused by physical damage and penetrate deep to nourish.

Steps

  • Take 1-2 tablespoon of virgin coconut oil and warm it a bit
  • Massage it gently on scalp and hair
  • Leave it on for an hour and rinse off completely with gentle cleanser

Egg mask

The egg has biotin, iron, and protein all essential for good, strong hair.

Steps

  • Whisk the egg yolk and apply it to your scalp and leave it on for at least 30 min
  • Rinse it off using a shampoo

Alongside, nutritionists and dermatologists recommend having a blood test done to understand the condition. Having a healthy stress-free routine, exercise and sleep is also vital for healthy, happy hair!

title.rendered: 5 Foods To Promote Better Sleep

content.rendered:
People across all age groups are facing trouble sleeping, more so in the recent pandemic situation. With lifestyle-induced stress and anxiety on the rise, many are now devoid of quality sleep. However, a good night’s sleep both in quantity as well as quality is essential for the proper functioning of the body as well as mind and dealing with tough situations better.

Diet and nutrition play an important role in our sleep cycle along with the environment, exercise, and daily routine. Foods containing melatonin along with certain other nutrients regulates our internal clock and signals the body to prepare for a sound sleep. Let us look at 5 foods that can promote better sleep:

1. Warm milk

Probably as old as a tale, our grandmothers have been telling us how a cup of warm milk before bedtime promotes better sleep. This is because milk contains an amino acid tryptophan which helps to make sleep-regulating melatonin and serotonin. They also regulate mood, appetite along sleep. Warm milk when taken together with turmeric as “Haldi Doodh” or with cinnamon, Almonds as “Badam milk”, its benefits are increased manifold. This is something that can be consumed across age groups, from kids to the elderly, for better sleep.

2. Fatty Fish

Fatty fish is rich in omega-3 fatty acids, specifically EPA and DHA. They are known to reduce inflammation and promote brain health. Fatty fish is also rich in Vitamin D. Combination of both helps inducing better sleep as they have shown to increase serotonin levels. Include fatty fish at your dinner for a restful sleep.

3. Nuts: Walnuts and Almonds

Loaded with omega 3 fatty acids, magnesium, folate, and calcium, they aid in boosting melatonin and serotonin levels and help regulate sleep and mood. They are also vital to maintain heart health and supply essential nutrients. Include a few almonds or walnuts before bedtime, preferably with a glass of milk for beneficial effects.

4. Kiwi

We all know how kiwis are a great source of Vitamin C which maintains our health and immunity, but they are also a powerhouse of nutrients like folate, Vitamin K, potassium, and are low in calories. According to several studies, kiwis have the potential to improve sleep quality because of serotonin in it which regulates the sleep cycle.  Eating few pieces of kiwi fruit can be your option to have a sound sleep at night.

5. Chamomile Tea

The calming effect of chamomile tea is nothing new to tea lovers. This herbal tea is loaded with antioxidants and is best known to relieve stress and induce peaceful sleep. There is evidence that suggests that drinking chamomile tea reduces anxiety and depression, improves skin health, and strengthens the immune system while also improving better sleep. It contains an antioxidant that binds to certain receptors in the brain that promote sleepiness. Drinking a cup of warm chamomile tea before bedtime is not only soothing but also light on the stomach.

The above-mentioned foods will work best in promoting better sleep if they are coupled with a better healthy lifestyle, moderate exercise, and proper work and sleep cycle along with limiting blue light emitted from screens before bedtime. A proper sleep cycle with quality sleep goes a long way in improving health and avoiding health complications, and these foods will certainly help in achieving that.

title.rendered: Know How Your Lifestyle Affects The Gut Friendly Bacteria

content.rendered:
We are accustomed with sayings like “I have a gut-feeling that…” or “my gut is telling that…” while the outcomes may or may not be true, but there is no doubt our gut is like a mini brain and gut-mind connection is widely researched. All of it is because of the vast micro biome that resides there. Two of the most important factors that influence the intestinal integrity are the bacterial population in the gut and the health of the gut mucosa, both of which are influenced by several factors and lifestyle plays an important role.

Maintaining healthy gut flora is very important to life a long, healthy life, imbalance of which can lead to cancer whereas on the other hand a healthy lifestyle promotes healthy gut flora thereby adverting several life threatening health conditions like cancer.

Over the years there is explorative studies on the role of diet and other environmental factors in affecting the composition and metabolic activity of the human gut microbiota which in turn affects health. Let’s look how our actions affect negatively and positively:

Lifestyle that affects gut bacteria negatively

1. Addictive habits: regular habits of smoking, drinking has been associated with imbalance in gut population which in turn lead to bio activation of enzymes in the gut bacteria. These bio activations can lead to cancer.

2. Unhealthy eating habits– consuming junk, heavily fried items, additives and colours, frequently eating out, lack of fiber deprives gut bacteria of required nutrients for them to flourish and creates imbalance in population. It is in turn manifested with several digestive issues and health hazards.

3. Sedentary lifestyle: Lack of physical activity and exercise lead to unhealthy cravings, release of excessive hormones, depression all of which affects the gut micro biome and dwindling its population.

4. Ignoring early years– Inadequate breastfeeding and improper food habits in the early, formative years leads to poor gut bacteria population formation and if impacts lifelong.

5. Heavy drugs and environment- Consuming heavy antibiotics kills the bacterial population good or bad and inadequate replenishment of good bacteria affects health overall. Polluted environment and surrounding lead to formation of carcinogenic compounds which affect the gut health majorly.

Lifestyle that affects gut bacteria positively

1. Nutrition– Regular inclusion of prebiotics and probiotics in diet leads to healthy gut and proliferation of good bacteria which affect overall health positively. Diet rich in prebiotics like fiber and peels of fruits, legumes are as important as consuming probiotics like curd, buttermilk etc.

2. Regular Activity– Active lifestyle releases good hormones and helps in the healthy gut bacteria formation. Regular exercises in turn lead to healthy digestive system.

3. Explorative lifestyle– Experiencing diverse range of foods and cuisines is very important for a healthy colon bacteria. Make sure to include different fruits, vegetables and food ingredients and not stick to monotonous routine. Eating seasonal foods are very important too.

4. Healthy environment and surroundings– Having a positive, unpolluted surrounding is very important for both mind and body. Fresh air, water and basic necessities are very important that leads to healthy gut bacteria and thus a healthy life. They also reduces the risk of cancer.

5. Routine– a proper everyday routine of sleep cycle, food, stool timings and activities leads to proper maintaining of biological clock, digestive system, and overall outlook of life. It helps functioning of gut bacteria better, thereby releasing ample enzymes and absorption of nutrients.

Thus, it is an endless loop, the way we lead our everyday life affects our gut bacteria and thereby affecting our immunity and several bodily processes whereby leading to a prolonged, healthy life.

title.rendered: Oil-Free Diet: Yay or Nay

content.rendered:
Right from tempering of your favorite dal in your lunch to those tempting fries, it is hard to imagine life without oil, isn’t it? As we move towards healthy lifestyles, diet trends push it to the extremes of elimination of certain ingredients. But is oil-free diet justifiable?

Oil which is a category of fat, provides 9kcal per gram, which is the highest of the macronutrients. This readily available energy can be a blessing as well a curse if its intake is not properly regulated. Many weight watchers tend to eliminate oil completely from diet and resort to options like air fried chips, steamed curries, boiled vegetables, baked goods etc. Modern equipment and utensils like non-stick pans too aid in preparation of food without the use of oil. But in the process, don’t we forget the very essence of food that it should be enjoyable and fulfilling too? This is where proper guidance and necessary knowledge is important.

Learn when to say no!

The food industry is booming with unhealthy, heavily fried junks that tempts us to “cheat” our diet. A pack of deep fried chips at a store or pakoras and fritters at a local street stall is more readily available than healthier alternatives. Refined saturated oils and oils that has been repeatedly used for frying (as in roadside stalls) are extremely harmful to our system. This leads to series of health conditions like affecting heart health, obesity, diabetes, high cholesterol to name a few. Such unhealthy junks affect digestive and mental health too. Though they may seem extremely tempting, we should know when to say no!

Everything about oils aren’t bad!

Oils are extremely important for proper functioning of our systems too! From absorbing the fat-soluble vitamins to transmitting neurological signals, they are very important, apart from being an energy source, palatable and enjoying the process of eating. Oils are also important to maintain healthy skin. Understanding the right method of usage, quantity, cooking temperature of oils are extremely important to avail maximum benefits from oil. Fat based diet are prescribed specifically for several neurological issues like Alzheimer’s too. There are several types of oils that benefit our systems. Following are to name a few:

  • Rice bran oil– Rice bran oil is extremely healthy oil, rich in micronutrients and containing tocopherol which is vitamin E fat soluble vitamin. It is beneficial for maintaining healthy heart, lowering cholesterol, building immunity, protecting cells from oxidative damage.
  • Coconut oil– It contains MCTs or medium chain fatty acids which are helpful in increasing the levels of HDL cholesterol which is a good cholesterol helping in lowering the bad ones. Coconut oil is extremely helpful in digestive issues when absorption is compromised.
  • Olive oil– Olive oil is anti-inflammatory and contains good amount of MUFA which is good for heart and overall health. It is mostly used as salad dressing, light sautéing and tempering. It is not meant for deep frying.
  • Cold pressed oils– Cold pressed oils retain the nutritive benefits and are not lost in processing of extraction. They are of superior health benefits.
  • Nut oils– oils extracted from nuts and seeds like almond, sesame are rich in nutrients and phytochemicals which have added health benefits.

Oils can be both harmful and beneficial depending on source, usage and quantity. It is advisable to consult dietitian before eliminating oil from diet following trends. Depending on body conditions, lifestyle, health goals and underlying requirements, professionals can guide properly on combination of oils, quantity and its usage and planning.

title.rendered: Younger Population Is More Vulnerable To Covid Delta Variant

content.rendered:
A novel corona virus that originated in 2019 as Covid-19 has undergone several mutations ever since. One of the Covid-19 variants- B.1.617.2 or the Delta variant of Covid which was first identified in India is becoming a dominant variant of disease globally, according to World Health Organization (WHO).

What makes the delta variant a matter of concern is that it is highly contagious and spreads rapidly amongst the younger population. A recent study from the Chinese Centre for Disease Control and Prevention showed the viral load of the delta variant being 1000 times higher than the initial strain of covid. While it is not clear whether it makes people sicker, but experts suggest it is by far the most rapidly spreading of all variants. Vaccinated people are either asymptomatic or have mild symptoms if they contract the Covid delta variant. Most of the hospitalized cases across the globe were of an unvaccinated population.

While the delta variant can affect any age group, it has been found to affect the younger population more. One study suggests that this could be due to the fact that most of the older population had already been vaccinated and were of low social contacts as compared to the younger generation who are more susceptible due to low vaccination rates and higher social and occupation contacts. However, vaccinated individuals can spread the delta variant rapidly to others without themselves being seriously ill. Hence, experts suggest the necessity of wearing masks and maintaining safety protocols even with a vaccinated population.


How to protect the younger population?

Since the research to vaccinate younger population below 18 is still underway in India specifically at The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi and Serum Institute of India (SII) Pune, and might take up to December 2021, provisions to import vaccines are underway.
The eligible population for vaccination in India, 18 and above must get vaccinated to prevent further outbreaks and protect the younger generation. The vaccine is effective in preventing illness, hospitalization, and death. Since vaccinated individuals can still be carriers of the variant as it spreads rapidly even in the vaccinated population without causing many symptoms, hence safety protocols must be followed at all times.
American Academy of Pediatrics reported below 18 children, older teens and adults need to be cautious. They need to limit unnecessary exposure and avoid high-risk zones. With schools, colleges, and institutions closed, the young population has to focus on building physical and mental health. Resorting to an unhealthy, sedentary lifestyle will only result in weakness and poorer immunity. Including fresh fruits and vegetables, everyday physical activity, engaging in other curricular activities, and limiting screen time are vital steps too.
Previous outbreaks saw populations with underlying conditions being more affected, but present variants depend more on the vaccination status of individuals. The Delta variant falls under the Variant of Concern according to Prathit A. Kulkarni, infectious disease specialist at Baylor St. Lukes Medical Center, Texas, USA. The delta variant being an area of concern and much of it is still in research, protocols should be underway to prevent a third wave of outbreak. The virus will continue to mutate as unvaccinated people contract the virus, hence safety should be everyone’s priority until the entire population is fully vaccinated.

title.rendered: Yearly Round Up of Health Myths & Facts 2020

content.rendered:
There’s so much advice buoyant around on what to eat and what not to eat, and it can be difficult to shift out the truth. Here we have enlisted five healthy myths and facts to round up your year 2020. These facts might drive you crazy once you find out about why and which food is healthy for you.

Myth: Eating at Night Causes Weight Gain
Fact: This can be a complex one to answer as it depends upon personal eating habits. One cannot gain weight if they do not exceed their caloric intake daily.
However, nighttime munching can be a little more complicated than you think.

Many people undergo bedtime cravings, this is often possible due to boredom or you are up all night binge-watching your favourite shows and there are chances that you might Indulge in mindless snacking. Unconsciously ingestion of calories can make it more difficult. Also, if you give in to the mindless snacking, you may still feel full the next morning and avoid breakfast, which can throw off your daily eating habits and may cause weight gain later.

As long as you are conscious and aware about your food intake there’s no harm to eating at night. If you go hungry, instead of craving for junk foods go for fruits and vegetables or any healthier alternative.

Myth: Kale is the Healthiest Green
Fact: Yes, kale is the healthiest green. It contains an abundance of nutrients that includes vitamins B6, C, K, & A, manganese folate, and calcium. Its nutrient-rich leaves contain vitamins that are known for lowering the risk of cancer and cholesterol, so the calories are well-spent.

Ensure that you continue drinking your kale smoothies because it won’t be leaving the superfood excellence list anytime soon.

Myth: To lose weight, you have to give up all your favourite foods.
Fact: When it comes to your favourite food items, you don’t need to upon them while you are trying to lose with. Why? Well, the answer is really simple, an adequate amount of your favourite high-calorie foods may be part of your weight-loss plan. Just remember to keep a track of the total calories intake. To lose weight, you must burn more calories than you take in through beverages and food.

Myth: Dairy products are fattening and unhealthy.
Fact: Dairy products are one of the most vital food groups because they contain rich protein which is an essential need to help organs work well and build muscles and not to forget mentioning they contain calcium which strengthens the bones. Milk and yogurts have added vitamin D that helps your body use calcium. Dairy products made from low-fat or fat-free milk have fewer calories as compared to dairy products made from whole milk.

Myth: Carbs are bad for you.
Fact: For achieving a healthy diet, carbohydrates are very essential as they provide energy to the entire body. Many people tend to eat more sources of carbohydrates that are not good for them like refined sugar and grains. Carbohydrates are best received from healthy and minimal processed foods, like nuts and seeds, fruits, vegetables, dairy, beans, and whole grains.

Over to you
These were some yearly round-up of health myths & facts 2020. A decade is about to end but not the suffering. Let’s take a pledge to keep our people healthy and strong for the coming year to fight against the odds.

title.rendered: Top 5 Gluten-Free foods

content.rendered:
Gluten sensitivity and celiac disease caused due to the presence of a protein component called gluten has affected many individuals, disrupting their digestive system. Many without any known or diagnosed gluten sensitivity are shifting to a gluten-free diet in recent times too. Many adults get diagnosed with gluten intolerance or sensitivity much later in life. Since gluten is present in staple food grains as wheat, rye, barley, it’s important to look for alternative grains and avoid food and food products with gluten in it. Such individuals find it tough as they can’t enjoy simple and widely available products like bread, biscuits, cakes, chapatti, pasta, etc. Here is a list of healthy food grains and seeds that are completely gluten-free.

1. Quinoa

Quinoa is a super grain which is also called “the mother grain” for its superior nutrient quality. It is rich in complex carbs, fiber, amino acids like lysine, cysteine, methionine and is an excellent source of iron and phosphorus. Replace your wheat and rice with quinoa in form of staple, salad, mixing with veggies and condiments.

2. Chia

Chia is a super seed loaded with good fats in form of omega 3 fatty acids, fiber, and antioxidants. It is a vegan substitute for eggs in baking too! Incorporate it in your diet as pudding, in baking, or sprinkle on your breakfast bowl and beverages!

3. Oats

Oats is a good staple grain rich in beta-glucans known to reduce cholesterol levels. It is high in fiber, bringing in satiety for longer durations and also aid in losing weight by controlling portion size. One can choose whole oat groats, steel-cut oats, rolled oats, or instant oats.  Rich in zinc, iron, antioxidants, phosphorus, oats is a great breakfast or meal option with a variety of toppings like seeds, nuts, fruits, nut butter, etc. to choose from.

4. Amaranth

Amaranth comes under the category of cereals as well as minor seeds. They are very unique as all the nutrients are concentrated on its center and as a result, it’s protected during processing. It is a good source of protein, iron, magnesium, manganese, and phosphorus. Amaranth puffs, chikki, bars can be consumed as snacks or breakfast, replacing gluten-based snacks like cakes and cookies.

5. Buckwheat

Although it has wheat in its name, it’s not related to wheat. Make cakes, muffins, dhokla, bread, or anything with buckwheat flour. Sprouted buckwheat is also a great way to include good quality nutrients like manganese and amino acids.

Although these grains are gluten-free by nature, one must be extra careful while purchasing them and look into labels carefully as the cross-contamination with gluten-based products happens during processing. One must also incorporate good sources of fruits, vegetables, nuts, and seeds in the diet.

title.rendered: How to stay fit being a newly married couple

content.rendered:
Trying hard starving and dieting to fit into your favorite outfit for the big day and then gaining extra kilos soon after the wedding is over? Well, you aren’t alone in this! Most people prepare months to stay fit and look best at their wedding but celebrations such as Indian weddings are mostly a grand feast. Followed by that there is pampering from in-laws, lack of activity, more outing, and being less mindful of one’s diet. All these results in weight gain post-wedding. A different shift in routine and life may take a toll on one’s health too. Hormonal changes occur too. Following are some tips to bring you back on track to a healthy weight!

1. Motivate to exercise together

Embarking on a new journey can be challenging but staying fit gets easier when there is some push in form of mutual motivation to stay fit. If one gets lazy, munching on chips while watching TV, the other gets demotivated too. Working out can actually be fun. It would be a great way to bond, have a conversation as well as level up your motivation. You can either go for a morning run together or train at a gym together or even exercise and yoga at home together and pump up your energy levels!

2. Limit outside eating

The festive mood tends to indulge in outside food. More often portion control isn’t done and overeating causes a series of health issues. Try to eat at home as much as possible maintaining a balanced routine. Cooking together is a great way to spend time with a partner too!

3. Be mindful while travelling

Post-wedding comes the exciting part of traveling, honeymoons, and exploring. Most often couples are less mindful and indulge in heavy eating and experimenting. While it’s okay to indulge and enjoy food but one must be mindful about overeating calorie-dense foods and unhealthy junk.

4. Get enough sleep

Often lack of sleep due to added workload post-wedding or lifestyle changes take a toll on health. Make sure you have enough sleep at a proper routine.

5. Carry healthy snacks

Carrying healthy snacks like nuts, seed mix, multigrain granola, etc. while traveling or working is a great way to control junk food consumption which results in weight gain.

Following a proper, active, and healthy lifestyle post-wedding can help you avoid unnecessary weight gain and prevent various lifestyle disorders and diseases.

title.rendered: Know which one is the healthiest: Brown rice v/s White rice

content.rendered:
When it comes to staple food, rice would be the one for more than half the world’s population. White rice, which is the most widely consumed staple, has been ditched by health enthusiasts for Brown rice, and rightfully so!

Let’s find out which one would be a better choice!

The grain

While brown rice is the whole grain with only the inedible outer hull removed (having the bran and germ layer intact), White rice is the refined grain with the hull, bran, and cereal germ removed leaving only the starchy endosperm.

Nutrients

The bran and germ layer of brown rice has the most concentration of nutrients in form of vitamins (B1 and B3), manganese, iron, fiber, protein, oil (rice bran oil).  White rice contains basically the starchy endosperm, supplying mostly calories. It is low in fiber and nutrients.

Cooking time

White rice is refined and polished with no bran layer cooks faster than brown rice. Brown rice takes a longer time to cook since it has a fiber-rich coarse bran layer. The roughly cooking time of brown rice is 40-50 minutes but it is worth the time!

Satiety

Brown rice makes you full quicker hence you need to consume a lesser quantity to reach satiety whereas white rice, rich in starch, reaches fullness much later. Hence you end up eating more white rice!

Health Effects

The fiber-rich brown rice helps in lowering cholesterol, eases the digestive process, and reaches satiety faster. It controls overeating and prevents the onset of diabetes and heart diseases. It also aids in weight loss and an active lifestyle.

title.rendered: 5 Easy home exercise without equipments

content.rendered:
Are you missing out on your gym workout? Wondering what and how to exercise while staying indoors? Well, there are couple of easy exercise routines that could be performed at home without the need of heavy equipment or workout aids.

There should be no excuses when it comes to spending at least 30 minutes for exercise daily. Exercise and physical activities boost the immune system, tone muscles, burn excess calories, increases lung capacity and improves overall health and wellbeing. Many of us enroll for gym memberships with much enthusiasm but then stop showing up soon enough! What if we could exercise at the comfort of our houses with no requirement of gym equipment? Sounds great right! So here is a list of 5 easy home workout that must be part of your daily routine:

1. LUNGES

It involves pushing one leg forward with knee bent and foot flat on the ground while other leg is positioned back. By doing this, it helps your exercise, quads and hamstrings. It is also helpful for maintaining balance and bringing flexibility.

2. PUSH-UPS

It is a common exercise focusing on the pectoral muscles, triceps, shoulders and also back. When done properly it helps in strengthening lower back and is a very effective in building overall strength. Start with few pushups and eventually increase count.

3. BURPREE

This is a full body exercise which aids in metabolism and is used in strength training and aerobic exercise. It is a squat thrust with an additional stand between reps and is also known as “four count burpee”. It works on legs, hips, buttocks, abdomen, arm, chest and shoulders.

4. JUMPING JACKS

They are great for cardiovascular health and also the muscles. It targets belly fats and coordinates between limbs and brain. It aids in relieving stress and is a great easy workout.

5. PLANK

It is a core strength exercise with position similar to push-up but maintaining for a maximum possible time. A beginner however should not push too farther and it is okay to start with 3 sets of 60s.

Include these simple exercises daily that could be easily performed at home as per ones comfort without the need of any heavy gym equipment.

title.rendered: Beat weight loss Plateau with these Effective Tips

content.rendered:
Worried about reaching weight loss plateau and thinking about giving up on the workout and diet regimen after following so hard? It might seem demotivating and unfulfilling after religiously following so hard and reaching a point where you feel you can’t push more ahead, but it is important to understand that it is part of the process and it’s extremely normal. With some right kind of alterations and guidance, you can again be on track.

Why does it happen?

Once the body has adjusted to a low-calorie diet, it usually results in a stall where body stops dropping kilos. Since the body is extremely adaptable, it requires far lesser calorie than before. One can however come out of this stagnation and here is how:

Principle of progressive overload

It is a continuous process to improve the endurance, muscle strength, and size. For an instance, on doing 20 reps of 2 sets of push-ups every day for a certain period of time, there would be shaping of chest and biceps. But there would come a point wherein they won’t grow any further. This is when alternation is needed instead of giving up. Either modify your sets and reps or include more weight to the regimen. This will then lead to a better build and overcoming the weight loss plateau.

Enough Sleep

Sleep is the key to good health be it mental, physical, or emotional. Proper workout and diet should be accompanied by a good and sound sleep to metabolize properly. Improper sleep may result in stalled weight, altering hormones and driving up fat storage.

Re-analyze diet

A balance of all food groups and nutrients is essential. When weight stalling occur you may think of re-analyzing your diet and incorporate alternate sources of the food group. Following monotonous diet will do body more harm than good.

Avoid Alcohol and limit eating out

Alcohol tends to loose inhibitions and make you indulge in wrong food choices. Limit eating empty calories and junk food. It alters metabolism in a bad way. While eating out prefer healthier alternatives which are more suited to your regimen.

Activities outside gym

Apart from gym routine, one must also indulge in various outdoor games like squash, football, badminton, running, free-hand stretches, dancing, etc. This will bring in a routine change, reduce stress, and help in working on entire body in varied manner. Such activities help in improving mental composure and beats anxiety.

title.rendered: Post-Pregnancy workout

content.rendered:
Many new mothers find themselves worrying about the weight gained during pregnancy and effective ways of losing them. Many go overboard in exercising which may lead to complications. Mothers have high nutritional and bodily requirements post-pregnancy because of lactation. Generally, 6-8 weeks of rest should be given post-delivery. Weight loss journey post pregnancy should be gradual and best when backed by professional guidance. Here is a list of exercises for a safe workout journey post-delivery.

1. Walking

Light, brisk walk not only aid in better metabolism but also improves mood and wellbeing. Prefer walking in a park or beach where you can tune in to nature and get much-needed fresh air too! Carry your baby in a perambulator and don’t miss out on walking every day!

2. Yoga

There is no better substitute of Yoga. It not only corrects posture and balance but also instils positive energy within. Many new mothers have disturbed and irritable moods which can be effectively dealt with proper yoga. Begin with easy postures to bring back the body flexibility and then continue with specialized positions.

3. Pilates

Pilates helps in working on the core and flexibility. It helps in toning and strengthening the muscles. It also helps in reducing stress and aid in fat burning. It is gentle to the body and helps in easing tense muscles. Take help from trainer or someone professional to guide on the correct and effective exercises.

4. Light weight training

Mothers should not at once start exercising with heavy equipment. Exercise for new mothers should start with light, free hand training followed by difficult and more intense ones.  

5. Cycling

Although mothers who experience bleeding should not try cycling at once, but after bodily changes are reverting to normal light cycling is beneficial. After few weeks rest post-delivery, one should gradually start cycling. It helps in managing weight, strengthens muscles, relaxes mind and allows some personal time to engage in.

Many mothers start working out in heavy equipment without proper knowledge. One must start exercising slowly focusing on parts that needs more attention. Since every body type is unique, care and exercise should also involve personalization with proper consultation and guidance from professionals.
