title.rendered: Delaying ageing with exercise

content.rendered:
How often have you seen your parents and elderly exercising? They would say it’s for the youth. Exercise and ageing is so tightly interlinked that without exercise you age faster, be subjected to tons of ailments and diseases, and lose out on health benefits that would have been possible with proper exercise.

Exercise is for all age groups. One may start slowly and gradually pick up pace. Once a person realizes how beneficial exercise is, it will help in bringing positivity and longevity to one’s life. Exercise plays an important role in delaying ageing and extending youthful and healthy life. Here’s how!

1. It strengthens and tones muscles

Exercise helps in strengthening body and muscles and helps you in performing heavy works. People with no exercise barely can do any heavy work and get tired easily.

2. Prevents osteoporosis

Exercise improves bone health and makes them stronger. Women who don’t exercise tend to have fragile bones and onset of osteoporosis happens earlier whereas women who exercise everyday delays osteoporosis from happening.

3. Maintains skin health

Skin elasticity and tonicity is maintained by regular exercise. It also makes the skin glow. It helps in preventing wrinkles and skin from sagging. More than superficial cosmetics, good diet and exercise reflects in skin greatly.

4. Prevents age related health conditions

Engaging in regular exercise of 1 hour ranging from running, walking, freehand exercise or yoga has shown to improve health conditions and also prevent lifestyle disorders like diabetes, obesity, CVD, etc. Elderly population who exercises have far less health conditions than the ones living a sedentary life.

5. Improves longevity

People who exercise regularly live longer and healthier. In Japan, people exercise, eat a proper healthy diet, abstain from junk food and they have one of the longest living population. Exercise makes later years of life bearable and beautiful.

Studies have shown that individuals who have been exercising all their life age far slower than individuals of same age who live a sedentary lifestyle. They also tend to live more, are less affected with health complications, and have a positive approach towards life.

title.rendered: How to avoid post wedding weight gain

content.rendered:
Weddings are filled with fun, celebrations, and emotional moments. It is the time for indulgence on delicacies. Weddings brings families and friends together. While the bride and groom embark on the new journey, most often they end up gaining weight after the wedding and there is a remarkable shift from singlehood to wedlock! As important it was to be the best and fit version of yourself on your big day, it is essential to maintain a healthy lifestyle throughout post-wedding to have an active and healthy life.

The celebrations don’t generally stop at weddings and continue for weeks with new relatives making you indulge in those gorgeous desserts to in- laws making you eat more. A different shift in routine and life may take a toll on one’s health too. Hormonal changes occur too. Hence proper care should be given to one’s diet and lifestyle.

Careless indulgence needs to be monitored and sticking to a healthier routine should be a priority. Here is a list of ways how you can tackle the post-wedding weight gain.

1. Mindful indulgence

Weddings bring forth social gatherings, outings, and events. Be careful what you indulge in and don’t succumb to peer pressure. Don’t indulge in too much junk and take care of the portion size. Avoid over indulgence in sweets and desserts as there is a tendency that most relatives and people visiting would bring a pack of sweets.

2. Be active

Indulge an inactive lifestyle and stay fit by practicing yoga, aerobic exercise, and house-hold chores, go for a run, exercise, etc. Get your partner involved too and practice living an active lifestyle. It not only helps in staying fit but also prevents health disorders and complications like diabetes, cancer, obesity, and heart diseases.

3. Portion size

Be careful of how much you eat as much as what you eat. Often there is a tendency to finish off food and leftovers to avoid waste. Be mindful of how much you cook so that both overeating and wastage are avoided.

4. Initiate healthy habits

A new member can help in inculcating healthy habits and behavioral changes in a family as a whole. It will help in eradicating unhealthy habits and encourage towards a healthy living. While cooking, look for healthier options over-refined and empty calories.

5. Buy smart

Indulge in healthy shopping and buy smartly. Look for healthier ingredients and commit to healthy grocery shopping for you and family as a whole.

title.rendered: Pre Wedding Diet plan

content.rendered:
It’s time of the year when the temperatures are getting low and it’s the wedding season we know! With thousands of thoughts in your head and butterflies in the stomach, a wedding day can be really stressful. The shopping schedules and to indulge in eating outside can result in weight gain and health issues. Proper diet planning is required before the wedding so that you could be fit and healthy and avoid unnecessary trouble on your D-day!

Here is a sample diet routine for your pre wedding nutritional needs:

Early morning

  • Aloe vera juice or herbal tea
  • A handful of soaked nuts like almonds

Breakfast

  • Veg omelet with carrot beetroot juice
  • Avocado toast with a berry smoothie
  • Dosa with tomato chutney

Mid-day

  • Fruit bowl with seeds
  • Spinach smoothie

Lunch

  • Quinoa+ Sweet corn+ carrot+ beetroot
  • Veg uttapam + sambhar+ salad
  • Chappati + dal+ Veg curry+ scrambled egg

Snacks

  • Green tea with veg sticks
  • Soup with garlic bread

Dinner

  • Millet mix + sautéed veggies
  • Chicken salad with pesto dressing
  • Mini idlis with mint chutney

Bedtime

  • Cinnamon milk
  • Turmeric latte

DIET tips for bride to be

One must not starve to look thin on the wedding day or else chances are that you may faint during the ceremony. One must be well prepared in terms of good nutrition to sustain long hours of the wedding ceremony and rituals as well as avoiding and health complications. Here are some tips:

1.  Don’t sleep empty stomach. Have a filling meal.

2. Do not indulge in large meals and instead have frequent small meals.

3. Don’t eat heavy fried or something that has been lying on fridge for long as they may lead to digestive problems.

4. Have good fiber rich food for better digestion and bowel movements.

5. Don’t try something entirely new before your wedding as you never know if sudden health crisis occurs.

6. Do not indulge in junk and calories out of stress and anxiety.

7. Avoid drinking and partying before your big day to avoid hangover and exhaustion.

8. Stay hydrated as much as possible.

9. Eat before stepping out for shopping to avoid unnecessary indulgence.

10. Look for healthier alternatives whenever you feel munching.

title.rendered: Nutritional Solutions to Sustain your wedding glow

content.rendered:
The wedding day marks a new beginning to an individual’s life and one needs to be their best self on the big day! The days which pass by so quickly yet there are months and months of planning, preparations, and schedules involved. All this along with the event itself is bound to bring anxiety in an individual. The bride and groom are generally more concerned about their looks and their weight. The preparation to look fit and beautiful starts months in advance but the stress and work-life balance may take a toll on one’s health. From choosing the right outfit, the venue, the right parlor, and makeup- everything may seem tedious and stressful. Along with all these, one must not neglect one’s health and well being. Staying healthy, fit, and positive is very essential for those days to pass by with ease. Imagine feeling sick and dull at one’s own wedding! Nobody would want that, right?

Good nutrition will now only bring the glow from within but also help you keep your weight in check. Here is a list of foods to include in one’s diet to sustain the wedding glow!

1. Nuts

Nuts are loaded with nutrients and essential oils required for good skin health. Include a bunch of nuts in all forms like almonds, walnuts, pistachios, peanuts every day. Include as baddam milk or in desserts or have them simply soaked. They are rich in Vitamin E, vitamin C PUFA, and MUFA, minerals like zinc, copper which help in collagen formation and keep skin youthful and healthy.

2. Raw veggies

Incorporate raw and fresh veggies in form of salad with your favorite salad dressing and toppings. Include lettuce, kale, broccoli, carrot, beetroot, cucumber, amla to your daily diet. Have spinach in form of smoothie. Add an ample amount of greens in your diet. Have them with your quinoa or chickpea. Loaded with antioxidants and phytochemicals, they are bound to bring a glow to your skin from within, keeping supple and healthy.

3. Herbs and spices

Include turmeric, ginger, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom, and loads of Indian spices and herbs that have anti-bacterial and healing properties. They will help prevent the formation of pimples and protect from other skin related ailments. Ginger and garlic also help in improved digestion and metabolism.

4. Herbal teas

Include herbal teas in form of Chamomile, rose, lavender, Hibiscus and other floral and herbal teas which have individual health benefits along with managing healthy weight.

title.rendered: Top 10 Home remedies for PCOS

content.rendered:
PCOS is extremely common condition affecting most women with range of symptoms including irregular periods, heavy bleeding, excessive hair growth, weight gain leading to complications like infertility, gestational diabetes, miscarriages, sleep apnea, endometrial cancer etc.

Here is a list of top 10 home remedies for PCOS:

1. Lifestyle changes

Modification of lifestyle is very necessary for managing PCOS effectively. Bringing in proper routine and healthy habits into everyday lifestyle will help in easing out the conditions. Proper attention to sleep cycle, meal timing, exercise needs to be done.

2. Dietary guidelines

  • Avoid high calorie foods and consume nutrient dense foods
  • Instead to sugary items have naturally sweet fruits and nuts
  • Add more fiber in form of complex carbs and whole grains, vegetables and whole fruits
  • Never skip breakfast. Have a wholesome meal for start of the day.

3. Plan your meals

  • Proper meal planning as per weight and complications is essential
  • Eat small, frequent meals
  • Plan and eat meals at proper timing

4. Exercise regularly

  • Start with simple exercises that suits your body and system best
  • Engage in walking, running, jogging, climbing stairs, free hand exercise
  • Try gradual weight loss focusing on abdomen fat

5. Maintain stable cycle of ovulation

Avoid taking pills, drugs or any substances that may hamper the ovulation cycle and hormonal balance. Don’t consume any medicines without doctor consultation.

6. Control stress

  • Engage in activities that uplifts mood
  • Spend more time with nature
  • Consider traveling for rejuvenating within
  • Don’t panic too much about irregular periods
  • Engage in social and welfare work
  • Practice rising early and doing yoga

7. Include special ingredients

  • Consider trying certain home remedies like consuming amla or Indian gooseberry
  • Have bitter gourd as boiled or in juice form. It helps in bringing down sugar levels
  • Include fenugreek leaves, tulsi, basil and other indian herbs in your diet

8. Try Ayurvedic approach

  • Early intervention of Ayurveda may help in managing PCOS
  • Use natural form of food and lifestyle
  • Consult ayurvedic doctor for appropriate guidance
  • Cleanse your system with natural and healing foods

9. Sleep adequately

  • Check your sleep cycle
  • Depend on biological clock over alarm
  • Get adequate rests and naps
  • Proper sleep will help regulate hormones and metabolism better

10. Practice Yoga

  • Yoga brings balance to mind and body
  • Try practicing Surya namaskar
  • Engage in yoga clubs and groups and be motivated

Managing PCOS needs simple yet persistent changes in life. Connect with people suffering from PCOS and fight it together with appropriate guiadance.

title.rendered: 7 Tips to prevent and control type 2 diabetes

content.rendered:
Diabetes is a chronic metabolic disorder preventing the utilization of glucose partially or completely. Predominantly there are two types-type 1 and type 2 diabetes. Type 1 diabetes depend on insulin which occurs mostly because of the inability of the pancreas to produce enough insulin. Type 2 diabetes on the other hand is non-insulin dependent diabetes. Enough insulin is produced but its action is impaired.

Timely detection of diabetes and proper management can help to control it to a great extent. Here are some points that help in preventing and controlling diabetes:

1. Healthy Diet

The diet recommended for a diabetes patient should be high in fiber, low in refined carbohydrates. Cutting down on empty calories, sugary items, colas, heavily processed foods, junk foods is very important. Refined carbs like maida, cakes, pastries, etc. should be completely avoided. One must also look into the glycemic index of foods and consume foods with a low glycemic load. Foods which rapidly increases blood glucose levels should be avoided since it would put a strain on the pancreas to release insulin.

2. Exercise Regularly

Regular activity and exercise can help prevent diabetes by not only managing body weight but also increasing the insulin sensitivity of the body cells.  It helps in consuming more energy and keeping the blood glucose in the lower range. One must engage in aerobic exercises, walking, cycling, bicycling, swimming, yoga on a regular basis.

3. Check what you drink

Drinks like colas, fruit juices, sodas are loaded with sugars and calories that rapidly spike blood glucose levels. Instead, try having plain water and have it as often as possible. Packaged drinks and beverages are loaded with hidden sugars and additives which adversely affect the condition.

4.  Healthy weight

People who are overweight and obese are more predisposed to having diabetes and other lifestyle disorders. Mostly the fat is accumulated in the midsection and lower abdomen which may lead to insulin resistance. Managing weight is thus very essential.

5. Give up smoking

Smokers are highly at risk in developing diabetes, more so if he or she is pre-diabetic. Passive smoking also increases the risk. Quitting smoking will help to bring down the risk factor in developing diabetes.

6. Avoid sedentary life

Studies have shown a significant link between a sedentary lifestyle and type 2 diabetes. Avoid living a sedentary life and engage in activities like household chores, freehand exercise, brisk walking, etc.

7. Optimize Vitamin D levels

Vitamin D is believed to improve the body’s sensitivity to insulin and thus reduce insulin resistance. Have adequate sources of vitamin D, fortified foods along with a daily dose of sunshine!

The complications associated with diabetes are elaborate, hence strict routine and management are advised.

title.rendered: Managing Diabetes with keto diet

content.rendered:
Keto diet restricts the intake of carbohydrates and instead makes fat the primary source of energy. In Diabetes, a person needs to control the consumption of foods that readily elevates the glucose levels on the blood stream. With keto diet, which reduces carbohydrates intake, diabetes can be managed and controlled.

Meal planning

Keto diet have quite many restrictions and so does dietary guidelines for diabetes. With proper planning however, proper supply of nutrients can be provided. Diabetics are recommended to reduce carbohydrate intake restrict processed and refined foods. Combining the principles of both the diet would involve

  • Very low consumption of carbohydrate and carbohydrate in the form of only complex carbohydrate is allowed
  • Moderate amount of proteins in the form of lean meat, eggs and legumes
  • Good sources of fat like nuts and seeds
  • Avoid starchy foods like pasta, potatoes, corn
  • Ample amount of fruits and vegetables. Look for non-starchy vegetables like green leafy vegetables
  • Fruits high in phytochemicals but low in glycemic index like citrus fruits which are keto friendly
  • Increased intake of fiber in form of fruits with peel, leafy vegetables, whole grains.
  • Adding curd and probiotics
  • Avoiding bad sources of fat like heavy fried products, processed sugary items like cakes, pastries, sweets
  • Avoiding colas, sodas and sugary drinks

Advantages of keto diet in controlling diabetes

  • Reduces the intake of carbohydrates hence rapid glucose elevation in blood stream is avoided
  • Helps in managing weight
  • Improves glycemic control
  • Unhealthy sources of fats and carbohydrates are eliminated, reducing the risk of other lifestyle disorders
  • Improves HDL cholesterol profile
  • Sustained release of energy

Impact of keto on medication and weight

Keto diets need to be properly planned and regulated as per the body type and requirements. Often low carbohydrate may lead to low glucose supply in the body leading to hypoglycemia where blood glucose level falls to 70 mg/dL or lower.

Keto helps in managing weight quicker. It may help in patients with pre-diabetes from going into diabetes, thus reducing its chances and helping in managing it. However proper direction of doctor and dietician is essential.

Side effects:

  • Keto flu
  • Muscle cramps
  • Irritable moods
  • Fogginess
  • Headaches
  • Cravings

Footnote

Proper guidance and monitoring from doctor or dietician is required before embarking on a keto diet especially for diabetes since every body type is different with different conditions and capacities. Hence, it is advisable to seek professional support before following any diet.

title.rendered: Common health problems in childhood and appropriate nutrition

content.rendered:
Childhood is a vital time of one’s overall growth and development, hence appropriate nutrition and care is required for lifelong good health. However, there are certain health problems that are common in childhood and needs attention. Careful monitoring and steps are essential to manage these problems.

1. Dental problems

Almost all kids suffer from dental problems in childhood, most commonly dental caries mostly due to excessive indulgence in chocolates and sugar rich items.

Nutrition management:

  • Vitamin A is necessary for enamel and Vitamin C is essential for dentine.
  • Calcium, Phosphorus, and Vitamin D is essential for calcification.
  • Make sure to include lots of green vegetables, yellow colored fruits and vegetables, milk, sesame seeds, citrus fruits etc.
  • Cut down on sugary items, heavy fried snacks, chocolates
  • Practice good oral hygiene and brush for adequate time twice a day.
  • Avoid sticky caramel, and carbs that stay stuck in tooth for a longer time.

2. Eye health

Vitamin A deficiency, bitot’s spots, night blindless, are very common among pre-school children. Vitamin A deficiency is preponderant in children. The liver reserves are mostly depleted along with low dietary intake.

Nutrition Management:

  • Ensuring adequate intake of Vitamin C and carotene rich foods by pregnant mothers for adequate liver stores.
  • Early initiation of breast feeding
  • Feeding colostrum
  • Vitamin A and carotene rich foods like spinach, carrots, pumpkin, dark leafy vegetables, ghee, papaya, mango etc.
  • Cutting down digital time
  • Maintain appropriate distance from screen
  • Milk , butter, oil fortified with Vitamin A

3. Specific Deficiency

Kids tend to be picky eaters, avoiding certain foods like green vegetables, milk, and certain fruits. This may lead to deficiency of specific nutrients in the long run. In order to avoid specific nutrient deficiency include proper planned diet.

Nutrition management:

  • Add variety, alternative sources of food for nutrients
  • Include foods in different preparations.
  • Add supplements if the level is too low
  • Make balanced meals
  • Packed lunch should be healthy and not monotonous

4. Poor growth

Although one’s height and built is more of genetic predisposition, inadequate dietary habits may result in stunting and poor development.

Nutrition management:

  • Good amount of protein in form of eggs, milk, nuts, and pulses.
  • Exercise regularly with more outdoor games.
  • Cycling, skipping, stretching exercises
  • Good amount of energy from healthy sources
  • Proper hygiene habits to avoid unnecessary illness that depletes resources of the body.

Proper care and early intervention will help prevent many common childhood problems.

title.rendered: PCOS and Acne

content.rendered:
Acne is a manifestation of something that went wrong inside, be it your digestive system, your hormones, or that damn sebaceous glands and bacterial attack! But in the case of PCOS, acne is almost inevitable. Acne outbreak may affect your mental health as well but the temporary and superficial application of products won’t provide you the cure to the root problem that lies within!

 Acne is one of the most common signs of PCOS and often people mistake it to be a a result of puberty even past teen years. Acne can be severly painful and may get an ugly infection if not managed well. As much as 25% women have shown to seek treatment of acne due to PCOS.

How is PCOS related to acne?

PCOS and acne are linked due to the overproduction of the hormone androgen caused due to insulin resistance. Acne serves as one of the symptoms of PCOS.it is mostly difficult to cure PCOS related acne which predominates the lower portion of the face.

How to distinguish PCOS Acne from regular acne?

Acne generally occurs when pores get blocked by dead cells, or sebaceous glands produce excess oil under your skin leading to outbreaks which may also harbor bacteria and lead to pus and infections. In the case of PCOS acne is a lot severe with tender skin rather than bumps. It mostly occurs lower face in the cheeks, chin, jawline, and neck. They are very sensitive and may also result like cysts, leaving behind terrible scars.

The excess oil production in sebaceous glands occurs due to the imbalance of testosterone which is the male sex hormone and leads to acne along with trapping of oil, bacteria, and dead skin. This imbalance to an extent also occurs during the menstrual cycle leading to blemishes.

How to manage it?

Proper dietary habits, reduction of excess weight, cutting down on unhealthy junk and fried foods, and staying hydrated is very essential. Having anti-inflammatory foods and avoiding foods that contribute to inflammation help in easing the condition too. There needs to be proper guidance and dietary management which can help in keeping hormone levels in check.

title.rendered: How to tackle picky eaters?

content.rendered:
Is your child, like Shin chan, leaving behind those capsicums on plate? Are you tired of tantrums of your child regarding picky food habits? Well, you need careful planning and understanding on how to make them eat nutritious foods without much fuss!

1. Slowly bring in the new!

Many kids feels reluctant to try new foods and mostly the ones they find “ugly”! Try to introduce new foods slowly, along with their favorite dishes. Add fruits like guava with apple, or grapes in a fruit bowl. Mix new veggies in a curry.

2. Make them presentable

Children love attractive platter. Prepare foods in shape of their favorite cartoon characters, animals etc. Decorate toasts with fruits in shape of bears, monkey etc.

3. Color they love!

Kids find dull colors boring! Make meals colorful with ingredients like beetroot, various fruits to make patterns and visually appealing. Colorful foods contain pigments that are antioxidants and highly beneficial to the body like the anthocyanin, betalin, revesterol etc.

3. Add texture

Many kids prefer one texture over other, like they may not eat mashed potato but have it as potato crisps. Add wide variety of texture in meals, make crisps out of vegetables like yam, beetroot, kale etc.

4.  Go the alternative way

If your child don’t like having oats porridge, make them into veg oats upma or choco overnight oats, or in form of pancakes. Ingredients can be incorporated into different recipes to make it more attractive and to add variety.

5. Nutrition in disguise

Most kids are picky eaters when it comes to vegetables, milk, or certain fruits. Even after repeated trials to make into different alternatives, they somehow sniff and understand! You may add those foods in disguise like in blended smoothie or batter.

6. Alternative nutrition sources

Although a particular food is irreplaceable, but if your child won’t just consume a food, look for alternative foods with similar nutrient profile like add more citrus fruits for vitamin C if they don’t consume amla or guava. Add sesame seeds in diet for calcium if they consume less milk.

Careful planning and understanding your child’s habits goes a long way in making behavioral changes in them and avoid deficiencies. It might get tiring and troublesome but appropriate guidance and patience will help in the long run!

title.rendered: Super foods that must be on your PCOS diet

content.rendered:
Women often find themselves in dilemma regarding PCOS diet and foods that must be included. While each body built up is different with different metabolism and routine, there are certain foods that are super helpful in easing out the condition of PCOS and its associated symptoms.

Apart from medication, these foods will come handy in improving your condition and help you manage PCOS better. Most of the super foods mentioned are readily available in a home kitchen.

1. Flax seeds

These tiny seeds are rich in omega-3 fatty acids and lignin. They help in reducing testosterone levels and help in improving lipid profile. These seeds are good source of good fats and fiber which help in improving mood swings and reducing androgen level.

2. Turmeric

Turmeric is loaded with medicinal properties and helps ease out inflammation to a great extent. Include it in your recipes or have it raw or add it to your milk as turmeric latte. You can also include it as turmeric tea with ginger in the morning.

3. Cinnamon

Cinnamon or dalchini has strong distinct aroma, astringent properties and sweetish distinct taste. It helps in managing PCOS by improving metabolism, aiding weight loss, regulating menstrual cycle among many others. It significantly reduces insulin resistance which is one of the main causes of PCOS.

4. Fatty fish

Another superfood for PCOS is fatty fish which is rich in omega 3 fatty acids. It helps in reducing serum testosterone and regulate menstrual cycle effectively. Include indian mackerel, sardines, trout, cod pomfret and herring. It is also rich in vitamin D, protein and B vitamins effective in fighting PCOS

5. Barley

Most women suffering from PCOS is also overweight or obese. Low GI food like barley can be of great help in bringing down blood sugar level as it takes time to digest and releases glucose slowly. Among other grains, barley has shown lowest GI.

While PCOS can’t be cured but proper exercise and dietary planning is very effective in managing it. Include these above mentioned readily available super foods in your everyday diet and help ease out PCOS!

title.rendered: Do’s and Don’ts of PCOS

content.rendered:
Polycystic ovary syndrome or PCOS is manifested in form of irregular periods or no menstruation at all. Women having PCOS have cysts in their ovaries caused due to overproduction of androgen hormone, testosterone hormone and also results in disruption of the hormonal balance.

PCOS needs to be managed by managing the dietary and lifestyle choices, which otherwise may lead to serious other complications in the body. Dietary pattern largely affects PCOS and there are certain dos and don’ts to be followed while taking care of it.

DO’s

1. Keep positive outlook by engaging in various activities that soothes your mind like meditation

2. Include high fiber foods that keep the insulin levels proper and glucose levels in check

3. Add low GI foods that releases glucose slowly and steadily

4. Manage weight effectively with proper diet and exercise rather than fasting

5. Include anti-inflammatory foods like turmeric, tomatoes, kale, spinach in diet

6. Add lean protein like fish, chicken, tofu in diet

7. Proactive lifestyle choices leading an active life

8. Exercise and daily physical activity keeps insulin resistance at bay

9. Focusing on complex carbs like whole wheat, oats, and barley

10. Small frequent meals help in avoiding overburdening the system. This helps in slow release of glucose in the blood stream.

DON’Ts

1. Avoid junk, oily, deep fried products completely. They not only aggravate the condition but also makes it difficult to heal.

2. Cut down on sugary items like chocolates, desserts, candies etc. which are very unhealthy during PCOS.

3. Avoid refined foods like maida, white bread etc.

4. Avoid inflammatory foods like red meat, certain spices, processed items, refined carbs, and margarine

5. Empty calories, sodas and sugary drinks needs to be avoided

6. Cut down on screen time, especially before bedtime to avoid unnecessary strain to the body

7. Avoid stressful situations which overburdens the mind

8. Don’t overfeed at once at it will lead to weight gain and unnecessary splurge in glucose in blood stream

9. Don’t lead a sedentary lifestyle, rather exercise and do physical work daily.

10. Don’t mind seeking professional help, and therapist as proper guidance is required to manage PCOS.

PCOS is by far very common amongst women but the stigma around menstrual periods have made it difficult to open up to discussions and knowledge sharing. Feel free to seek professional help who understands your body and can help tackle PCOS in a customized way!

title.rendered: Clean Vs Dirty keto

content.rendered:
Keto diet has gained popularity because of fast, effective way of weight loss all while gulping on your favorite desserts! The high fat, moderate protein and low carb diet has also shown many health benefits including improved mood, lowering risk of type 2 diabetes, delayed aging etc.

But everything has pros and cons, and so does keto diet. Many often complain of irritable moods, sudden weight gain, digestive issues etc. The mismanagement in planning may lead to complications, hence proper understanding of source of food is essential.

Here is an outline on what clean and dirty keto- two types of keto but to an extent a blurred aspect- is all about.

Clean Keto

Clean keto includes traditional foods that undergo minimal processing. The source of fats are healthy like fish oil, nuts, seeds rich in omega fatty acids, MUFA, PUFA. The objective is to burn more calories, being low carb but from complex sources only. Elimination of refined grains, incorporating more fiber and good fats are the key here. It contains whole foods, grass fed meet, butter, olive oil, and non-starchy vegetables.

The focus id more on food quality that is easy on the body and easily digestible. Clean keto lead to health benefits that lowers blood sugar levels, lowers risk of cancers, aids in brain development.

Clean keto avoids consumption of junk foods and heavily fried products that are high in unhealthy fats, salt and sugar.

 Dirty keto

Dirty keto although low in carbs and high in fats but the source of fat is unhealthy in form of deep fried foods, calorie rich desserts, processed foods that are low in nutrients and high in fats that are unsaturated.

While you reach ketosis and may reach health goal quicker, the underlined health problems are far severe. Many people following dirty keto experiences digestive issues, heart health problems, sudden weight gain, irritable moods, intense cravings etc.

Dirty keto is also called lazy keto, indulging in unhealthy sources of food. It is rich in sodium, sugar, unsaturated fats and trans fats. It lacks micronutrients and may lead to severe malnutrition.

While dirty keto may seem tempting and delicious way to lose weight, it comes with a heavy health issues. Stick to the proportion of high fat, moderate protein and low carb but all from healthy sources. Professional help and guidance is essential before following a keto diet.

title.rendered: Foods to include while on Keto

content.rendered:
Confused what to eat and what not to in Keto? Well, we have the list of foods to be included while on a keto diet! The key principal is to maintain the proportion of high fat, moderate protein and minimum carbohydrates. The source of these nutrients are very much important as incorrect source may lead to adverse effects on the body!

1. Fruits

Generally fruits are rich in carbohydrates in form of fructose hence correct choice of fruits that are low in carbs and high in nutrients is essential. Include melons like water melons, cantaloupe, muskmelon; Citrus fruits like lemons, pomelo; berries like strawberry, raspberry.

2. Vegetables

Avoid starchy vegetables like potatoes and include green leafy vegetables rich in fiber like spinach, celery. Include fat rich avocadoes. Cauliflower, cabbage, mushrooms, broccoli, zucchini can be added.

3. Grains

Include super seeds like amaranth, quinoa instead of rice. Include high fiber grains over refined ones. Avoid rice and wheat and settle for alternatives in form of almond flour or coconut flour instead.

4. Nuts and seeds

Ample amount of nuts like almonds, coconut, cashews, and walnuts should be included along with seeds of chia, pumpkin, sunflower, flax rich in omega fatty acids and good fats. While on keto, instead of grain flours, flours made out of almonds, coconut is used for preparing rotis, pizza, bread etc.

5. Dairy

Include full fat yogurt, cream, butter, cheese, paneer in various dishes. Add fruits and high fiber grains to yogurt for better nutrition.

6. Oil

Include olive oil, MCTs like coconut oil. Avoid too much saturated fats and have unsaturated PUFA, MUFA rich fats.

7. Meat and fish

Good amount of meat can be included including red meat. Fish rich is omega fatty acids should be incorporated. Eggs should be included too for proper amount of protein consumption.

All food groups should be present but the key is to have proper choices from the food groups. Our staple being carbohydrate rich foods, shifting to fat based diet may seem difficult but proper guidance can lead to amazing results.

title.rendered: Is Keto diet good for you?

content.rendered:
Keto diet has been around quite a long time now.  So what is it all about? Well, Keto diet is followed by weight watchers, wanting a quick and easy way to lose weight. This diet basically restricts carbohydrates, basic source of energy to the body, and increases the intake of fats and proteins. Yes! Fats! The energy source shifts from carbs to fats and proteins, where the metabolism of readily available fats and formation of ketones occur and in turn unnecessary conversion of carbs to fats is restricted.

What about fats?

Fats provide 9kcal per gram, whereas carb and proteins provide 4kcal per gram. Thus fats are the richest source of energy. But there are good as well as bad fats. Not all kinds of fats are included in a keto diet. Saturated fats which are harmful to the body is avoided and healthy fats like PUFA, MUFA, MCT are added.

But Carbs are the staple!

Yes, but apparently not for keto dieters. The carbohydrates, specially refined ones does body more harm than good. The carb is metabolized to release glucose as energy, excess of which gets converted to fats in adipose tissues. All your pasta, rice, chapatti, bread, pizza etc. would be available to you but made out of almond flour, coconut flour or cauliflower (cauliflower pizza base is yum!) or some other substitute! But then carbs can’t be completely removed hence little amount of carbs is included.

Is keto boring?

Not at all! It lets you have your favorite dessert without any guilt! Keto diet is mostly interesting with various tasty items like avocadoes, cheese, broccoli, nuts, cauliflower, yogurt, paneer etc.

What are its benefits?

Keto diet makes you lose weight faster, all while gulping your favorite pizza or dessert!

In addition it

  • uplifts mood
  • slows aging
  • better sleep
  • increases energy efficiently
  • prevents overeating
  • reduces inflammation
  • gluten friendly
  • increases HDL cholesterol which is good for heart
  • releases energy steadily

Although initially keto diet may seem tough because of the shift from carbohydrate being staple food, but with proper guidance and diet planning, keto diet can work wonders. Proper diet customized as per body type, activity, preferences is essential for keto diet to work best for you!

title.rendered: Common habits that are harming your child’s immunity

content.rendered:
Immunity doesn’t develop overnight by gulping down antioxidants. It’s a gradual build up starting right from the womb. Immunity developed in childhood impacts throughout life. With remarkable shift in lifestyle in recent years, new and bad habits can put your child’s immunity at risk if not corrected on time.

Here are some common habits that might hamper your child’s immunity.

Screen time for prolonged hours      

Kids nowadays are surrounded by multiple digital screens- Smart phones, video games, Television to name a few. This wasn’t the case for previous generations. Screen time although necessary, mustn’t go unchecked. Protracted screen time can be detrimental to your child’s health leading to obesity and affecting eyesight!

Lack of outdoor activities

Is your child a couch fanatic? Does he spend most of his time watching or playing video games? If yes, then it’s time for you to encourage them to get off that couch. Low physical activity will weaken your child’s immunity which will make them susceptible to tons of illness. Outdoor time for your child will not only improve their physical strength, build strong muscles and lung capacity but will also boost the dose of Vitamin D in their body. It will also aid in developing hard immunity in them.

Consumption of junk food

Many parents tame their kids’ demands by giving them a pack of chips or unhealthy snacks. While it is okay to indulge once in a while but regular consumption of fast food and processed items which are high in sugar, preservatives and additives is detrimental to your child’s health by increasing free radicals in body. It also affects digestion and leads to dreadful inflammation.

Picky eaters

This is undeniably every child’s habit. Some may leave the green beans behind, while others may give you a run for avoiding drinking milk. Picky eaters tend to consume fewer fruits and vegetables which can lead to specific nutrient deficiency. As parents, make sure to include 3-4 servings of fruits and veggies and include the disliked food items in different form or recipes to maintain the nutrient balance in body.

As the saying goes, “Old habits die hard”, let not the bad habits go into adulthood where it gets difficult to change. Parents must identify the prevalent practices of their child to elude intrusion on their immunity. You never know when another deadly virus might erupt!
